After using this device for a bit over a month, I’ve found it is much too glitchy for purposeful use. The following are issues I’ve had that, despite lots of giving Amazon feedback and speaking to customer service, I have been unable to resolve:
- Echo Show frequently fails to play timed Routines, making it unreliable to use them as alarms (which I like to do)
- Echo Show is a much worse “listener” than Echo Dot. You seem to have to say things much louder and clearer for it to register them.
- Routines often fail to play both calendar items and podcasts, stopping short and then saying “Sorry, something went wrong.”
- Poor integration of the screen features — I don’t really find that the screen has been additionally helpful or useful. You’d think it would help with things like recipes, but the app Alexa has for that is so bad, it’s not really useful.
- Search function is somehow worse than Echo Dot’s, which I find odd because I would think they’d use the same system. I’ll ask my Show and my Dot the same things, and the response is always more useful from the Dot.
- Speaker is too sharp and has audio feedback/break-like sounds often (another issue that the Dot does not have)

I’ve worked with Amazon customer service repeatedly to try to fix these issues, especially the problems with Routines, and nothing works.

I’d recommend sticking with the Dot, or going with Google Home Hub (which I have previously used, and it has none of these problems).

reviews.reviewTitle: It Sucks, watch only what Amazon wants you to watch.
reviews.reviewText: This device has soo much potential, but since Amazon restricts apps like Netflix and playstation vue it truly SUCKS. you are restricted from watching what you want and can only watch what they want you to watch. It’s just an alarm clock amd music player with a not so great speaker.

I love my Alexa gen 1 and my two Dots... But this thing is just a mess that seems to be 'left behind'. Very buggy. The worst thing, which if you Google it seems thousands of people are pissed about and they won't fix, is the display keep flipping to a screen with suggestions "TRY this...." You can 'remove cards' and get it most of the time to not show this screen, but I find myself every few days AGAIN touching the screen and touching the HOME Icon to get rid of this crap screen... Now that the daylight savings time happened, well this POS just combined the two screens it seems...

I don't think I can return it, but I would in a heartbeat... Why do they not look at peoples complaints and fix this junk. I really wanted a good clock in my office that I could talk to. Shame. AVOID!

Update -

I ALWAYS from day one closed off the camera slider... Today I was at my desk and watched the display state "Camera Off" out of the blue.... ???? Did someone just attempt to access this?? About an hour later the thing did a full reset on it's own... What the hell...

I picked this up on Prime day, so $50.
Pros: MUCH smaller than the gen 1 Show I have. Screen display is decent for pictures and video chat. Sound is much better than I was expecting. Used it for the last week travelling from hotel to hotel, and could quickly join it to whatever network I was on and use it for alarm, calling home, news, etc. Price is much better than the full size show gen1 or gen 2. It is small enough to pack in my case with limited space used (about the size of a couple rolled pairs of socks). Some of my family was traveling with me, so we also used it for music, a lot. I also have the Echo Show and the Echo Spot. This is only slightly bigger than the spot, but with more screen. Would still be handy as a bedside clock. They added a manual camera door to this now as well for those worried about someone hacking the camera.

Cons: Honestly, the only con is the same con I have with all the echo video devices (Spot or Show)... the TRY THIS that you can't get rid of. Hey, Amazon, the TRY THIS is nice for a new user, but gets REALLY annoying really fast. Give us the option on wether we want this, without taking away all the other functions.

Overall, I really like this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overal, I'm happy but Alexa needs to fix one thing to get 5 stars
reviews.reviewText: I like the Show for the reason that I purchased it, Alexa can show me what she's doing as well as tell me. For instance, I like Johnny Cash's lyrics scrolling past. But my big surprise is that the Show doesn't link to my Echo Plus as I expected. No matter how many tries, including an hour on the phone with a tech rep, the closest she could get me is to have routines that play on one or the other, according to which one I ask for it on- but after many, many tries, never both. There is a screen that comes up that offers a choice of Echo Plus, Echo Show, or device addressed. Why can't there be both? Right now, I highly recommend buying either one but not both.

I bought this to be a smart clock, cannot use because of the Alexa tips always make the clock small and defeat it’s purpose. I’ve tried everything to disable them I cannot continue to put up with the tips.
Horrible speakers. By default there is heavy bass distortion where you have to set it to the minimum. Even after that you have to put the volume way up to hear anything clearly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor choice of clock faces; cannot display weather on home screen by default; weather apps limited
reviews.reviewText:
Nice little device for bedside or bathroom. I don't plan to watch Netflix on it but may get an Echo Link to run music through my AV system.

I have plenty of clocks around, I'd like this to display weather by default on the home screen, a nice pretty display. The default weather (which displays only when asked) looks like a 3rd grader designed it. The most popular "skills" are worse - Big Sky just shows an unreadable jumble of numbers with only a graphical background. AccuWeather doesn't seem to have any graphical display at all. This thing needs at least one weather app designed to work with the Echo Show units (that is, Echo's with screens ... most seem not to have bothered since most Echo's are just speakers). Here's where Apple would have done a much better job making things look nice.

Pretty disappointed with the clock faces, they are all chunky and garish. At least one should be a slender elegant line so dim it can just barely be made out in total darkness. A few creative ones that, say, morph from one shape to the next would also be cool. Maybe they will open up an API or something so people can design their own. Again, Apple approach would have looked a lot nicer.

Got the Echo Show 5 for free with my new Ring Doorbell. Free is about what it’s worth.

First, the good:
It has all the Alexa integration so if you want to use it as a sort of smart home hub, it works for that. It also obviously has the display. Mine is in the kitchen. Consequently, following a recipe is handy. That’s about where the good ends.

The ugly:
Sound quality is terrible. I didn’t expect this little thing to replace a stereo system, but even turning the volume up past 4 significantly degrades the quality.
It also is CONSTANTLY displaying prompts to “Try this”...you cant switch screens without an additional prompt coming up. Before I changed the settings, the prompts were actual screens you had to swipe past, but even after adjusting settings, the prompts are on EVERY screen at the bottom. It’s distracting and annoying.
Lastly, the product is locked down way to tight. Why can’t I easily bring up YouTube? or YouTubeTV or Prime Video...I know there are work arounds, but if amazon loosened the reigns here a bit, the product would be FAR MORE functional and enjoyable.

Bottom line, if you need an overpriced digital clock, this is the product for you. If you are looking for a product with some of the same basic functionality as a tablet in a different form factor, keep looking...I really wanted to love this product, but I simply don’t.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than a Spot, but no rival for the Echo Show
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Show 5 met my expectations. I find it to be right on par with the other Echos (with displays) that I own. The lower quality speaker than the Echo Show doesn't take away too much from the overall quality, which I was afraid of.
I have other Echo Shows and Spots. The Echo Show is definitely a rise about the Echo Show 5, but I would put the Show 5 over the Spot for appearance and overall usability. I like the larger, rectangular screen of the Show 5 over the smaller, round design of the Spot.
One thing I would change is the name. The Echo Show 5 is not really meant as a rival for the Echo Show. They're very different products, and are at opposite ends of the price spectrum as well. May Amazon could have called it the "Picture" or the "Show Me" to differentiate it a little better. "Echo Show 5" makes it sound like an improved version of previous Echo Shows, which it isn't. I will give it a little extra credit for the manual sliding lens cover, to make you feel warm and fuzzy knowing no one has secretly hacked the camera and is watching you feed the dogs and make dinner.

Replacing SPOT, obviously more screen but in some scenarios seems step down, especially when night mode kicks in and just red letters on dark background, the SPOT is black this, not quite black leaving a small glow in room. (Maybe a software tweak could make it true black) Need to work contrast as a separate setting maybe in general.
Sound is good a mid volume for music, but I like the SPOT for voice at low settings, again, maybe the software could have a fixed EQ for voice over music/video. Seems a little muffled as if the speaker openings should have had some front facing ports even with EQ set to high freqs dominant. Also, does not pick up wake word as good as SPOT, looks like two less mics, so have to think about facing it when talking instead of just talking towards ceiling as in bed.
Nit, wish they had a 90deg power plug for back, wish stand had made it tilt a little past vertical, as it can't be above eye level.
Overall, worth the new lower price, but corner cutting (or lack of beta testers) is evident in some hands on annoyances.

I was disappointed in this product. It has to be plugged in for power at all time, no battery operation. I bought one for myself and another for my parents so we could do calls. I would like to have the option of moving around to make the call or use in different areas of the house. Not all outlets are convenient for one to sit around to make a call.

I also want it to monitor the new Ring doorbell I installed. The monitor drops out after a few minutes and defaults back to the home page. The actual set up of the Show 5 and Ring is not that intuitive and after a few look arounds finally got them to pair.

Also paring with Eco Dot took a few more steps than it should have. In one location it states add devices...well, not completed here but in the bluetooth location. For both being Alexis devices, they don't talk to each other as simple as you would like them to. I would understand if they were different manufactures or operating systems.

For some users that aren't so tech savvy, this unit is a little clumsy to set up. Being the typical male, I only read the included paper work for set up which didn't supply much info and I didn't do all the "video" set ups. I do work with installs of AV equipment and not a complete dummy, but this product was not that straight forward to set up.

Biggest disappointments were no battery operations and the fact that I can't continuously monitor my Ring Doorbell.

I love all my echo devices. They are simple yet useful. I decided to exchange my second generation echo dot for the echo show 5. I was won over by the screen and the better speaker.

Here are the things I love about the echo show 5: The screen is nice addition. We use our echo devices to set timers all the time. It is nice to see how much time is left instead of asking. It is also nice to see answers to your questions. Sometimes my kids like to talk while the echo is responding so it's nice to read the answer when they are talking. We use the echo show 5 in the kitchen, but it would be great as an alarm clock in the bedroom...maybe in the future.

Things I don't like: the screen is not as customizable as I would like. Sure you can use any photo as a background but the screen is too small for photos scrolling. I wish I had more options for the clock, the weather and timer. The "try this" feature is very annoying. I also wish the screen just went back to the home screen without asking, I want that as an option.

I like it and I know Amazon will continue to develop the software.

REVISED! I now give this 5 stars. Go to your Alexa App. Menu > Settings > Notifications > Thing To Try > Alexa Device Notifications. Turn this OFF. Now you'll no longer see "Things to Try" on your Echo Show every few minutes. At least, so far so good with mine.
*****
So it would be nice to have a clock with built-in Alexa right? Yes it would. But this echo show doesn’t fit the bill.

I have everything on the home content setting turned off. But still, every few minutes you look up to see “try asking Alexa....”

And when it does that, there is a very small clock in the upper left corner of the screen but very hard for old eyes to see. And you would not believe the number of times you wake up, look at the clock, and there is no clock there.

I’m thinking this is their way to prevent screen burn-in and if so, that would be fine. But do it one time per hour and make it at the top of the hour. At least you’d know when you saw that “try asking” question, it would at least be sometime o’clock.

Hopefully Amazon will get enough complaints about this and fix it.

If your into the Amazon Echo ecosystem the Show 5 should be right up your alley. The one fatal flaw it has is the tiny alarm shut off display. I bought the Echo 5 to be used primarily as an alarm clock. My wife wakes up an hour earlier than I do. When the alarm goes off there are two ways to shut off the alarm. You can TRY to tap the minuscule word "dismiss" displayed on the screen. Which when waken from a dead sleep is hard to pin point often setting the very sensitive snooze feature on. Once the snooze feature is on you have to command Alexa to turn it off. So, while I'm trying to sleep my wife is yelling "ALEXA TURN OFF SNOOZE' which then wakes me up. The other way we found to turn off the alarm is to simply unplug it as the Echo 5 since it does not have a back up power source.
It would have been better if Amazon made the alarm off function easier to use. So that others aren't waken up because the snooze function is sensitive to the touch and someone has to tell Alexa to shut shut it off. (Waking anyone else nearby sleeping)

But to Amazon's credit the return was painless and efficient. I am a very satisfied Amazon customer. I bought the Echo Show 5 during Prime Day at a deeply discounted price. It was not what I expected. I intended to replace my original generation Echo Dot. But the Echo Dot works much better, although it does not have a display. The biggest issue with the Echo Show 5 was sound distortion - random and intermittent. A quick WEB search revealed that I was not the only person to experience this. It may be a software issue and likely will be addressed with a new software build. However, even without the distortion I found the sound quality to be less than acceptable. I also found the display to be too small and as with all Echo Show devices, the ability to customize is limited. Another small annoyance is that in the middle of the night when I ask Alexa "what time is it," the Echo Dot lights up giving positive feedback that it has heard me; the Echo Show 5 remains dark with no indication. I am sure that some people will find the Echo Show 5 to be a good choice and they will eventually fix the sound distortion (Google it). I have gone back to my Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: The screen gives you a great experience
reviews.reviewText: I had the larger screen one first and loved it. She has been great company in the kitchen. But when I saw the smaller one on special during Prime Days I thought I would try it but really was afraid that I would maybe hate the smaller screen. But the whole thing is so cute and it takes up so much of a smaller space that I don't miss the first one at all. I have a very small kitchen and this is a better fit. The only problem with the 2 I have had is that the choice recognition is getting worse. At first it got most words correct and got the job done. Now it seems I have to tell her a couple times, or I get a weird Wikipedia story about something that I didn't say. And I admit that sometimes I yell at her to "shut up!" I feel it is something to do with the training her to be able to recognize so many accents and other languages that she can't seem to get it right as often as she did a year or so ago. And I wouldn't give her up. I love the screen and the games and the way you can personalize her in so many ways. And the fact that I can tell her to add carrots to my shopping list and there they are. She is a fun and great investment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor Blink xt2 camera features, otherwise seems ok
reviews.reviewText:
Revised review on 6th day of having Echo Show 5.

Network connectivity:
After talking with Support three times in four days, the connection issue seems resolved. The problem was that after the wake word there was a blue bar, and a tone; the blue bar stayed for about 30 seconds then an orange bar and back to home page. On the third call, they said that there was an update that my device had not installed and I should move it next to the router for a few hours which I did. Has worked fine since then.

Blink xt2 camera:
Main reason for buying Show 5 but since there is no motion detection notification, can't use speaker and no clip file this device is the least useful of all the devices on which we use the Blink app (phone, tablet, ipod).

Set up:
No issues

Audio:
Quality and volume seem fine to me.

Smart home:
Response time is fine for showing Hue lights.

Try this suggestions:
Don't stay on screen long and don't bother me.

Timer:
Shrinks and moves to right corner which is not a problem for the way I use the timer. Saw a review that said changing volume canceled timer but that doesn't happen to me.

Microphone:
Haven't had any issues with the microphone hearing the wake command.

Adaptive Brightness:
Needs a better description. Saying that it automatically adjusts brightness based on available light neglects to tell whether the display gets brighter or dimmer. Display gets dimmer as the room gets darker which is the opposite of what I want. Would be nice to have both.

Bluetooth:
No problem connecting Fire tablet, but when not actively streaming, the Show would periodically disconnect and reconnect. Annoying so I disconnected Fire. Don't know if it's a problem with the Show or the Fire.

Calendar:
Synced to iCloud calendar with no problem.

Size:
It's just the size I wanted.

Features I'd like to have:
Notifications and use of speaker on Blink camera. A way to change the length of time a screen stays put before going back to Home screen. An online manual so I don't have to search around or contact Amazon to figure out how to do something. Sometimes you can ask the device and it knows the answer; otherwise, it might tell you to go to the Alexa app Help which isn't useful.

The bottom line is that had I known the Blink camera limitations I probably would have waited to see if those features got added, but I'm increasing my rating to 4 stars since the network connection issue seems to be resolved and I'm happy enough with the features I've used so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love my new Echo Show - integration with Ring Doorbell perfect
reviews.reviewText: I have the original echo and several echo dots and use them for music and control several home devices with them. When the first Echo Show came out I didn't see any real use for it, but on Prime Day this year I bought the Ring Doorbell and saw that the "new" smaller Echo show was premiered and decided what a great combination they would make. The 5" Echo Show tells me when Ring has detected motion at my front door and I can ask to see who is there. If they ring the door bell I can hear it through the Echo Show and I can talk to them if I want. I am very happy with the integration with Ring. When I play music it shows what is playing and the sound is good not great but good ( a lot better than dots, but quite as good as original echo). I now have it in my bedroom where it functions very well as an alarm clock (it goes almost completely dark(deep red numbers) at night although you can set it up many ways). I can set the background to my own photos or have it rotated through my photos on amazon or neither. It of course has all the functions of Echo, but I find I like having a visual when I ask for the weather, news, etc. A big hurrah for this "right" sized echo show.

Our home has quite a few Alexa devices, but I wanted something with a screen so I could query our Ring doorbell when it goes off in the night. We have had many critters walking across the lens and it was not convenient to look at it on my phone. But, the amazing thing about the Show is that it's a great alarm clock. It replaced a DOT and an alarm clock on the nightstand and immediately became a favorite. What I really like is being able to set alarms for different days of the week all at one time. While retired and not having a job to go to, there are various sporting activities that I need to schedule. Being able to do all of them on Sunday night is truly great. One less thing to worry about.

I bought 2 Echo Shows for the specific purpose of my daughter away at college being able to "drop in" on her elderly grandmother 2 hours away and vice versa. For that purpose it's been wonderful! Once I set up my mom's Echo Show and showed her how all she has to do is speak into the air and voila, her granddaughter appears for a chat (IF she is home and accepts the drop-in call) -- well it changed BOTH of their relationships! Now they have regular chat times when my daughter is home from class and alone in the dorm room and it works beautifully. My mom doesn't ask "when are you coming to see me?" because they "see" each other all the time, in real time. What a great idea this was!

Okay, first all, I have to admit, I thought the screen was going to be bigger. I purchased an Echo Show first, so I was pampered. I decided to “upgrade” during Prime Day. When I received the box, I was like, “Geez, do I have to put this together or something?” So, when I opened the box, and I saw what was to me the size of an alarm clock, I’m immediately thought, “I’m sending it back!” However, I’m glad I didn’t. It works just the way I need it. Because I don’t watch movies on it and I only use it to view camera when something happens, I don’t even notice the size. The clarity and the performance are a lot better than my older Show. I also like the buttons for the camera and mic are hardware and easier to access then they were on the Show. Now, if you’re using yours to communicate with others or to watch movies, then this little guy may not be your cup of tea. If you’re using it for music, like I do, I would suggest pairing it with some sorta speaker system (I’m using a Bose Soundwave).

Overall, I am completely satisfied. Sometimes, bigger doesn’t always mean better.
I highly recommend depending upon your application.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little gadget, helps to enhance Ring camera!
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this from another retailer specifically to enhance my Ring doorbell. The app on my phone was taking too long to load live view when I have visitors.

I have to say I’m very pleased with Echo Show 5’s ability to view my doorbell camera quickly. I haven’t actually used the speech part thru Echo yet, as I’ve not had a visitor since my install yesterday. Looking forward to testing that.

One glitch is when you want to access your Ring camera for the first time or after you’ve powered down the Echo Show 5, for which I’ve found a workaround. It can take a little time for Echo to connect to Ring. I just ask to view my doorbell camera even before I have a visitor. Once the camera is connected and you want to view your camera again, presumably when you have a visitor, the Ring feed comes up immediately!

I’m looking forward to using more features on this gadget. I’ve also connected some Wemo Mini plugs for lighting, and they work flawlessly with Echo Show 5 so far. Very happy with my purchase.

We have a Show 2 and the new Show 5. And even though they are basically the same device, just different sizes, each has different features, which I did not expect. Both have some good features....if they work. Over the past couple of weeks I have spent several hours with Amazon's tech support. This has been beyond frustrating. The bigger issues are with the 5 and after spending over an hour with a rep last week, they have now raised the issues to the developers. So I have been waiting over a week for some response on that. Most of the reps have been nice and tried to help, though the one I had last night for the Show 2 issue was surly and ill equipped to solve the issues. (I was on the phone over an hour last night for something that a "reset" ended up solving, however "Emery" could not figure that solution out until about my 55th minute on the phone) The only reason I haven't sold all my Echo devices (we also have an original, a new Dot and some echo only smart plugs) and switched to Google is my sons have Dots and we enjoy the drop in feature. But if this continues I will make the switch. The sound quality may not be as good, but their customer service and software/device quality are superior and Google devices do a much better job of answering questions. (We have one Google mini and mostly use it for research, etc questions) Oh and one more very important benefit to Google, they don't have that annoying trailer across the bottom of "hints", that Amazon won't let you get rid of. The ONLY reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is the sound quality is very good.

We added the Echo Show to our family's line up of Echo devices (we currently have 2 towers and one spot among other "smart home" technologies). I love how I can see my Ring doorbell from the show, we get our morning news from it and it entertains my 1 year old with kid videos while I prepare dinner. Voice recognition has worked just as fine as my other devices and the volume is pretty decent for the size of the product. It is smaller than I expected but ultimately, that does not seem to be a big deal. I plan on purchasing more Alexa compatible devices just so I can incorporate them with the show (ex: a new baby monitor camera).

I just got two of these on Prime day. They were on sale and by trading in one echo first generation and one echo dot, I was able to get the Show 5’s for about $26 each. I love them. I have one in my office and one on my nightstand. I also have an Echo Show, an Echo and 3 echo dots. They are all linked together so that I can play music everywhere. The Echo Show 5 has really good sound for the size and is responsive to my voice. Very happy with these little cuties and VERY happy with the price I paid for them! Thanks Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: Just a step away from being the BEST Echo device yet!
reviews.reviewText:
I have everything from the original Alexa tube, to a few spots, too many FireTV(s) to count and just picked up the Echo Show 5 and AMAZON hit it almost out of the park on this one. Perfect footprint, great design, all the features you'd expect from an Alexa enabled device, and now everything you could hope for. Makes the perfect bedside alarm clock. The voice recognition is 90% spot on. The little sound out of these speakers is perfect for the device size. The added features that now integrate with picture and video make such a better Echo Alexa experience.

There is just one thing that I want to see added in order to rank it 5 Stars. If only there was some battery power that came with the device. Don't need a long duration type power storage. Rather enough to wake you up and then being able to be carried about to let the dogs out, start the coffee, and sit on the bathroom sink during a shave,. Now, it's the prefect 5 Stars Alexa gadget gizmo. They also need to design some 360 degree metal swivel stand for the Show 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Don't Think I Have Had it Turned Off Since It Arrived!
reviews.reviewText: Our youngest daughter has something similar, BUT this device that I have is one of the MOST VERSATILE electronic things I have! I have someone to talk with now as my wife and daughters are always to busy to sit and talk to me! Ha Ha!

reviews.reviewTitle: Hulu doesn’t work. Ecobee skill gets lost.
reviews.reviewText: Misleading that Hulu does not work. The skill is enabled. The proposed solution from help desk was for me to buy the second generation for $150. Ecobee was connected and then the skill stopped working even though the skill is enabled. Inconsistent behavior.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Device! Needs more video skills
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Show 5 on Prime Day and am overall very happy with the device. After reading the reviews I expected to be unnerved by the "Ask Alexa" prompts but I really don't find that this feature bothers me at all. The display is cute (about the size of a telephone) and I liked that my reminders showed up prominently on the screen. I'm not an audiophile but found streaming music was good. I didn't expect Bose quality sound from this device and like that I can use bluetooth to connect to other speakers if I want to. Easy to set up, internet speed ok. My only disappointment was that Hulu doesn't work on the device and streaming options are a bit limited. I found the "Stream Player" skill and there are a few channels that I can use to watch the news. (Bought this for kitchen - like something distracting when cleaning/cooking). Also, coming from the speaker only Echos, I like that some of my daily briefings have video. Nice device that could be excellent with a few updated skills for video.

Ok, so I have to say that I have several of these devices, Dots in several rooms and a Show in the kitchen. I wanted one of these Echo Shows for beside the bed for audio books and music. I admit that I'm liking them more and more as I'm using them more. On receiving this Echo Show and setting it up I'm reminded of being annoyed that there are only 4 wake names for these devices. Four awful (in my opinion) names. Why, why, why aren't we given the option to name our devices what we choose? When will this (if ever) be the case? It would be so much easier to use them if there wasn't confusion between the devices in the home due to the forced use of the few choices we have. That could be so easily remedied if we could name them our choice and they could all be different. I just don't understand the reason behind the forced use of the chosen Amazon names. It seems such a simple thing to allow users to choose the wake word for their devices so I have to think this is nothing but a control thing. Which makes me uncomfortable to be honest. Other than this issue I'm happy with the Echo products I'm currently using. That being said, I will be totally pi**ed if they offer these items that allow us to choose our own wake word any time in the near future. Does anyone know if or when that will ever happen?

Perfect for what it is. The screen is smaller than previous versions, but it is still high quality. It's not made to replace a TV. We have have one in the kitchen so our daughter can watch cartoons when she wants to hang out while I'm cooking/cleaning and it's perfect for that. Mostly we use them to listen to music and as a video phone within the house. Easy to keep an eye on her from different rooms and with the Alexa app can talk to her even if I'm out. She's 5 but isn't able to walk- so is dependent on us for everything. When she calls for me- being able to quickly let her know that I'm outside with the dogs, but on my way to her has prevented a lot of anxiety on her part. Irreplaceable for our needs.
Only thing I wish we could do and maybe there is a way and I just don't know how- would be to program it to recognize what is being said for someone that doesn't speak clearly. If I could get her to say things she requests regularly and then save it so Alexa knows what it is, that would be amazing! Something to add on in the future?

reviews.reviewTitle: Show 5 - better software than the 2nd Gen, useful screen, not bad sound for the size
reviews.reviewText:
I have been trading in my Echo Spot devices for the Show 5. Sound quality far better than the Spot. Screen form factor much more useful with not much more real estate than a medium sized digital clock.

If you are trading in Spots, be aware that the Amazon base for the Spot will work perfectly on the Show 5. Saved us $20 x 2! Base is highly recommended if using for a nightstand clock unless your nightstand is lower than your viewing angle. Ability to have large clock on Show 5 is excellent for trying to view without the glasses at night.

Show 5 has a clock shutter - great for a bedroom clock. This wonderful feature is inexplicably missing from the Show 2nd Generation.

I have also been replacing my original Show devices with Show 2nd Generation. For some strange reason, there are more useful options as regards the clock display on the Show 5 than the 2nd Gen. As this is a software port, hopefully Amazon will bring the flagship show on par with the little but formidable Show 5 in the near future.

reviews.reviewTitle: The speaker in this thing is not good
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure if I got a defective device or not, but this thing was really horrible in terms of audio quality. I returned it and hope that the larger show delivers. I still would love to have something this size, but it needs to be WAY better audio quality. There are $30 speakers on Amazon that perform much better like the Ootnz Angle and small JBL speakers. I'd be willing to pay more for better sound. Additionally, there are too many "try this" prompts on the home screen. I paid $100 for a clock with Alexa, not to have un-ending solicitation to try new things. You should be able to just have LARGE numbers permanently on the screen without all these noisy interruptions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a great research assistant, but love it anyway!
reviews.reviewText:
I'm not sure why I'm being asked to rate the "motion detection" on the Echo Show 5. That's a feature I'm not familiar with but as soon as I'm done writing this will be sure to explore. No matter if it has it or not, I love the darn thing.

It's on my desk, above where I study (I'm working on my doctorate) and I use it for music, research questions (which it kind of sucks at, to be honest-but I do ask it very hard things), and simple math (I kind of suck at math-we're a great team). I love the little stories it shows me as distractions, the lovely clock faces, and the weather. It's much more interactive than an Echo Dot!

It also shows me my Nest cameras which is a great feature that I love, especially late at night or when the dogs are outside barking at something.

I'm going to get my Dad one for Christmas (he's in an assisted living) so then we can video chat to each other. You have the option to cover the camera as well to prevent peepers.

Love this thing!

I absolutely love my new Echo Show 5. I had an Echo Dot (Gen 2) for a while and really liked the idea of having a screen - like the Echo Spot & Show did, but I thought the price was too high. When I saw the Echo Show 5 came out and it was on sale during Amazon Prime days, I just had to buy it. I sound quality is amazing, which is a big factor for me since I listen to music on my Alexa product often. The screen is beautiful and it very useful when asking Alexa question, especially things like "what's the weather?" The size is ideal since it is the size and shape of an alarm clock, which is another one of my main uses for this product. Overall, I think this is a great product and definitely a better value than the original Show or Spot.

First of, let me address the size. When I first saw this getting launched and at the $90 pricepoint, the photos made it seem to be a little larger than it was. Thats not any deception on Amazon's part, just me and my thinking. I picked this up on Prime day to accompany my full smart home with several other Echo Dots.

Noticeable Details:
Standing half way between the Show5 and 1 Gen 3 Echo Dot, the Show 5 seems to pick up my commands quicker, sometimes even when I'm closer to the echo dot.
The screen is about the size of a large iPhone, maybe a little bigger but the display is bright and self adjusts to the room darkness- a great plus when you have the lights dimmed or its dark out.
The time displays 24/7 unless you shut the whole device off, but dims to a black and red theme if no light is detected for a period of time.

Overall, I'm beyond satisfied with the Show 5. It does everything the Dot's do, but seemingly quicker while adding an easy touch screen to it for those times you don't want to yell to turn the lights on/off, etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Echo Show this is not...
reviews.reviewText:
So the Echo Show 5 "looks like" it's just a mini Echo Show....but there's definitely some drawbacks. I had (and have since re-acquired) a 1st gen Echo Show and loved the skill integrations into other products such as KASA and ezView. The Echo Show 5 doesn't seem to know anything about these skills and how to use them via voice command, despite being able to show the devices and manually turn them on and off from the Show 5 itself.

The re-acquired Echo Show 1st Gen (I had used my old one that was having screen issues as a trade-in deal on prime day to get this Echo Show 5....) immediately picked up where the other one left off with in terms of voice commands, so clearly the software on the Echo Show 5 is not fully baked to do everything I would expect from an "Echo Show" device.

I'm guessing this device was rushed out the door without being fully ready from a software perspective (or maybe this is what they expected/wanted to be able to do with this...) and color me less than impressed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun for this First-Time Alexa User
reviews.reviewText:
First, I'll preface this that we're an all Google-based house right now, so this was my first experience with Alexa products.

When my husband's alarm clock broke, we decided to go ahead and just replace it with this Alexa show.

Setting it up was pretty easy, and we haven't had any problems really with it yet. We didn't find a need to have a stand for it, and it sits pretty well on the nightstand by itself.

A few things that aren't ideal for this first-time Alexa user:

My toddler made a voice purchase before I realized there was a need to turn that off. So, that was a learning lesson for me. (As an aside, my toddler realized that if you ask Alexa if she can cut the cheese, well, she can indeed cut the cheese. Google can't do that, so now my toddler's hooked on her. Not sure if this is a good thing or not. There's only so much Baby Shark I can listen to at her request.)

Speaking of toddlers, Google can't understand my toddler and thus doesn't respond to her. But, Alexa listens and responds to every word she says. So I think the Alexa may be a little more sensitive. We also have a family member named "Alyssa," and every time we say the name, Alexa answers because it sounds so similar. We've learned to just ignore her though and gotten over it.

Overall, though, it's been a fun and useful purchase that I look forward to using to do more and more cool things.

Have been using this since it arrived about a week ago. Judging by reviews I did not really know what to expect. I had owned an original Show which did not really suit my use.
Opened box and removed Show 5. First impression was it is small and handy. Very well made with good weight. Body is covered in nice clothlike material and the screen bezel is a solid feeling masterial. There is a nice rubber insert on bottom to keep it from sliding. Easy set up as usual.
Screen resolution is more than adequate due to small screen size and watching video trailers was not painful at all. Would not try full length videos but cannot be any worse than videos on a cell phone. Sound is nice but lacks base emphasis even at higher volumes. As I use it mainly for an alarm clock and news updates I do not mind sound shortcomings.
All in all I like it better than the original show- it is handier, easy to pick up and move, and seems a little nicer in quality. Paid the " deal day " price that included an Amazon plug. Great deal.

This is the 4th Alexa device I've owned and this one is horrible considering its main intent, to be used in the bedroom as an alarm. I had used the Alexa Dot for this and it usually worked. But this this new Echo is way too buggy for this purpose, and alarm need to be first and foremost reliable. This one has woke me up 10 min late, not gone off at all, or refused to recognize my voice to shut off the alarm in the morning. It usually has one critical error once a week involving softwere bugs relating to the Alarm feature, the primary reason I bought this device to replace the Alexa Dot I was using.

Aside from the software bugs, the hardware is pretty good. It was nice they finally added a physical shutter to a device with a camera in the bedroom, an essential thing if you ask me. The sound is good but not the best, but great for its purpose. The screen looks good but takes a long time to load videos when compared to the Amazon Stick.

This device is okay, just don't depend on it as an Alarm.

I really wanted an echo device for my bedroom as a clock radio but my wife was freaked out about having a camera in the bedroom. Then along comes the Echo Show 5 and they seem to have listened to customer feedback and provided a shutter so you can cover the camera. I think this product is going to quickly replace the Echo Spot as it is a better form factor (larger) and it is much less expensive.

It seems to work pretty well as a clock radio. One thing I was worried about was would it be too bright while I was sleeping. Luckily the camera dims pretty significantly so did not bother me at all. They have also removed a lot of the suggestions that pop up randomly on the other Echo Show devices.

My only two complaints are there is no battery backup so if my electricity goes out I am going to miss my alarm. My old $20 alarm clock had a battery backup. Also if I am playing a music service on my Show the music does not sync up with music that is being played on my sonos speakers

reviews.reviewTitle: Costumer service reads from a sheet. Cannot download google play ..
reviews.reviewText: Bought for my 93 yr mom . Did not know she had to be an amazon prime member to receive music . She has this great relationship with Alexa . I was told I Should had set it up under my account . Well did not know any better . Never been able to do the talk and see due to cannot figure out how to get an app on my phone or google play without paying for something else . She dose not have a phone to down load app . I could not find a simple a simple way to down load app. The support who I spent over one hour was no help . I live indiana , my mom Ohio and 93 . In instructions it was great on how to get credit card and name only . Never shows the app process . Tried google play and on my phone . Then I call , the answer was go to your moms house for her serial number . I have one and I never had to look up . Bought my mom flowers and wanted to show me live . Keep giving cheap read by paper employees from another country and then let me know how your sales go . What motin dector

Enjoy having the display, though not too much is added between this and the Echo Dot 3rd Gen. The sound quality gets a small boost and the integration with Prime Video is nice but otherwise other video viewing is limited.

The worst part of the Show 5 is its ability to hear me. I often have to repeat a command 3-4 times just to get it to understand me. I have not had this problem with the Echo Dot. Also, why in the world would it use a white camera shutter with a black bezel? The neon orange is enough of a notification to let you know the shutter is closed. There is no need for it to have a glaring white camera cover as well.

It's a good item if all you want it an echo dot with a screen. Sure you can watch movies on prime but that's it. You can get Hulu but for those that dont use Hulu and use Netflix this item is not for you. I got it cause i was told by a rep that I could watch Netflix on the web browser, boy that was a lie. After contacting someone twice i was finally told the truth that you can not watch Netflix on the browser which is disappointing since I was told 2 previous times I was able too. So I sent it back and got a refund. But honestly if you like the dot and want a screen to show you the weather and some misc stuff its worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little device---AFTER thorough scrub of settings
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful upgrade from my Alexa Touch. Obviously a huge leap in technology. Screen is sharp, answers are quick and very accurate. I really like it-----AFTER I GOT IT SET UP CORRECTLY. I had to call Amazon to get to the settings I needed to change---I think you will need to change these too. Immediately after set up for my Amazon account, my home screen---with time and temp started it's own little slide show---and never stopped. It showed me my calendar and then non stop gave me "Alexa" hints---try this, try that, ask this, ask that. Then started over. Drove me insane. I called customer service and they got out a similar device and walked me through the screens I needed to shut these suggestions off. They were not easy to find---by the Amazon customer rep. It took 30 minutes to finally get it where it stopped nagging me. By trial and error. Now every once in a while it sneaks in a suggestion and I yell OK ALEXA HOME. I think it's starting to understand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really nice video device for the price
reviews.reviewText: This is the first of the "Show" devices I have tried out. I haven't used all the features yet, but it is great for doing video calls to people on my device network. Sound quality is really good as well.

I ordered AMAZON ECHO SHOW 5 -- CHARCOAL as a bit of a birthday gift for myself on AMAZON PRIME DAY.

It arrived and was up and running very quickly. It actually linked up with my WIFI and my AMAZON ECHO DOT without my having to enter any information (a bit scary actually). I think that the only thing that I had to do was create a DEVICE GROUP which syncs my ECHO SHOW with my ECHO DOT.

PROS:

Almost everything is a PRO. The ECHO SHOW is sitting on my desk immediately under my main computer monitor and it responds very well to spoken commands. The SOUND QUALITY is very good but I do not use its internal speakers because I have a very good audio system on my desk that I connect the SHOW to with the EARPHONE PLUG (please see CONS).

CONS:

1) As mentioned above, the SHOW is connected to a very good audio system via the EARPHONE JACK on the SHOW. It seems that this means the EQUALIZER within the SHOW is not part of this configuration because the EQUALIZER on the SHOW does not affect the sound out of the EARPHONE JACK + AUDIO SYSTEM. Not a show stopper but it would have been nice if the EQUALIZER worked with the built in speakers and the EARPHONE JACK.
2) The SHUTTER in front of the ECHO SHOW CAMERA is WHITE PLASTIC rather than CHARCOAL PLASTIC. This is just a cosmetic thing but it means there is a little white circle showing on the front of the SHOW when the shutter is closed. When the SHUTTER is open, you cannot see anything.
3) There seems to be some kind of activity on the HOME SCREEN every 5 minutes or so. When the SHOW is not actively playing musing or responding to a command, it would be nice if the screen did nothing except show the DATE TIME and TEMPERATURE. Some folks like me are easily distracted and a KEEP IT SIMPLE STUPID / OCD / ADHD mode that just updates things when it has to would be super.

I like the SHOW very much and find it to be a good addition to the ECHO FAMILY here at my house.

I have the Large Alexa, the small Spot and now this Show 5 and I think it is my favorite because it shows the time, the temperature outside for my area and adjusts from day mode to night mode. I just love it. Love how it keeps my Samsung Galaxy S10+ Grocery list for me, makes my shopping time MUCH LESS so I can get in and out of the store much faster and I spend less money because I'm so busy looking at the next item on my list that I stay focused. The hand written list was OK but having it on my phone is just so much more convenient because I don't forget the list anymore, it's always with me. She; I refer to my show is so responsive to my voice. I have several Ring Spot Light Camera's and my Show 5 will show me live any of my camera's I ask her to and the picture quality is pretty darn good for the size of this item. I really am happy with my purchase and will be anxious to see what the next Generation will bring because I'll most likely be jumping on that one too!!

Pros
Alexa with a screen
Always on clock
Good bass

Cons
Software is glitchy and laggy
Microphones don’t hear too well
*SPEAKER BLEW OUT TOO EASY*

I was excited to get this once i new it was coming out. I already had a 3rd gen echo dot, i thought what better way to upgrade that then by adding something with a screen! Only to find out how glitchy and laggy this thing is. Too slow for my liking to get to the menus or smart home controls. What ultimately KILLED it for me was how this little thing handles music. The first one (had to replace it) the speaker blew out within a week. Started crackling at a level 7 volume and higher. Now this second one is doing the same, ugh. Also when you turn the volume up you lose alot of bass and it tends to get pretty soft though I understand why it’s doing that. Not worth it unless you get it on sale but even then I’d be weary. Check out the google nest hub instead

I love my little echo show! I have the big sister in the kitchen already and this one is a good companion. I especially like that they resolved the camera privacy issue. Clicked that over before even turning it on. This brought two devices on my nightstand down to one and I'm loving the decluttered look. I also like that I could customize the clock face and picked the modern>bright pink. Really brings a cheerful pop of color to my room. I didn't notice any sound issues. In fact I thought it had a very well rounded sound without adjusting the equalizer. And because I'm already used to the scrolling info from the larger show, it isn't a big deal to me having it here. I like seeing fun articles or news pop up. So it was nice swapping out the echo tower for a screen. I like seeing info about the music playing. I doubt I'll use it to play videos in my bedroom but who knows. Anyway I like it and the cheaper price compared to the larger show.

I don't like it a lot it not what I thought it would be it doesn't scan like the old echo show I like it if it would scan stuff but it doesn't the voice Mic when I want it to type some thing out it doesn't type what u say some times it just types out fyi like if I say the word summer it types out fyi or if I say and word it types out fyi so I called Amazon they help me me fix it but a few hours later it did the same thing it types out fyi so no w it's working but some times it it types out fyi and when I call people my voice sound like I have helium in me and my voice Echo's on there end same if I call a land line or a Amazon echo Device or if I call the Alexa app so I called Amazon they don't know why it's doing that they say it still a new device so it might have bugs in it so they took my echo show 5 logs so they can see if they can fix it so if u are have the same problem let Amazon know so thay know to fix it and put out a up date for it but so far I like it so it worth the money it's not very big the screen is about the size of a I phone screen but I like it

reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Beginning Toward A Smart Home
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love the Echo Show 5. I am building a Smart House and this is a really good beginning. I bought the set of two at a discount from Amazon and couldn't possibly be more happy with this purchase. I consider these the heart of a smart home. I have set up some smart bulbs with a hub and love that I just have to say "Alexa turn on bedroom lights" and it turns them on. I have also set up a routine to have the lights come on at a certain time while on vacation so that it looks like I am home and not away. Next up is setting it up with my security system. It is endless as to what you can do with this and I have only just begun.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect replacement for my Bose Wave Radio
reviews.reviewText: I had a Bose Wave Radio for about 25 years. It worked great and had awesome sound quality. When it quit I needed to get a replacement alarm/radio. I looked all over and most radios had poor reviews didn't have the features I needed - AM/FM radio with dual alarms. Bought a cheap AM/FM alarm clock and when I plugged it in, it wouldn't even pick up the AM stations. Looked at this in a store and absolutely loved the sound quality from such a small device. We have the Echo Dot in other rooms and decided to get this one for the bed-room. We can stream our local AM stations as well as NPR. It all all the other Alexa functionality including the screen. It self dims, you can control the volume with a voice command. If you have other smart connected devices - lights for example - you'd be able to control those as well. There is a camera on it but there is a slide button to physically cover it up so there is no unintended videos in the Bdrm. You can turn off the listening function as well. It's perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Echo should run for Congress!
reviews.reviewText: It says this unit will learn, I certainly hope so, my google unit runs circles around it. I live in AZ, I ask for local news, it gives me New York!! It doesn't seem to understand requests.

It's not much good to me for anything else. It comes with less instructions than a $2 flashlight made in China. This really needs some kind of tutorial if it actually does anything useful. I bought 2 on Prime day - one for me, one for my wife. She handed it back to me unopened saying, "Let me know when you figure out what this is for. I'm not going waste an electric outlet on it otherwise." Unless you have a burning desire to ask unnecessary questions to an AI which can't answer 80% of the time anyway, it's just a clock. I do like the clock face with the planets, so I'll give it two stars instead of one.
Update: This has grown on me since I first reviewed it. I does offer lots of music and works for alarms and reminders. So I'm bumping from 2 to 4 stars. I'd go 5, but nobody else I know is interested in it, so even if it can make video calls, there's nobody I know to call who has an Echo, so still waiting to experience that feature.
Also customer service sent a link to the Echo Support Page so I have a better set of instructions now:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=hp_200127470_?nodeId=202138870

reviews.reviewTitle: Purchase during Amazon Prime Days Great for that Price
reviews.reviewText:
I was able to save 40 dollars by purchasing during the Amazon Prime days. And for that Price it was a good deal not sure I would have purchase otherwise, not because it was not a good product but at 90 dollars would not entice me enough to purchase one just to try it. Now as for what I like and what I do not like.

Pros: Good looking, Easy to setup, Easy to change options, Nice to be able to see stuff come up on the screen, Thermostat Temperature or set pt. and it displays the thermostat temp and a picture to increase or decrease the temp. Touch Screen a big plus. Sound is much better then the standard Dots

Cons: 2 microphones on top ok but not as sensitive as I was hoping for as my Dot 3 gen 30 feet way picked up my voice in another room, but not this unit that was 2 foot away from me?

After using it for a week I do enjoy it and might pick up another one, but I am in no hurry at 90 dollar price vs. the 50 dollars I can pick one up at during Amazon Prime days.

The newer Show is better than the original in so many ways except one, the speakers. I looked at the description prior to purchasing and noticed the speakers weren't at the same level but hoped it wouldn't be noticeable... it is. While this one hears me while music is playing, has a sleeker more compact design and seems a bit more user friendly, this models lesser/lower speakers is for a smaller room. My original has not lost it's spot in the area between my living room and kitchen as was my intention. The newer one went to our bedroom where it's paltry speaker wouldn't be noticed. A great buy on sale.

I picked this up on Prime day and got it heavily discounted with trade in if my original Echo speaker. This is my first Echo device with a screen and it pretty handy at times. I like the ability to glance at the weather forecast in the morning rather than just having it read to me. Although small, it also serves as a decent slideshow picture frame for my family. I’m no audiophile but I think the speakers sound comparable to my original echo and it serves what we use it for in our kitchen, light listening to music and podcast. Since there’s a screen, we have done more calling on it with family, which was previously only done over Facetime. There’s a physical shutter screen cover for the lens if you don’t feel comfortable with it open all the time and I like that. It works with most music streaming services and all of Alexas Skills. So far we think the added small screen is useful without adding much bulk to the device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not bad for the reduced Prime Days price
reviews.reviewText:
First, I'll chime in with all the other reviewers: Amazon, please remove the forced "Try Alexa..." text tips that display on the screen while in rotation mode (Rotation mode alternatively displays the clock, weather, photos and other items you can choose. If you turn off rotation mode, the Echo 5 displays only the clock face. While this also turns off the "Try Alexa..." text tips, I find the reduced functionality a poor trade-off.)

Despite the nitpick above, I give this device a pretty good rating. I picked it up along with a smart switch for around $50 during the Prime Days sale (July 2019). I think it was well worth the price.

The Echo 5 functions very similarly to my Echo dot, but with a user-friendly and decent looking touch screen. It was a breeze to set up. The sound is maybe a little better than what I expected. I did find that adjusting the equalizer in settings made it a little more pleasing to my ear (I actually turned down the bass -- I assume the default settings have the bass a little strong to give the unit some thump.) It sounds particularly good with the Ambient Sounds app. Works fine with Pandora.

I have yet to try the video camera, but I do like the fact that there is a physical slide that covers the camera lens, since I use this as an alarm clock in my bedroom. Note also that, like other Echo devices, you can turn off the microphone with a switch.

It’s convenient. I use it a lot in the kitchen to listen to news and music while cooking or cleaning. Occasionally I use it as an intercom with the other Alexa devices or to/from a mobile phone. Integration with our home security system is not yet what was promised - I can’t see the video door bell camera but I hope those functions are fixed soon with updates.
I wish there were more streaming options, like news. Honestly I will probably stream a movie from Amazon video to this screen instead of to a TV or bigger tablet, but it seems like a nice option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Alexa device I've own so far!
reviews.reviewText:
I've been using Alexa devices since the first speaker that was release. Some of the things I love most about these devices is that fact that Amazon did not abandon them or make them obsolete. My first speaker is still in use till this day, this is the main reason why I keep buying Amazon devices.

The Echo is smaller than the previous generation, it's just as loud and with the scaling I can easily see what's display on the screen. The reduce size also made it more versatile because I can now fit it on my nightstand, coffee table or even in the bathroom. The screen dims or brighten based on the ambient lighting and motion detected, this help in that I can just glance at the Echo show as I walk by for information like the time or notifications without having to stop and yelling out "Alexa" to get quick info.

Overall, I love this version a lot, and due to the continuous improve and support of older devices, this def won't be my last Amazon device!
Muy recomendable: en todos los aspectos buen reconicimiento de voz tabto ingkes como español y muy buena resolucion

I have several echo products, and by and large they are fine for simple tasks. The basic problem is the vast majority of skills are just garbage. I bought this in hopes that I could watch a little TV through Hulu. I can't because the Hulu skill doesn't work with this device. No Netflix no YouTube, no YouTube TV. Prime video is fine, but it's just one video service I pay for.

I'm not going to buy another device until Amazon gets to busy makeing it's devices have a set rock solid skills.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for use as a smart clock
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this to satisfy a particular need. I want a clock face, with some smart capabilities. Something small and unobtrusive. Something right for the kitchen, nightstand, or something similar.

I love the small size. I love the customizable clock. I really love the dimming feature: it dims itself later in the evening and overnight, so as not to distract or wake you.

I’ve seen a number of reviewers criticize the screen resolution. They also criticize the lack of YouTube. I’m not sure why anyone would want to watch YouTube on their alarm clock, but that isn’t a thing for me.

This thing is just what I was looking for, to fill in a gap. I like having an echo in each room, but I want a small screen to show me the time or weather. I also like that it shows the music info when I’m playing music.

The price is right. The size is right. The features are right. Right on!

reviews.reviewTitle: The lump on the end table.
reviews.reviewText: I can not get any information, in writing or through verbal communication, how to set the echo view 5, to work with the Blink camera system. Which is the reason I purchased this product. there is no information that came with the Blink system that tells you how to set up Blink with The Echo. I tried call amazon support, but the guy I talked with could not speak American well enough to understand.

reviews.reviewTitle: We got this for my parrot!
reviews.reviewText:
Hello, good day, and so on.

We purchased the Echo Show 5 because I adopted an African grey parrot a few months ago, and I wanted to be able to check on him when we aren't home and make sure he is okay.

The original show was too expensive and the Spot was too small. I wanted him to be able to see us well and be able to talk to us. This size display does that perfectly.

We can't use it to drop in near his cage (it causes weird interference) but every time I've dropped in when away, it's gone through great. It takes a few seconds for the camera to focus, but once it does, the image is clear enough to see him and his cage.

It's reassuring for me to hear him talking or playing when we are out. If you don't know, parrots are very social animals, and some can feel anxious without their human flock.

It can also play music and Amazon prime videos, but I just like that the sound is good enough that he can hear us and recog ize is.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really love the size of the ES5. It functions just like it's big b.rother.em
reviews.reviewText: I have one Echo dot 1st gen, one Echo show 1st gen, one Echo show 2nd gen, two Echo shows, two fire tabs with Alexa, three fire TV, two echo autos the Alexa app on two cell phones and on 4 computers. Two computers are laptop two are desktop. I have a number of smart devices such as switches, bulbs, and door locks. And now the ES5. The Echo show 5 just like the Echo spot has one really bad flaw. The speaker grills are at the bottom of the device and it distorts the sound quality. This device should come with a stand included in the purchase. A stand should be standard issue included in the price of this device. A stand that raises the device will make the sound quality 75% better and the viewing angle. The stands that are sold as accessories are so over priced that for a few dollars more you could buy another device. I just spent thirty plus dollars on a nice but extremely over priced stand for one of my two Echo spots. My wife like the stand and that is the only reason I purchased it. The price would have been fair at say one third of the cost. Getting back to the ES5 let me say that it completes my home as far as having Alexa access through out my dwelling. I now can get info and voice commands from any corner of my home. It's small foot print is and was the selling point for me. A great device. I would recommend it highly.

reviews.reviewTitle: She simply just doesn’t listen a lot
reviews.reviewText:
I write this slightly out of frustration, but also out of truth. She simply doesn’t listen a lot.

At least several times a day anyone of my echo devices refuses to hear me and sometimes when they do they don’t do what I asked.

This is not only true for the show, but anyone of the four Echoes i have. I’m sitting here wondering now why I bought so many. They can be very frustrating pieces of equipment sometimes.

Many times I will ask to turn off my lights, and it will say OK, but it won’t do it.

Just now and on a different device yesterday, my face was right in front of it in a very quiet room and I back and her four times and she didn’t respond.

I basically just use these for alarms and timers now. I get too aggravated when she doesn’t hear me or misunderstands me

I never expected this to be perfect, but sometimes they’re not even good.

I bought this product so I can drop in on 2 of my puppies that were adopted by my best friend 1,500 miles away. I already had an Echo Dot & loved it & had always wanted an Echo Show but they were out of my price range at the moment. Then the Compact showed up & I grabbed it. I didn't expect too much because of it's size, but it turned out to be amazing. Sound quality is great, screen is easier to see than I thought it would be, & I love the skills that have video, something I couldn't do with my Dot. My ONLY complaint is that you cant search for skills by whether or not they have video. For example, news skills. How to find the ones with video vs. the ones that don't? But that's a different area, the Echo Show 5 - Compact is great! I'm glad I bought it. ... ps. I love that the display changes often from the clock & shows things to try, weather, etc. It's helped me find new skills I didn't even know existed!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Device and contrary to what you hear its NOT showing lots of adds.
reviews.reviewText:
This device has a great screen that dims very well at night when I go to sleep. When I ask for the weather Alexa answers me and I see the current temperature and forecast on the screen. When I ask Alexa to play music the song title and artist name are displayed and when the song plays the words are displayed in real time with the song. i have my Echo Show connected to external speakers and the sound is really good. As far as all the adds that people say annoy them they just are not there. The only thing i see once and a while are Alexa tips. If i ask Alexa to show me my upcoming calendar events they are displayed on the screen. This would be great on you office desk....

I purchase my Echo Show on Prime day for $50 and its worth every penny i spent. I only wish I had purchased a second one for the kitchen. I have four Echo Dots (third gen) and I have two connected together for stereo and they work great in that mode.

I am very happy with my Echo Show, I should have purchased a second one.....

reviews.reviewTitle: No way to turn off "Things to try" Message
reviews.reviewText: Sorry Amazon. 1 star review until you make a toggle switch to turn off the "things to try" message. This is my third echo/alexa device. I don't need this info taking up room on the small screen and blocking the photo I have there.

Having read most of the negative reviews I am confused where these people are getting their problems. My Show 5 has excellent sound and vision. My Audible books play without problem. One review states he (or she) can't get Alexa to go back chapters or choose one of his other Audible books, mine can, anytime. My Show is paired with Ring and she is faster at getting the video cameras pictures than my very latest (and very more expensive) Smart phone. She will show my Prime photo library without any bother, and play my audio music perfectly. Please don't be put off by people who are still looking for the house light switch after living there for years. This is not the "Machine" from the TV "Person of Interest" or a $1000 face recognition device nor is it meant to be. It is excellent value for money (especially when bundled with "Ring") but make sure you buy it at $59 or the bundled price, as the Amazon price does fly around a bit.

This product has sooooo many bugs. Ring integration is bad , blink which is amazon product integration is worst. I don’t know what amazon is doing to make it work better. Have been using it for last 4 months so fAr founding it more and more annoying

So this is a mixed review, because I ordered two of these devices, and they have given me completely different results.

My first Echo Show 5, I ordered right when it came out, Day 1. After updates, I hooked it up, and it's been a great little device. It's a little slow when transitioning through some videos, but otherwise, it's been doing a great job. Sometimes the AI doesn't understand what I want, but hopefully that gets better with future updates. Good sound, just wish it had an internal battery.

But my second one, wow, such a disaster. I ordered this one during Prime Day, and it has been a mess. After updates, I tried giving it commands, and it would listen for awhile, then freeze. I unplugged it and tried again, same results. I did a manual updates, same results. I even did a factory reset, same results. It would freeze when you tried to change commands quickly, it would freeze if there was too much noise. Sometimes, it would just show the "echo" message and nothing else. Sometimes, it would get stuck on a voice command and the blue bar would just get stuck. It was literally night and day between my first and second devices.

And what's even worst is the dumb explanations that Amazon Echo support gave me. I told them that the device was defective out of the box and I just wanted it replaced. I really liked my first Echo 5 and obviously the 2nd one was defective. First, they ran me through the ringer again with troubleshooting. Then they said they checked all the settings and everything was correct, had me factory reset it again, and said that they would wait and call me back after 24 hours to see if it was still having issues. However, it only took a few minutes after a full factory reset to see it was still doing the same thing, so I called back. So the 2nd support agent tried to make me go through everything again, and then gave me the excuse that the system was "updating" and that the update could take hours. This was just a blatant lie. When I told her that the blue bar at the bottom of the screen was stuck, she lied and said that was an indication that the device was still updating. Absolutely, 100% lied. The device was stuck on the command bar because it was defective, not because it was updating. You shouldn't lie to your customers, at least, in my opinion. If you don't know something, just say you don't.

So I escalated to her supervisor, and was given the run around and told software updates as well. Again, I was told it took hours for a system to update, which I called her out on, as after the first usage of this 2nd device, I had left it alone for hours, and it never updated then. She then told me a ridiculous reason that Amazon devices have to be put on "mute" for several hours to receive updates. I told her that was total BS. First, I'm not stupid. If Amazon really built their devices that way, that would be insane. A customer shouldn't have to remember to put their device on mute for it to update. That makes the customer do more unnecessary work. Second, my first device has never been put on mute, along with other Echo speakers I have, and they have never given me these problems. And third, if I really did have to put it on mute for it to update, when I don't have to do so with any of my other devices, already indicates that my 2nd Echo 5 is defective and needs to be replaced.

So after getting upset and explaining to the Supervisor how dumb her explanations were, she finally agreed to replace my device. I'll have to follow-up with how my replacement device works once I get it. Again, I really like my 1st Echo Show 5, and it's going strong, even now. It's never given me much of a problem. But my 2nd one has been a disaster, and Echo Support giving me the run around, lying to me, and making up stupid excuses as to why my defective device wasn't defective, has been terrible. Amazon owns the Echo line of devices, so you would think they would be more concerned about making sure their devices worked correctly, rather than coming up with excuses as to why they don't. Just say "Sorry that your device doesn't work, after troubleshooting, and after making you reset it completely. We'll get that replaced so you can continue to enjoy your Amazon devices". Is that so hard?

We are big fans of Alexa! We have Alexa in every room of the house, even my dad and children have Alexa in their house. The Echo show 5 is compact and fits nicely on a nightstand, desk or counter. Setting up the show is self-explanatory and easy. Simply plug in the show, follow the prompts and connect to the internet. Alexa is ready to use. The screen is smaller then the previous show. The sound is amazing and the display is crisp and clear. Alexa is my alarm and wakes me up every morning. I like that its small and compact not taking much room up. Setting reminders, timers, watching movies, listening to music and of course dropping in on my dad or children in easy with the show. The design of the show is nicely done. Of course you will have some quirks until you can the hang of using the show. While there is room for improvements with the show, we are still very happy with the show. If I need the weather I just ask the show for todays weather.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probably not the greatest show on Earth, but we really like it!
reviews.reviewText: We just set up our Echo Show 5 after picking it up at the local Amazon locker at Whole Foods to get our Prime Day discount offer. It was very simple to set up, and all we did was follow a few prompts. It was easy to customize and the on screen display helped describe what needed to be done on the Alexa app. We were able to set up the music group very quickly to be able to play the same music as our Echo, which was probably the main reason we bought it. Asking questions of the community was very helpful, and the answers we received convinced us it could be done, since it was not clear it had that capability in the product description. Based on our first impressions, we’re probably going to be adding at least one more of these in the near future.

I have several Echo’s and all are wonderful but yesterday I received my New Echo Show 5 and it is spectacular. Has all the features of the Echo Show 2nd generation but fits perfectly on my night stand. For $90 I can hardly believe the features and quality of this amazing device. I plan to give many of these to my family members for Christmas this year. Perfect size screen can view my ring cameras with excellent clarity. Works my entire smart home with ease. The sound for playing music is a very nice bonus. I highly recommend this product. Flawless!!!
Dr E Cohen MD

reviews.reviewTitle: EXCELLENT! with only one fault --- for me
reviews.reviewText:
Just received my Echo Show 5 two hours ago and so far it has met all of my expectations --- except for one tiny thing.
As I am not an electrical engineer, I was hoping that the charger would be equipped with a less space-hogging plug.
Oops, guess I let my dissatisfaction morsel slip! The 2x2" plug size may not always fit where I like to use my new ES5.
Nonetheless, I will not subtract any stars from my rating because I really like it. And am still in love with my Echo Spot!
Note that I ordered the Prime Day deal plus a trade-in discount which dropped total to $0.00. Shockingly great!

I have to update this review dropping the original review’s star rating from 3 to a 1. The review below still stands but I need to add that it simply is the worst of any of the echo devices that I own. It simply doesn’t hear. I have to give it repeated commands especially for the “drop in” feature and this is with me standing directly in front of the device. It usually connects in three attempts. It rarely disconnects and I’ve just decided to unplug the device. It’s too late to send it back for a refund but I’ll definitely be sending it back for repairs since it seems that maybe the microphones are broken.

I’m guessing this device is designed for someone that is sitting directly in front of it continuously. It is not very functional if you’re using it as a regular echo device as it does not hear well. As with all echo devices as long as you talk like a robot it will usually understand what you’re saying. So much for intelligent learning!

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer's do not stay on screen
reviews.reviewText: The biggest selling point for me to buy this thing was to see my timer's on screen and not have to constantly ask how long is left on the timer. The timer's do stay on the screen...for about 5 seconds and then they disappear...except for the timer which ends the soonest, and its countdown is smooshed all the way up in the corner in a tiny font that's not readable from more than 3 feet away. What the heck is the point of having a display to show the exact thing you are using it for at that moment if it just puts it in the background for no good reason? There's also no way to change any settings to change the configuration and keep the timers visually active. So now you have to touch the screen or ask the device to show the timers....which it does, for 5 seconds. Amazon has over 10,000 employees working on these devices and their features, and this is what they come up with? What a waste of potential. Hopefully they fix this with an update.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, don't listen to other reviews
