reviews.reviewText: It is true that this has some negative qualities, but I personally have never experienced any of them. When you are thinking about ordering one of these it is very important to remember exactly what it is. It is an echo, with an intractable visual interface. This is not a tablet or a smart tv / monitor. I use it for the alexa features. It is great because it can show you things like song lyrics and you can mess around with some skills that Amazon has for the echo. Why anyone would attempt to view videos on this thing is beyond me. You can use this as a communications device which I just figured out which is awesome. It allows you to have physical control over your smart devices and see which ones are active and which ones are not. There are no "ADs" that it displays, what ever you ask for to be displayed it does and it including something like "Give me my flash briefing" when it is SHOWING YOU THE FLASH briefing is not an advertisement. Great product, 10/10 will purchase for my whole family when on sale again.

This device made me really mad when I first got it. My echo dot seemed to work wonderfully with my tv but I decided this would be an upgrade to that. However it seemed a little buggy. I did realize this occurred around the same time my internet service was shorty so I will update after a few days.

I was also getting the dreaded video skills error when I was trying to control my Hulu and Netflix on my fire stick. I tried everything and all my settings were the same! Upon clicking around the app I found this: What you have to do is go in the app under settings>tv and video>fire tv>manage devices> then you will see linked devices. You may have to click on this to change what is currently linked to the device or if you have nothing linked then select link another device and choose the echo show and the fire stick or whatever you want to control. It should work fine after that!

reviews.reviewTitle: Kind of impressive at Prime Day pricing
reviews.reviewText:
Update: Minutes after I posed my review I got a call from Amazon customer service, asking for more feedback on the Echo Show 5. I was surprised to get a call, and even more so when it was nearly instant. They told me they had a lot of feedback on the rotation, and there wasn't a solution for it yet.

But a co-worker told me how to fix it....

Settings --> Home & Clock --> Home Content
Turn off Rotate Continuously

It will rotate through one time, and then sit on the clock face until you interact with it. I'm much happier with the item now. I wish I had found the setting before ranting.
----- original review ------
I was excited to get an echo show 5, thinking it would be similar, but better than the echo spot I received as a gift last year. It's great in the kitchen, brings up recipes and is a nice clock, but it keeps rotating with suggestions, news stories, and things you can do with alexa. I'm sure some people like the feature, but it seems there is no way to turn it off. Which means every few minutes, the screen changes, and I notice it and look over. It's a small annoyance, but will likely outweigh it's usefulness, and it will get returned or given away.

The unit is replacing a 1st gen Echo, and the show is a smaller device, and I didn't expect the same audio quality. But the sound that comes of out this little box is less than impressive, even for it's size. I would say it's comparable to the 1st gen echo dot.

I might be missing a setting, but the Show 5 doesn't display song lyrics like the spot does. It does however have a physical camera cover, so you can be assured that the video of everything going on in the room isn't being recorded and sent back to Amazon, just the audio ;)

All in all, it was underwhelming. Not a bad device, but the $49 prime day price could have been spent on something more impressive.

reviews.reviewTitle: You CAN turn off the "try this..."
reviews.reviewText: We just got our Echo show 5 today. I was very hesitant to get it because of all the reviews about the constant "try this..." comments. But the deal with 5 monthly payments was too good to pass up. I just set it up and you can turn off the rotation of try this. Just go into your settings, and choose home and clock, and you can select to turn off what you don't want to see. At the very bottom you can turn off the rotation as well. Very excited about this device and loving it already. I can see my front door and use it as a baby monitor as well! Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really wanted to like this, but it's Awful sounding.
reviews.reviewText: As Amazon knows by now I'm a Nerd Gadget guy, I own 3 other Shows, all the Alexa devices, so when I saw this I thought Cool a smaller version I can put in my room. I like the size, the Camera Slide shutoff, the color and even found the perfect place 4it 2sit. Then I start using it....... Very Disappointed right off by the Sound coming out, checked all the settings and played some of my Favorite songs I know Very well, Still Horrible tinny sound. I hooked up a BT speaker and the sound is good thru the BT so I know it's the Show5. I have Blink cameras and 1time it connected but took 4Ever. I have 2get close 2let it hear me correctly because from several ft away it Never Understandseems me. I'm very Disappointed because I really wanted this 2b the one I use most. For the $ I paid and it sounding like a old am/fm radio, I'm thinking just return it till something better comes out. Many reviews agree with me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started nice, but don't buy to make video calls
reviews.reviewText:
I bought a pair of Echo Show 5s to use to make video calls with my family who lives across the country. They started out great, but within a few months problems started. First the video calling stopped working on both - turned out to be a software glitch, I guess, because resetting to factory settings fixed both devices. Now one of the two has all incoming video calls so quiet that the receiver can barely hear the other person even with the volume at 100%. Amazon "repaired" it but it still has the same volume issue.

The devices still work fine for weather, movies, music, etc, but not for calling so I guess I'll give them 3 stars. I see a few other reports in the reviews here and in older Echo Show versions, too, so if you want a device to make video calls, I guess the Echo Shows are not it. Too bad for me, since that was the reason I bought them. Learn from my mistake.

I’m really enjoying the Echo Show 5. It was easy to setup and has a small counter foot print. It fits easily anywhere. Love, love, love the Amazon music integration, the way I can communicate with Alexa. It’s like having someone here, but not having to feed them. You can ask Alexa anything. Only one problem I have is shutting off the ‘sounds’. I’ve tried saying, exit healing sounds. But it continues to play. It’s a bit frustrating. But, I eventually win and get it to stop playing when I need it to stop playing. It’s great that it will guard my home when I leave. I just tell Alexa, I’m leaving. It’s still fairly new in my home, so I haven’t tried using all the many things (skills) it can do. I feel I’m going to enjoy having the Echo Show 5 around all my days. Another great thing it does is work alongside with my Wyze cameras and Ring door camera. It’s fabulous. You won’t be sorry in getting yourself one... or two.

reviews.reviewTitle: Barely worth it, and it was free
reviews.reviewText: It's ok. I don't like how Alexa's voice sounds. It's very echo-y. And I absolutely HATE the unremovable hints. (If they tell you they're removable via the app, they're lying. The only way to stop seeing them is to remove some of the show's functionality. ) I don't want to be told Try asking Alex <insert irrelevant statement here>. I don't want to ask her to tell me a joke. I don't want it to be suggested that I try such a thing. Honestly, between that and the fact that it sounds like a demon with the tinny echo, I unplugged it and kept with my gen 2 dot. Voice sounds more like a real voice on that. The only reason why I got the show is because it came free with the ring doorbell pro. I recently installed the doorbell, so I plugged the show back in. But it's literally just so that I can see who's at the door without having to open my phone or turn on the tv (fire stick). Fact is, I was fine with my setup as it was, and getting a free Show doesn't make me suddenly realize, "omg I've been missing this all this time??".

Perfect for what I bought it for. I bought it to replace my aged iHome alarm clock.
Replaced the Echo Dot and my alarm clock freeing up much needed space and one less thing to plug in.
Great for a quick check of my cameras if I hear a noise when I am in bed as well.
I put it on an arm off the edge of my bed frame so I can see it easy without my glasses.
Sound is as good if not better than my Dot Gen 2 and it is nice to see lyrics if I want to.
I like having the weather on display as well. It gives me a good start in the morning to have it right there,

The biggest downside I would say is customization of the clock/home display.
I would love to be able to set font, font size, and such.
Not only that but I would like simple widgets like my cell for calendar, weather and such.
It would be nice to be able to add more home screens to scroll to as well for quick access to things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Received as a Gift DOA and Waiting
reviews.reviewText:
Apparently if you receive a broken DOA device you have to wait to ship your defective device back before getting a working device. That is totally unacceptable, a new device should be sent immediately. Instead, I have to take the time to return a complete piece of junk to receive what I hope is not another piece of junk. My device would not power on and I come to find out that I will not get another device unless I return this first. That is unacceptable. This was a gift and Amazon should treat it as such.

Just stay away from Amazon and these devices, they are worthless. This device was broken on arrival, do a Google search and you will find this is quite common. I had to contact the person who bought it for me to remove the device from their account before support would help and then the Indian support just linked a return label. So I received a gift and now I have to do foot work to get a device that works at all. This is a complete failure of customer service, I should have been sent a new device ASAP and been able to return the defective device my leisure. Just disable the device Amazon, I gave you the serial number and send the customer a working device. I recommend avoiding this product, when researching my problem I have found the product to be a complete lemon that breaks in the first year if your device is working at all.

We received our first Echo 5 and are very impressed with the features. We did not have a security camera directly looking out from our front door and so I installed a Ring Pro doorbell to fill the gap in our security camera coverage. I ordered the Show 5 mainly to give my wife quick and easy access to the Ring Pro camera. The installation and integration with the Echo Show 5 was easy and basically seamless. Once everything was installed, I was very pleased with all the features of the Echo Show versus the regular Echo Spot and other full size Echo speakers that we have. The sound quality is great and the other features such as getting information directly on the screen is a really nice benefit. The words of the song scroll through while playing music and it is especially nice to see the weather forecast scroll through for a week at a time. I am sure that there are many other features that we will discover in the future, but so far I am very impressed and highly recommend the product. I also ordered the new Show 8 at the same time and hope it will be as easy to install and use. Once I receive it, I will write another review to let you know!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent alarm clock & table top speaker. Impressive sound quality!
reviews.reviewText:
Likes:
- Excellent sounds quality. Can easily compare the sound quality with similar size Bose speakers.
- Overall size makes it a perfect fit for side table as a table top speaker or alarm clock. I’m not a big fan of show 2 because of its overall dimension.
- Camera shutter offer privacy control.
- Easy setup & configuration.
- I was very impressed by the quality & range of this device’s microphone. Even while playing music at high volume it can pickup my commands from the corner of my 42ft living room area without a glitch.

Bad:
- Thick bezels reduces screen real estate drastically. With the small form factor, it bothers especially if you are planning to use it as a kitchen countertop device to watch videos.
- Software bugs: Critical obvious defects in key functionalities such as syncing photos from prime albums. (Never had such issues with Amazon software before).
- August cam video takes a while to load (as compared to the same video stream on my firetv)

Way back in the distant past (March) I had on my night stand a clock radio. Then, I added an Echo Dot in June. Since then , I have used the Dot as my alarm and music source. The clock radio was then just a clock. I considered a Spot but the price stopped that idea and I consider the Show 5. Once I decided to get one, thought I’d wait for a sale or trading in my Dot. Well, a sale come up last week at Best Buy and I got the Show 5 for $45! Now I only have one thing on the nightstand and one plug in the wall.

I like the plain screen with the clock since I have not set a picture as the background. The clock dims at night and is dimmer than the radio was. The sound is not bad. While I wish that the “Try this...” could be turned off, after a while I no longer really notice it.

If you are considering this for a bedside clock and music system, you will not regret your decision. If, like me, you have a Dot and just want to simplify thing a bit wait for a sale.

False advertising. This thing has limited to 0 functionality. I bought it so I could lay and bed and say "Alexa watch ...... On bedroom TV" it can't do that. Doesn't support Netflix. This thing really is worthless unless you want an alarm clock that can read only very simple and limited commands. What a joke. Get a Google home and have a device that actually works as advertised.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size for my home office
reviews.reviewText:
This is my 4th Echo device. I previously had an Echo Spot which I also liked, but often wished for that extra screen space. I didn't want to get the big Echo Show; I just don't have the desk space. When the Echo Show 5 came out and Amazon offered a trade-in on my Echo Spot, I didn't hesitate. I bought Show 5 during Prime Days in July, so it took a while for Amazon's inventory to catch up to my order. Apparently other people thought this size of Echo Show is ideal too!

I do have external speakers hooked up to mine (not great ones) but then I don't use my Show for music. I love the rotating display of information that I can determine. I bought the Amazon stand for this Echo Show (https://smile.amazon.com/Echo-Show-Adjustable-Stand-Black/dp/B07MV64LGF/ref=sr_1_4) because I have my Show at eye level, and I needed a better angle for viewing. I ask Alexa all kinds of questions, so it's nice to have a display to go along with her answers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than Dot or spot for easy less than a show
reviews.reviewText: I got this to replace my echo dot 3rd gen in my room. Ihave almost all the echo products. I have echo dot gen 2 & 3, fire tv cube, input, auto, I even have the fire tablet with dock to become an echo show. Now about this product. The screen is ok at 5" and the speaker is pretty decent. I have it right next to a Facebook Portal and I compared sound quality on both. It doesn't compare to the bigger Portal but it holds its own. Not the best but definitely not the worst. It has a physical built in cover for the camera which is great. I also like the different alarm sounds which were funny. It's a great night clock as well. For the price, it is a better option than the echo spot which is smaller and more expensive. If you're wanting to get an echo show for a lot less, get this! I recommend this product! Bigger display and cheaper than the spot, better than a dot since it has a display.

I've only had this for a few hours, so I can't list too many pros. Here are my cons though.

* The UI lags like crazy. Like you swipe multiple times because you think you did something wrong.

* You can't set a routine as a shortcut and the "smart home" panel just shows you recently used commands. It would be nice if it were more customizable.

* I have the black model and when you close the shutter you see a white dot on the screen?!! Why??? The switch on top is already red when the shutter is closed. Now I have this dot glaring at me.

Okay, I'll list a couple of pros.

* I set an alarm time which is really what I wanted this for

* It sounds good for its size.

* Screen looks good, but I'm not displaying pictures, so...

Overall I'm happy because I only paid $45 for it and I don't have to go back into the living room to ask Alexa to do something for me. I'd be mad if I paid $90 for it.

I already love my first generation echo show that I keep in the kitchen. It's such a great way to keep in touch with family! It's especially wonderful for my in laws to be able to see my kids face to face during conversations and it's so much easier for them being not tech savvy. I would ask my echo for the weather while getting dressed but I had to listen several times because I'd get distracted. I bought this little guy and I absolutely love it! I can check the weather and see it for the week! I can chat with family if I want to! I can drop in on my other show and see what's going on in the kitchen! (I scared my teenager in the middle of the night when he"thought"he was being quiet! I dropped in on that show and he saw my face in the screen! Lol. This is a fabulous deal for another show. I love it. The sound is good also! I wish I had gotten another one when they came out and they had a fabulous deal on them.

I purchased 2 of these. 1 for me and 1 for my granddaughter in another state. We configured them to Drop-in calling and used the function about 4 or 5 times, but now hers will not work. It drops-in ok, but the camera shows off even when on. It apparently is a problem as indicated by here. https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/473332-drop-in-camera-not-working-on-show . I have also noticed another issue. Mine replaced an Echo Dot in my family room that was working great. With the Dot, I was able to control my Fire TV in the same room with my voice, but now it acts very differently. When I try to use Hulu now, the Echo Show 5 does a search on the FireTV where the Echo Dot would open Hulu. I also purchased 2 full size Echo Shows and both had to be replaced by Amazon due to a bug. When I replace one Echo device with another and both work through Alexa, I expect the commands to be the same on both.

The screen is a little bigger then the spot ( which we still love) I really like the off button for the camera. We also got the stands and those are really a nice addition as we can tilt or put the show in any position to make it easier to see. This is a great product and I would highly recommend them. Pictures are clear. Sound is very good. And it completely replaced my alarm clock ( that I really loved ). Perfect middle of the echo devices..not too big and bigger then the spot. If you buy one you won’t be disappointed Now I am hoping for skins soon to decorate it like I did my spot.

I have original Show, original Alexa, new Input, 2 Spots and 6 Dots as well as adjustable light bulbs and 6 of the plugs and the Ring doorbell. All of these work great together. I have this new Show linked with my Bose spreaker and it is great. It is by my bed and reads my audible books to me and is the best alarm clock ever, among things. Just love them all.

I am pretty heavily in the amazon eco system now with fire tvs on every tv and echo dots in three rooms. This one was a mistake. It was prime day and this show 5 was on sale plus there was the trade in program going on so with all discounts I got this for about 2 bucks. It replaced my first gen echo that we used in the kitchen/living room area (open concept floor plan). We were excited about the screen so we could do recipes and etc on it. The microphones are terrible. Or missing maybe I havent decided. No lie, sometimes the echo dot upstairs will respond before the one right in the room picks up my voice. Fan of Alexa. Not the echo show 5

reviews.reviewTitle: Great alarm clock and Amazon product
reviews.reviewText:
My husband has a Google hub and i like this over Google because of many reasons:
1) The night mode is a bit brighter so in the middle of the night, i see the time - Google is very dim and hard to see
2) able to see ring doorbell
3) able to play amazon video (ok quality)
4) able to set alarm based on songs available on prime and my alarm can be turned off and on from app
5) it is a bit smaller than Google hub which feels more like an alarm clock.
Most people complain about the Try this, my echo is usually in night mode because its the bedroom so i don't see much of these cards and also you can change the setting to what information is displayed.
The only thing i dislike is the color of night mode. I wish the color can be changed to blue. It is red unless you choose photography and the green leaves then it is green font. Overall i love this echo show.

reviews.reviewTitle: I guess I was expecting more.
reviews.reviewText:
What I was hoping for was a smart clock that doubled as an echo and did some more things considering that it has a camera. I'll keep it, it works a any other Echo device, but here are my disappointments...:

You can't set it up through the Alexa App, you must do it on the screen itself.
The camera and the monitor are pretty low resolution
The camera can not record or be accessed via an app, making it unusable for security or a "Nanny" cam.
If you have a ring doorbell and ask it to show the front door, it will, but if someone rings the doorbell it won't automatically show the video or allow a conversation the way a smartphone works with Ring.
In "Setup" you can get it to stop scanning through all the stuff it wants to show other than the clock but it insists on periodically showing the weather along with "Things to Try." There doesn't seem to be any way for it to just stay on the clock until you ask it do do anything.

reviews.reviewTitle: UPDATED: Amazon was really helpful fixing my problem!!!
reviews.reviewText:
[UPDATE BELOW]

The set up through the Alexa app was absolutely confusing. I found out through the Internet that the Echo Show isn't supported by the Alexa App which doesn't make sense since it asks for it when requesting to use services like Spotify, Youtube, etc.. How disappointing. I guess I will use it as a pretty clock instead.

(Update): After writing this review, Amazon contacted me to figure out the problem. I'm an Amazon account holder in two countries and my phone was in another language besides American English. The Alexa app assumed I was currently in the other country and paired with my other Amazon account. Whoever wrote that it wasn't supported by the app was partially correct. The only inconvenience is that I have to set it up in English then change the language over to my second tongue through the app. My Echo Show is set up and ready to go! Thanks, Amazon!

Pre-Ordered this awaiting the release on June 26th. Received it on that date and couldn't be happier! This replaced my Echo Spot in my bedroom. Sound quality is far better than the Spot, larger screen and like the camera shutter. Also had the Echo show v2 and found it to be too big and settings not customizable like this one. Returned it and glad I got this. So happy with the Echo Show 5 I bought two more, one for the kitchen and one for my home office.

Have the Ring doorbell and the video is so much easier to see on the 5 than the spot.

Highly recommend this device!

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t allow SONOS to be added to Groups
reviews.reviewText: I bought 3 of these (in addition to other echos I’ve had previously). My Sonos speakers appear in the Alexa App under “Devices.” However Amazon doesn’t allow you to add any of your Sonos to a Group. Therefore, I can’t play music on all my devices at once using the Group feature. What is the point of linking devices to Alexa if you’re forbidden to add them to a Group? Just ridiculous. I initially thought it might be due to there being an audio lag between the Echos and the Sonos. But no, I can (painstakingly) make music play on everything by individually sending the music through the Sonos app in addition to sending music through the Alexa app, and they are in sync. Amazon needs to update the firmware to allow Sonos to be added to Groups and/or get with Sonos to remedy this issue. There’s no way I’m giving up the sound quality of Sonos to buy more Echos. They need to get along.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Best Option for a Display Based Echo Device
reviews.reviewText:
If you don't plan on being across the room while using your Echo Show, then the 5's screen size is a good size and will likely provide all the display you need for a personal device. If you plan on a more family oriented device, the larger screens will likely suit your fancy, but this provides all that functionality into a smaller form that seems to fit just about anywhere you may want/need it.

Also the price, particularly during Prime Day, kills every other option out there at this time for a smart home device.

If you are Amazon, and you have what is arguably the best digital assistant out there in Alexa, your goal should be to embed her into as many devices as possible. Enter the new Echo Show 5. The form factor is about the size of a small digital alarm clock. I have been using my Echo Dot as my alarm clock for a while now, but have missed being able to roll over and see the time, making this a great bedside upgrade. The built-in shutter to cover the camera aperture is a nice addition, showing that Amazon is taking the privacy concerns of its customers seriously. You can swipe in from the top to access settings, and from the right to access common activities. My only complaint, if you can call it that is that the sound has a wee bit too much base for my tastes, making everything sound a little off. Otherwise, an all-around great piece of equipment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, though voice commands sometimes a miss
reviews.reviewText: Love the Amazon Echo Show 5. It’s nice that it has the ability to drop in to talk to other members of the household. The only drawback that I’ve found is that it isn’t the best at voice recognition if there’s much other noise around. For instance, we have an August lock on the front door, as well as a Ring doorbell. When someone comes to the front door, and you ask Alexa to unlock the front door, most of the time it thinks you’ve asked it to show you the front door, so it activates the Ring camera. This is just a little annoying, but isn’t that big of a deal.

Well, first I guess I don't like that it was half-price on Prime Day. Geez, we pre-order and then within two weeks of receiving the product it's half off? Gosh, just call me a sucker and pin a "kick me" sign on my back.
The screen is nice. Set-up was pretty easy, although the obligatory update took about 25 minutes on my pretty robust home network.
Sound is ok. Alexa seems more responsive than on my other devices. Form factor and foot print are nice. Looks like a quality device.
Not enough options for clocks and backgrounds (that will probably change over time). Seems to integrate with music and other apps as well as my other Alexa devices (Sonus and a second generation Echo). But as many people have mentioned, those home screen ads do tend to drive you nuts if you sit and look at it. I don't, so it's not that much of an issue for me. I would like to turn it off, though. Shouldn't that really be our right?
It's a lot of money for an alarm clock and an Alexa device. That leaves me on the fence.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little Alexa device, small screen
reviews.reviewText:
I love this little gem, but I regret giving up a bigger screen. I used to have a Fire tablet on the purpose-built stand using the display mode of the Fire. I think it was the 7" tablet, and we had it sitting in the kitchen. While it was very nice, the Fire tablet is SO SLOW and would occasionally blank out, leaving display mode for no reason at all. The voice recognition was spotty, and the sound quality was weak.

I bought the Echo Show to fix the issues with the tablet, and it does, in nearly all respects. The voice recognition is far superior, and the sound quality is many times better and stronger than the tablet. It is very reliable, and I have not had any problems with it whatsoever. The only downside is that the 5" screen is tiny, which limits its usefulness for displaying recipes or watching videos on it. For us, though, those uses were more of a novelty with the tablet, and the Echo Show is a useful addition for home automation and for information like weather.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice, more advanced alarm clock option, same qualms as others...
reviews.reviewText:
I got this on Prime Day, as I'd been looking for a newer alarm clock for our bedroom (so we're not always relying on phones).

Pros: Voice recognition is great, I can whisper a wake up time for the morning and it picks up every single time. Having the weather scroll by, as well as some news stories can be helpful. It's also nice that it detects the ambient light in the room, so as not to be a glowing beacon of light all night. Alexa intergration is good and I love the ability to drop in to other rooms using Alexa.

Cons: While the weather and news are sometimes helpful, when I'm passing by and want to glance at the time to see if I'm running early/late, you either have to squint or wait for the primary clock to come back around. If we're streaming music, the sound is a little tinny compared to our Echo devices, but that's a minor gripe.

Maybe a bit of overkill for someone just needing an alarm clock, but the added functionality is generally a pro for us.

Pretty much everything on it works rather well, picture is nice, alexa is cool. Only main issue I have experienced right now is the sound (If you are watching a show and the men have deep voices, it is like super bass. It is very muffled/mumbly. So much that I had to turn on closed captions). The video picture is great. There are some times that alexa does not understand what I am saying but I think that is because I have a fan in my room. Room ambiance should be removed when the mic is listening to a voice - Some kind of cancellation would be nice. Other then that, it is pretty good. I just got a stand so that I can adjust it on my nightstand. I have a feeling being off of a glass surface may help the sound a little bit. Oh! And the Try saying this "Blah blah Alexa" stuff is a bit annoying. I havent been able to remove that ONE feature but I dont have adds or any other stuff on my screen except that. Not sure what everyone else is dealing with in terms of adds but I dont have any really (Not like on my old Fire Tablet - That thing is riddled with adds etc.). Good buy for the sale it had ($65).

p.s. It does have a neat feature that when you leave you can say, Alexa, I'll be right back. She then goes into sleep mode. When you walk back into the room, she continues where you left off. It is a bit frustrating when you are still walking to where your show is playing from and it has already started... so you may end up having to tell her to go back 30 seconds in your show. It is pretty cool that she wakes up though, like you never left.

reviews.reviewTitle: Come on Amazon, stand by your product!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this on Prime Day back in back in June. It's small, about the size on an alarm clock, that's fine. The sound is decent, Alexa generally understands what I'm saying. So why the low rating? LESS THAN 5 MONTHS into using it *lightly* (I don't even interact with it on a daily basis) the speaker sounds busted! And I don't play it loud! So I call customer service.... what do they tell me? "It's outside of the return window." This is extremely irritating. I also agree with the other reviews complaining of the constant ads that scroll, and also there is not much customization ability. For the price, I expect better! And come on Amazon, stand by your product quality!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't completely stop 'suggestions' and just show big clock face
reviews.reviewText: As others have complained, I can't completely stop it from displaying 'suggestions' along with a tiny time in the upper left, instead of the big clock face I bought it for. Even carefully disabling all 'Home & Clock' content and cycling, it still insists on cajoling me into trying additional Alexa commands. Really bad behavior for a **purchased** product. (I have had multiple other audio-only Echo products for a long time and really like them, but this Amazon-controlled billboard is a big disappointment.)

I got this unit to use as a nightstand alarm clock in my bedroom. The display can be shut off at night, and the camera can be disabled with a switch that physically covers the camera, both of which are ideal for the master bedroom.

Unfortunately the alarm seems to be unreliable. In the two weeks I've used to the Show 5, the alarm has failed to work the majority of the time. I am not sure why, but I have noticed that the unit makes a single muffled tone (not loud enough to wake anyone), and that's it. Setting a different ringtone or even setting it to wake up with music, had no effect. I use IFTTT to link the alarm service to my ISY based smart home, and the scheduled alarm starts the programmed morning routines, but yet again no sound. I'm sure that it's this particular unit and not the device in general.

Overall, the unit did very well with voice recognition and integration with the smart home. The Alexa functions are entertaining and the sound volume is amazing. The sound has a very strong base and is great for music. It is surprising to to hear Alexa's voice with that much base (sounds like her brother talking), but you get used to it.

I am planning on replacing my gen 2 Dots with the show 5, in all the rooms. In my case, having an audible alarm isn't that important, because the morning routines wake me.

I would strongly recommend this to anyone that is thinking about the Amazon echo system

Disclosure, I work for Amazon Alexa.

This device has the worst sound quality, mic array, and latency of and of the echo devices. I have it sitting on my kitchen counter between the kitchen and living room.

On it's own, it has a hard time understanding my native English voice. Don't have data to quantify, but it seems like this device has very low speech regocnition accuracy.

Most of the time my echo dot 3 in the next room, 3-5x the distance from me, will respond first to pretty much anything. I have to keep that device muted to give the echo show 5 a fighting chance. The device is slow to respond when it does understand me. Seemingly slower than my dot or spot.

Again, can't quantify the sound quality, but the dot seems better. The show is just loud.

Just buy a dot, spot, it maybe the show 2 instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great replacement for an Echo Dot on desk or nightstand, better sound than expected!
reviews.reviewText: This product proved to be a pleasant surprise, especially in the quality of the sound! I used it to replace an Echo Dot that was linked to a Bose Soundlink Revolve. I was planning to link the Show 5 to the Bose, but was amazed that the sound from its own speaker was pretty darn good! So, I only occasionally link it to the Bose (and sometimes also to a Samsung soundbar) when I want a bit more sound from it. I use this mostly as a bedside clock radio, using the "set a sleep timer" function to listen to a Pandora station when I fall asleep. I also have an Echo Spot, but at a considerably lower price, this is the better choice. I wish it had come out before the Spot, as I would have certainly purchased it instead. For what this is intended to do, it is a great desktop / nightstand option. Recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent for video playback, surprisingly good speaker
reviews.reviewText:
This sat in a box for a couple of weeks as I has been traveling and just took some time getting it set up. As with all my dots, spots, etc, it was a piece of cake to set up, connect to the network and start being the standard voice assistant.

I did have some problems on my Philips Hue lighting in that while adding this to my Alexa App on the phone and then getting prompted to do something with the Hue App, it forced some sort of update and reset on all my lights. We have two accounts and I have been able to control all smart devices from either account and this somehow split it the devices across both accounts with no real method or pattern. Amazon support told me that whatever I had been doing was never possible, even though I had been doing it. I eventually re-added 50+ smart devices onto one account (which meant that several Alexa devices were no longer able to control them as they were attached to another account). Then the whole thing reset again for no reason. Not blaming the Show as much as the backend application. Interestingly enough, the next day, all devices were now accessible across both accounts again. Must be black magic so don't let Amazon Tech Support know... I don't want them to mess it up!

But as to the device itself. It was not bought to watch videos as I have a smart TV 8 feet away, multi iOS devices and a couple of laptops, but it plays video very well and I anticipate fantastic resolution when I install external home security cameras. Downside is I do a lot of webex for collaboration meetings and there is no app or learning for that at this time.

What is really remarkable is the sound quality. About the time I got the Show fully set up, Tool released it's new album Fear Innoculum. I have Amazon Unlimited and gave it a good test run as a stand alone speaker as well as connected via cable to a Bose speaker system. While the Bose can achieve the deeper bass notes and maybe give a slightly richer sound, the Show by itself is considerably more crisp and rich than a stock car stereo. It's really a pretty good speaker if you don't want to be an incredibly picky audiogeek.

It does have the same annoyances of the Spot with the clock not always being diplayed at 3:45 am when you wake up and want to see what time it is and instead stare at "Ask Alexa to do xxxxxx" for three minutes. Maybe someday we can just get a steady state screen. Today is not that day.

Overall I am very pleased with it and will order several more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to the echo family and to our home!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great device, especially when bought on sale. We have owned many of the echo devices including original echo, echo dot, and echo show. This one is probably my favorite, or close to it. The audio quality is better than the dot, but isn’t as good as the original show or the gen 1 echo. It’s good enough audio to fill our smallish kitchen/living room with good, no distorted sound. The screen is also great. We love that this form factor is big enough to see, but not so big that it is all you see. We have ours set up to flip through photos and show us the weather daily. My daughter loves watching shows on it as well. Overall, this is a great, easy to use device. If you are familiar with other echo devices, this will setup in under 5 min. If not, it may take a little more, but it is easy to learn.

reviews.reviewTitle: Basically an expensive clock. TImes out in seconds rendering device useless.
reviews.reviewText: Nothing here to like. Thi is my 8th or ninth echo device. Echo dots, Echo Auto, Echo Fire cube and now this piece of )*&^. If you get a recipe up, it will disappear every some odd seconds because of the clock screensaver and you have to start over. The "engineers" at amazon really screwed up with this one. There are no settings to correct this behavior.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't really like it - Becomes Hate It
reviews.reviewText:
I kind of regret getting this product. I used to have Dot Gen 2. It worked flawlessly. Voice recognition etc... worked great. It even heard and understood my 2yr old daughter's voice. I thought I wanted to change the Echo to have the version with a screen. This Echo Show does not recognize voice really well. Often times I have to yell to it so that it can hear me. I have to give orders mostly twice. The first one it just ignores me. Not really happy with this one, I thought with the new version at least everything can be improved. So yeah, pretty frustrated with this one, always have to call it twice and it does not really hear unless you're really close to the device.

Several months later - even when I'm 7ft away from it, it was not able to execute some orders, or wouldn't even respond. I like the dot better.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would and will order again! Love it!
reviews.reviewText: I love this! I use it as our hub for the Dots. This one is in the kitchen. As soon as I can, I am ordering another for the bedroom. They will make a wonderful alarm clock and to be able to check my Blink camera alerts without having to fumble for my phone at night. The speakers are awesome! I can’t say enough good stuff about this, except that I am ordering another ASAP! Alexa has improved our lives dramatically. I have Dots placed strategically places around the house, so if I should fall, I could ask Alexa to call my husband!

We have a myriad of Echo devices that include 2nd gen show, 2nd-3rd Dots and 2 Shows. Sane people would ask why I would order an echo show 5 and I’d have to say I have just never loved the spots and have been hoping for a different option.

I’m going to compare apples to oranges here between the two. What I like about the ES5 over the spot. Probably in this order...sound quality (bass!), screen size (the spot is round so rectangle videos are even smaller), love the shutter on the camera (I can ditch the electrical tape!), clock size for those of us with imperfect eyes.

Cons are few but do exist. The ES5 does take up more space on a desk or nightstand. I find the screen a little brighter so I just ask Alexa to turn off the screen.

Overall it would baffle me why someone would choose a spot over an ES5 especially with the $40 price difference.

reviews.reviewTitle: Volume Issues and DO NOT sync your contacts!
reviews.reviewText:
Three stars might be too high for this device, I would do 2.5 if I could. This device works for what I wanted it to work for. Kind of. I purchased it so that my child could call and "facetime" (video chat) with her grandma whenever she wanted to without tying up my phone or ipad. It works. Its easy for her to call and for her to answer when grandma calls her (shes 4 but quickly learned the Alexa commands). But the sound is terrible on it. When using the Show for calls, the volume, even turned all the way up is so low that you can barely hear the person. But Alexa's voice and the ringer and even music at that volume are way too loud. So it's definitely not a speaker issue, and it's startling when you go from leaning in so close to the device so you can hear the other person speak and then all of a sudden Alexa's voice chimes in and about blows your ear drum. After trying to research to see if it's operator error, I found several others have been complaining about the exact same thing for awhile now. I hear there is the same issue when trying to watch videos (but I have not tried watching any videos on it).
Issue number 2: DO NOT give it permission to add your contacts. When you do, it adds ALL of your contacts (and for me this includes work contacts, emergency numbers, people I haven't talked to in years but forgot their contact was in my phone...) and then you can not delete any of them! (I thought maybe it would give you the opportunity to choose which contacts to add and which to not, or at least the ability to delete the ones you didn't want on there.) This is not a good thing when I have a 4 year old giving it voice commands of who to call. Again, researched this to figure out how to remove them and there is no easy way. (Some horror stories included people setting them up for their offices and having all of their personal contacts stuck on multiple office devices.) Currently the only options are to back up all your contacts into a cloud and delete them out of your phone and re-sync your empty contacts to the device (this sounded way too risky for me) or contact Amazon directly and have them do it. I went with the second option. Once I finally reached an Amazon rep I was told that they couldn't do it. It wasn't until I threatened to send all 3 of my newly purchased devices back that all of a sudden she figure out a way that she could do it.
Issue number 3: This is probably more of a wish for improvement as opposed to an issue, but it would be nice if it had at least a little battery in it so that if I needed to move the device from one location to another I could do so without it completely shutting off and taking 5 minutes to restart.
As far as the ads go, yea, they're slightly annoying, but to me, that complaint is minuscule compared to the volume issue. There are also a few other annoyance issues, but for the price I can overlook those.
All in all, it works for what I wanted it to. My daughter can call her grandma by herself anytime she wants, but it sure is hard to hear. I guess you get what you pay for and I got it when it was on sale for $65. I think if I had paid the full $90 I would have returned it.

I already had an Echo Spot which I paid $130 for, but still love. That is, until I picked this up for around $30 plus a trade in for an older first generation tinny sounding DOT. Amazon 25% off with trade in deals are amazing, and still work even when new devices are already on sale. I was happy to sell an OLD DOT for $2 credit when it also came with about $17-18 discount on a new device.

This little rectangular number (about same size as cellphone screen) has been upgraded to showcase in the master bedroom and that little circular Spot has been relegated to guest room.

Oh, and this little rectangular beauty has what I wish the SPOT had - a camera slide to disable those little prying eyes from insomniac little eavesdroppers burning the midnight oil at Amazon. Much cleaner than my permanent piece of black tape covering the SPOT camera.

Seriously, DON'T BUY THE SPOT. Buy this instead, preferably during a sale.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not to my expectation at all
reviews.reviewText:
The major purpose I need this item is to watch live Ring Doorbell when motion detected.
However, it is not compatible with Ring doorbell 1.0. Immediately after setting up the Echo Show 5, and I say "Alexa, show front door", it works and shows the front door live camera streaming. However, after an hour, it always say sorry front door isn't connecting.

I restored to Echo factory default, add Ring again via Alexa app, it works again for the first 30 minutes, and then never work after an hour. I repeated the setup game 5 times, same situation. So i returned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst touch screen interface I've ever seen
reviews.reviewText: Read other tech review sites and get an honest opinion before falling for Amazon's pathetically falsified rating on their Echo devices. This one especially is a great example. The device doesn't do a single thing well. The voice recognition works correctly maybe half the time. The actual functionality of skills is embarrassingly inept. The navigation on screen rivals a toddler's learning tablet and provides no menus or functionality AT ALL. This whole thing is a joke. The speaker quality is so poor it's only slightly better than the half inch speaker inside most smartphones. No bass, no actual functional menu or use for the screen, no useful skills, and I didn't begin to mention every single screen gets covered in FORCED ADS. You can only disable some of them and they are on everything including your now playing screens.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well for the most part.
reviews.reviewText: I noticed people complained about the ads. I just ask her to clear screen and they are gone for a good while. They don’t annoy me either way. As far as motion detection I have not tried that out and honestly don’t know how I would use it. The one thing I don’t like is when I ask it to announce supper is ready in another room. It doesn’t do it or volume is not loud enough. That was the main reason I wanted it for. So that’s disappointing. Other than that I’m happy with it. It plays my music and other things everyone knows already.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easiest Connection Yet, Great Sound in a Small Format
reviews.reviewText: I use Echo Shows to communicate with my elderly mother. She is 95, and over the past 2 years she has adapted slowly to using Alexa commands. Although she was resistant at first, she now really enjoys the video since she still lives alone. I recently connected this Echo Show 5 in her bedroom (privacy isn't a big issue for her since I dress and bathe her), and I think she feels more comfortable in her bedroom in case of another fall. I have had to put Alexa commands on big post-it notes on her walls, and so far she remembers to look for and read the commands. I was impressed with the quality of sound. To me it sounds just as good as the larger version.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent device but very substandard microphones
reviews.reviewText: Alexa features work great... When it can hear you. Regularly have to scream at it, especially when there is other noise (family, water running, etc.), And way too often, an echo Dot 30 feet past it, in another room, reacts instead of the Echo Show 5. Even when both echos signal that they can hear the wake word, sometimes the Dot 40 feet away will answer instead of the Show 5 ten feet closer and between the person and the Dot. Don't know whether the Dot is just equipped with much better microphones or what.

I bought this because it was on sale during Prime Day. I was not going to buy it because I already had the Show and thought it had many problems. But I am glad I bought this because Amazon decided to fix the problems with the Show 5 but for some reason they did not fix the problems with the Show. I am confused. Why would you fix the problems with this smaller devices and leave the problems with the bigger device. For those who don't know the 2 main fixes are the screen timing out and the Try Alexa " " message on the bottom of the screen. The Show 5 does not have these problems. The Echo Show still does. I actually like the smaller device better now. I took 1 star off because the resolution and the brightness is a little wanting. But not so bad that it would be a 2 star bump. Amazon fix the Echo Show with the options you put in the Show 5 please. It's just software.

reviews.reviewTitle: As good as the regular Show at a fraction of the price!
reviews.reviewText: We are avid Alexa users in our household. We currently have 6 Dots, 1 Show, and this Show 5. It was a heck of a deal so I went ahead and purchased it on Prime Day. Normally, I like to wait several months and read reviews before deciding to purchase. We have been very happy with the Show 5! We use it in the bedroom, as an alarm clock. I use the Sleep Sounds app to help me fall asleep. It connects to the other Alexa devices in the house flawlessly. The only thing I might say negative about it (and this might be more the Alexa system as a whole) is that sometimes it just won't recognize the wake word. I'll have to repeat it 2 or 3 times before it recognizes that I have spoken. Other than that, I definitely recommend this - as good as the regular show (we can't really tell much of a difference in the speaker) at a fraction of the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's what I wanted, but I really don't like the Alexa suggestions.
reviews.reviewText:
I really wasn't prepared for just how annoying the Alexa suggestions would be. I turned them off about as much as I could and it is still displays quite a few suggestions throughout the day. I do a lot of writing while laying in my bed and the screen will catch my eye every time it dims to display a new Alexa suggestion. I just want it to stay on clock mode and dim the brightness when I turn the lights off.

Other than that, I really like this product. It's clear and easy to read the numbers (when the regular clock setting is showing) and I like all the features and the ability to just play an episode or two of a show before bed.

I really wish Amazon would allow us to take these ads off our products. Hoping XDA finds a way to jailbreak it so I can be rid of this "feature."

I have a Show 1 and 5. The 5 fits in smaller places and takes up less space so it can be added to a night stand or a crowded desk much easier than the original. That being said, the sound quality is not the same without 2 big speakers on it. The screen is much smaller as well, about the size of a smart phone. I got it to sit on my wife's desk so she can see who is at the Ring doorbell while she is working, so it works perfect for that along with every other echo task.
One downside I did find is that this show does not support all the skills that the full size one does. Like Hulu and some other video skills are not available, which was disappointing. I assume this has to do with the device having less processing power for video, but not sure. I did not see any disclaimer about this prior to purchase, so that is the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.

We use this on beside table and works great. The display dims at night with the lights off as we had hoped. In the dimmed display, it is still possible to see the local outside temperature and time - again, just as we had hoped. The time is displayed in 2 lines - hours on top and minutes below. Takes a little bit to get used to that, and - if there is a way to get the time displayed in a single line, we haven't figured out how to change it yet. In summary, works like our other Echo devices and very much like our original Echo Show - just smaller which makes it great for bedside.

Love Everything About It! Dont know what all the complaints are all about seriously. You dont like the "try Alexa suggestions " turn it off in the setting. You need the night mode - its in the setting. You want a bigger clock display - change it in the setting. Please go through your settings. Educate and familiarize yourself with the product prior to rating and writing bad reviews. As a fellow consumer, I am reading your reviews and depending on it. I was really on the fence of actually NOT purchasing this because of all the negative reviews but I'm so happy that I didn't listen and made this purchase on Prime Day. It was a really great deal for a great device! The sound is great! Now please note the measurements. It is the size of your cellphone but in a triangular shape. So please don't think you are getting a big screen tv for this price...lol...Enjoy!

To say I was shocked about the size is underestimating my reaction... but I hooked it up and because the screen was as small or smaller than my iPhone XR, I had to decide where to use it where it could be seen. I decided to put it on our computer desk under the edge of the monitors so easily monitor our Ring doorbell and to ask questions of "Computer" (changed the name not to get a response from an Echo in the same room and wanted to keep this one independent). It works and fills a niche. Don't think I'd ever need another that small and some day may get the bigger one for our theater or master bedroom, but not another one as small as a phone. Sounds pretty good for the size, but can't compare to the much larger Echo (2nd generation), but that's not why I'm using it so that is fine by me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs to Work Better with Nest
reviews.reviewText:
Pro: Compact unit, which fits well on my cluttered desk. Good picture. The ability to create buttons for often-used skills is a great convenience. Sound is ok given the unit's small size. Minimal learning curve if you already have an Alexa.

Con: No You Tube on Show and while I can see and hear my Nest doorbell camera, I can't speak through it. Easily using my Nest was a primary reason I bought the Show, so Amazon deciding to not play nice with Google is a huge problem. I am not buying a new Ring just to work with Show, so Amazon - how about you put your squabbles with Google aside and fix the skills so we access You Tube and speak through Nest? Amazon is already making obscene profits so I doubt some integration with Google would really kill the bottom line.

I purchased the Show to monitor my Ring Spotlight camera in the front of my house. Although I had an echo, I find myself using the Show on a daily basis. It can arm my alarm system, turn the lights on and off and more importantly wake me up in the morning. The Show came in handy the other day when I had an emergency and my 17 year old wasn’t answering her phone. So I was able to use the “drop in feature” to get her attention.

I’m thinking about buying one to keep in touch with my 90 year old mother who has difficulty with cell phones. The drop in feature is great.

The screen is small is not useful for leisure media watching but for the functions I use it for. Its perfect.

Overall very satisfied especially given the price I paid on Black Friday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not ready if you want to video call someone without an echo show.
reviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately is not as useful as I thought it would be.
The great thing about the echo DOT is that you don't need to interact with a screen. In this case I thought getting this to use video call on skype and whatsapp.
Even though you can use skype, it doesn't seem to be well integrated and it doesn't come by default.
It is not possible to use whatsapp whatsoever. Not even with the browser.
The browser is firefox, and it doesn't seem to have the option to load web.whatsapp.com in desktop mode.
You cannot install Chrome.

Another thing I noticed is that it doesn't recognize what you say as well as the echo dot.
Calling contacts can be frustrating because it just won't understand the name you say.

So I'm returning this.

I bought this to replace my dot and I'm pleasantly surprised how much adding a screen has made such a improvement. It does everything echo does but now you can watch movies, Ring video, other useful videos, view pictures and have a clock face showing time and days weather, great no more needing to ask. Screen is small but looks good even speaker is better just play with equalizer but doesn't handle full volume well which isn't really needed. J like it and if you got a dot this is definitely upgrade should be looking into.

I'm pretty impressed with this. The screen quality is much better than I expected. I have one of these next to my bed as an alarm clock and one in the kitchen to use to guide me through recipes.

My one gripe is there are no "apps", you have to ask alexa for anything you want which can get repetitious and tedious. I wish on the main screen you could pull the screen down and see all your apps there. This is a huge missed opportunity. I now have 2 echo shows and 2 echos and I love every one of the devices equally!

Ok but definitely not worth $90. As many complaints stated, the “try this” ads are annoying, and the screen is tiny. So don’t buy if you plan on using it for watching videos. But my biggest complaint is the position of the microphone... it’s on the top of the unit which is angled away from you. So it screws up CONSTANTLY. It’s practically useless, in my opinion, if you are using it to tell Alexa to do anything. Which is the main reason I buy these products! I’ll be exchanging to see if it’s defective. If it was, I’ll update this review.

reviews.reviewTitle: I just bought a second Echo 5 and I might buy a 3rd
reviews.reviewText: I was already looking for a new alarm clock and then this caught my eye. I had never really cared about the voice recognition function with Alexa, I just wanted a better alarm clock and I love the look of this device. The other features are gravy. I love that I can set the alarm simply by saying 'Alexa, set alarm for 530am' or watch a movie by saying 'Alexa, watch the movie Jaws'. Or finding the local weather, listening to music and getting news. The snooze feature by tapping on the top is hit and miss but when I say 'Alexa, snooze' it never fails! I never have to even touch this little gem. After about a month, I decided I needed one for my home office, too. The shutter on the camera is a great feature, too. Amazon continues to impresses with wonderful innovation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Same as the Original.. Just smaller
reviews.reviewText: This works perfect as an alarm clock in your room and still have all the features of an echo device. Best feature is the switch which slides over camera for those who worry about privacy. I probably won't use the camera that often but it's a nice bonus. The clock stays very dim at night so it's not keeping you up at night due to brightness. Everything is adjustable (homescreen, newsfeed, background pictures etc.) so customization is key. The volume is plenty for a small device. When most people look at the screen size, they compare it to an iPhone (5.5"). If you want a his/her alarm clock in the room, you could add a 2nd one and setup the speakers as stereo (left/right) and possible have great stereo sound in the room. I haven't tried that yet but always an option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great new edition to the Alexa family.
reviews.reviewText: The new echo show 5 is a great little device that is a wonderful addition to the Alexa family. This actually replaced the round device. It looks really stylish on my nightstand and Weich but the screen is easier to read and more touch friendly. I have included a few pictures of the new device and also one side-by-side with the original. The sound quality is adequate. I really like that the mute button has a visible color when you slide it on or off. At night the screen goes very dim with the time being displayed in small numbers in the upper left corner. Personally I like this design better than the last. I do have the larger show in my kitchen and this one is about 1/4 of the size of that device. You can tell that Amazon put a lot of thought into developing this newest version.

Really like the Show 5. Sound is very good for its size. Screen is sharp and clear and I've noticed no lag on screen response time. It's a great size for lamp table or nightstand. I have no one to video call with but think the screen would be more than adequate.
UPDATE!
Okay, after reading other reviews I decided to shut off the things on the Home screen just to see..... Don't fight with me, this is only MY opinion. If I had wanted a clock or another Echo I'd have bought one. Without some of the things you can have on the home screen this is only that! I think in the end when I went back and turned things on I dropped only one of the defaults. Different strokes people.... because you don't like something is no reason to give it a bad review. Just sayin.

reviews.reviewTitle: It replaced an Echo Spot - and I'm ever so happy.
reviews.reviewText: The Spot was cute and functioned perfectly, but I wanted to use it to view my Wyze Cameras and the Spot's screen was too small. Not too long ago I updated the original Echo Show and knew this was too large for my nightstand so I was very pleased to see the 5 inch Show come to market. Combined with a discount on the show and a trade-in on the Spot I got the Echo Show 5 and glad that I did. It has an excellent screen and speakers. Also, works well to display the Wyze cameras and does all the things Alexa and the Echos do in my home.

reviews.reviewTitle: down to 2 stars from 5 stars after a recient behavior change. Wont stay on the lrg clock/home screen
reviews.reviewText:
imagine telling the alarm to stop, and then peering at it 5 min or so later to make sure you dont stay in bed too long. and the time has shrunk to a small font in the upper left hand corner. and you cant get it to switch and stay to the large clock screen. I can get the clock back by interacting with the screen , but that is defeating the purpose of voice control.

Amazon appears to be aware of the issue.

the pros
1 easy setup
2 manual camera shutter
3 right size

the cons
1 needs more flexibility in the clockfaces. it would be nice to be able to increase the font size of the weather and calendar info that is in the upper left and lower mid center. I can bearly make those out a distance of 5 ft. and not at all at 6am. hopefully there will be an update that can improve this.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Excellent Echo Device That Takes Up Little Space
reviews.reviewText: I bought three of these on Prime Day for $49.99 each as the price made it worth taking a chance. I was not disappointed. The Echo Show 5 is very compact yet has remarkably good audio for its size. Even better than the original Echo Show. It fits nicely on a night stand and made a good replacement for my older Echo Dot 2. I like the manual camera shutter and hope that when a replacement for the larger Echo Show 2 comes out that it includes that feature as well as the audio jack that is on the Echo Show 5. Also I was surprised that the Echo Show 5 displays emoji characters in color (like the red heart show in the photo) whereas the older Echo Show devices display in monochrome. Certainly something that can be fixed with a firmware update in the older devices but still a nice touch.

reviews.reviewTitle: mini super sound system when paired with an echo sub / echo remote-
reviews.reviewText:
excellent mini iteration of the echo show 2 ... sound sometimes hisses when you play music (nothing a power restart can't fix) ... and i even paired it with an Echo Sub for excellent sound, i also used an echo spot stand so it'll look different ...

the echo remote works well too (Simon says [ insert text for Alexa to say here ]) ... the only real issue/complaint with it is the echo remote doesn't work to switch previous/next song on my Amazon music playlists (this echo remote feature works on echo dots 3rd gen/echo show 2)

so technical support, if you're reading this, please update echo remote firmware (or the echo show 5) so echo remote can switch forwards/backwards list of songs on my amazon music playlist [again, this echo remote feature works on the echo dots/echo show 2]

donald j. trump is your president, btw

reviews.reviewTitle: Good as alarm clock but some annoying features
reviews.reviewText:
So I am a loyal Alexa user and this was bought as an upgrade to the dot for my master bedroom. Bought on Prime day for $50 then waited for two weeks to receive which was annoying then immediately after receiving saw the $50 price at the retailer that rhymes with West Why. So felt a bit like Amazon played the Prime day shoppers.
Set up was easy, had to do some tweaks to get the Show 5 to recognize the Hue lights but I eventually figured it out.
Works well on everything except music. The Show 5 will not play a specific song. To get a specific song you have to subscribe to Amazon music plus. This would not be a big deal except my Echo, my 1 gen Echo Show and my other 2 dots will play specific songs. So if this is a cripple done as part of the show5 interface it’s annoying.
Also, while the screen does get very dim at night and that is a nice feature. It would be nice to have the ability to turn off the “attract” feature. Ie the constant ask me about the Brad Pitt story ... At this point I know how Alexa works. So ok at the $50 price point but with some annoying quirks as a smart bed room clock.

reviews.reviewerName: John Hancock / Metro Intelligence Criminal Investigations
reviews.reviewTitle: ALEXA FORCED TO RIDE THE SHORT BUS BY GOOGLE
reviews.reviewText:
My Alexa sits next to my Google hub. The google
Hub works every time and is very fast. Both units
we're purchased at the same time. I was one of the first to buy into the first Alexa units.

Half the time the Alexa will not respond. Sometimes if you yell that works. Most of the time
Alexa says she is having trouble connecting.

But the Google Hub responds instantly. Not sure
If this is a bad unit, or maybe it just belongs on
short bus.

I now have two Alexa Echos. Neither one works
works well. I thought I had the state of the art with Alexa until I saw how fast and precise the
Google Hub is.

I am disappointed because I love everything Amazon. With all of the resources Amazon has
You would think they could do better.

The reason why I gave it 2 stars is that the response to your voice is horrible u really have to scream at it for it to hear me and its not even 2 feet away from me. matter of fact it sits right on top of my desk. omg its the worst item I ever bought from amazon, I regret it so much I should have gone with Echo Dot 3rd Generation instead. I also wish they would of put more consideration in designing this item, like placing the mic on the front right above the screen and the speakers on the right & left the side of the screen. so u can hear it more clearly without so much bass but they still continue to do the same mistake on the new Alexa Echo Show 8 that will be coming out soon. I guess they didn't even bother to think about changing anything just the size and hearing the feedback from their loyal customers like myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my new Echo Show 5
reviews.reviewText:
I have the original Amazon Echo and use it every day. Wanted something for the bedroom so I could listen to music at night, incorporate an alarm clock, and have my calendar information handy. The Show 5 does that and more.....

I am so pleased with the ease of setup and it has features that I have not even utilized yet like search the Web with either Silk or Firefox. It has a very nice sound and screen is a bit small to watch a movie or video but I was able to finish a Prime movie with no problem. You can even ask Alexa to turn on captions without pressing buttons trying to figure out how to do it. I tested book reading and that works very well.

I know some reviewers commented on the scrolling text (informational) but that does not bother me at all. Show 5 does what I wanted and that makes me happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little gadget to keep by your nightstand.
reviews.reviewText:
I like this gadget very much as it can not only tell you the time but also everything else you would want from Amazon's Alexa. We use it every morning to let us know how the weather will shape up. At night the screen dims so that there isn't any bright lights by your eye sight. I think it's a well thought out gadget. The only think that bothers me is the constant feed of stuff that I could care less about. I wish (and they may be as I haven't even touched any instructions), a way to have it display only the clock until you ask it something. I am one who really could care less about what the Hollywwod types are doing this morning and that sort of gossipy junk.

Despite the occasional bother by some useless headline, I do like the clock and find it not only useful but also a good buy for the price.

I absolutely love this! I traded in my echo show 1 that I kept on my nightstand so I could stream my babies monitor. This being more compact is so much better! The sound to me is good- for the price it’s great! Obviously today you have multiple choices for everything and some other reviews are not great- but I truly am happy I got this. The camera cover is a small change but makes a huge difference in how I like the product. Baby monitors cost $200 and don’t do anything but stream the one camera- this does so much and I love my amazon products and the ease it gives me as a mom to do stuff hands free and not live on my phone! Ie, adding things to the shopping list, weather checks, asking store hours, checking the baby monitors, safety checking the security cameras, and sooo much more

reviews.reviewTitle: Tangled mess of wires and a huge electric plug
reviews.reviewText:
I like the new echo show, but I prefer to to tuck the wires away from sight. With echo dot, it is easy as I changed the USB adapter to a low profile version that allows it to stay hidden behind the dresser or refrigerator.

This has a huge proprietary electrical plug that not only is inordinately thick, but also blocks the USB ports of the outlet.

The screen usability aspects also has issues. I would prefer to have a dashboard with a detailed weather display all the time, and simple customization's like these are simply not possible.

The echo also constantly nags you with irrelevant information and news, which I do not want.

The sound quality although better then older echo, now has a unnatural boomy sound (similar to cheap tiny bluetooth speakers). A more neutral sound would have been better.

I have a houseful of @@@ Home devices and now seem to be accumulating Echo devices. Comparing the two, I do see that Echo devices have lots more apps and had an easier time understanding what i want. It's frequent that I want to turn off the lights in a specific room that the Home device will turn off all of the lights.

The latest Amazon Echo acquisition was the Echo Show 5 and it it far more configurable than the @@@Home Display. I like to be able not only to see the time, but the outdoor temp, as well. The Echo displays that as well as a customizable background. Not to mention that it has a camera and can be used as a really nice video chat box between it and the Alexa app on my cell phone. Can't do that with the other one. Great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Got it during Prime Day and am glad I did.
reviews.reviewText: I traded in my 2nd gen echo dot with this little sucker during amazon prime day sale. It is well worth the investment in this upgrade. Sits next to my bed on the night stand and it serves me well. I was worried about it being too bright to be on the nightstand. But brightness is adjustable and screen dims enough when the room goes dark. Screen is of pretty good quality and videos from web and Amazon Prime looks and sounds good. Haven't tried video conferencing yet. But overall very satisfied with the quality and functionality.

I had the OG Echo Show and though I liked the display, the speakers were tuned in such a way that the bass seemed overboosted, so it was muddy at low volumes and well-balanced only at medium or higher volumes (we rarely used it at that level because we have better dedicated speakers for music, movies, etc.).

I still wanted an Echo (though I am more "married" to Google's assistants) because I love Drop-in for the kids and older family members and this looked perfect. It's the size of an old-school bedside alarm clock but with a great display, more balanced sound (at low volumes at least) and all the functionality we needed.

It's less bulky and the display is more useful than the also-cute Echo Spot (the small ball alarm clock).

I purchased this to replace my Spot. The idea of having the Show5 versus the Spot was awesome for me, since the screen is bigger. I am a glasses wearer, and in the middle of the night, it is still something I can see clearly without my glasses on, where I wasn't able to with the Spot. I do really like the user interface. It works perfectly great connecting my smart plugs, Dyson fan, and smart lights. She is able to function every time with any of those options. I was also able to link my Apple Music account which I really enjoy. I do really like the camera cover option as well! When I had the Spot I had to purchase a separate screen protector and camera cover, so its awesome to have a camera cover option, especially when its sitting in a bedroom. Overall I am extremely happy with this purchase! I think for the price range, its a fantastic option!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Best for a small Show for desk or bedroom
reviews.reviewText: I have had all the generations of the show and spot. This is now my 4th show. The only one I was disappointed with was the spot, it was to small for my desk, and the round was an issue. This product solves all the problems for a desktop or bedside device. The people that are complaining about this devices notifications and ads are completely wrong. You can easily turn these off on all Amazon devices. As per the sound quality it is great for what I use it for. I wish I traded in my spot and bought another show 5 for bedside.

I really like this Echo Show 5. It's a little larger than the size of my large screen Smartphone. What caught my attention to this model and I love, is the ability to shut off the camera and turn off the mic when not in use to prevent it from activating. You can scream or whisper Alexa to it and as long as the mic is switched off, you don't need to worry about the kids playing with it or it activating at random. I like the privacy that with the camera switched to off, I have no worry that it can turn on or be hacked. I have control over the microphone and camera features on this Echo Show.

I ask Alexa for briefing and amazed how clear the videos that show the news and other skills I added to it. I even have a web browser on it when I want to check something online. I have the Alexa app on my phone, tablet, and computer.

Imagine if you need to call 911 and can’t reach your phone. Alexa can help you simply by telling her what you need to do.

Our Ring doorbell is connected to Echo Show which makes it fast to check who’s at the door. Much faster than scrambling with the Ring application.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't know I wanted or needed it! LOVE IT.
reviews.reviewText: I recently had a birthday.. the day before, my husband went out to buy my present.. as he was leaving, I mentioned.. "no jewelry" as that is his "go to" gift.. (but I have enough, and we don't do a lot of socializing).. Well.. I was quite surprised when I opened my gift and found the Echo Show 5, this was not something I thought I wanted... although I have numerous Echo devices in the house, I even waited months on the invite list for the original one, not to mention having to wait for the car version.. there was nothing about the Show that appealed to me. Silly me! I love it. Aside from all the usual commands and responses, I love being able to view my front door cam, from another part of the house, and I love being able to view my various WYCZ or ARLO cams.. (yeah, I'm techie).. it's great having a visual of my shopping list, of the weather.. the things I like about it go on and on! I am even thinking about getting more .. and perhaps giving as Christmas gifts, or maybe adding another one to the house. Yeah.. I like it!

Bought this Echo Show 5 to put in my bathroom. I already had the original show in my kitchen and thought this size would be a better fit for that room. Almost everyone who uses my bathroom stays in there longer because they want to play with it. I have this placed in between my shower and sink and have not noticed any problem. So far, I am very pleased with it and will get one for my granddaughter who is going away to college.
