Hoping that it would be on sale during the next Prime discount time and then I will get another one for another room in my house.

My only gripe is I can't turn off Alexa tips like I can on my Fire TV Cube but I deal with it. I wanted a smart clock that I could use my own pictures as the wallpaper and it works perfectly fine for that purpose. It dims any custom wallpaper you use so that the clock and announcements are more visible. It's not bad but noticeable. It would be nice to change the font of the clock maybe in a future update but I doubt that will happen. The speaker sounds okay. It's not great but okay. It has more bass than my echo 2nd gen speaker but overall not as good. That's fine with me since I don't watch videos or listen to music on it. Announcements are nice since the screen is always on unlike my TV connected to the Fire TV. It also shows a user interface when controlling home automated devices such as my lights that's a nice touch.

I have got a few of the Amazon Alexia Echo's and they are all linked together, and I have no problem with any of them!! This thing, however, does not want to link to any of them, I have to almost yell to get it's attention, then I get one of the other ones to answer! Like I said, It sucks!! The only reason I ordered it in the first place, was to see the words of the songs it was playing, and it only does that part of the time!!! Was going to send it back, but just found out that yesterday was the last day I could do that! So, I guess that I'm STUCK WITH IT!!!!!
If I could give it 0 stars, I would!!! Also, It does NOT do any motion detection!!!
I am Thoroughly Disgusted with this whole thing! If it weren't for the other ones, that work so good, I'd get rid of them and go to GOOGLE!!!

Theres a great many things, a device with a screen should be able to do, that this cant. Lets start with how it does alarms. If you dont work weekdays, you have to go in and set a repeating alarm for each day you work individually. You cant just say "wake me up at 9:30 am every tue, wed, thu, sat. The screen is ok, but if you lower the brightness so that it doesnt bug you at night, it doesn't auto-adjust bright enough for daytime. You can tell it to "turn off the screen" but you have to tell it every time, you cant schedule it. Also if you say turn off the lights, instead of saying winch ones, or just turning them all off, it says "I dont see a device called lights" . I have 4 smart lights all named differently. I can setup a routine to do it, the word lights should be ambiguous enough.

The echo came as a free gift when purchasing the Ring doorbell. I thought, what the heck--it's free! Well, I absolutely love it now! I have it synched with our Ring so it'll say when there is motion detected or someone is ringing the doorbell. It plays any music you want. The speakers can go very loud - at one point i had it in my bathroom and listened to songs while in the shower, and it wasn't even at the loudest volume. When playing songs, it'll also show the artist, title and even lyrics! It can do anything all the other "Alexa" products can do - but this includes picture. You can personalize it to your liking - such as the bright screen dims at night (so dim you almost can't see it) so those complaining it's too bright at night - they just haven't figured out how to adjust the settings. You can do alarms, grocery lists, ask what the weather is like, ask it to tell a joke, and so much more. It's small enough to have on your nightstand and doesn't take up much space. I love it so much, I'll definitely buy another!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Device That Turned My Smart Home Into a (Bleep) Show
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 5 is great — WHEN it works. I’ve had the device for six weeks, and for those six weeks, there hasn’t been a single day where the device doesn’t go offline at least 5-8 times a day. When it disconnects, my Echo Spot also disconnects, but not my Echo Dot. When I bring the Echo Show back online, the Echo Spot then automatically reconnects, as if the Spot and the Show are working as one device. It’s been nothing but a headache, as it’s time consuming to have to stop and go through the steps to bring the device back online again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again. I would NOT recommend the Echo Show 5. Maybe I got a faulty device, but I had absolutely no problems with any Echo products prior to bringing this device into my house. It’s been a (bleep) show since the Echo Show arrived.

Just love the size and the quality of the Echo Show 5. The image on the screen is so clear and of course, Alexa is awesome. Quick response, great voice reconnection. I have a soft and low voice and never have a problem with Alexa understanding what I am saying. I have barely touched the options available but what I have used worked as expected. I am an owner of a Tap, Echo Dot & Echo, the sound quality of the show is excellent compared to the Tap & the Dot. I have added a bluetooth speaker to have the music in another room but no sound on the Alexa Show 5 when the external speaker is working. If there is one disappointment, this sound issue is the one. I have not been disappointed with an of my Echo devices and now I am looking forward to adding Alexa to my car!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Buy for your Hard Earned Money
reviews.reviewText:
That Prime Deal two day sale was the Best, but hard to connect to because of the volume. I am so pleased with my Echo Show 5 purchase !
There are soooooo many things it can help you with ! Like reminders to take your medications, which I sometimes forget!

Thank you Amazon !

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for dropping in on grandma
reviews.reviewText: My 90-year old grandma is having fun with this thing. We have one and she has one (both on my account). I named hers grandma, and I say "Alexa, drop in on Grandma," and I give her a call and tell her to go into the Alexa room, and boom, I am video chatting with Grandma over 900 miles away. She plays her music and just loves it. Other family members may be getting them too to check up on her. :) As I was writing this, she said dial (my number one digit at a time) and it called me. :) Yeah, this was a hit.

reviews.reviewTitle: This show is smaller than my friends, but I like how it fits in the room
reviews.reviewText: The show is our only show, it is about the size of my cell phone Galaxy 5. It is smaller than my friends, but we like it. I tend to keep the camera closed unless I am on a call with a friend. It works nicely, and has a few perks like showing the weather and my next few notifications that are coming up today. It has a touchpad so that is a nice feature. I asked her to play songs I haven't heard in a while and they were very nice, and the lyrics came up on the screen.

Meh. It’s cute. But I think some of the functionality got lost in this smaller version. My biggest issue is with the voice recognition (which is kinda why I got this in the first place). It’s located in my small bedroom on the nightstand next to me. I have to turn over, look straight at it, and say Alexa DIRECTLY at the front of it or she won’t hear/recognize me. God forbid the TV is on. Then it’s worse. The other thing that sucks is that the screen stays on all night. I’ve got the brightness turned down, but I wish there was a way that during “do not disturb” times that I could dim it (as part of the routine). I can say “Alexa, turn screen off” - but then we’re back to adjusting myself to be right in front of her and speaking to her like she’s got her hearing aids turned off.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best Alexa in the product line to date!
reviews.reviewText:
I have had Alexa and Alexa enabled devices since the launch of the product line, and the Echo Show 5 is by far the best to date!

It's sleek design is fantastic. It's at home on my night stand, in the kitchen... it's a perfect size.

Technologically speaking, it's performance in on point. Turn the lights off to do go sleep and it switches to dark mode - just the time, temp and alarm setting in a deep red that doesn't disrupt your sleep. One of my favorite settings for the wake up alarm is that for 10 minutes prior to the alarm going off, the screen gets incrementally brighter to simulate the sun rise. I have woken up easier because of this- it's a more natural wake up.

The audio is good too- sounds much better than you would expect from a speaker of the same size. The manual camera cover is a nice addition if you use drop in or accept video calls with the device.

This devise is chock full of the best Alexa has to offer, and at an amazing price point.

I have 4 Alexa devises and 1 Alexa enabled Sonos speaker. I will be adding to my devices with more Echo Show 5's... you betta believe it!

Absolutely love the Echo Show 5! I always research a product before buying it and I was a little skeptical at first because I saw the reviews about the advertisements you allegedly cant turn off. Well, this is completely FALSE. You absolutely can turn off the “try this” and rotating screens. I love that I can clearly see the time, weather and alarms on my “home screen” and I can customize the background. Yes, it takes patience to explore the settings but with the Alexa App (which is FREE), everything becomes easier. I have the least amount of patience and I was even able to tolerate the setup. Clear voice recognition, Alexa plays songs with lyrics, and so much more. I bought this item on prime day so it was $49.99. For what I use it for, that was a deal. If you utilize all the features like the camera, video calls, recipes and all that, it’s worth the full price.

I pondered buying this Echo 5 Show since it was first announced. I decided on Prime Day to pull the trigger. When it arrived I was thinking is the little thing going to fit our needs? After setting it up which was easy I noticed it was having a difficult time understanding my commands. The sound wasn’t that great either. I called Amazon customer service and explained my concern. They connected me to a technician after going through several steps he concluded that the item was not working correctly. I had to return it and it took two days to receive a new one. This one works great. No problem understanding commands. Is the sound up there with my Echo Show? No, and it’s not intended to. If I want I can add my Bose Sound Link to listen to my playlist. Would I purchase this again? Yes I would.

Sometimes, based on no pattern I can figure out, the alarm doesn't go off. Or, more precisely, it doesn't sound: when you ask Alexa when the alarm is set, she will insist that the alarm is already going off--but it's not actually, you know, SOUNDING AN ALARM.

I have, on the advice of Amazon tech support, power-cycled the device, ensured that the system software is current, and factory-reset the device. Still, the alarm just randomly fails to sound. I have learned from the Amazon product forums that I'm not alone in having this problem--but, Amazon tech support has nothing useful to offer.

I bought this to be a bedside clock. Because the alarm can't be relied on, what I actually have is an expensive, ugly paperweight.

reviews.reviewTitle: Automates/Controls my whole house! LOVE THIS!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.reviewText:
ECSTATIC to have this is an understatement.
This is the coolest new toy / gadget I have ever owned. I don’t know how I survived getting up in the morning before having my echo show 5.

I have set it up to control my entire home: turns on/off lights, locks my front door and changes my Nest thermostat. I can even ask it to show my Ring front door camera at any time. Pretty cool to be laying in bed and ask Alexa to turn off the lights or lock the door. Keeps me feeling safe!

I have setup several “routines” through the Alexa App that sync with my echo show. When my alarm goes off, my Echo will tell me good morning, give me the weather and then the news. You can setup your routines specifically for what you want to do. This is just how I have one of my many routines setup.

There’s even a function to have your lights, TV and door locked as soon as your phone / device leaves your home (your location) and vice versa when you arrive home. You need smart devices to use this feature but it’s worth it! (Smart WiFi light bulbs, smart door locks, smart tv, smart thermostats).

You can change Alexa’s voice whenever you want. The sound quality is insane for an alarm clock. Listening to music on it is perfect for my bedroom. It actually has some nice bass to it.

I’m mainly impressed with the thousands of “Skills” you can enable for the Echo Show through the Alexa App. Instead of installing apps on the echo, I just enable whatever skill I want my Alexa to have and it’ll work immediately on my Echo Show. For example: I enabled probably 20 skills the first day I had it (yesterday lol), like The Bible, hurricane news, a weather radar, an Earth Cam (will show Live Photo’s of million different random places on Earth), sleep sounds, relaxing morning music, rain sounds, and more. I can ask Alexa to read me Bible verses, meditation, News, weather, give me the word of the day, help me learn Spanish. The list goes on and on.

Just make sure you read the reviews on the Skill you’re wanting to enable before adding it to a routine. Some of them are just novelty or useless. But the majority of them are pretty freaking cool. I’m going to be playing with the Echo all day today and keep teaching Alexa new ways to talk to me.

Sorry so long! I hardly ever write reviews. But I am totally impressed with this new little robot!

reviews.reviewTitle: Affordable Alexa device with insufficient parental restrictions
reviews.reviewText:
It's a nice sized device and it's easy to use the Alexa features. It's also pretty customizable. It's integrated with our Amazon photos albums to act as a digital photo frame.

The big drawback for me is that it currently lacks some pretty important parental restrictions. If you restrict screen time in your household, then you should know that there is currently no way to stop users from accessing Amazon Video. And while it's true that you can set your Amazon video account to require a PIN, this is an imperfect solution because there's currently no way in Amazon Video to require a PIN for G rated content. So, (1) users can view all of the titles and cover art from the entire Amazon Video library; and (2) users have unlimited access to G-rated content. For our household, this is a significant change, and until new restrictions are added to either this device or Amazon Video, I cannot rate it higher.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect bedside clock over the Echo Spot.
reviews.reviewText:
The perfect bedside clock. Period. I've been using the Echo Spot as the same thing for the last few months and the show 5 blows it out of the water. It dims to nearly imperceptible levels when we turn the lights out which is perfect for rolling over and looking at the clock at 2 am without burning retinas. Love that it has the temp in the corner as well as the shutter for the camera. One of the best features is the ability for the Show to also act as an ambient sound generator.

I'm very happy with this. Not really sure why "Portability" is in the "rate features" categories. I wouldn't necessarily call this item portable, as it will always require a power supply. I bought it to stay in one place, so that's no issue. If you're looking for a clock that does a little of everything this is it.

reviews.reviewTitle: EZVIZ security cam is unstable in Show5
reviews.reviewText:
Same here, i can see the cams on my i phone and the 'classic' win 10 app on my laptop. But the cam image is unstable / and flickers or shows only static on my Echo Show5. Is this amazons fault or EZVIZ ? I think it is Amazons Show 5 that is weak. As I can also view the cams on my Fire TV Sticks without instability. UPDATE 8-24-19; Amazon asked me to return the first one i bought on Prine Days. The replacement arrived this morning, and the EZVIZ camera display on this Show5 goes unstable/ flickers just like the original they sent me. All the while the EZVIZ camera is working fine with my iPhoneSE, Windows10, and even Amazon's Firesticks of which i have a 4k and the standard Firestick. I'm pretty disappointed because this was the reason they asked me to return it, and replace it....for the same result. By the way, the Speaker is ok for music, but very muffled for talk or news radio, so was the first Show5 they sent me. So if Amazon asks you to return and replace, i will say, don't bother. one more thing if i could i would change my rating star to a 1 star.
UPDATE: Sept 1 2019. Its been several weeks and they replaced it once, None of the problems were resolved, especially frustrating is that my EZVIZ, that is Alexa compatible is still unstable and un watchable . And now a NEW PROBLEM, while listening to music, it will al of a sudden go t 100 percent STATIC, no music, It will play static until you give it a command, or unplug it. WHAT A POORLY TESTED PRODUCT THEY RELEASED TOOOOOO EEAAARRRLLLLYYY !!!!!!!!!
UPDATE Sept 15 2019, I see they've lowered the price of this error prone product. Don't be fooled, it is not worth the price of a DOT!!

I primarily use my Echo Show for music. I have them in various parts of my condominium so I don't need to have the volume too loud and disturb my neighbors. The music flows nicely as I move from room to room. The smaller profile of the Echo Show 5 fits nicely for this purpose. It tucks into a small space but without skimping on the quality of sound. Song lyrics are visible for those who like to sing along. Set up is a breeze. As long as you remember to confirm all the Echo Shows are on the same internet network and have been plugged in long enough for all the software upgrades to download (I find a day for all this to settle in works pretty well - you'll know everything is OK when you notice the Echo Show is online when you are setting up the group.) All in all, a nice addition to the Echo Show family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems to be working well now - Updated
reviews.reviewText:
*Update*
I upped the star rating because the Amazon team reached out pretty quickly to assist with the issues. However, I managed to get 2 of my 3 cameras to display and have to finish the third. A pain because it’s installed out of reach but I somehow got everything working. I’m happy with it for the most part and I’ll update again once I use it more.
*Original*
The main reason I got this was for my Blink camera system. I have the a range of Alexa devices including the spot and that integrated with Blink really well. Sprung for this show and 2 more cameras and now there appears to be a big issue with the Blink integration. Idk if this is usual rollout before it’s ready kind of thing. It it’s annoying. I like this little device but it’s useless for using with Blink.

I purchased the Echo Show 5 after my bedside clock radio died. It was a good choice. It’s small enough to fit on my nightstand while being large enough to see without my glasses. I also like that there is a physical shutter on the built in camera just in case my mother calls me a little too early in the morning.

Set up was simple and was mostly accomplished via the device itself. It also seems to hear me from anywhere in the bedroom, including the walk-in closet. And the sound is pretty good given it’s size. But I can’t imagine watching a movie on the Echo Show 5, despite what the description says, unless you’re truly desperate.

All-in-all, I think it’s a great little device and it’s nice to have Alexa at my beck and call.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I had bought it sooner!
reviews.reviewText: I am in absolute love with this thing! I needed this in my life and I didn't know I needed it! It/She hears me well, follows command, has tons of features, and if I want to watch a show before I drift off (I don't have a TV in my bedroom), she's there to help me out. I'm loving this item much more than my Echo Show (2nd gen) that I purchased the same day and is super glitchy. This item is not glitchy at all and it's awesome! I have a feeling this may be a Christmas gift this year for someone. My ONLY complaint is the news content. Every night since she has arrived, every time I walk into my bedroom it says something along the lines of, "_____ has died." Every night before I go to bed it lets me know who is no longer with us. Can I shut the daily death announcements off? Otherwise, I'm so glad I made the purchase and I would repurchase it again for another room!

I ordered this as a bundle on Prime Day. Like others, I assumed it was as previous models, bigger. When it arrived I was disappointed. The screen is very small, about the size of my Moto Play screen on my phone. It set up quickly and I was able to try it out. Searching for videos seems a task. It uses Bing as a search engine, I prefer Google. I haven't figured out if I can change that yet. When videos do come up there are the usual 15 second ads just before but then the same adds loops and plays again so between the search time and the ad time there is a good minute before the video you asked for even plays. I tried searching recipe videos and such but Bing can't seem to find the ones I request.

I really want to love the Echo Show 5 but so far it seems a waste of money. I was happy with just using my Dots and standard Echo speaker. The tiny screen really doesn't add to its' value for me.

If you’re looking for something that does everything that a fire tablet does, this is not the device for you. We wanted some form of echo for my daughter’s room and thought it might be a cute idea to buy this so she could watch videos on it occasionally. It does okay with prime video, but there are no skills for other video sources like Netflix and youtube. Mostly she uses it for playing music and it is fine for that... as good as any of the other echo products. I like that the price point of this is much more affordable than the echo show, which my son has. Same basic functionality, but smaller screen. For the price, we’re happy with it. If you want the tablet functionality though, spend the same amount and buy a basic fire.

I have a Ring doorbell and wanted a visual device that could answer it. I was replacing an Echo (2nd gen) and my daughter has the Echo Show (which was nice) and when the Show 5 came out, I was excited.
I was okay with the smaller screen and assumed it would be the standard "better than expected" of all the Echo's I have.
Not so! The show has poor voice recognition and the speaker is quite under-powered. Unlike the Echo it replaced, it misses about 1/4th of the requests.
Then there is the speaker. While it has a decent freq. response, it isn't loud enough to be heard very well throughout just the kitchen.
All-in-all, I am quite underwhelmed. I wish it had the quality of all the other Echos I have (4 of them, 3 diff models).

The echo show 5 is definitely not a large screen device. It's about the size of a mid-range cell phone screen. It also (like the others in the echo line) is required to be plugged in. So not really portable aside from moving it around whatever surface its on. I would recommend buying a stand. I've connected my google calendar and it works great. We can walk into the kitchen and ask what is on our schedule for the day. Pretty quick display changes between apps.

Some nice features - calendar integration, music integration, built in web browser with voice commands, amazon photo's for quick background changes. Video calling between device and cell phones!

Some things I'd like to see fixed - the camera placement is odd for us. It tends to point upwards. Not a huge deal. I can't seem to call out with video from the device. We can initiate a video call from our alexa apps on our iphones. But we can't figure out how to call out with video.

Last thing -the sound is amazing for this small device. Fills up the room nicely.

I would recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t be fooled...this is the PERFECT size for your bathroom or small space
reviews.reviewText: This is a great addition to my Alexa family of products. I upgraded my Echo dot that I have in a bathroom to this...so happy that I did. Has a easy to read clock, can listen to my favorite music or radio station, can get my flash briefing, commute time etc all as I get ready for work. Easy to flip switch to turn off the camera for privacy. At first I was concerned that this would be too small...it’s not it’s the perfect size for a bathroom. I have the second larger show and I love it to. Was concerned about the sound quality on the smaller as it has too much base out of the box but found the adjustment bar and it’s great. Absolutely LOVE all of the clock faces!!! Don’t hesitate to get this as you will find out how useful this can be while getting ready for work/school etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overpriced for the screen size and sound quality.
reviews.reviewText: Other then that the camera manual shutter toggle is great and makes you feel privacy and security is within your control at all times. Being able to access our ring cameras from the bedrooms at any moment helps push the security issue to a greater level. The screen has a good look but for this money and this size screen I felt it could have been pushed to a higher quality, or go with a 2 inch larger screen. We tried using a 7 in fire tablet and using the show feature but it would not integrate with the ring cameras and was useless to us. This was the best option. We purchased them when they hit the sale on xmas in July and that was a great deal for the money, that being said we are happy for what we paid but feel they should lower the price point permanently.

I was an early adopter of the Alexa technology since I had a number of smart home devices already in my home. I have an echo dot in almost every room in my house and thought it would be cool to have a screen interface but did not want to spend the money, then this device appeared on Prime day at a deal I could not pass up so I bought one.. I love the clock with the date, the time and the local temperature. I have it in my living room and I now want one for my night stand in the bedroom.. It's to small to really watch long videos but short clips like you would view on your phone are ok. The sound quality is ok for music but I would suggest an external speaker which is what I have done with a couple of my Echo dots.

Overall I’m a fan of the Echo Show 5. It’s my first Alexa product.
Cons
Sound quality isn’t the best out there , which could be a disappointment for some, I’m personally don’t mind.
I feel like I have to speak louder than I would like or I have to repeat myself sometimes for Echo to hear me when I’m trying to give a command.
Also a bummer: no battery back up.
Pros
I really love the multitude of features.
Sleep sounds is one of my top used. I love the ability to change the clock face . I love the fun facts feature too.
I am excited about the camera cover especially. I feel more secure.
I can even watch Amazon video on my clock!!! How awesome is that?
I have loved this clock since I got it.

I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality. I had assumed it would sound similar to the echo dot, but the speaker really packs a punch and really fills the room with quality sound. The display quality is fairly good too, pretty much what you would find on a standard smartphone or tablet. Alexa integration is the same as every echo device, except the visual feedback is really nice, especially when playing games or getting the news. The main drawback of the Echo Show 5 is the ads. During the daytime (or when the room is well lit) the device frequently displays ads for Alexa features and skills. So if, like me, you're interested in seeing the clock face always on when the device is idle, then you will find it pretty annoying. Overall a pretty awesome device. Just get rid of the ads please.

reviews.reviewTitle: Voice recognition and Sound Quality Downgrade from Echo
reviews.reviewText:
The voice recognition and sound quality is not as good as the Echo I was previously using. The screen is great, but everything else feels like a downgrade. She doesn't hear me as often as my Echo. And the sounds is meh - feels like a knock off. It didn't automatically connect to my Fire TV either so I still need to go back in and reset everything, I just haven't had time. I use the timer a lot (for cooking, laundry, etc) and I was disappointed that you cannot leave the timer front and center on the screen. It eventually becomes tiny up in the top corner and you still have to ask what's left on it if you're across the room. I tried asking her to leave it large / on the main screen but she doesn't understand. I probably wouldn't have purchased this had I tried it out prior. I would have either waited to get the fancy show or just kept my Echo. I didn't feel like I needed the Fancy show b/c I don't plan to watch shows on it. However, if the sound/recognition quality is better - it's probably the way to go.
I am giving it 3 stars because I do like what the screen shows/ suggests - weather, try this/that, etc. That's something that a device without a screen can't do. Overall, eh. It's okay.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor replacement for an old-school alarm clock
reviews.reviewText:
Latest review:
I have docked 2 stars for the latest software update that broke stuff. Really Amazon if you keep breaking stuff the device is not bulletproof enough to replace a regular alarm clock.

Item 1 (affects both of my Echo Show 5 devices:
It will no longer show the time in big numerals. Instead it shows the time at the top left with a big blank area where the time should display. As suggested on Reddit I toggled the Home Content settings that govern what you see on the screen, like sports highlights and so forth (turning them on and then off again because I just want an alarm clock. I did the same for Rotate Continuously, all to no avail.

Item 2 (affects all of my Echo devices):
My alarms stopped playing my local radio station, instead playing the default alarm tone. When I try to play the same station (KOMO on Tunein) it is silent for a while, then says "KOMO on Tunein isn't available right now". However if I go to the Tunein website on my PC it can play KOMO.

Item 3 (affects all of my Echo devices):
In order to set the aforementioned alarms I had to do it by voice, as you cannot choose music/radio as an alarm sound.

If these weren't all past their return date, they would be in a box right now. They fail at what should be their primary purpose - an alarm clock that you can easily configure via an app (try rescheduling an alarm late at night by vouce6when your spouse is sleeping.

Previous review below:
The device itself is really nice. I especially like the screen, the mechanical camera shutter, and the sound quality.

CORRECTION - the rest of this (below) is incorrect, the Echo Show 5 *does* let you cancel the upcoming iteration from the screen while leaving subsequent iterations intact.

What I have an issue with is the following:
I have an alarm set for 7am weekdays.
I get up early one morning (or tomorrow is a day off).
In either case I would want to cancel just the next alarm.
I can accomplish this by speech - asking to cancel the alarm and then responding to the follow-up question ("cancel all, or cancel next?"). But that wakes my wife up. Bad move.

This device needs a way to do the above from the screen. There is a link that lets you cancel the alarm forever, but not to cancel just the next occurrence.

Nothing special here, we went the Amazon route for these devices 2 years ago and they are okay. Amazon is simply a business that sells products. I really dislike the fact that everything takes you to Amazon instead of the internet but I was away of this choice prior to purchasing. I bought this on a sale for $30 or $40 and I am not excited. We placed it in the kitchen and it has become background with little use. We were hoping to use it for special cooking tips and music videos while we are getting food cooked but using our phone since they are voice controlled and do not have to touch them to search the internet is still our main choice. Not disappointed but I doubt we will purchase another one for other rooms in the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very helpful and fun to use. Great alarm clock!
reviews.reviewText: Feeling like I was being left behind technologically, I decided to try the Amazon Echo Show to find out if it lived up to the hype. My verdict is I think it's fun to explore and I really do like it as an nightstand alarm clock which truth be told is what finally pushed me to purchase it. It has a nice bright display for daytime and dims at night. Not only does it dim at night, it has a 'night mode' where the numerals change to a red/orange with a black background. It is visible in the evening (prior to bed) but when you turn out the lights it REALLY dims such that it has a very faint illumination. I have looked for years for an alarm clock that dimmed enough in the dark that it didn't illuminate the room and disturb my sleep. I was truly delighted to see this feature. It also has a 'sunrise' feature where it starts illuminating to a bright orange as the final minutes tick down to your alarm going off to help you wake up (this is optional). Multiple sound effects to choose from to wake you if you want an alarm but music is of course an option as well. Snooze is an option with this clock either through touching the screen or saying, "Alexa, snooze" to give you more time to get up. There are so many options I haven't explored but plan to. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is there is minimal instructions on how to use. I know it's made to be intuitive and with it being advertised as learning to do new things all the time, it's hard to include instructions with what seems like limitless possibilities but some of us are old school and like to read instructions. I would have preferred MORE instructions even if you can't cover everything. Even just the alarm clock features could have been documented. I had to figure out how to use with trial and error and exploring the settings drop down menus. Of course I asked Alexa for help but she didn't understand all of my questions. She seemed better exploring the outside world than the functions of the clock. "Alexa, change the alarm from 4:30am to 5:00am"....her response "Setting a 2nd alarm for 5:00am". I figured out how to do it the old fashion way, manually.

reviews.reviewTitle: Try again Amazon, nice $50 alarm clock when on sale.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this so I can control my smart home from a display. Horrible execution. Buried underneath menu after menu just to turn a light off, Amazon needs to add smart home controls to the home page of the device. Yes I know you’re supposed to talk to Alexa but at 11pm when everyone in the house is asleep I wanted a way to quietly turn off my lights when I hit the hay rather than reaching for my Alexa app on my phone. Also, I have an echo dot in my bedroom as well and now Alexa doesn’t respond as good as she used to and sometimes she says “sorry I’m having trouble connecting to your hub”. Sometimes less is more I guess. Hopefully a future firmware update will improve the usefulness of this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product, But Needs Battery Backup Base
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased primarily as an alarm clock and its voice control features. Best feature, issuing a GOODNIGHT command to Alexa and having our ceiling fan turn on and changes to our prefered speed during sleep, our Vizio tv turns on and sets to a perfect sleeping volume, and our Phillips Hue ceiling down-lights and night stand lamps slowly turn off with a sunset theme.

Amazon needs to bring a base with battery backup capabilities. I still have an old school alarm with a 9 volt battery in case of power failure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little nightstand clock oh yes its Alex's as well
reviews.reviewText:
A great idea. Essentially use guts from cell phone to create nightstand video player 5 inch screen to cram more Amazon content into my tiny brain. Yes I love but you have to like Amazon fire tablets and advertising model. You get a great device cheap they have a 5 inch screen to sell you items. Pros nice screen clock faces breze to set up
Plays video cameras such as ring Blick etc great for basement ansering doorbell monitering security cameras
Cons Amazon family plans make customizing sub accounts devices a bit seemy. This is more of a dig at Amazon as a whole prime account for family's and linking devices isn't the best.
Hard ware top notch great build quality little video player. If your a Amazon fan you need bedside clock video player this great

Love our 2 Echo Show 5's. Not quite the sound quality of "Alexa" but still very good. We use it to "drop in" on our mother who has dementia while we are out at the store. It has given us a great sense of security knowing that we can see her while away from the house and that she can talk to us just by saying, "Echo, where's Lizzie?" which we have written on a piece of paper by her bed, her chair where she watches TV and by the Echo Show 5. I would have given a rating of 5 except that, while having 2 Echos, only one can be "dropped in" on and the other must be called and answered. We have a large house and wanted to cover more area. I'm sure the software will updated to correct that soon?

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I never knew I needed
reviews.reviewText: Video and sceen quality is nice. I prefer the speaker on the echo dot 3rd gen. Everything else works the same. *edit* as far as these "ads" people are talking about. The screen has to cycle through a short screen saver to reduce burn in, I'm assuming. They are more like tips on how to use the show, rather than ads.

reviews.reviewTitle: Exceeds my expectations and serves my purpose perfectly
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the Echo Show 5 for use as an alarm clock due to several key features that are new to this model. The square screen is quite a nice upgrade over the previous versions round display and offers a much more traditional appearance of an alarm clock. The benefits of using an Echo device as an alarm clock are many, waking up to a rundown of my day and the weather forecast is very fine, and with integration available for other systems such as Phillips Hue I can set the alarm to softly engage my room lighting. As a heavy sleeper this is great!

The integration and software features are amazing, but the primary reason to finally upgrade to this particular Echo option is the physical optical break for the built in camera. Other models may have included software options to disable the camera, but having a physical block simply can't be beat. Paranoia may exist in this instance, but hardware won't be overridden by software (easily, anyway).

If you're considering using an Echo Show 5 as an alarm clock, or any other purpose, you should make the purchase. The build quality is excellent (as with all Echo devices) and the feature set is going to be tough to beat.

This is a dandy version of the Echo Show. I have one by my sofa and one on my nightstand. It has more screen saver options than the regular Show. I like that I can shut the camera. The display is beautiful. I switched over the routines from my dot to this one, and it works perfectly. I think this is too small for kitchen use, I'm glad I have the larger Echo Show for that. The $50 price was fair. It works most of the time with my Blink XT2 cameras.

I'm trying to figure out how to get it working with Fire TV. My dot worked seamlessly with my Fire TV. It seems buggy at the moment. It might be me. Not sure. I will update when I figure it out. I'll lower the stars if there's no way to get it working with my TV.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good, depending what you want to do. The viewing angle isn't that good.
reviews.reviewText: I prefer the echo dot as it has the dot button that you can press to go the the Alexa prompt automatically by pressing it, Also i can use that on the car. The echo show 5 viewing angle isn't good, it is also bad feng shui to have it beaming by your nightstand. I sometimes use the echo dot and there is no bothersome light or stop awake or stimulate your sleeping. Device should be priced lower than $50. It is real easy to set up the show decise on wifi. Can't get Skype setup yet, that would be super neat to get working, and I do like the Aleca outbound calling of phone numbers to any USA Canada and si I believe Mexico. That's a worthwhile feature for outbound dialing, there is a video screen with a keypad. Sweet.

I love this version of Echo. We own multiple Echoes, Dots,Tap and Spot including the Echo show. This is replacing my Smart Beddi alarm clock. I absolutely love it. The customizations of this echo 5 is superior to any echo. As always the more you talk to it the better she understands you. Along with being able to see all of my Ring cameras while Laying in bed is awesome. Not much I can say about it negatively, it was pricier than I would have preferred.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best Echo devices yet
reviews.reviewText:
Awesome Echo device for the money and I've own almost all of them. This one is replacing an Echo Spot. Love the bigger screen (than the Spot) and very compact size.

Thank goodness they put an AUX out on this one (lacking on the big Echo Shows).

See photo of it next to my Google Home Hub (now called Google Nest Hub).

UPDATE 2019-07-25: Still liking it so far but wish it had a higher resolution screen. Changing rating to 4.5 stars and rounding up to 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it cherish it just epic
reviews.reviewText:
Love this new Amazon Show 5
Very intuitive very easy to operate right out of the box.
Speakers are loud they have better sound and clarity than my Echo DOT Gen 3.
I prefer the new Show 5 3X more.
I like how the ease of navigation through the menus almost identical to Android phones or tablet devices.
I utilize this little device every day listening to music while I work. I work from home so this really is a true work desk companion.
I have 0 complaints Amazon has come such a long way with these high quality devices.
Just be sure to disable the adds filter them out in settings menu.
I highly recommend this product and off Course Using Amazon Prime shipping was super fast as always.

I replaced my Echo Dot (1stGen) with this device in July when it came out and it’s been quite the wild ride!
-The voice recognition is nowhere near the Dot’s. With the Show I practically have to either shout at it or be right next to it. I once tried to get the traffic info from my master bathroom and the device not only did not hear me, but my EchoPlus (2Gen) was the one who heard me, and it was all the way on the living room!
-It’s just laggy, feels like a rushed product plagued with bloatware; those ads and unwanted tips are probably what’s slowing it down.
-The video is OK, I wasn’t expecting much for the price, you get what your pay for, right?
Summary: if you plan on using this as an alarm clock or directly from bed (as it sits on your night table) or you’ll be close enough for it to pick up your commands then go ahead.
I wouldn't replace any of the existing devices with this though, it’s just doesn't work well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like a husband, doesn't answer when called
reviews.reviewText: I love the size and design. I absolutely hate talking to it. I have to scream Alexa several times before it answers even if there's no background noise. With my fan on, it's pointless. Then it never responds appropriately. I have been controlling my security system with my echoes for about a year, this one never hears the command right. The scrolling isn't terrible but luckily it goes away when sleeping as this is right on my nightstand. Wouldn't buy this one again. Paid $19.83 total for it on prime day. If I'd paid full price, I would be P*SSED.

Here’s the deal: for me the key purpose for a device like this is to use it primarily as a clock that you can ask for information ON DEMAND. The device is just not flexible enough to do that well. I have found no way to increase the size of the clock numerals or to completely control the brightness. Though I did ultimately succeed, it was too difficult to get the darned thing to stop peppering me with information on the screen that I didn’t want or ask for. Particularly when I was relying on it as a nighttime clock I didn’t want things popping up and making the time display go away. I should not have had to look at every menu and research it on the Internet to make that stop.

Yes, the Alexa features are nice, but let’s face it, she’s pretty much a moron except for the most basic questions that are phrased carefully.

Amazon, here’s your homework: make the user interface fit the the way human beings are likely to behave and make the AI smart enough to understand and answer more complex things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Show 5 vs. Spot as a bedside clock
reviews.reviewText:
I recently replaced my Echo Spot with the Echo Show 5. I do like the larger screen. Displays more w/o being too large for a night stand. The audio quality is also considerable better. However or has a couple of downsides as well.

Most importantly is its ability to listen. I have several Echo devices at home and when I say the wake word, even when sitting less than 2 feet away from the Show 5, one of the other Echo devices will answer instead from another room. This was never a problem with the Echo Spot. Apparently the Spot has much better microphones than the Show 5 🤷‍♂️.

Second, the display does not dim as well in night mode as the Spot did. It still puts out quite a bit of light.

We got this primarily to use as a secondary monitor for our Nanit baby camera. The lag over the wifi is 3-4 seconds, compared to the iPad which is maybe a 1 second delay. The sound quality is pretty good though, so there's that.

As for Alexa's base features, she scrolls through the same 6 "top stories" or so, all day. I can't customize these stories, so instead of hearing about the Amazon jungle burning down, I was alerted that Drake was the butt of an instagram prank and that Taylor Swift was rereleasing some of her old songs. Great.

The voice recognition is terrible. I've asked for so many things and the common end result is that I'm forced to ask google on my phone. This is a complete waste of money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa with Video in a small but powerful package
reviews.reviewText: This is a very nice compact version of the Echo Show that I’ve been enjoying for a long time. It’s a great desktop or bedside addition to your connected lifestyle and a great way to tap into the power of Alexa. Setup was a breeze and the display and speaker are surprisingly good for its compact size. I really wish the optional tilt & swivel base came standard but I guess Amazon needs some way to recoup their investment while still offering Echo devices at such affordable prices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for music and Alexa, but do you really need a Show for it?
A little disappointed in quality of Echo Show 5.
reviews.reviewText: I bought 2 Echos Show 5 devices. One of them was for me. It is working, but have issues with sound quality on "s"s....it has a hissing sound and/or like the person has a lisp when talking. I am going to try to do some work with the equalizer to see if it can get better. Also a few times Alexa did not understand the command. I did not have any of those issues with my Echo Spot. The 2nd one I bought for my great niece's 9th Birthday (yesterday) and when we plugged it in, nothing happened. We tried several electrical outlets, other cables and nothing....it was DOA which was VERY disappointing for this 9 year old. Today I shipped it back to Amazon so I hope you replace it quickly for this little girl. I am worried that your quality assurance is not as good as it was in the past maybe due to demand. Are these coming from China?

reviews.reviewTitle: Right size for small cramp space!
reviews.reviewText: I had a 1st gen. echo and it was pretty big to sit on the computer desk with bunch of useful junks. Taking up space. I desided to purchased Echo 5 because it small with big screen. Almost like a cell phone screen. Better than our travel partner small Echo Show. Great sound, awesome video, my girlfriend and I love it! And it don't take a lot of space out of our computer desk. It's perfect! She said it's much better and she enjoyed it very much. So do I. I'm glad I found the right size.

I purchased 2 echo show 5s and had them for 3 days now. I purchased this specific device over a dot because of the camera mode, and on the Product information page of amazon it shows a photo that says “Alexa, show me the nursery” and Alexa checked in on the babies room . I have a seven month old so that was my plan on buying two of these devices. I name to the device accordingly in my app. however when I tell Alexa to show me a room, She only can video call a room and someone needs to be in there to answer it. Obviously my seven-month-old can’t answer Alexa, So I’m really upset that the product information was misleading. Alexa still needs some serious updates. Other than this major disappointment as the sole reason I bought it, The device otherwise functions well . The sound quality is great for the size . The display is a nice clear quality . And if you word your questions appropriately Alexa can answer them . She does not understand some simple things wil she does not understand some simple things though, for example , she does not recognize that mobile phone and cell phone is the same thing . With time and updates she has a lot of potential.

I picked up a couple of Show 5s on Prime Day; one was installed in my home office for reminders and monitoring my Ring doorbell camera and the other went in my bedroom, taking the place of my old alarm clock and an Echo Dot. Integration with the Alexa app was easy and the doorbell camera comes right up so I can see if it's a Jehovah's Witness or the pizza delivery man at my door. The bedroom Show works well as a hands-free alarm clock; the automatic night mode is dark enough for me (a light sleeper) to not be disturbed by the display, but during the day is bright and readable. My only complaint is that there are "Try 'Alexa, tell me <whatever>'" suggestions on the home screen and turning off the Discover Alexa setting does not get rid of them. I like to have the time, weather, reminders, etc. cycle on the home screen, so turning that off so I don't have to see the "Try Alexa" suggestion is a no-go for me. If there was a way to not show these annoying suggestions, I would have given this 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa can't shut off the alarm if your internet goes out.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to use as an alarm clock in my bedroom and am quite pleased with it. I really like the sound in it even more than my full size echo show. The other night my internet went out (not a power loss) and I was pleased the alarm still went off and woke me up. HOWEVER without an internet connection Alexa does not function so I could not get her to shot off the alarm. One would think that since Alexa is in this device and so is the alarm that she would not need an internet connection to stop the alarm but this is not the case. I ended up unplugging it and plugging it back in to stop the alarm. I believe the mute button may shut off the alarm as well and will have to try that next time this happens. Other than that this is an excellent device and definitely the easiest alarm clock to set and change I have ever owned. I like the hardware switch that covers the camera with a physical shutter rather than electronically shutting off the camera. The sound is fantastic. The auto dimming works very well. I was planning on getting an echo show for my kitchen but I may be getting another echo show 5 instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Delightful appliance every home should have
reviews.reviewText: All the best of an Echo product + a touchscreen. Perfect for use as an clock radio on steroids, which doesn't do it justice. Easy to use, great sound picture, bringing to life many of the things Alexa used to provide using only a single sense. For example asking about the weather brings back images of the weather as the day progresses, without having to make an additional request. Nice night mode to be able to have an alarm clock when you want it, but also a digital photo slide show device during the day. Nice work, Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device... but the sound may disappoint some
reviews.reviewText: I suppose all the glorious reviews set my expectations too high, but I was disappointed with the sound quality. So much so, in fact, I returned it for a replacement under the assumption the first Show 5 received was defective. The sound was uneven and sometimes sounded “ mushy” with a hint of distortion even at lower volumes. Amazon was quick to offer a replacement though it took almost a week to arrive. And while I believe there is less distortion, it still sounds a bit mushy. Sounds better than my Dots but not as good as my Echo or even my Tap. But, all the other features makes it a good value and a keeper. I can connect it to one of my external speakers when I am going to do some extend listening.

reviews.reviewTitle: Size is okay, SOUND IS NOT
reviews.reviewText:
I have an Echo Show and now the Echo Show 5. I think it works well but I’m also kinda disappointed
- I was nervous about the size, but it’s honestly fine. It’s like the size of a phone, but I watched movies on the screen and It was great.
- no VUDU, I think? That sucks. Truly sucks to only watch amazon or Hulu. Blah. 😑
- WHY DOES THE SOUND BLOW?! It works fine then alllll of a sudden it doesn’t work and sounds like a broken radio!

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it , nice add on to my Alexa range
reviews.reviewText:
Update: 7/23/19, This is my 2nd echo show for my daughters bedroom , she loves it, Just
Need the echo show 2nd generation and I will be very happy ...
I like it nice addition to my Alexa range , easy setup , for the price I think people expect too much for the price . Does the job it’s designed to do , cool drop in feature, sounds good ,, will be purchasing a doorbell for the video option , and some outdoor cameras ... my opinion it’s a nice size , sits on my table without looking out of place .. I am a Alexa fan so am biased :)

I bought this at a great price on Prime Day. It's a great model for the kitchen so I can look things up hands-free. I like that the screen can function as a digital photo frame, too. The sound was surprising from such a small unit and it's nice to be able to add it to a multi-room group and control my smart plugs and devices or make have free phone calls without moving a finger. I don't imagine I'll want to use it to watch movies on the small screen, but so far I like it!

I really had high hopes for this product until I received it. I was truly disappointment at the size of the screen, it’s literally about the size of my iPhone XS Max. I bought it mainly for the capability of viewing my security cameras, however, I find it didn’t really make my house “smarter” as it claims. It would be SMART if it automatically shows who’s at the door when security camera detects motion or when someone rings the door bell. Instead, you will have to ASK Alexia to show you the camera in order too see who’s actually at the door, and most of the time, you have missed at least 30 seconds of the camera time. But once you finally get connected to the camera, the video quality is not bad at all. As for rest of the echo show 5 functions, an echo dot would do the trick at a cheaper price.

Recently they changed the "try alexa" hints so that they are always on the screen. I have everything turned off and selected the large clock face but the small clock with try alexa hints stays on. I can no longer see the time from across the room. I have to ask alexa for the time. I hope they change it back to where the settings you want actually work. 😡

Not thrilled. When i first saw this release i got excited. Finally a more affordable echo show that would fit my needs perfectly. Until i got it. Voice recognition is horrendous. It gets what i ask wrong all the time (mostly weather and news), while my original echo located two rooms over, hears and responds. The speakers are so so. I’m not going to complain about them due to it’s price so you get what you pay for. Lastly, it seems the WiFi signal gets lost often. I’m not sure if the blame should be on the device or my provider but my previous devices in the same spot with the same service didn’t have these problems. Overall I’m just super disappointed. The voice recognition is bad. WiFi signal bad. Speakers ok. Screen fine.

I tried to talk myself down for getting and echo show since I really had no need for it, but really thought it seemed cool. On prime day I thought, hey why not. I got 2; one for upstairs and one for down. Similar to the Echo, it responds slow. My echo dot will respond from another room than either the show or echo. My mom and sister said they would get one so we can video call. Maybe when that happens I will see more value. But honestly, messenger video calls work just fine. The only real plus is showing you who is at the door. But since hardly anyone comes unannounced that is not a feature I will use a lot. I would stick with the dot if on the fence because repeating yourself for even simple request can get old.

reviews.reviewTitle: Highly functional device with great display
reviews.reviewText: Very functional, compact smart speaker. The capabilities are significant; the display is very clear and easy to read. Fairly intuitive for most users. The sound quality is fairly poor, especially for music but this isn’t the device one would purchase if listening to music was your focus. The spoken word (news; weather; etc.) reproduction is quite acceptable. Though I have no other smart speakers or devices in my home, I can easily see the how this compact device would integrate nicely into that ecosystem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Sound, Lots of Easy-to-Use Features in Small Package
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this for the family to use in the kitchen when it went on sale. Set up was 10 minutes. I like to access my Amazon Music Unlimited mainly and FM radio stations. I was surprised how clear and deep the sound is for a device this small. The TV screen played my Amazon Prime TV and the image was clear though a bit small for my tastes. There is also a customized alarm clock you can voice-activate, so I'm thinking of getting one or two in the bedroom. At this price point, the Echo Show 5 is a no-brainer.
Update:
Bought a second one with no problems. The first one had some distortion, so I reset it and rebooted it. This appears to have resolved the problem, but I will update if things change.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sluggish, muddy sound, unimpressive but has potential
reviews.reviewText:
Sluggish interface - taps take a while to resolve, comparatively; animations are unnecessarily long.

The sound is muddy, a bit low-heavy compared to the Echo Dot I switched from.

It has a harder time understanding/hearing me than the Echo Dot did - I'll have to repeat my requests more than I had to with the Dot.

The time should show all the time, no matter what screen you're on ('cept, maybe, if you're watching a video).

Integration with other Amazon devices could be better.

Other than that, pretty much equal to the Echo Dot except with a few added visual features.

Oh, and it's not huge; the screen's about the size of my phone; but I needed a clock, so that's handy. I hope they continue to improve upon it.

Echo Show is like the Echo spot, except bigger. I got this during Prime dayto try out for the Echo Show functionality with a touch screen. I have to say, i was a little bit disappointed. I have a love for all the echo, echo dots and FireTV integration to them, which works well. But the Echo Show 5 needs some work to make it right. Some suggestions I have would be a integration of echo show to the fire TV. make it a touch screen remote to operate the FireTV would be awesome. or 2, create routine buttons on a menu in the Echo Show, which allows you to run routines by clicking of a button when you wake up. The visual engagement will help users feel more intuitive and more engaged. Also, porting some apps to fit for the echo show 5 will be great as well.

The only problem i am having with this device is that it has trouble responding to requests SMS completing tasks. Other times it will perform functions opposite of what i ask. I do not have a speech problem and i have had other people try with the same results. I hope there is a way this can be fixed. It's getting annoying. When I've asked the unit to learn my voice it says that it cannot perform that task. So yeah really really annoying. Starting to wish i would have kept my echo dot 3rd generation now.

I have the Echo Auto and it allows me to say "Alexa send a text message" but on the Echo Show 5 it says "Sending SMS is not support on this device" I am a little confused why some features are not consistent across all Amazon Echo devices

The product itself physically is good, the video quality and screen quality, but the features I'm noticing from my 2 echo devices just aren't consistent.

Bought this echo for my daughter’s nursery. I was sick of yelling to my Alexa in the living room. This echo just happened to be on sale when I was considering getting one for the nursery. I use it even more than I thought I would. It’s wonderful for playing music and I can FaceTime my husband when my hands full. I also use it with our wink hub and smart bulbs to turn lights in the nursery on and off or just dim them when needed. Glad I decided to get it.

I received the echo dot when I bought my ring doorbell. I wanted to be able to see who was at the door without having to go into my phone. When I found out the show 5 was coming out my son and I wanted to get it. It is smaller, but for what we are using it for it works. I do not plan on watching television on it. The sound quality is really good, and the picture is also good. I listen to my audio books with and the quality is great. I would recommend this product to anyone who wants to buy it. Also I am glad that it does not take up a lot of space that is also a plus.

This is a very nice Echo model, but I'd recommend the regular Echo in almost every situation. The screen is too bright for a nightstand, even when dimmed - if that's your need, go for the Echo Spot. It's really not ideal for a bedroom because of the light and the constantly changing screen content. Unless you have an external speaker, then, it's not a better option for anywhere that is mostly about music. If you want it in the kitchen, for example, you're better off with the Echo Show 2. So really, this is best in a common area or a desk, which makes me wonder just why this is the best choice for anyone but goofballs like me who have about 8 Echos in the house already. That said, if you're a goofball who has 8 Echos in the house, this is a great compliment.

I am loving it so far. The size is perfect to replace the echo show 1st gen I had on my night table. Sound is impressive considering the size of it. I am as surprised as I was with the echo 3rd gen. During the day it shuffles photos from my Amazon photo album and let's me control my Philips Hue lights through the Philips bridge; my ring alarm system and my size cameras. I can't ask for anything better to control the smart part of my house from my night table. At night it goes into sleep mode and the screen turns completely black with red numbers showing the time and temperature. In the morning it wakes me up with the weather forecast and music from some of my favorite artist (all these set as a routine through the Amazon app on my phone).

Not bad. Not awesome. Picture is average. Sound is reasonably balanced but not awesome. A fully manual shutter is nice for areas where you Want to securely disable the camera without resulting to duct tape or fingernail polish. The most significant shortfall is that it really could use both volume and screen intensity buttons and greatly improved voice integration as Alexa is near clueless in adjusting the settings while playing a movie and indeed forced me to go find the movie again and start it over instead or just responding to “return to movie” or anything else that I could s think of as an alternative. Finally, the optional stand is in no way optional unless you are mounting it exactly how you want it. The base should be integrated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have you tried this? Yes, and I don't like it.
reviews.reviewText: Who wants an appliance that interrupts you with advertisements. I don't and I'll bet you don't either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact and attractive Alexa display multifunctional device.
reviews.reviewText: Now this is a perfect and compact in between Alexa display devices compared to the more expensive ones. The display of my calendar, song lyrics, different options for of the clock and my outside temperature. Great voice recognition. Thoroughly recommend it for those who do not want to buy the more expensive models of Alexa display devices but want the option of visual display Along with the security of turning off the camera and microphone. Thanks Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent little device for the price
reviews.reviewText: Decent little device for the price. I use it to access my cameras and as a substitute for an alarm clock next to my bed.

Such a cool addition to our home! This is my first Alexa device and she is living up to the hype. I’m particularly happy with this purchase for the speaker. I have lots of really nice, name-brand speakers but this one has taken presidence in home due to the convenience of her playing whatever I want hands free. I’m enjoying learning new tricks to her everyday. I like that it is compatible with my Apple apps and even iRobot. The Show even plays videos! She is in my kitchen helping me with recipies and timers but also helps us with daily alarms, fun facts, finding my phone, calling phone contacts, shopping lists, etc. My name is also Alexa and we haven’t had nearly as many problems having two of us in the house as I thought. She seems to know specifically when you’re speaking to her. Overall, very cool toy! Not sure she’s more useful than that yet.

I just received the Echo Show 5 two days ago, and am very impressed with the price, and the amazing versatility (music, audio books, connectivity with my Ring and Arlo security cameras, and Bluetooth speakers). Not so impressed with the video, due to the screen size, but that's nitpicking because of the almost unlimited other options for stream video.

The sound is not for "serious" listening, but for background music while cooking, as an alarm clock, etc., it's more than adequate.

I would like to see Amazon come up with a powered satellite speaker that could plug into the available 3.5mm output.

It's very easy to set up

reviews.reviewTitle: Mediocre sound quality and poor voice recognition
reviews.reviewText:
I have multiple Echo devices at home. Although I’m impressed with the features, this
model seem mediocre in sound quality and voice recognition. The bass is not that good that I had to configure the equalizer to shut it, It gets my commands 50% of the time, if it could even hear them. I like the ability to see my Ring cameras from it but there’s at least 5-7 seconds before it could stream. Overall, it’s a good product but not enough to recommend. I hope there’ll be more improvements on the software or next gen.

This is my 5th Echo device, and first with a screen. I love it. I keep the physical camera shutter closed all the time, but love having this on my bedside table. It’s perfect for bedtime music, a light-responsive clock, and a nice wakeup alarm. Although, only during morning hours. That needs to be fixed. Voice recognition is almost perfect... it occasionally has trouble hearing the wake word. Nice speaker sound in a small package.

I don't know how it connected to my wifi without asking me for any info at all but it did. easy set up and integration with ring doorbell (it does not automatically show video view but will if asked). Swipe down and select home screen to disable the annoying "trending topics" notifications. There are no ads, unlike what other reviewers have reported. It's a great item. It looks good and sounds good. It's a complete reinvention of the bedside digital clock.

I bought the Echo Show 5 to integrate with my existing Echo Show and 2 Echo dots. I have it on my nightstand. The first thing I noticed was that it has a really crisp, clear picture. You also get pretty impressive sound out of this smaller device, much better than I expected. The voice recognition is often better than what I get with my Echo Show. I love all the options for setting up your alarm for different sounds or music. The only downfall for this device, or any Echo device really, in my opinion is that I wish they included the stand rather than requiring you to pay extra for that. Overall, I believe the devices just keep getting better and this one is no exception.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buena relación precio/calidad. Muy buen producto
reviews.reviewText: Me encanto!!! Es un gran producto a un precio razonable

I thought this product would be a real dud. Too small. Screen would be impossible to see. Sound would be bad. Wrong on all counts. I have owned all of the Echo devices (except the Spot, but I have given those as gifts and am familiar with them). This device makes the perfect bedroom device. On a bed stand, the clock face is extremely visible. Voice recognition is terrific - picks up from a very good distance. Sound is amazingly robust for such a small enclosure. And of course can be paired to a Bose or other Bluetooth speaker if you want an even more robust music playback experience. And the price is the best surprise yet. Kudos to Amazon on this one. You hit it out of the park!

We have smart Amazon devices in every room of our house. We have the original Alexa, the Dot, The Echo Show, and now the Echo Show 5 Compact. I love the Echo Show and wasn't sure if I would enjoy the compact version, but as it turns out I love it more than the larger Echo Show with the heftier price tag. It does everything that the other non-display smart devices do, but you can also browse the internet using the built-in Firefox or Amazon Silk. The apps seem to work better on this device than the larger counterpart. The interface is cleaner (I'm guessing it was necessary due to the smaller screen size) and the choice of background skins is modern and sleek. Now I can watch my shows from Prime Video on this Echo Show 5 instead of having to hold my phone.

I have had this for a little over two weeks now and so far I have satisfied with the responsiveness and its operation. For those of you who have complained about the annoying ads coming on the screen all the time, I was able to disable all that by going to the setting which is made available by swiping down the screen and then selecting the "Home and Clock" option. There you can toggle on or off various options including the suggestions (ads). The sound quality is fairly good and the screen resolution while not as good as the full size Show still good and acceptable. Overall I like this addition to my Alexa devices with a touch of sight and sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Look at me in the 21st century
reviews.reviewText: I bought this unit on Prime day. I figured $50 it was worth a shot. Instructions said 5 minutes to set up, took me about 6 minutes. Had to remember the WIFI password. It seems to do everything it suppose to do and is kind of fun. I was shutting down for the night and told Alexa "turn off the music and good night" It replied "nighty night and get some rest" How nice is that. Is this an absolute must have? No, is this useful and fun? yes. Glad I bought it.

the main reason why we bought this was to communicate with family members who live in other areas. It was a simple solution so the kids can call without having to bother their parents to use the smartphone and a video app. now the video just stopped working. you can make audio call but you cannot make a video call. so basically it is now a useless paper weight. I don't care about the other features because I did not buy it for those features. the video is the only reason why we bought it and now it doesn't work. Other users are saying the same thing. Stick with video apps on your phone and save your money if all you want is the video function.

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera not working on 2 Echo Show 5 units - Software Issue!
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 Echo Show 5 devices that I've been using for a couple of months in different rooms in my house. The video camera stopped working on the 1st device a couple of days ago and the only way to resolve the problem was by doing a factory reset (unplugging the unit did not work). I just noticed today that the camera stopped working on my 2nd device and I had to do another factory reset. After Googling this issue there were reports of other customers having the same problem. This is clearly a software issue because the camera works once you do a factory reset. Please resolve this problem Amazon!

It recognizes some of our home wired devices but none of my four amazon cameras, one is wyze cam 1080p work with the echo show 5 even while all devices are listed on it. It does recognize turning lights on and off. I have three echo shows and all devices AND all cameras work on those but NOT the echo 5. A few people have said the wyze camera works on theirs and I have asked the group twice how I may get the other cameras AND the wyze camera to 'show' or 'drop in'. Alexa lists them but says she can't 'find' them even when you press on them she doesn't use the camera name at all, just says 'I can't find 'camera''. I'm unsure what to think of my echo 5 purchase. Perhaps this is software issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Size and Great Third Party Integration.
reviews.reviewText:
I have been really enjoying our Echo Show 5. It is great to sit on the side table next to my chair and not have a giant screen but still have something that can show me stuff. The touch on the screen isn't the best but really how often do you really expect to use touch control with a voice activated assistant. This Echo can pick up my voice from anywhere in my living room or kitchen which is about a 35ft distance at the furthest that I could be. The Echo has integrated great with my Alarm.com system, third party light switches, Canary video cameras and Samsung TV. It is great to be able to control all of these systems with just my voice.

Don't expect for high quality sound though. Although it is decent quality and you can hear the Alexa responses clearly and loudly it suffers when listening to music. It is OK if you want a little music in the room but if you really want good quality just use the Bluetooth speaker to connect to a soundbar or other type of speaker.

I had a 2nd Gen Echo Dot which I recently traded in for this device. It's been super frustrating so far. The Show 5 just can't hear me with the microphone setup. Whereas the dot could hear me from across the room at a normal speaking volume while there was a lot of background noise, I need to either yell or be right next to the Show 5. Other than that, it's a fine device that does what it says it does. But this should really be considered a short-range only system. Very disappointed in what seems like a cost-cutting measure by Amazon reducing the user experience.

The advertisements that people keep mentioning aren't an issue. You can control all of that through the settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: Member of the family that secretly records everything you say an do.
reviews.reviewText: Meet George Jetson.....Alexia his wife...just watch the video....

reviews.reviewTitle: Has made my life easier and more fun.
reviews.reviewText: Love my Echo Show 5. It's like having a very smart roommate. What fun to listen to old favorite songs, watch Prime videos and be able to get an answer to about anything I can think of to ask Alexa. She even tells me jokes, riddles and stories. She shows me the latest headlines and tells me weird stuff to know. My favorite features is that she tells me when Amazon has made a delivery to my door. I'm able to get the package inside and not worry about it sitting out in a public walkway. No regrets on this one. You have to remember that it is not a high dollar item and may not produce the highest quality sound but it works okay for me and I can integrate all my devices.

One of the key uses for this device is as a bedside alarm clock. For that it’s just mediocre. First, you can’t set alarm volumes for individual alarms. I wake up early and easily so I want my alarm really quiet. My wife needs the sound of nuclear attack to wake her up. You should be able to specify a volume level for each alarm. Also, the gradual ascending alarm volume does NOT work with music. What’s up with that.

I absolutely love my Echo Show 5! I love how customizable it is (my home screen clock is so cool!), You can upload your own photos to use as backgrounds or if you decide to stick to one that's already in there you can change the color, clock face etc. I moved my Echo Dot 2 to my son's room and he thinks that's so cool and it's awesome being able to use the drop in feature. The browser is great, the sound quality is excellent and the screen is amazing! Overall, my favorite Prime Day purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: I really wish the hints/tips would not scroll across the screen...
reviews.reviewText: I do like this Amazon Echo Show 5 but after a while, those scrolling hints and tips get really annoying. It's like I bought an ad machine - okay, so maybe they aren't ads or most are not ads, but the thing is, I paid for this item and it shouldn't be annoying me by doing stuff I don't want it to and there isn't any way to stop it as far as I can tell. I mean I looked on the Echo Show's tools and found nothing, then went to the Alexa app on my phone and found nothing there. If there is a way to turn that crap off, I'd love to know how. And I sure wish Amazon would understand that if I pay good money for a smart home electronic item like this, it should serve ME, not Amazon...

Only four stars so far - I’ve only had the device a month, and I’m still putting it through its paces.

I’ll start with sound quality - it’s excellent, especially considering the size of the device. I just played music on it for the first time, and was pleasantly surprised by the richness and depth of the sound. Voice recognition is also very good - the only real problem I have with the Echo Show 5 is when I’m trying to use the skill attached to the game show where all responses must be in the form of a question; however, that same skill dropped a major update the same week I got the Echo Show, so I am almost convinced that the update is the problem, and not the device.

In summary, the device does what I want and expect it to do, and for the most part, does it well, or even very well. Recommended.

I was reluctant to buy this because people were all complaining about the same thing; the never ending 'try this' and 'try that'.
