I thought it was announcing it but it shows it on the screen which doesn't bother me. There is a way to stop it but I haven't bothered so far. I love the way it is like a tiny computer screen giving me the weather which is the main reason way I got this gadget. It's not something that I needed and got it on Amazon prime day.

When I compare it to my Spot, I believe that it come out ahead on most levels except overall looks.
At Prime Pricing for both items the Spot and the Echo 5 the 5 is the winner. Saying that I really don't know what
to do with it Fire 10 with Alexa is better for movies though sound is not as good. I think that time will tell
if it does well at full price. If you really want to get two very good Echo pieces consider the INPUT and CONNECT.
These do great things for very little money. And bye the way where was the timer clock this Prime Day.
Finally could you please try to make it somewhere other than CHINA, please.

Definitely a giant leap backwards from the dot. All of my smart devises have issues since I switched out to the show 5’s. It can turn on my lights sometimes and not others. Constantly tells me my devises don’t support what they have done for years. It’ll work one day then not the next. Only thing that changed was swapping my echo dots for show 5’s. I’d suggest waiting until they put a little more effort into their product development.

reviews.reviewTitle: Telly, Alarm Clock, Calendar & Mobile all in one!
reviews.reviewText: Telly, Alarm Clock, Calendar & Mobile all in one! Plus a jukebox and primary/secondary smart home hub. The gradient light alarm wakes you, then gives you your top messages and first calendar meetings. Both the audio & visual are stunning, and I wasn’t expecting that depth when I ordered it as a gift for my spouse.Only downside is that my husband of 16 years has a very bad habit of using it to set up “jokes” like having the echo/dot in every room play “It’s Raining Tacos” at top volume if you walk by, along with randomly turning on bedside lamps at all hours. Despite my household jokester, we will be purchasing ones for all of our parents, grandparents and siblings.
I really love my echo show , the Size is perfect doesn’t take up any space and it looks great

Nice size and shape for bedside alarm/Alexa/weather station. Easy to set an alarm and Alexa responds appropriately. Would like an onscreen touch button to turn off alarm when it sounds so I don’t have to talk to Alexa. Screen brightens slowly before alarm signals to ease into consciousness. Displays weather, sports scores/schedules, and more. Physical camera cover is a good feature for bedroom use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice little unit, but interface is slow
reviews.reviewText: I Purchased this unit when it was on sale during prime days. At the reduced price, I felt it was worth buying. I would not have bought it at its regular price. Sound quality is decent and the display is nice, but it does have problems. The interface needs to be greatly improved. It takes significantly longer to start a video than it does using the app on my iPhone SE. And my iPhone SE is old technology. Yes… I use it every day, but I have many other options I could be using instead. It just seems like the product was released before the software is optimized for speed. And if that is not a problem, then the processor is inadequate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good device for area where don’t want the larger screen.
reviews.reviewText: First, I own at least one of all Echo devices with interactive screens released so am familiar with all of them. To me it’s all about space available. I like the large screens in the kitchen, office and family rooms for viewing recipes, searching information, checking weather (both locally and for where I am traveling that week), listening to local radio stations and connecting them all so I stream content throughout my house. I use a Spot in smaller bedrooms for basic functionality and chose this new Echo to replace the Spot because I wanted a bigger screen. Have not regretted any of them; decision should be made on how going to use.

I have the original Show, which is just OK. I got this because it got some good reviews, and was real cheap; after trading in a Dot. I did not realize how small the screen is. My phone is bigger. A screen the size of a phone works great at arms length, but not helpful from longer distances. The sound quality is poor, but its listening is good, and I like the camera lever. For the discounted price, glad I got it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dissapointed in the Sound Quality and Voice Recognition
reviews.reviewText:
Overall, it's ok - but I find there's more that I wish it could do, or do better. I'm thankful I got it on sale.

1) The sound is no where near the regular Alexa or Alexa Plus units. I miss that....ALOT.
2) The screen size is small. Smaller than I realized. My Smartphone is bigger than the screen. If buying for cooking and recipes --- it's just too small. Should have bought the bigger model:(
3) The voice recognition isn't the best....it struggles alot. I have to repeat myself often.

I guess I'm glad I bought it, but I'm really pleased that I didn't pay full price. Hoping all the above can be worked on for future generations/builds.

Bought this Show 5 to replace a big clunky alarm clock. Thought I could use it to replace the dot in my bedroom too which I use to turn the light on and off. Alarm function works great on the Show 5 and the sound is great. The only problem I have is it doesn’t wake up easily. I have to be right on top of it before it wakes up and even then sometimes it fails to turn on or off the light at first request. Amazon needs to install a wake sensitivity adjuster. This seems to be a reoccurring issue from what I read here. In conclusion, I have the dot sitting on my other night stand just to turn off the light. Glad I got the Show 5 on sale.

We got the Echo Show 5 to replace our Echo and after about 2 weeks, the jury is still out as to whether or not we made a good choice. The sound quality of the Show 5 is actually not as good (in our opinion) as the Echo, and the ads are a nuisance, but after a while you learn to ignore them. That aside, the biggest issues are that the Show tends to be very sensitive to location when it comes to internet connectivity. We have it in the same location as we had the Echo and it seems to lose connectivity much more often regardless of whether we are connecting via 2.4 Ghz or 5 Ghz. This manifests itself via a significant drop in the quality of the audio while playing music. Disappointing! Also disappointing is the integration with SiriusXM via the Alexa SiriusXM skill. At first, we could request all / any of the streaming channels, but now....for whatever reason...we are often told by Alexa "sorry, I can't find that channel". This is despite the fact that the channel we are requesting most definitely exists and is available via the SiriusXM streaming app.

So, we will see whether we keep the Echo Show or return it and purchase another Echo. To be continued.....

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent solution with a screen at a good sale price.
reviews.reviewText: This sounds better than a dot but not as good as the larger units. I purchased during Amazon days because I wanted to see who was at the door with my ring. The ring skill works ok with this but I have not figured out how to automatically show who's there when the doorbell is used. It will show it if I ask it to show the front door. I like that you can slide a cover over the camera to disable in SW and via HW. I will likely purchase another one for family during black Friday at discount prices as the Amazon day deal was decent. This is much better than the circular versions that were previously available for more than twice the price. Integrates well with my smarthome items and my TV.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is no way to mount upside down.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this device from Best Buy to use in the kitchen for recipes and music. The device itself works fine, as you would expect from an echo device. The touchscreen works fine. However the magnetic stand has no screw holes to use as mount points, and unlike every other touch screen device in existence, including Amazon's own Fire tablets, there is no way to invert the display for mounting under a cabinet while leaving the buttons exposed. You would think that even if the device lacked an accelerometer to save money, there would be some option in the software to flip the screen. Alas, no, and I'm finding myself having to return the device for a refund and go with a google product that will flip the screen. If inverting the device is a critical feature for you, as it was for me, consider yourself warned.

I love the Echo Show 5 way more than the Google home I have. There were a lot of complaints about ads, but I haven't had an issue with any ads. In fact I don't even think I've seen a single ad yet. The call quality of it is fantastic and it recognizes my voice better than my kids do, but I guess that's not saying much. I've used the sleep sounds the last couple night and they're perfect. It really is an all in one functional piece that I've used everyday so far which is far more than I can say about the Google Home that I've had for over a year. Oh and the sound quality is amazing for the size of Echo.

I had the puck version for a couple years and these screen Alexas provide a different experience because they're constantly showing you different things. I like that they display the lyrics when they're playing music too. I picked up two because of the Prime day deal, one for the kitchen and one for the bedroom, replacing my clock. We liked them so much, we bought three more and gave them to our kids who put them in their kitchen too. Now we make video calls because sometimes it's more convenient than using facetime. And inside the home, it's a decent intercom, although you have to ask to "drop in" because Alexa doesn't know what an intercom is.... :-/

reviews.reviewTitle: Good device, needs OLED for bedroom use
reviews.reviewText: While this is a good device and generally works as advertised, if you are wanting it in a bedroom on your night stand as an alarm clock there needs to be an option with an OLED instead of a backlit LDC screen. I like that it can dim way down at night and does so automatically when set to do so, but there is still a significant amount of glow from the screens back light, and when the screen is that dim it makes reading the time in the dark a challenge. I think an OLED would give you inky black blacks and only light the numbers on the screen when you're wanting to sleep, which would be ideal for bedroom usage. Will I keep it in my bedroom as an alarm clock? Yes, I most likely will. Will I wish its screen was better every day? Yes, I will. Hopefully the next gen can get it a little better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Device is ok, but Alexa is beginning to lack
reviews.reviewText:
The Device is ok - like the fact it shows the weather and can show Amazon Prime videos. But lately Alexa, in general, lack capabilities that is had before. Example: I would say 'Alexa, what is the score of the NY Yankees game?...' Alexa would tell me the Score. NOW - Alexa would say ' Tune-In live is your home for MLB....' Seriously?

Alexa has also been losing the ability to understand my voice on other stuff, even if I speak slowly and right to it. Amazon better a grip on this. It's frustrating to tell Alexa to 'turn off Hallway lights' and Alexa responds with ' Sorry, cannot find device All-light' very frustrating.

And I'm sure I'm not the only one.

I bought the Echo Show 5 for my mother who is not at all tech savvy. She struggles with most technology. We have never had any Alexa devices prior to this so I can't really compare it to anything, other that Siri on our phones. Alexa understands WAY better than voice commands on our phones. The screen is just a tad bit bigger than our iPhone Plus screens for comparison, and the screen picture is actually surprisingly pretty decent. I wasn't expecting the quality, honestly. She uses it to play music thru the day, and has alarms set to remind her to take her medication. She's getting more and more comfortable with voice commands so I have to say an A for usability.
So far, really my own complaint is that the screen picks up fingerprints pretty easily, and from what I saw in the box, there's not a cloth included to wipe the screen. It wasn't such a big deal for us because we have a few laying around the house, but for some that could be a pain. Second, the speaker isn't that BAD, but it sort of sounds like you're listening thru a tube or tunnel. I could definitely see why some people advised just to upgrade to the larger Show. My mom hasn't complained about sound quality, it's just something that I noticed.
Definitely a great product if you're just starting out with Alexa devices. We will probably buy the larger version to use as a smart home hub in our kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart Speaker. Smart Photo Frame. Smart Clock. Smart Choice!
reviews.reviewText: I won't go into detail about all the features of this product. (You can check those out in the product description above. ) Suffice it to say that after having the original Echo for over 3 years, this unit was a most welcomed addition. It's just the right size for the cubbyhole in my desk and does all the things you would expect....and more. If you're thinking of getting an Echo device consider this one. It does everything the regular Echo or Dot will do with the addition of a screen. Music is my main interest but I use many other features as well. The Echo Show 5 is a quality item with a value well above its low price point. Get one and you'll be a happy camper like me. Thanks for reading.

There are some reviews that are giving this ES5 a hard time. I really like it! I have multiple echo devices throughout my house, including the original echo show. The sound quality on the original echo show is amazing! Shockingly, the sound on the ES5 is just as good. The only reason I took away one star is because I don't like the design of the ES5. It has a awkward point at the back. I'd say you definitely need the adjustable stand. Other than that it's a perfect device. It responds well, has great sound, the screen is larger than my cell phone, and the picture quality and sound quality makes the $50 price tag that I paid, worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works just fine - Better sound quality than an Echo Dot.
reviews.reviewText:
It is cute, easy to setup - works just like my Echo Dot but has a nice color screen.
the time and whether display is nice to see. the screen blanks out when I turn off my Desk light to go to bed.
The constant "Alexa, tell me something..." messages are very annoying but not too difficult to ignore. They are mostly trying to get you to add skills to Alea - Most are really dumb. I was disappointed that Amazon has developed/designed many, many skins, covers and other enhancements for ALL of the other Alexa products - But NOT ONE for the Echo Show 5 (probably because it is going to be discontinued I am sure)!!

Some work still needs to be done on the software. It should be possible to modify existing reminders, appointment and so forth. It may be that I'm just not knowlegeable enough, but although I can modify my "To Do" list, I don't seem to be able to change reminders or appointments. I have to remove & replace them at present. I'll spend some more time with the APP and see if I can find instructions to accomplish such changes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like it more than I expected
reviews.reviewText: Got this because my old digital alarm with BIG numbers was on it's last leg, this looked about the same size. It's actually a bit smaller and the clock display is smaller but I love it. I had an Echo in the bedroom but this is awesome for watching videos in bed. Has too many great features to mention. My only complaint is, why didn't I get 2 or 3 while they were on Prime Days? Just for kicks, I video-chatted myself on my phone and, aside from a bit of lag, the quality was good. It's nice that it auto-dims according to the light level so it's not blaringly bright when it's time for sleep. I do plan on buying one or two more as well as the full size unit!

reviews.reviewTitle: Knew I wanted one and it was tough waiting for Prime day!
reviews.reviewText: I own an echo show 2nd gen and really love it. One thing that I really like is that I can view my WYZE security cameras from it. So when I saw the new Show 5 coming out it sounded like a great way to not only be able to view my cameras from the bedroom but replace my existing Echo Dot and alarm clock and Bluetooth speaker with one device. It worked great for replacing the Dot and alarm clock but had some issues with the Bluetooth speaker. When i would use another skill that used audio I would lose my Bluetooth connection and have to manually reconnect it. I went back to a seperate Bluetooth speaker. You know what they say "two out of 3 ain't bad." Like the large customizable clock screen and the fact that you can set it to rotate styles so you do not get any burn in images on the screen. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an Alexa device.

Show devices needs much more "video skills". A deal with youtube, netflix, crunchyroll and other streaming companies are NECESSARY! Do not ignore it. We know that the Amazon Prime video is cool, but there are life outside of it! Other way to see it, that maybe seeing what the people wants and use can help you to improve your own plataform. Other point, I want to be able to login into the youtube using the firefox or other browser and access my prefered contente even without a youtube skill. The same is valid to ip cameras and other devices that can use the alexa show!

I had been using a Echo Dot 2nd gen before, which was able to be heard clearly and understood me nearly every time.

This new device is the opposite - poor voice recognition and muddy Alexa voice that's hard to understand. I have to talk (nearly shout sometimes) like a robot to get it to understand me.

Bonus: the screen randomly fades out and back in at random times. This motion startles me if it's in my peripheral vision. It also will show me text about other things I could do with it, and you can't disable that.

I just want a bedside clock that doubles as a *functional* Alexa device. Is that so hard?

I bought this echo show for the ability to drop in on my aging mom. It works wonderfully with in my household (on the same account) the challenge is when others drop in from other accounts. I have 3 echo shows on my account for my household which includes my mom. BUT if her other children or grandchildren want to drop in from their accounts they have to dropin on my household (not a device) and that appears to be the first echo show it finds. Meaning an echo show outside the household can’t specify what device they want to dropin on in my household. So I had to limit the permission for outside dropin to only my mother’s device.

We are an Alexa family. We bought the first Alexa, then the Echo, then the Show and now this smaller version. The Echo Show full size (10.1") has excellent sound and picture. We wanted to fully integrate our home and bought this newest Echo 5 for that purpose. When I installed it I asked it to read "A Discovery of Witches" from my audible collection. The sound was so distorted that I had difficulty making out the dialog. I then tried, music, even worse. Photo quality also not as good as the Show. I unplugged the new device and re-installed the Show. The Echo Show is the best of all of the Alexa sound products.

We kept this device until it was about to get out of the return window, because we REALLY wanted to like it. We have a ring alarm system with multiple cameras and LOVED that you could ask it to see one of the cameras. That was our favorite part besides having an actual clock to look at. The voice recognition is poor, you would basically have to be standing right in front of it to get it to complete a command. Also, the speaker is very poor. We have multiple Echos and an echo dot. I can honestly say the speaker in this is the reason we ultimately decided to return it. At times when it was talking or when a song was playing, it sounded as though the speaker was blown but then the very next song, it was crystal clear. We love the speaker power of the Echo and this was just mediocre at best. It isnt even up to par with the dot. The camera is great and we had no problem with the screen size or clarity. The "try this" is kind of annoying, but we have multiple fire sticks so we are kind of immune to the "try this" messages. I do wish that you could keep the camera as the main screen and not have a picture of a meal with a note saying, "Try this - recipes for fried chicken." We are just going to move our echo back into the room we had this and wait for a sale on a larger echo show. This was a disappointment.

I have the Show and the Show 5, plus various other Alexa devices in my home and absolutely can't live with out my Show 5. I use it as my night stand alarm clock and music playing. It has amazing sound quality that outranks some of my other bluetooth speakers I own. Great price for the quality as well! Love the ability to link it to my Ring door bell and see my front door or drive way cameras right from my bed.

First thing first,The screen size is about the same as a Smartphone so dont expect to sit across the room and read or watch a video.Your buying this knowing the screen is smaller than an Echo show.I already have 2 First gen Echo show devices so i basically know what to expect.I did some intial tests and everything is good about this device.I like the sound the speakers are surprisingly good for the size of this.And a major plus is the tab to close the camera.I like having that option and i know it will appeal to alot of people.The price is very good for this device so if you see it at a discounted price like i did at $65 its an absolute no brainer.

It's a very nice compact unit the fitsvon my desk without blocking my computer monitor. The sound is as good as echo dot gen 3. The one thing that's annoying is the constant cycling of info and ask Alexa this and try that ads that it runs. Should be an option to turn that off. It does not do that at night though so if in a bedroom you can sleep.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works fine - when you can get it to wake up.
reviews.reviewText: Was very excited to try out this new Echo Show 5. Setup was as easy as all Alexa-type devices are. Problem is that the device rarely wakes up on the first attempt. Have tried changing the 'wake-up' word, relocating, and even bought the stand to try. Same issue every time. This is less than 3 feet away from me when I am in bed. The first time I say "Echo", approximately 80% of the time I get nothing, it usually responds on the second attempt, but occasionally I have to try a 3rd time. At that point I am usually irritated and am louder, and I am not soft spoken to begin with, lol! I have multiple devices in my home, including an Echo Show 1st edition downstairs and they all work fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well worth every cent and more!
reviews.reviewText: I love this! It was so simple to set up! The picture is beautiful and the sound is amazing for what it is! I can customize it and make it all me! I have my family pictures scrolling by on my home screen along with the time date and weather and they were right about the little try this stuff you can turn it off! Now it just scrolls through one time and it that's it! It's gone. I love this sooo much can't wait to get the big one next! And I paired it to my Bluetooth Bose speaker with just one tap. I wanna get my mom one. She can put it in her kitchen and look at recipes. Christmas! Ohhhhh this is super cool!

This is a great device especially for the elderly (wish this was available before my mom passed). It's easy to set up with an Amazon account (will need help to set it up for those who are technically challenged). Bought my wife and my mother-in-law (who like smart devices but doesn't know how to operate them). She now "tells" Alexa to call her daughter and they get to see each other everyday (we live about 200 miles apart). I would like to get one for all members of the family. A voice is nice, seeing them is priceless. Regardless of where your parents, children, siblings live this will bring you closer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Camera, ok speaker, middle of the line microphone
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the show 5 to go in my home office so I could ask Alexa to show me the various cameras around my home, especially the ring doorbell pro I have at the front door. I like to know who's there before I answer, because that dictates if I even bother to answer (I work from home). As a camera it's quick, responsive and clear. As a speaker (I listen to music while I work) it's ok. The bass on some songs gets distorted and the sound made by the letter "S" recently began sounding like crap to the point where I have to unplug the unit and do a restart. Annoying, but it's only happened 3 times so far. The microphone is not quite awful but it's not good either. I sit 3 feet from the unit and it can't hear me using regular room voice level. When there are two other people in the office talking, I have to shout to get her to hear me. I prefer the microphone and speaker capabilities of the Echo Dot 3rd gen, but I needed the video to show me cams. I already own the spot but the rectangular screen on the show 5 is superior to the spot. I own 8 dots, 1 spot and 1 show 5. I will buy dots everywhere I need Alexa, unless I need her for a screen, and that's where I'll get a show 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good idea but with one critical flaw if you like video chatting...
reviews.reviewText:
We use Echo Shows for work to do basic video conferencing, and when the Echo Show 5 was announced we decided to buy a couple, as the larger Show model is too large for some of the employee desks/homes for this use. Got it earlier today with stand. Nice enough design (basically looks like a cell phone laying on it's side). Stand pops on bottom via a magnet. There were immediate setup problems which I'll describe below, but the biggest "flaw" as I'll call it, is the placement of the camera and how it displays the user on the other end...

With the Echo Spot (the small round model) and larger 10 inch Show, the web cams are above the screens, in the middle of the devices. Not so here. On the Echo 5, the web cam is on one side (right). The device is so small you don't really think this will make any kind of difference, but it does. If you look at the sample image included - in the upper-right corner where I am, even though I'm sitting directly in front of the Show in the middle, I look like I'm on one side to the person on the other end. I'm not centered. If I want to be centered to them, I have to turn the Show at least 30 degrees to the left. Well, this centers ME, but then the whole device isn't "flat" when I'm looking at it - I'm looking at it at an odd angle. NOT ideal and as a coworker said, "it looks very awkward". So if your goal in buying this is for video chatting, be very aware you're going to not be centered on the other end. Not sure why they didn't place the cam in the center above the screen on this one as they did the other models (??).

In terms of using it for a clock, watching casual videos (no youtube app though), and all of the other Alexa tasks OTHER than the video chatting or anything that doesn't involve the web cam, it's fine. Of note though... during the installation, it hung up on installing updates. Once it got to a "Loading" screen, it just froze except for moving dots. More than 45 minutes later (on fast wifi) it was still doing it. I called Amazon tech support and they were stumped and even after rebooting it still did it. They were about to send me a new one, but on my own, I decided to reboot it again, only this time to continuously swipe my finger down to try to bring up a non-responsive menu to switch wifi channels. This allowed me to go back to a "install updates" screen and on the 3rd try, it worked. Just be aware of this.

So, overall? Solid build. Decent but not stellar sound. Ok screen. Works as an Alexa device, but VERY poor implementation of the web cam makes for awkward video calls. If that again is one of your main reasons for getting one of these, I'd recommend either going with the larger 10 inch Show model, or the small Spot model.
Great display. A nice step up from the Spot!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product in a little body
reviews.reviewText: Very surprised! I bought 2 of these to replace the original echo’s we had. Wasn’t expecting anything super about them but I was surprised at how well they worked! I got a super deal on them during prime days so I definitely don’t regret it. I wouldn’t regret them even at full price. The sound quality is very good for their size, and I haven’t had an issue with it yet! The selling point was how dark the screen got when I go to sleep. It just shows a faint red clock and I can’t even tell it’s on unless I look directly at it. Works great too when dropping in on my daughter and being able to video chat with her.

This is the most logical next step for the Echo Show devices! This is small, but not too small, and has just enough volume to rival the bigger Echo devices!

The screen is the perfect size too! The echo spot is also good, but the round screen makes for an odd experience if one is watching a video or the news...

This Echo Show 5 is basically like a fat cell phone with a very responsive touch screen and access to millions of songs/movies!

My favorite part is how the new UI links up to your smart home devices for easy access!

Great job amazon! Now i want to see an amazon alexa robot that rolls around my house!
Sensitive microphones, good speaker, very good screen. Replaced echo spot

I have been wanting to replace my very large old fashion radio/clock and this Echo Show 5 is the perfect clock for my needs. The Echo Show 5 fits so much better on my night stand than my old clock. You can customize the clock and picture on the front of the device. I love being able to set my alarm and have Alexa tell me the weather after she wakes me up. Setting alarms is so easy and I also use it for my smart plug to shut off the bedroom light. The ads that show on the screen do not bother me, sometimes I see something interesting and I'll investigate it further. I love my Echo Show 5. Thanks Amazon!!

I'm a senior citizen , honestly I did not overly want this thing I'm alone, had an emergency room visit I'm fine, but had a talk with my son he told me about the echo and that it would help me it happen to be on sale so I got the thing that was going to spy on me.
It turns out I love this thing it reminds me to take my meds each day or pick up a friend if we have something planed finds all the music that I love music I could not find for years if I fall I can have it make a phone call for me it dose way way more I love it and like my son said to me dad do you really have any secrets the Chinese government wants

I didn't think I would like this thing, but it excels. It is so much better than the other Show my wife got last year (the larger model with a bigger screen, taller bezel). I use this for researching component compatibility for PC building and other items for coding/database shortcuts. It rocks. Alexa works. And the screen is easy to read while the speakers are more than loud enough for what I need. My wife can also drop in on me from her phone and we video chat. It even has a "find my phone" if I set it down since I use it less with the Show doing most of the heavy lifting now. I am happy with this product. Well done, Amazon. Well done.

I love my Show 5. It wasn’t as expensive as the other screened echo devices. Had an adequate sized screen. Makes a great bedside smart clock, good sound and connects to authorized security cameras quickly. In bed I can say a few words and monitor all my cams around the house. It’s way faster than pulling your phone out and loading an app. The sound is very good for such a small device. Resolution looks good. You aren’t going to be able to watch HULU or anything from this but that’s not what it’s for. I love the words to songs that scroll across the screen and tips and weather and other info that casually slides on and off the screen. Neat device!

I have always wanted an Alexa device with a screen and camera. I use the drop in feature to check up on my son in our living room. I have not told him that is why I use it. But it is nice having a camera in the home for security purposes too. the echo will also alert you if the fire alarm goes off or glass breaking. I haven’t tested that feature yet. I like asking Alexa to play random songs on demand. Something that can can improve is the camera. It doesn’t have fish lens. The camera can not be adjusted so you have to prop the echo a certain way to get a good shot into a room. You can only see as much as you would squinting your eyes (if that make sure sense). I also like the wake up alarm clock feature. All in all I like it. Would get another one

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, microphones could be better.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this on Prime Day for a discount intending for it to replace an Echo Dot and to provide an actual clock in my bedroom, and have been very pleased for the most part. It does everything I want it to do, meaning everything the Dot did and then some. A lot has been written about how it works, what it does well, etc and I agree with all of it, so I will just share my one complaint: The microphones sometimes have trouble picking up my voice while the device is on my nightstand, a problem I did not have with the Dot. Still, it's a more than capable device that I'm surprised I ever lived without.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like my original Echo better
reviews.reviewText:
First off, this looks pretty nice and feels sturdy! But, I miss my old 1st gen Echo. This one has only 2 microphones so sometimes (most of the time) I need to repeat my request a couple of ones to get it to hear me.

Plus the small speakers make it sound like it is sitting in a box. Sort of a muffled sound. I hook it by Bluetooth to a Bose speaker so that does not bother me too much.

The picture looks pretty decent on the screen and it has a large variety of screen savers.

All in all, I guess I like the unit, only I sort of miss my old Echo and wish they just made a screen for it instead.

I have an Alexa Spot, and it handled most of my needs before but it had thee major annoyances, i would often have to repeat myself, the camera was always on (unless "disabled" via app, or taped) and the screen was too small to actually show me anything other than clock and minimal items.

All those items were solved with this upgrade, i have a clearer larger picture, the voice recognition is better and i dont have to repeat myself as often, and the camera has a physical switch on it so i dont have to wonder if someone is watching through the device.

Would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Home screen not customizable, just rotates between different ads
reviews.reviewText:
I just need it to show me the time and the weather, but it keeps showing advertisements or “Ask Alexa how to make waffles!!”
I’ve had several Alexa devices in my home for some years now and my least favorite thing about a new device is all the “HAVE YOU TRIED THIS?? WHAT ABOUT THIS?? DO YOU KNOW HOW TO BREATHE???”
Yes, I know all those things, please stop acting like this is my first device ever like I don’t own a smartphone.
It keeps telling me there’s three things I need to try and know about the show, but we’ll never know what they are because when asked, Alexa doesn’t know.
I’m so sick of looking at the “try this waffles recipe” ad that I never want to eat them again.

reviews.reviewTitle: MUCH TOO sensitive to environmental sounds, IMHO
reviews.reviewText:
With a fan running in the room, the alarm I set will not go off - it will automatically snooze itself over and over, so that is really disappointing (again, IMHO). Perhaps once I turn off the fan for the season, that problem will go away... The timer works just fine, which is a bit of a help, but not quite the alarm I was hoping for... I may also try putting the Show 5 in a different spot... maybe.

I love the size, the screen, the touch-ability of it and its overall look (along with reasonable price point) -- except for the problematic alarm if there is some other sound or vibration in its "reach"...

I decided to try out the Echo Show 5 since it was a great deal during Prime Day, and I already had several other Echoes in the house. It has been a bit of a disappointment, especially in the most basic of features, Alexa's voice recognition. It is even worse than the limited functionality on the old Dots from a few years ago, and I keep finding myself either having to quite literally yell at it to respond, and then it seems to get a good 30% of the commands/requests wrong, or just using either the Alexa app on my phone or going to another room with a "real" Echo to get it to do what I need it to do, like turning off lights in another part of the house or switching songs on a playlist it is playing. The sound quality while playing music and audiobooks is great, but the fact that it can't hear commands over the sound it is itself generating seems like a disappointing design flaw.

I have a bunch of different Echos. Both Show sizes, Gen 2 & 3 Dots, Echo Plus gen 2, and Spot. Sound is better than the old dot but that's about it. It may need some tuning. What I did notice after using it for a few weeks is that it's response time is slower than the other devices. When I call on it, there is a noticeable delay until it starts to listen. My other devices are quicker. Maybe it's listening right away but it doesn't seem to. I'm wondering if they sacrificed hardware quality for price point.
The screen is better than the spot. The price is great for what you get. I would recommend it if you want an Echo with a screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Except for rotten voice recognition, an excellent piece of hardware
reviews.reviewText: Voice recognition on these things is still pretty dicey, I'd say about a 20% error rate overall including ghostly awakenings where it thinks it heard its name but was responding to a TV playing in the room. But the display is beautiful and you can use the Amazon Pictures screensaver. I particularly like that it solves a dilemma in my household. There is a non verbal member of my household who cannot use voice commands. The touch screen on this device may be swiped left to reveal pushbuttons for all remote control devices. Now he may control the lights and TV (with Firecube) by touch while I summon them by voice. Perfect.

I have the Amazon Show as well. I wanted something for my nightstand. I want back and forth between an alexa or spot. Then this thing popped up on Prime Day and I thought, why not? Super glad I did. I love this. perfect for a clock and my morning / evening routines. When I go to bed, it knows my schedule and sets my alarm appropriately it also plays a mediation for me and my white noise oh! and it shuts off all my lights!My alarm goes off in the am (I have mine set to pop music in the morning to get me going and I get a weather report) then when I am ready to leave, tells me traffic and my agenda for the day. LOVE!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love Echo Show, integrates pretty well with Ring and Video call
reviews.reviewText:
My wife and I love our new echo show and here are the reasons why

1. We got this for almost ~$65 instead of $90
2. Integrates with Ring and can show the activity on the door
3. Has awesome integration with the baby cam. Grandparents can now see the baby.
4. On top of that, you can browse through the Alexa settings/features extremely easy.

Love Amazon for creating Echo variants

For those who are saying you can stop the ads 100% , I don’t know how you are achieving that . Sure you can stop take from continually doing it but at least once an hour mine goes through the “ Alexa how to ads “ tell her to stop your alarm and up they come . It’s rather annoying .
I have it set up for my alarm to go off on weekday at the exact same time and at first it was working , today thought Alarm was set and I kept watching the time tick by and the alarm didn’t go off . I checked the settings and it was set correctly . Yesterday I asked her to snooze for 10 minutes and I got a “ I am having trouble right now “ from it . This device definitely has issues . I am highly thinking of returning it as I am not going to spend. $90 for a device that won’t even have the alarm go off correctly .

The Echo Show 5 is great for the kitchen!!! It is likely great for any room but for now we just have one in the kitchen and Dots in all the other rooms. It is very convenient to be able to see how much time is left on timers. Amazon's somewhat recent integration with Youtube makes this product even more useful. Video calling between this device and the Alexa App on our mobile phones is a neat feature as well and has us considering replacing some of our Dots with more of these for this function.
The speaker on it is decent enough to provide an acceptable sound for listening to music in a small room.

I now have an Echo speaker, Echo Ear Buds, and this product. I may have items that overlap in their use and features but I love all three as well as my Amazon Fire Stick and several FireHD Tablets. Back to the Echo Show. The voice recognition has been improved across all products. The speakers on this Show are great. I'm using this as a bedside companion. I like have the time/temp handy as well as listening to classical music or guided meditation to help me sleep. It's a small screen but still the quality is great. For the price ($59.99) it's a great addition to my Amazon family of products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok but not great at anything
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for an alarm clock, baby monitor screen and music player. They really gotta get rid of the the “try this” suggestions. This negates the clock as it shrinks the size of the clock to an unlegible size at the top of the screen. Sound is pretty bad if you want something to fill the room. Works good as a screen for my baby monitor with a cloud cam. Wish there were more third party apps for controlling smart home. Philips hue you are only able to dim lights and cannot change color. Debating on whether i should return it. Only paid $50 for it but definitely not worth $99. Cant imagine anyone watching videos on it as the screen is smaller and worse quality than most phones nowadays

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but not perfect; needs to leverage the touch screen with more touch gesture functionality
reviews.reviewText:
This is a neat little device, does everything you expect from Alexa in a very conveniently sized form factor and I think the display is very useful. I think it needs to leverage the touch screen more, it would make it more useful. Here are a few reason I give it 4 stars and not 5...

Alarm issue: My intention with the echo show 5 is to use it as a bedside alarm and for that it is good but not perfect. The biggest issue is that even though you can use an on-screen touch gesture to dismiss or snooze the alarm while it is ringing, there is no touch gesture to dismiss the alarm in between snooze intervals. Touch gestures are useful in this case so you can dismiss the alarm without having a conversation with Alexa and really annoying the heck out of your spouse or partner if they usually wake up later than you. For example, I have an alarm set for every weekday at 5:45am, I snooze with a touch gesture so it will stop ringing and ring again in 9 minutes at 5:54. At 5:50 I decide to get out of bed and get in the shower, but now I have use voice and have a conversation with Alexa so it won’t ring while I’m in the shower and while my wife is trying to sleep. Seems like this was an oversight that can be fixed with a software update, I hope they do. For now I turn on whisper mode so Alexa answers in a whisper if I whisper, this is a little glitchy however and sometimes I get a full voice Alexa for part of the exchange, not the whisper. Again, probably fixable with a software update.

Needs presets: I would recommend Amazon add the option for virtual preset buttons on the home screen so you can get to certain actions with one touch, like to tune into a certain station (physical buttons would have been nice for this). Voice control is quite awesome but sometimes it’s just not appropriate and touch controls make more sense.

Home screen: I have yet to figure out how to remove the “Try xxxx with Alexa” prompts on the home screen rotation. It’s silly and annoying please allow for a way to turn this off in the next update

Sound quality: fine for talk, for music it’s better than you would expect for it’s size but don’t expect miracles!

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool echo device, doesn't do what I thought it would
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: This device will now connect with the rest of my devices when playing music in a group, and displays the words. I've updated my rating from 2 start to 4, waiting to see my front doorbell camera to give the last star.

Original Review: I got this wanting to view my front door camera (via Alarm.com), but I am unable to. I also cannot connect this device into music groups with other echo devices, which was disappointing. I hope some upgrades come out soon to make this device more versitle.

It is a cool clock, the touch screen is nice, I like that it shows lyrics to amazon music, and the visual briefing is nice.

Perfect bedside clock. I use it for news weather sports video (yes video plays well) and sleep sounds. When opening sleep sounds just ask Alexa to exit and her screen will go back to clock. This replaced an echo. The sound is rich for such a small item. I preordered at full price. On Prime Day it was $50. I called customer service asking for the difference in price so I didn’t have to send her back just to reorder. They honored my request. ☺️ At times she doesn’t listen very well and I have to ask again. And again. That will probably get better with time I’m hoping. All in all I’m extremely happy with this Echo5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bit disappointing for an Echo Device - Sound Quality Issues
reviews.reviewText: Mostly the sound quality. Noticed the only way to get it to NOT sound muffled, was to lift it up off the counter. So I purchase the pricey $20.00 plastic stand. It didn't help. :/ Neither did adjusting the EQ. :( ALSO, when are these shows going to let me watch CNN??? If I only wished to listen to it I would have purchased a radio, with a better speaker ;) All other Alexa devices sound great. Update: Even it hearing me request anything is a chore... I almost have to repeat asking it anything, before it finally recognizes my voice. Worse release so far.. all my other Alexa products work great .. this one's a lemon!!!! :/

reviews.reviewTitle: I was going to put this in the guest room but I liked it so much I kept it
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this on Prime day for the heck of it. I was just going to play around with it, then let it live in the guest room.
However, the Echo Show 5 has made it very convenient having it in my bedroom. I can enter the dark room and tell alexa to turn on the lights before I take a step in the room and turn off the light in the room I am leaving. I didn't think I wanted to put an echo in my bedroom, but having the ability to close the camera and turn off the microphones was a big influence in deciding to keep it in my room. I can even tell alexa to wake me up after I take a power nap.

reviews.reviewTitle: Music sounds like a Nokia in a tin can!
reviews.reviewText: The device works great for home automation, simple questions, time, weather, you name it... but ask it to play music and be extremely dissatisfied! If we could go back in time I would compare it to dino turds, in other words it's a huge pile of... you get it. Everything else is great, but I feel like they're really trying to get the audio right to be used as a portable speaker that is always there. That's why I gave it only 3 stars, because it fails horribly. The best highs and nearly no lows on an echo device can be heard using the first generation Echo speaker, it's the best sounding Echo I have experienced.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did they reduce the number of microphones ???
reviews.reviewText: i like this device but unfortunately since it doesn't have the full microphone array found on an Echo Dot, it's not as responsive if you're giving commands from across the room. It's ok if you're close to it but being used to the responsiveness of the Echo Dot, this felt like a letdown. The screen looks good. It gets loud too but tends to distort at the max level. you will have to live with all the Amazon ads on it too. They did make accessing your routines easy which is a plus. I'm hoping they'll put all the microphones back in gen 2. The Echo dots in the adjacent bedrooms pick up my commands faster that the Echo Show 5.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great upgrade from Echo Dot- installation much better
reviews.reviewText:
I ended up getting this on prime day minus trade in for around $25. Its a very good smart clock radio- in a bedroom the speaker volume is decent and it is okay for listening to late night music , but of cours e wont replace my Sonos pair.
Also the clock dims at night and lightens in the morning.
Much easier to hook up than the dot- just type in password for network and login to amazon account.

I had been wanting an echo spot for a long time (but couldn't convince myself it was worth the price - really just wanting a reminder system because I tend to forget a lot of things). When the Echo Show 5 popped up as a Prime Day deal and at a really really nice price, I grabbed it! It has been a heaven sent! I can set reminders for everyday (like administering medication) or to remind myself to check on something in two hours. The notifications are not an issue - hopped online and turned all that stuff off and tinkered with some other settings because I am too lazy to swipe the screen and set everything on the device itself. I also love it has a camera cover so I know without a doubt no one is spying on my kids, etc. The microphone can be turned off, but Alexa will still notify you of a reminder which is also great in terms of functionality. I did link it with the firetv, but not to any doorbells, security cameras, or thermostat controls. I haven't actually used it with a firetv because I can just pick up the tv remote (I am lazy, but not THAT lazy!). I don't know if I would have purchased it without the Prime Day deal, but with two boys on completely different schedules for almost everything, it has been worth it 100% just for the reminder feature alone (something that wasn't available on my firetv's). Thank you Alexa!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little device, awesome price, crippling audio bug
reviews.reviewText:
For those who want to add a few screens around the house in place of their dots, this is a cheap way to do it. Sure, it's not big enough to really enjoy video, but for occasional news, photo slide shows, home automation, etc, it's pretty darn cool for the price.

The only big problem is that there's an audio bug that has affected every echo show 5 that I have, and some that my friends have: Sometimes the audio gets a distorted treble problem and it won't go away until you stop the music / talking for a while or if you restart the device. I've reported my symptoms to Amazon Support, so hopefully they will resolve this. I will update my rating if they fix this.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this as a smart alarm clock
reviews.reviewText:
I'm not one for putting Alexa through her paces; I pretty much only ask for simple things:
"Alexa, set a weekday alarm for 5:30am."
"Alexa, flash briefing."
"Alexa, turn on/off the lamp."
"Alexa, turn on/off the fan."
"Alexa, tune to KUHF."
"Alexa, tune into Kim Waters radio."
"Alexa, remind me to feed the dogs."

She does those things just fine. I've also asked her for ambient noise, Westwood One radio, and for gregorian chants; she responds well.

My only beef is with the speaker. At first it was really good--very nice, deep bass response. But over time, it has taken to hissing on the sibilant sounds; the treble speaker seems to be failing. This is disappointing; as of right now (9/25/19) I am considering a return. I will update this when appropriate.

EDIT (9/27/19): Called Amazon tech support; a very nice young woman helped me fix the problem, ie reboot the device and reset the audio equalizers. It's all good again.

Horrible ad platform. Does not fulfill the need for an ‘alarm clock’ that can also allow me to use voice commands and access camera feeds as it just displays rotating ads CONSTANTLY. I’ve turned voice off, covered the camera, and now it’s mostly a paperweight.

Moving away from all Alexa products, can’t stand Amazon’s approach and disregard for user preferences and privacy.

Echo Show has a small footprint on my counter. Among other uses, I "drop in" and check on my dogs, but in order to do that I have to put something under it to tilt it forward so it faces downward even on the optional stand. And I love it when my daughter, in California, suddenly appears on the display where she drops in on me. The other improvement I would make would be to put the power cord in a spot where it would be recessed or make the connection a right angle. As it is, it has to stick out on my counter to accommodate the space needed for the cord, which comes straight out from the widest part on the back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, sound quality could be better
reviews.reviewText: I was a little concerned with some of the reviews, but am impressed overall with the Echo show 5. The sound isn’t as crisp or clear as the other echo devices that I have. The viewscreen is high quality, and the night mode allows you to use it as an alarm clock with ease. It works seamlessly with my ring doorbell. As others have stated, the issue with ad display is resolved easily in the configuration of the device, although it is at least three screens deep to get to it. I’m pleased with my purchase, and keep one in the bedroom as an alarm clock and the other in the kitchen for recipes and my morning podcasts. I only can wish for better sound, the device sounds muffled no matter the volume
I really enjoy this device. its my first one and I'm very impressed with all the features.

Full disclosure I am writing this as I am frustrated but even outside of that I have been amazed on how much more my echo dot second generation understand more of what I am saying and from further away. I can yell upstairs to my dot and it picks it up. The echo show I can yell at it the same simple command 10 times in a row and she will ignore it, open on a different device etc. I ask it to open you version 20 times in a row and she can't get it. Just very disappointing and frustrated and my kids seeing me getting frustrated at her is not great either (stay calm enough with them around, but still.)

We replaced a regular Echo device with this small Show in the kitchen and have been very happy. We are learning, as we acquire more and more of the things, where a Show is the right choice, where the Echo fits well and where an Echo Dot is all we need. What I like about this small Show is that it fits on a little shelf you can screw on as an attachment to an electrical outlet, which took this little guy from taking up minimal counter space to none. Very happy we made this purchase.

PROS: I like the voice recognition. It always understands me. I like the ability to pull up my Wyze cameras by saying "Show me the front door," or "Show me the kitchen." I like being able to ask for a certain song and having it start playing or ask for a certain type of song "Play something from the baroque era." I learned how to turn off the suggestions/ads. I love being able to "drop in" when I'm away from home.
CONS: I'd like to be able to enlarge the font for the clock at night. it's a little too small for me to see without my glasses. I'd like to be able to watch YouTube videos but I get it, Amazon vs. Google.

I like the small size for a unit beside the bed. It takes the place of the phone, clock, and "something" else. The only down side for me is I would like the camera to be of better quality. I only have a few people who also have shows. It is really nice to talk to them and see them at the same time.
Overall, I am liking the unit a lot. It does everything the sound units do with the addition of video.

What a great little device. Use it as an alarm clock on night stand, easy too read in the dark and during daytime, its a little computer with a 5.5" screen too watch movies or play music videos or just listen to music, just ask Alexa to play it for you even news and weather reports. Its like the Amazon Fire Tablet only smaller, like your cell phone. Great sound with the built in bluetooth and external speakers, the little speaker that's in it sounds good to. Take the plunge or get the bigger one you won't be sorry. Take it from a 70 year old man. Amazon you did it again, great product.

Purchased this on Prime Day because I was looking for a new bedside clock for my nightstand. Although Amazon has a specific Alexa device intended for such a use, I found that the Echo Show 5 works well as a bedside clock. The sound quality is nice and it works well as a speaker for playing music in my bedroom. I also like the ability to see popular news stories throughout the day. The included camera is a neat feature although I have not used it yet and it can be covered if you have privacy concerns. The material covering the touchscreen is a little thin as indicated by the fact that you can see pressure spots on the touchscreen if you press somewhat forcefully. However, this is par for the course for such a low-priced device. Overall, a great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect night stand smart speaker/alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 5 is a great smart speaker between Echo Show and Echo Spot. The screen size is perfect for night stand. I was surprised by how good the speaker sounds on the Echo Show 5. I also love the ability to block the camera for privacy.

It’s great I love this. It reminds me of my old bedside radio just does wayyyy more. The screen is about the size of my iPhone 6. I like it for turning on my bedroom lights. It also has a feature where it rotates picture in albums you created.

If you are a person like me who is pretty content with your echo dot but want to have a little bit more this is the item for you. The next middle up is about 200$ so it’s pretty expensive.

Couple of downsides it has no battery so it has to be plugged in at all times. There is advertising on the screen (I read somewhere we can remove this).

I haven't had my show 5 long but I think I'm going to love it. It was ridiculously easy to set up. I plugged it in and it did its thing. I have other Echo devices which probably made that easy. The only thing I had to do was find and turn off the dreaded rotating things to try annoyance. Amazon should make the default off for that. A great thing is the auto-dimming. I'm using it bedside and it dims the display to match the light levels in the room. Now if Amazon could activate whisper mode I'd be really happy. That way I wouldn't disturb others sleeping when I have to speak to Alexa.

The product is honestly quite annoying. The home screen consistently displays advertisements for Amazon ventures. While I personally have my entire house wired with smart products, this may be my least favorite. I do not find its utility to outweigh the advertisements. Additionally, it is a bit hard to control sometimes. If it is reading an audio book for example, it is very hard to pause the product. I have had to unplug it and turn it back on multiple times to get it to exit out of audio books. For those looking to round out their smart house, you can definitely save $ and skip this.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is amazing Edited Review After Use
reviews.reviewText:
I already had 3 Echo Dot's - I bought this Echo Show 5 on Prime Day. It arrived 2 days later, it was super easy to set up and I really love it. Compact size, great screen color and sound is quite good. So far so good, I'm really glad I bought it.

Editing my review after using it for several days now. There is No way to turn off the scrolling messages at the bottom. Like ask Alexa this or that etc. or try this etc. That is very annoy and distracting. I have this just 2 feet away from where I sit. Every time it scrolls a message it distracts me from what I'm doing. Why does Amazon force these kind of things on us? I have turned off every notification option there is, but you can't turn this off. Very disappointed The only thing that seems to stop it is to turn off the microphones and mute it. Now it's just an expensive clock for me. If they fixed this one problem I could go back to giving it 5 stars again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice upgrade from the original Echo
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this as part of an Amazon Prime deal to replace my old Echo and so far I am happy with this! I love that I can customize the background image with a photo of my own.

I also really like that it shows helpful suggestions on the screen of things you can ask Alexa, it helps me learn some of her tricks. The constant weather display and sports updates along with stock tickers is great as well to keep me up to date on things I care about.

I have not tried the video calling yet. Also, the sound quality is decent for listening in the room but don't expect to fill you whole house with sound.
Will not keep clock face on screen. Replaces clock with try stuff suggestions.

A couple of weeks ago I purchased 8 Amazon Echo Show 5 devices from QVC, Today Special, as Christmas gifts. Two weeks later I went to visit one of my daughter's in FL and decided to give her the gift and setup before I left. Last week my 1-year old granddaughter began seizing. My daughter asked her 10-year-old to find the phone and he couldn’t. Miraculously my daughter said “Alexa call 911”. Alexa placed the call to 911 EMS and my granddaughter made it to the hospital. I am a bit of a geek for gadgets; my kids not so much. My daughter later shared with me she is grateful for her geek Mom.

Absolutely fatal flaw: The clock is constantly being shrunk to the top left corner (where it's too small to see) to display an advertisement like, "Try saying, Echo, Why did I waste my money on you?"

And yes, I've turned off all home page content. It still makes recommendations that I have ZERO interest in.

Selling all of my Amazon devices and moving to Google.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great value for all the capabilities a 5 " screen and great sound
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a Prime Day treat, even got a gift card against the cost from the Amazon trade in of my 1 year old Echo Spot. It's a small footprint on my counter top, has WAY more features than I will even use it for, has a privacy blocker for the microphone and camera, and it sounds great! I highly recommend buying the stand also. It elevates it from a spill, and improves the overall sound. I've had no problems with it at all. I just wish Amazon would allow YouTube videos on these devices (it is on the Fire stick now though, which I have also). I recommend this device! THE PIC IS BLURRY BECAUSE OF MY CAMERA PHONE, the device display screen is perfectly crisp.

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice upgrade over the echo spot
reviews.reviewText: I had the echo spot before. i find this a nice improvement - it sounds better and because i can access video now via the firefix web browser there is more of a choice on what i can view. the set up was very very easy - even easier than setting up my fire tablet hd 8. while many may use it as a smart home hub or a smart clock i use it for news/music/entertainment and seeing news clips and video if i choose is a bonus.

reviews.reviewTitle: PRICE VARIES DRASTICALLY - AND NO PRICE PROTECTION FROM AMAZON FOR THEIR OWN PRODUCTS!!
reviews.reviewText: I do like this product - paid $89.99 less than 2 weeks ago. I went to reorder and the price has dropped $25!! I requested some price protection - just credit my Amazon gift card with $25 since this is so close to my original purchase date. Amazon informed me that "...prices are variable due to availability, demand, etc etc etc..". I would have to return original Echo Show to obtain the $89.99 refund and then repurchase at $64.99!! This is not really in Amazon's best interest and definitely not mine. Very frustrating. I will buy the second one though as I have created a marvelous "smart home" using these products with Alexa. I would give the product 5 stars if it were not for this poor policy on Amazon's own products.

I wanted a small clock that displayed the time, as well as, the day of the week and date. The size is perfect and I purchased the stand, which I recommend. The issue I consistently have is that the day of the week and date don’t update. I have to unplug the unit and plug it back in and then it’s correct. I had turned off continuous scrolling because I did not want to see other things such as ads and sports. I wanted to see the clock and date. I checked the settings, it’s connected to my Wi-Fi and I turned off everything under continuous scrolling. Except for this issue, it would be a decent unit.

I really do love my 1st Alexa ever had, love just sitting in my chair from a short distace, Named it Alexa instead of Echo, and tell Alexa to play something different, as that is what I bought it for.. Set up was easy, although I turned on voice view in accesibilty and I would suggest you keep that in off position as it was hard to get to all the setting with just being able to talk to it, no hands on, called customer service to get it back way was in beginning, thank you Amazon..Would recomend the Echo Show 5

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice size great for Ring users
reviews.reviewText: I love this, in fact loved it so much ordered another one for the kitchen. Very easy to hook up, it recognized all my Alexa settings. The only thing I had to reinstall was my Ring skill. I have this on one of my end tables, so now I can view my cameras while watching TV or see who's at the door. Size is perfect for me. Need to figure out how to download custom pics but like the different screens you can pick for your clock settings. The Ads (?) get a little annoying but since I'm not looking at it constantly, for the price, I will deal with them. Sorry Echo Dot and Alexa. You have just been replaced.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is my favorite in the Echo series (and I have most of them)
reviews.reviewText: This product replaces a digital alarm clock radio that was far too bright at night, difficult to use and had lousy sound. The Echo Show 5 is light years ahead of that old design. My favorite feature is when I turn off the lights at night. The Echo Show waits a second or two and then dims its display down half way. It waits another second or two and then dims the display all the way down so the time is just barely visible in the dark. Ah! Blessed darkness at night. If I need an alarm, I just ask Alexa to set it. In the morning Alexa turns the light back on and it gets brighter and brighter until the alarm goes off. If I am just waking up with no alarm, I will just ask Alexa the time without looking up from my pillow and this bright voice will tell me the time, give me the weather or a news brief or whatever I want and wish me a nice day. The other night, I had been watching the Ken Burns history of country music show and wanted to hear a certain song again. I asked Alexa to play Orange Blossom Special by Willie Nelson and she did it immediately. There are so many neat things this device can do - like turn the coffee maker on in the morning. The old digital clock is resting on a counter in the garage doomed to be recycled or donated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to the Alexa devices....
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this one (model 5 instead of the brand new model 8) because it was on sale at the time. This unit is a great addition to the Alexa family of devices and is a nice touch having a screen to display things that an audio Alexa device can't. The speaker has good volume and acoustics, the display is adjustable for brightness that allows for the perfect setting for your needs (along with automatic dimming in low light situations), is very responsive and intuitive, and has a great form factor. I highly recommend this to anyone that wants a step up from the audio-only echos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too much reliance on voice control
reviews.reviewText:
Voice control is nice, but would be nicer if it had a button to turn of alarm. Touch screen only puts into snooze and alarm goes off again in 9 minutes.

Haven't figured out how to turn off alarm other than with voice control. Have to wake up and whisper to turn off alarm without waking partner and it still goes on to ask several unnecessary questions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice to have a screen, but audio is an issue.
reviews.reviewText: The volume is muffled when Alexa responds to you. I’ve adjusted the bass all the way to 0, the mids to 0 and the treble all the way up but she still sounds like she’s in a box. I sometimes have to give commands 2-3 times. My dot seems to have better accuracy. UPDATE after having it for a few weeks, it seems it’s ability to hear the wake word (Alexa) and ability to comply with the request is less accurate than the echo dot I have.

reviews.reviewTitle: expensive alarm clock.. but its kinda cool
reviews.reviewText: I am no technophile/power user.. I've been slow to embrace new tech.. but i must say.. I like it, not at $89, but at $49 for prime days I went ahead and grabbed one.. using as a bedside alarm clock/audio book/podcast device.. basically what i used to use my smart phone for. . plus I can check the blink cams with it , im sure it does a lot more and ill find new features as I go.. so far so good.

I bought this to replace the Spot I was using as an alarm clock in my bedroom. The larger display is great improvement. It works great as an alarm clock since you can set up as many alarms as you want. It also functions as a smart assistant in the bedroom so when it's time to go to sleep all I have to do is say "Alexa, good night" and it turns off the lights, fan and any other smart devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hope you really like the Alexa Tips
reviews.reviewText: I really like the display and the ability to have a slideshow of my photos on my nightstand. The Show works wonderfully and while I haven’t played with every feature I’ve yet to be disappointed with what it can do. I will say you better really like seeing the “Try, Alexa…” tips because they are constantly being shown, even over my photo slideshow and music. After hooking the Show up I literally spent 20 minutes in the settings and online trying to turn this feature off like I can the Fire Stick. I think the tips are actually really helpful, but it’s a shame the feature can’t be turned off on one device but it can on another.

Got the Echo Show 5 on Amazon Day for an irresistible price. If you are looking for a video play device, you will probably be disappointment. Think of it as the ultimate alarm clock. These are the features I love about it:
- Always shows the time (yes, like an alarm click but not typical for most Echo devices)
- Automatically dims when the lights are out
- You can play music on it and it sounds very good for its size
- You can set alarms just by taking to it
- See results from Alexa

I had an Echo Dot in my bedroom, but this has replaced both the dot and my bedside alarm clock. Definitely glad I was enticed to purchase this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mostly good but disappointed with speaker quality
reviews.reviewText:
Has all of the features that I use with my other Echo devices in a smaller footprint. Like the amount of "dim" on the night display, makes a good bedside table clock. I like the hard "camera off" switch, although I am not sure it is 100% effective - but then if I was really worried about it, I wouldn't own the device in the first place.

Disappointed with the speaker quality though, particularly at low volume (since I use this device in the bedroom, I don't want "loud"). I know this is a smaller, less expensive package than my other Echo device, but the speaker quality is much lower.

reviews.reviewTitle: New additions to our Alexa equipped home!
reviews.reviewText: Another addition to our Alexa home. We have Alexa’s in all our rooms... and I will be honest one Google Home which we do not like at all. I love Alexa and these two new additions are in our bathrooms and are a perfect fit. What more can I say but we love them. Alexa is like The Duracell Bunny.. she keeps on going :) we control all our lights in the house etc... great new additions.

The main purpose I purchased the echo show as a camera monitor. I have Amcrest cameras set up throughout the house. We use one as a baby monitor in the kids room. Normally we have a fire tablet and it stays on that screen all night. 1st issue I had was the compatibility with the camera
and the echo show. I had to use the different Amcrest app so that it can work with the show. Which is the Amcrest cloud. I currently had the Amcrest pro app which works great with the tablet.
In order to use the Amcrest cloud for more than 1 camera I would have to pay $6 for each camera. Amcrest pro app is all free. 2nd issue is we like to have the screen on the camera all the time. With the echo show it goes back to the home screen maybe after 5 min or so. There is nothing in the settings to change this. So if one kids wakes up during the middle of the night we have ask the echo to show us the kids room and wait for the camera to connect . I should add it takes about 2-3 Min for the connection to go through if it goes through at all before we have to ask it again. We also have smart switches and light and those as well take forever to respond through the echo. WiFi connection throughout the house is great I get about 80-100 mbps. I have tested this numerous times. I am considering returning the product due to fact the tablet works better

I bought the Echo Show 5 to replace my clock radio on my nightstand. It works beautifully and can be programmed with the Alexa app on my phone. In addition to waking me up in the morning, it reads audiobooks and plays sleepy sounds at bedtime.
I have it programmed to tell me the day's weather and play 'Good Morning Starshine' after I wake up.
The shutter feature is nice. I can turn off the camera so I'm not being stared at.
The display dims when there is little or no light and brightens when lights are on.
I'm sure there lots of features I'm not using but for what I am using the ES5 performs great.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5 Star Item you will NOT Regret Buying trust me
reviews.reviewText:
This thing is awesome (Echo Show 5) at first I had the Harmon Kardon Cortana Smart speaker which now is out in my living room, a lot has changed since I first looked into these. Now the Cortana and Alexa works in partner which I absolutely love, I’ve had the kids echo in my kids room and got them all the Alexa appliances TV Lights LED lights Plug/outlets etc, had gotten the Cortana for use with my Gaming Station/Xbox etc but now the Echo show 5 connects to everything in my home including my Security System the Samsung Smart things ADT and Blink Xt2 cams which I can say Alexa show me living room and my Camera veiw pops right up. No hands cause have baby in arms trying to get her too sleep? Alexa play lullaby’s and wallah baby’s asleep, Alexa turn down Bedroom TV Volume 👌 like I absolutely Love this thing. Am planning on getting another for the kitchen and the bigger screen one for my room so can give this one to the kiddos etc.
Definitely HIGHLY RECOMMEND this product especially at $59.99, I was able to get the Monthly pay plan which still can’t figure out why I’m the only one that gets the pay per month plans? If anyone knows please let me know cause it’s not just from Prime membership etc but my mother and sister and everyone else does not get pay plan but I love the features it’s helping me max out my Christmas shopping right now, Single Father life 30 years old raising 3 Daughters on my own so all the help I can get from Pay plans to Smart home tech is super helpful, thanks again Amazon you guys never seem to let me down...

The product does not come with a manual, there is no downloadable manual, there is no support phone number. There was an email address which I wrote to but never received a reply. Alexa is so inferior to and Siri application. Don’t waste your money!

reviews.reviewTitle: Still Trying To Get Used to Features
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for the kitchen area. It works great but there are a lot of features I have not tried (or can't figure out). One of the things I'd love to use is sending a video chat to this unit when I'm out of the house. Can't figure out how to do this. Love the recipe features it offers as well as news, time/date, announcements and ability to change background to your own preferences. As mentioned, there are A LOT of attributes that I still have not tried; however, the things I have tried are so very cool. Am loving it and still learning more to love about it.

I owned 2 of the gen 1 Shows and they both failed in the first week. I swore off them until Amazon made a killer offer on these Show 5's during Prime day. I am extremely pleased having this unit on my nightstand. It replaces a digital clock, an Echo Dot, a Bluetooth speaker and an extension cord. All in one tiny unit. I personally keep the camera covered at all times but love having the display and useful information it provided such as weekly weather on screen and music lyrics. The sound and picture are beautiful. When I walk into my room and look at how clean and modern this looks it makes me happy.

The Echo Show was to replace a big bulky alarm clock on my bedside table to free up space. However, the screen stays too bright all night (even with it fully dimmed) and I have to turn it face down. It doesn’t seem to hear me when I tell it multiple times to stop the alarm until I actually yell at it (less than a foot from my head). It has trouble understanding my questions the majority of the time, yet the regular Alexa understands me just fine. The sound quality is no where near what my regular Alexa provides. This was really, really disappointing. I would never had made this purchase had I known then what I know now and I’m stuck with 2 of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: To be or Not to be...
reviews.reviewText:
First the Con: I have yet to be able to connect my living room lights to Echo Show 5. Three different suppliers ALL saying connections are easy; while ALL fail. Alexa has the same problem she always had since Echo Dot 1, misinterpreting my instructions, not recognizing what I want or where to go, frustration is an apt description of Alexa woes. No excuses when this isn't their first rodeo. Way beyond satisfied.
