Pro: There are pluses; so it isn't a total disaster. HD Display is excellent. Movie streaming is awesome. Calendar and weather are precise. The sound card is the best part of Echo Show 5.
Myke

I really like this new member of the Alexa family. I have the Spot, original Echo Show, and Dot (multiples of each). This seems to be the best combination of functionality for me. It's more compact than the original Show and displays video better than the round screen on the Spot. I keep mine next to the master bathroom sink and I have time, info, and smart home control readily available as I brush my teeth, comb my hair, etc. Especially in the morning, it's a great way to get updates. I can even receive and answer phone calls through it. I like it a lot.

Good little device, but the microphone in this sucks so much. I have to constantly repeat my instructions because it does not hear them correctly. If I'm close or loud then it works first time. If I'm far or there is other noise in the room it just does not work well. I have 2 first generation echoes and 3 dots in my house. The room where this is located used to have a 1st generation echo in it. I thought it would be a good replacement. It was not. Fist generation echo never misses a command. This one I have to repeat myself at least twice with each command.

reviews.reviewTitle: The most impressive alarm clock you have ever seen.
reviews.reviewText: Initially I purchased the Show 5 while it was on sale for about $65 as an upgrade to my echo Dot- I was not expecting it to be as good as it is. The speaker is punchy and loud, easily filling a large master bedroom with surprisingly vibrant sound. The voice recognition is spot on just as with my Dot, and the screen scrolls through the time, weather, and other helpful things. At night the screen dims and goes red to minimize sleep issues. This is in my opinion a clever and well thought out addition to the Echo family and with Amazon's payment plan, there is no excuse not to have one.

This is such a cool little item. Bought it on Prime day and it arrived next day. Easy to setup and its fun! The picture is nice and sound is great for the size. Will be going next to my bed. I might snag one more before Prime day ends.

This was mainly purchased so that I could answer doorbell from another room. It works great, in fact this brings up the doorbell much faster than my phone which is what I was using before. With my phone by the time the app brought up the doorbell, the person ringing was gone. With echo doorbell is almost brought up immediately.

However it does not want to play Hulu, but then I am still figuring everything out

Was disappointed that even with Prime two day shipping, it took a week to get it

The 4 star is because we are not yet knowledegable enough to use Echo 5 to its full poptential. The clock is nice and bright for me and dims for my wife when it is dark. I love being able to set the alarm by talking to Alexa. Since it is in the bedroom we may not use it too much with "WhatApp" with our kids. Will wait for the grand kids to come and show us what else it can do.

I put this in my kitchen right between my stove and sink. It’s pretty much perfect. I already have two Echo’s downstairs but this third one really gives me that full surround sound in the kitchen/living area. The screen is small but perfect for watching cooking videos and keeping track of your timers. I didn’t expect it to be this great but it really is. I’ve even watched the new season of “All or Nothing” while doing the dishes. Go Panthers!

I like the Compact Echo Show 5 far better than the bigger Echo Show. My bigger model was a 1st generation and it does not compare to my new compact one. I keep the compact by my bed and it gets me up in the morning even has a snooze on it plus and it will give me my todo list in the monring. I like the sound better and it just seems easier to operate

My bigger echo show's screen started jumping around soon after I received it. I sent it back and they said they fixed it but it is still jumping. Hope the little one holds up better. I would buy another compact one but not the big one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much more than an alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: Thank you, Amazon, for smooth installation...automatically connecting to my WiFi, updating software, many settings and recognizing devices. This device replaces my alarm clock plus offers so many features. Just asked for local movies...easy to read display, convenient with trailer video for “lion King” that exceeded expectations. Great clock with large numbers and weather. Music has great sound for its size. Looking forward to using Audible, calls and many other features offered.
Love that I can display pics, get my morning updates and an added per read lyrics to songs!

I love being able to see the screen! I was about to put a sticker over the camera as a safety feature, but Alexa actually has a built in camera cover that slides shut - a nice safety feature so no one can watch you without your consent. Setup with my previous Alexa devices was super easy with the app. Sound quality is nice. Seems rather accurate. I love the various clock designs and playing games through Alexa is a bit easier with a screen that displays the questions and such. Lots of neat features - I haven't made it through them all yet but really enjoying the upgrade from our Echo Dot.

I love this thing. I also have a Spot and this is so much better. I love the screen size and the fact that you can easily block the camera. The sound quality is good for this sort of device. I also like the information that shows on the display, such as information on on the song title and channel when I stream from SiriusXM, or video images from my security cameras. I want more of these!

reviews.reviewTitle: cool product but it doesn't work and the inconvenience of amazon tech support is unheard of
reviews.reviewText: Made the mistake of becoming a early adopter in their screen devices. clearly the speakers are cheap, it scratches when I play music on the device. amazon customer service has become so cumbersome to deal with as they've grown it's not even worth trying to return the product for warranty. it's a shame when you as a shopper spend $1000's on amazon every year.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality, but occasionally gets static
reviews.reviewText: I was impressed with the sound quality when playing music, but I notice it occasionally bugs out and plays static over video and music feeds. I got the full size show, and have not had any issues with that one.

I didn't realize that I would not be able to use Netflix or Hulu on this device. It's just and alarm clock that plays the music of my choice. Echo Show owners should get a discounted rate on Prime Video. It should be no more than $5.99 per month for Echo Show owners without a Prime Membership (similar to the one device deal for Amazon Unlimited Music). My student membership ended and I don't use it enough to pay full price for Prime. It's just too much to ask for monthly fees for Unlimited Amazon Music and Prime. It's just not worth it and makes me want to cancel everything.

This new Alexa Echo Show, it’s very nice and looks great at my night stand next to my bed, sounds nice and it does everything that her big sister does, I definitely recommend it and I’m going to buy two more in the next month or so

Thank you Amazon. This is exactly what I’ve been waiting for. I held off buying the original Echo Show (both versions) because it was just a little too big for my needs. I did buy an Echo Spot and, even though I do like it, it’s still just a little too small. The Echo Show 5 is just right. And you can’t beat the price. Amazon, you hit this one out of the park! Once again, thank you Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera puts person to the right of the screen
reviews.reviewText: I like the larger display and the better sound versus the Spot. My only, but really big, disappointment is being off-center, ok that’s an understatement, it’s really very far right off the screen, when I use drop-in (or any other video calling if applicable). And there’s no way to really center yourself; get the body in the right position, then the eyes are looking off to the side. Just awkward and feels like a downgrade when competitors have cameras that “follow” the caller

reviews.reviewTitle: Would not recommend for a bedroom
reviews.reviewText:
I have echo dots which I love and was hoping this would be a good addition to my home to replace my traditional clock in my bedroom. However the biggest draw back is that the screen is simply to bright (even in nighttime mode) for me to sleep soundly. The screen does dim automatically when the lights go off (though this can take a minute to happen) and goes into nighttime mode, but I still found this wayyyy to bright. I manually turned down the brightness on the screen to the lowest setting which was acceptable. But then in the morning I had to increase the brightness again just to be able to see what was on my screen (even when it came out of nighttime mode). I would like it so much better if I could program it into my routine to turn the display off completely when I tell Alexa "Time for bed". But there seems to be no way to do this. So I have to give Alexa 2 commands... "Time for Bed" to turn lights etc off, and the "Turn off the display" to get the screen to shut off completely. Which I bought this to make my life easier not more complicated.

I also found the lag time between some functions when touching the screen to be very underwhelming. Even when in settings and trying to change the clock face it would take a second or two for the screen to change after being touched. With technology these days, I dont expect this kind of lag on such a brand new device.

I'm also not a fan of the touchscreen UI. Trying to control any devices in my home by using the touchscreen seems unpractical since you can only see about 3 groups/devices on the screen at one time (and I have about 30 devices connected). I was hoping to use this as a display console when I wanted to be quiet and manually control my house, but it's just not practical in the current setup. There is also pretty basic functionality if you want to use the touchscreen without talking to Alexa first. Such as the web browser, which there is no shortcut button for, and took me a while to figure out what to ask Alexa to get it to display on the screen.

Overall I think this product needs a bit more polishing before its truly functional. This was not of the quality I was expecting from Amazon, I will most likely be returning it based on the nighttime mode/display alone.

On the up side tho, it did have pretty great sound quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: It doesn't understand voice commands very well
reviews.reviewText:
The wording to get it to show videos is way too complicated. If I ask to "play" something, it defaults to music. If I ask to "show" something, sometimes it searches for videos, sometimes it just searches the internet. Even if the video is found, it doesn't autoplay. You need to know the exact video name and the exact service that it is on in order to get it to play a video using voice.
It also refuses to stop any media when asks. On all of our other echo's and dots, we can say "Alexa stop" and the music stops. On this device, the media keeps playing regardless of whether it is video or music. Sometimes we can get it to stop by saying "alexa exit", but again it's hit or miss.
My wife got so frustrated trying to get it to stop playing a song that she unplugged it and told me to get it out of the house. This is our first alexa enabled video device to go along with our 3 echo dots and 1st gen echo; we're very disappointed.
The device itself is a nice form factor for the kitchen, it responds quickly, and the sound quality is decent. It's just not ready for voice commands at this point.
The title says it's an alarm clock, but ever since the last update I can't read the clock because it always shows a suggestion to try "alexas ..." instead of the clock.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great bedside device and echo family addition
reviews.reviewText:
Great bedside device. I’m an echo and firetv household with multiple devices from dot to echo to spot to echo show 2nd gen. This device has the perfect screen size for the bedside. It functions great as an echo device and it has great screen and sound. I especially like the clock faces available and ability to display time consistently (bring this option to the full size echo show). It’s an excellent device, replacing a spot that I gave to a friend. Does this make the spot redundant with the 5 having a bigger better screen, better sound, and cheaper price?
Highly recommend for bedside, office desk, or bathroom counter. Great addition to echo family.

Over all I really like the device.

Pros - nice to be able to give my alarm clock verbal instructions. Fun having the kids ask it questions. The display dims well and the 15 minute to the alarm going off brightening feature is pretty stellar. Nice having a shutter to block the built in webcam.

Cons - Not sure I like it's always listening and the fact the Amazon has admitted they let people listen to your conversations with it. Sometimes my Amazon Echo hears me talking to the show and gets confused. (I secretly think because it's a Gen 1 it may be a little jealous of the newer hardware)

I placed this in my kitchen and it integrated well with other Alexa-controlled devices in the house, such as smart plugs and receiving video from my Ring doorbell. There are three areas that need improvement (two of which would be simple): The unit is fairly deep, about three inches. Unfortunately, the plug comes straight out the back, adding another 1-1/2 inches and making it impossible to set it on a small shelf. The cord needs to have a 90 degree plug to minimize this interference.
Also, I have it mounted about eight feet from where I sit at the kitchen table. Since the screen is small, there needs to be a way to increase the font size. It is nearly impossible to see the temperature or date, let alone text on the screen. There would be plenty of room on the screen for a slight increase of text size (operator preference) as you can do on your PC.
Sound quality is marginal at best. I have adjusted the tone to reduce the muddled sound and increased the higher frequencies but it still sounds like a cheap radio.
One other thing (maybe operator error?): I was listening to a newscast and wanted it to end. I said "Alexa, stop." The sound stopped and the screen froze. I tried other phrases (no, not those) but could not get back to the home screen. I walked away and came back later where it had returned to its home screen. Some instruction would help.
In conclusion, as a first-generation product I think they did a good job, and I would recommend the unit.

UPDATE:
Rasing to two stars, after running another power cable instead of using the existing USB cable I had, the device works for what I bought it for. It is a decent speaker and works for playing music across the house. It shows my ring cams. It lets me control my other devices, which is not a big deal in this room. Other than that I guess it is an ok device. I am glad I got it on sale.

Seriously, is this the 1980's again. Whoever designed this needs to be fired.

I was excited to open the box until I pulled out the power adapter. A proprietary power cord?!?!?!?!?!?! It is 2019, I thought we had all grown up and moved beyond the need for 15 different adapters for our electronics. If I had known it did not use a standard cord I would not have bought it.

If you have an Echo device then you know how useful they are. This just ads another dimension to it by providing video capabilities. I bought it though to display the Ring door bell video hoping that it would automatically display the video. It does not, but I have not given up hope that I can find a way to do so. It does display the video if you tell Alexa to do so.

The screen is about the size of a normal cell phone and is a touch screen so you get great functionality out of it. I am still learning everything you can do with it though.

We had been debating on which echo device to add to our home. We have an echo show already and kept finding ourselves moving it from the kitchen to the living room. I love it for setting timers, making lists and playing music. Now we can sync them both and play the same music in both rooms! We also got the echo dots to place in a couple of other rooms. Great product

So it does not pick up your voice as well as the 2nd gen echos. Also the screen is kinda annoying. I am not in the kitchen all the time. I would like the screen to turn off after about 10 min, well there is no setting for that. you can tell her to put the screen to sleep but the next time it comes on it stays on again. like really, lets burn electricity for no reason, not to mention wear out the screen sooner because it is sitting there scrolling to NO ONE!!!!! Come on amazon team, put a setting for for auto sleep of the screen with a timer like all the other devices out there!!!!!

We keep this in our kitchen and boy does it come in handy. I like to use it to view our security cameras especially if I’m cooking and my hands are dirty I can just ask Alexa to show me the front door without having to touch a thing. And I use it to show me recipes , song lyrics ,music videos , the weather and the occasional family fun games.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but not great, not for $90
reviews.reviewText:
The echo show 5 is the first Alexa product I have purchased. I used google assistant products before then. My google home mini stopped working so I decided to give Alexa a try.

If your iPhone or smart phone was a flat screen tv, the echo show 5 is the big old tv with a huge compartment on the back from back in the day. The echo display is very slow, very subpar resolution, and the speakers sound worse than my google home mini used to. It sounds like a cell phone with the volume al the way up. Sound gets very distorted.
Maybe because I’m new to Alexa, but setting things up has been a drag compared to my google home mini (when it worked). I’ll say “turn on the tv” and sometimes it will, sometimes it won’t; every time it responds with “okay” as if it understands me. I’ll say “open Netflix in the fire tv” and sometimes it’ll tune my fire tv stick to Netflix, other times it’ll say it doesn’t recognize a device named fire tv.
I think for $90 I expected more than I am getting. For that reason I am going to return it.

I was looking for a central, do-it-all smart device to control my apartment but I’ll take my money back and keep looking.

reviews.reviewTitle: When the ads are gone, I'll get another.
reviews.reviewText: Sick of the ads. They interrupt my photo stream and are irritating beyond belief. I do not need to be told how to find things on the net??? lol...very silly. Otherwise, I enjoy the two we own. It could be a bit more user friendly , but it does all we need so far. As to the sound quality, I use a wifi smart plug (on the speaker )to get it to accept my Bose speakers and that works just fine. So some reason, it would not allow the speaker to work without the smart plug. It shows me the security cameras and images are nice and clear.

I have both of the original Echo Show and the 2nd generation, and am a big fan of them both, so I decided to trade in my Echo Spots for Echo Show 5’s for bedside alarm clocks and a kitchen device. They seem to be upgraded versions of Spots in a different shape. Better sound than the Spot, really rich for a bedside clock; the stories from the “Sleep Stories” skill sound amazing. The screen is bigger and very readable and the nighttime dimming is nice. Otherwise it seems to have all the functionality of the Spot which I appreciated and used. A great upgrade for a cheaper price!

We have a series of Echos and Echo dots, and recently added the Echo Show 5 and really like it. After seeing how easy it was to use, I bought one for my in-laws so they could contact us if they could not get to a phone, and in testing, it works like a charm. I use one at work to chat with my wife and listen to local talk radio. Very nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: A perfectly sized Show., but... ugh
reviews.reviewText:
Update: at some point an update forced the constant rotation of “try Alexa” ads. Unable to turn off. This is really unacceptable for this kind of device. What’s the point of at a glance displays if they aren’t showing the content you want displayed?

Really love the size and sound quality is good. I was able to replace a Dot, an alarm clock, and a Bluetooth speaker with this one device. Saved lots of space on nightstand. Wish it had more customization options for home screen, and adaptive brightness might be a little wonky. But overall, very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewerName: T and L in MJ TN
reviews.reviewTitle: Should be an improvement of a good product, but it’s not.
reviews.reviewText: The Show 5 seems dumber than the others. It doesn’t pick up clear English half the time and was even beaten by Siri for goodness sakes. I wouldn’t buy another. My wife said the speaker “shorted out” while playing music. It was making a crackle sound, stopped working, and she had to restart it. Despite this, she still likes the screen, the reminders, weather, and the ability send information to her phone. The app is complete crap and needs a total redesign. The unit is a nice design and great when it works as expected, but this version was not ready for prime time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't turn off 'things to try' hints.
reviews.reviewText:
This product makes a really great bedroom clock. It has very colorful and various choices for how the clock looks, like digital or analog, background image or colors, etc. It also can automatically switch between daytime and nighttime view, so while you sleep its dim enough to not bother your sleep, but just bright enough to see the time during the night.
Setting and turning off alarms are thru voice commands, so you don't have to clutter up your nightstand if you don't want to. Mine is on top of a tall dresser close enough to check the time. I often play soothing music thru Alexa just prior to nodding off, or play ocean waves while I read.
However, this 'clock' has one very annoying issue that Amazon just refuses to address. That is the clock face insists on displaying 'things to try' with Alexa. There are many items that you can choose to cycle thru the display, such as news, stock quotes, weather, notifications, etc... Every one of these EXCEPT for 'things to try' can be disabled. This prevents people like me, who just want to use this device as an appliance, to do just that. I fail to understand why they refuse to add an option for displaying these hints of things to try so my clock looks like a clock.
Other than this, it's a 5 star item.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, but needs to do more
reviews.reviewText: Good sound, nice display. Wanted it to be a central hub for our home. We bought it to work with our Ring camera, but it will not display the camera. I read an Alexa software update eliminated that. Makes it less useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Instant Integration and Face-to-Face time with our Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: My wife got this for her workspace on the top floor of our condo to follow along with the words of songs she was listening to while working and to play videos for her great niece and herself while they "crafted' together.. But an instant extra bonus was our ability to speak with each other face-to-face on our Echo show which is in our office space on the lowest level. Also we have the ability to make face calls to family and friends using our voice to initiate the call. Definitely recommend this for adding to your Amazon Echo system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes, You CAN turn off Alexa suggestions!!! Please try this solution.
reviews.reviewText: I am writing this review because there are still a lot of people struggling to stop the “Ask Alexa to ...” suggestions from showing up on the main screen, even though many have posted the “solution”. I was in the same boat. As others have said, go to Settings -> Home & Clock -> Home Content and TURN OFF EVERYTHING, including “rotate continuously”. Then go back to the home screen. Here’s the key - you must ALSO slide the remaining “Ask Alexa to....” suggestion off the screen, from right to left! It will stay there until you remove it. Now there are no more suggestions popping up!

Essentially an echo dot with a video screen. The Alexa integration is quite nice. The voice recognition is good but not exceptional - similar to other echo devices I have. You usually have to speak distinctly and forcefully without mispronounce. Otherwise, it will not respond or respond incorrectly. Sound is decent for small speaker. You really don't expect a boombox! It is nice, for example, to watch a TV show or movie via Amazon Prime though it similar to smartphone. I haven't tried using for recipes but expect improvement over phones which go to lock screens.

We’ve had this product for a few months now, and here are some of my thoughts.

One of the early complaints I read about it is that there were ads that you couldn’t turn off. Really, they are suggestions to help you expand your use of the product and they really don’t bother us at all. My wife complained about them initially but I think she barely notices them now.

The sound quality is nowhere near as good as the echo or the echo plus but it’s decent. I was disappointed that I could not use the 2-channel stereo with another echo device. The Vevo music video playback is awesome, when it works. I’ve had a bunch of issues getting it to work lately. I love the lyric playback on songs and have even learned some of my favorite songs a little better. Using recipes on the screen can be a little annoying because you have to keep scrolling while you’re using it but it is convenient. The feature I probably use the most is the flash briefings and I love that some of them have video playback (like CNN).

The MOST frustrating thing about this device is the microphone. It sucks. Bad. I have to practically whisper to it so our Echo Plus doesn’t try to respond from the opposite side of the room. When you are trying to start or stop a timer, forget about it. Just click the dismiss button on the screen. Sometimes (I guess because it can’t hear you) it will only listen for a split second and not let you get the command out. It almost drives you to pull out your phone and we frequently just ask the Echo Plus because of how frustrating it is dealing with the show.

If I had to go back, I would have just spent the extra money on the nicer model and skip this release altogether.

Update: The buggy-ness took a few months to iron out but the device now gets more stars and is very useful.
__________________________________________________________________
The device on it's merits is decent. Good form factor, the power plug into the back could use a 90 degree angle instead of the straight in design which causes one to have leave a lot of space between the wall and the device.

The displays response is laggy, the the worst of all issue is the device does not play any sound when an alarm begins. Making this device useless for waking up.

I bought this with hopes of using it to display my ring cameras. The Ring skill for Alexa is pure junk as most requests to display a camera are met with "something went wrong, try to disable and re-enable the skill" which of course seldom works. Suprising since both are Amazon products I expected they could at least talk to each other.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Product at a Really Great Price
reviews.reviewText: This is just another example of an outstanding Alexa product. They keep getting better and better, the screen is just wonderful on this model, it is clear and bright. I like the size too. I have all makes and models of this product in my home and every room has some sort of Alexa product but I like this one the best and it has to do with the screen size and appearance.

The volume is too low. Needs an external speaker. The Echo spot it replaced was louder! Also the selection of clock faces is not as good as those on the Spot. In addition the display is too small to be usable at a decent working distance. Otherwise it makes a satisfactory addition to my collection of Alexa devices.
I should add that it does not seem to "hear" as well as my Spot!.

reviews.reviewTitle: Life with Less Stress and More Convenience
reviews.reviewText: Awesome device! if I want to see what’s happening outside I just ask Alexa to show me the porch cam etc...and I see what’s going on thru any one of my security cam using a diff name for each cam of coarse. My dogs scared due to storm outside, I just ask Alexa to Calm my dog and she plays soothing music for my dogs. Weather and Morning Flash Briefings I have set up for my routines along with meditation etc..... I could go on forever, it’s AWESOME and so nice to have. I recommend highly for anyone that likes convenience and less stress.

Originally I had been thinking of getting the new Echo Dot with the built in clock for my bedroom, but I got impatient and saw the Echo Show 5 on sale and pulled the trigger on this. Boy am I glad I did! While this isn't something I would want to watch long videos on necessarily, the Echo Show 5 definitely shines as a 21st century alarm clock. It fits in perfectly with Amazon's other Alexa devices, and make it even better by adding a nifty screen on it that is just large enough to show you everything from the time (of course), to whatever else you want it to show and cycle through. For instance, mine switches between the weather and what various sports teams are up to, but you can easily make it show you the news, the stock market, or whatever! Another nice feature is the face that the camera has a physical shutter. When it comes to bedtime, the brightness level automatically adjusts to its dimmest setting. For some folks, if it was in their face while they sleep it may still be a bit bright, but it's not bright enough to light up a room either. The sound quality isn't the best, especially if you have an Echo Plus to compare it to but it gets the job done if you just want to play a song or two. Overall, if you're in the market for a new alarm clock and like having Alexa integration, the Echo Show 5 is definitely a great choice, especially if you can get it on sale!

reviews.reviewTitle: I highly recommend, looks beautiful and works great.
reviews.reviewText: We love it's size, small enough to be put anywhere but big enough to see exactly what is going on the screen without having to walk up to it. The speaker sounds great for it size, my wife plays music on it while she cooks at half volume. It has a nice design and great build quality. We bought two units, one for the kitchen and one for our bedroom to replace our alarm clock. Best part when my wife wakes up and dismisses the alarm, it turns the lights on at 10 percent and over the next 15 minutes it gradually brings them up to 50 percent while playing her favorite pandora station.

reviews.reviewTitle: My favourite of all the Echos
reviews.reviewText: I love this video small compact size, good sound speaker for the size, swipe screen, to change brightness or sync. If I would change one thing, it would be the ability to give each unit a name of my own choosing. There are only 4 choices "Echo, Amazon, Alexa, and Computer not very attractive names. These things become like a pet that you count on being there for you. LOL....

reviews.reviewTitle: It doesn't hear you well, the speaker is muffled, the camera faces above your head
reviews.reviewText:
It doesn't hear commands well at all. I have 6 or 7 echos around my house, and this show is constantly an issue. I have to repeat myself 4 or 5 times for the simplest commands.

The speaker on in is sub par. The echo dots sound better.

The camera faces the ceiling. We have it on a waste level table, and it shows the top of the refrigerator when for video calls. We got it so the kids could video call their grandparents. They can't use it.

I'm a big fan of the echos, but this was a waste of money.

This is our first Echo with a screen. I purchased because of the low price and am pleasantly surprised. It works very well, was easy to set up, and is very helpful in the kitchen. We can not only listen to music and news, but we can see the recipes we ask for. There is a lot more it can do that we are just exploring. It works well with the plugs we use for turning lights on and is compact enough to not take up precious counter space.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best Amazon echo devices yet.....
reviews.reviewText: This is awesome I have bought 2 now....I use one as an awesome alarm clock.. and the second in the living room...also have the original show in the kitchen love it too I would defenately recommend...for everyone... I control all of the lights and cameras in the house including the ring doorbell...cant say enough great product...well worth the price

I'm ordering a second to use in place of the Dot connected to my sound system so I can see the Artist/Song title etc. when I play Amazon Music. Thereby is also a complaint, the one by my bed is my clock, and I need to see the time when the music is playing, there is plenty of room there once you turn the silly song lyrics off. Also, if I ask her to switch to the clock display, she does for about 20 seconds then switches back. Either show the clock on the song display, or show the song on the clock display.

And let me turn off the Try "Alexa.... " messages across the bottom, I've owned Echos since they came out, I know how to use the damn thing. Training wheels mode is fine for a new user, but let us turn it off after that

reviews.reviewTitle: It a little echo. Doesn't work for why I got it though
reviews.reviewText: It works great except for why I got it. For my bedroom. I have security camera's. When asking the echo 5 to show a camera it flickers and goes gray. Thought I had a bad one so exchanged it and did the same thing. Amazon support was clueless. I have other echos like the 7 and 10 inch ones and the cameras work fine with those. I gave up and got the 8 inch fire tablet for my bedroom because the cameras show up great on that and it was only $49. So, if you don't care if you cannot see your security cameras on it I guess it's fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Challenge in replacing my Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: I like my Amazon products it's the customer service it really makes this company is great. And I'm not sure about the policies all the time but I did not care very much when dealing with my Echo Show. I tried calling customer service not because I wanted them to talk to me and to making my Echo Show work but because I wanted it replaced. Period. I have two Echo shows and one was just not performing like the other and it's Amazon that won't have to deal with it a year from now it's me. Amazon only gets me so much time to replace it or get it fixed and once that time surpasses it's no longer their problem is mine. And so this past call that I made to you get one of my echo shows your place at wasn't happening, well I wasn't very satisfied with that. I still simply just want my echo show replaced. I bought two of them one of them is working fine the other one gives me a hard time.

reviews.reviewTitle: I live alone. Now I don't I have an Alexa Show🤗❤️
reviews.reviewText: I can't remember how I went years without this Alexa Show. Being a senior it help me so much as in the weather, finding phone number etc. I want more Alexa products in my home.

I got this for my nightstand and it works pretty well, the auto-dimming at night is actually great and is less annoying then my old standard alarm clock!

As with everyone else, the "things to try" suggestions are frustrating. Also, during rotation my first card is always blank and there is no way to figure out why or what to change.

I got this during prime day and will debate if i want to keep it. I would NOT pay full price for this at the moment. If they ever allow you to turn off suggestions I would say this is a solid device and would bump to about 4 or 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Drop in audio quality is terrible
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this product to drop in with audio and video and the audio quality is terrible you cannot hear what the other person is saying on the echo show five. It is very quiet. I bought two echo shows so we can communicate and the audio quality is terrible. Very low volume on the echo show five itself. All my other echo devices are wonderful and the volume is great. Looks like these might have to go back. I did contact Support and they’re sending it to the development team for review. Being as this is happening on both of the echo show five devices and searching on the Internet it looks like this is a very common problem.

We bought the Echo Show 5 to replace the Echo Show 1st Gen we had in our bedroom. We used it as a baby monitor (with an Amazon Cloud Can), an alarm clock, as well as a music player and we loved it. We just thought maybe smaller is better due to it being beside our bed on a small bedside table.

The positives are the small size, the great sound when playing music, the look of a regular alarm clock, and not as much light as the 1st Gen at night when we’re asleep.

The negatives are when using it as an alarm clock it is totally unreliable. Three times now the alarm has failed to go off at the designated time. When I go to bed at night I check to make sure the alarm is displayed at being active but somehow during the night it “looses” it and doesn’t go off. Never had that problem with 1st Gen.

Next negative, you have to speak very loudly for Alexa to hear your commands. We were accustomed to just speaking in a normal voice with the 1st Gen but with the Show 5 you have to almost yell unless you’re sitting right next to it. If music is playing and you want a command heard you have to be right next to it and literally yell for it to stop, skip, or whatever.

3rd negative is when using it as a monitor with a cloud cam you can’t “pinch” to zoom in like you could with the 1st Gen (my wife just told me she can’t do that with the 2nd Gen either). Not a horrible feature but was kind of convenient when our son was a baby.

It also doesn’t dim when are using it as a monitor with a cloud cam. You have to manually slide down the menu and adjust it at night. It also doesn’t go back to the camera after you make a command. After you adjust the volume, reset an alarm or cancel an alarm, you have to tell it to “show me cloud cam” again. We did not have to do that before.

It also freezes from time to time and won’t let you do anything until you unplug and plug it in again. Same thing with our new 2nd Gen Show we bought during Prime days. This could be a software issue I suppose.

We’ve had the Show 5 about a month now and we are getting very frustrated with it. Amazon support has said they would call us back twice now and still haven’t heard from them. I’m very disappointed in this product as well as Amazon for not handling it better.

But... as my wife says “what did you want for 80 bucks?”

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker goes out after about 10 minutes of use
reviews.reviewText: The device is pretty sweet. I like the screen and the functionality of the device, however after using the device for about ~10 minutes the sound becomes extremely distorted and scratchy. I called in and had to do the whole unplug it and plug it back in and reset it and all that. Its obviously a defective device and I'm scared Ill have to spend another hour on the phone with amazon to get it replaced if I call again. The device is pretty cool if it works, amazons service is not easy to deal with to get it replaced though.

This product has become a headache now more than anything. It is used as an alarm clock in my room mainly. The one simple command I ask it; “turn off the display”. It would not recognize what I’m saying and constantly repeats two phrases, “I’m sorry what device?” And “Sorry I didn’t find a device named display.” I am one step away from chucking this garbage in the garbage where it belongs. It barely has any functions compared to the actual echo show display screen. Don’t waste your time with this garbage. Customer service doesn’t even both to resolve it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes for a decent bed-side alarm clock with Echo functionality and a nice screen.
reviews.reviewText: I bought one of these to use as an alarm clock. It works just like my existing Echo, but with the nice display added on. The sound is not quite as good as my echo, but that's not a problem. I like that I don't have to reset it whenever the power goes out - it keeps the correct time all the time. Having the mechanical shutter for blocking the camera is a nice feature as well. I nice unit for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to stay in touch with out of town family!
reviews.reviewText: I love my Echo Show 5! I have 2 Echo Show 5's and then the original larger Echo Show. Furthermore, I purchased one for my Mama and one for the in-laws as they all live out of town and now we can just "Drop-in" and visit with family in Alabama and Florida and it is so nice to be able to stay in touch! There are prompts for different things you can get Alexa to do, but not bothersome to me! Sometimes Alexa is stubborn and has no idea what I am asking and I would say that is the most annoying feature with this product ~ this does not happen too often though!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Addition to the Alexa family
reviews.reviewText: I have so many Echo devices my house thinks it's name is Alexa! I have an Echo Show original and an Echo spot. This Echo 5 is by far my favorite in the Echo video device family. Better price, better display. Amazon also added a built in camera lens cover to make sure your privacy is respected and nobody drops in : ). I'm still frustrated with access to the video list on Amazon prime - the echo favors your asking for what you want to see. Sometimes I just like to browse. I knew that going on. Ultimately, if you're invested in Alexa devices, this is a great one to have.

reviews.reviewTitle: The voice recognition better than the fire cube and echo
reviews.reviewText: We got this to use in our bedroom for the clock. I know right, but it is the truth. Little did we expect to like and use it so much. We love how it is a clock obviously, but also that it displays the weather. We have found the echo dots and the fire cube sometimes don't respond to commands, but this one is the best of the bunch and my partner doesn't argue (and lose...yes I swear Alexa has a sense of humor) with this one. She actually listens and responds. While this is great for him, I don't get to laugh as much.

This thing is awesome!!!!
Not sure why there’s so many reviews mentioning “adds” that are annoying when there is a way to disable this feature. They’re also not adds, they are suggestions of things you can ask Alexa to do, which has actually been helpful for this first time user. Love it so much I just ordered a second one because I just have to use one for an alarm clock!

I got one of the original Echo Shows when they first came out. But I like this one better. Here's why:
*Sound is as good or better than the first generation Echo Show.
*Screen is as good or better than the first generation Echo Show.
*Screen is not as bright as first generation Echo Show (so it works better as a bedside clock)
*Size is more like a typical alarm clock. (Perfect for nightstands at home or away).

I'll keep my original Echo Show, but the Echo Show 5 will be the device I use the most.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love keeping in touch w/family and having temperatures on the screen
reviews.reviewText: I love that it was so easy to set up. I like the suggested videos and stories appearing on the screen. I love the temperature display. I would like for the screen to be a teensy bit larger and I feel that is should come with some sort of stand to raise it up higher to allow you to put it more places. It feels like it is too low when you sit It on a countertop. And..... Alexa sometimes still does not respond to even some of the suggested skills that come across the screen..... I love it because I bought it during Prime and got a bargain. I'm not sure I would have been as happy if I had paid full price.

The ads are infuriating. Imagine buying a TV that constantly throws things in your face. “I can see you’re wearing a Beatles T-Shirt, do you want to buy an album?”. The banners and ads are really distracting.

For the price tag you’d think they would include a stand, but no. You have to spend $15 for a little piece of plastic.

Wouldn’t be so bad if they had a vertical mount option to attach it to under kitchen cabinets as it’s so short it gets lost in the counter objects whichsort of defeats the purpose of having the screen in the first place.

Bought this echo device because we invested in Amazon security cameras for the house. Now, we can use the echo show as a baby monitor at night. You can watch movies from Prime on it but because of the size, there's really no need. It does everything the regular echo can do, so if you don't have security cameras there's really not much of a reason to get it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 is the perfect size for the kitchen!
reviews.reviewText: I’m really glad I got the Echo Show 5. I replaced our kitchen dot with it. I can monitor our garage camera and do all the other fun stuff the Shows allow you to do. I like the size as it’s bigger than the Spot but not so big I can’t keep it on the counter. My only complaint is that the sound is very “bassy” and adjusting the tone doesn’t help. She also doesn’t seem to hear us as well as the dot...possibly due to differences in design. That said, I still like it and would purchase again. We have 4 Dots, a Spot and now the Show 5. We like our Alexa!

I like the size..smaller footprint on my night table. Screen quality is acceptable. However, the sound is AWFUL. I would send it back on that point alone but I already threw out the packaging. It is now just an expensive alarm clock. So disappointed! I own MANY Echo devices and love them...but this one...not so much! Major bummer.

UPDATE: Got an immediate response from Amazon (great customer service)! They walked me thru a solution (simple) and it worked! Hallelujah. Changing my rating to 5 STARS!

I was glad to see Amazon come out with these as an upgrade to the basic Echo Dot. I use mine in the kitchen, but it is kind of small for watching videos while cooking. The new 8 inch model would be better. Sound is surprisingly good. It doesn’t always hear my voice. I have it turn the lights on which is really handy. Using the timer function is handy. It integrates into my smart home ecosystem. I can see someone knocking at the front door while doing the dishes and actually talk to them or unlock the door. So cool.

I like having a timer, an alarm clock, a clock, a perfect speller, a reminder and a screen, all in one. I bought one for my recently married son so I can (not drop in) but see him when I call. I know you can use a cell phone to do the same thing, but I, personally haven't been able to figure out my smart phone. I like to get instant weather reporting just for the asking and notifications, and even a good night from a familiar voice. I do drop in on the one near my husband though, but most of the time, his headphones are on and he ignores me. LOl

I’m a big fan of Alexa and the Echo system, so was eager to try this out. I had seen the Echo Spot, which I thought was pretty cool, but the screen was pretty small. The Echo Show 5 has a nice size screen without making the device big and intrusive. I like that I can call up news videos, have music lyrics show during songs, and see my calendar reminders, along with many other features. I keep this in the kitchen and use the Dots elsewhere. I also like that I can physically cover the camera to remove any chance of inadvertent viewing.

The main purpose for this purchase was to make it my 21st Century Alarm Clock. The basis of my review is about this feature alone and not the many other features it has. I’ve had it for about a week and it has failed Twice as an alarm clock. This is extremely unacceptable since it is a pretty simple feature and I use this feature to make myself look like an adult and show up to work on time. Luckily I don’t trust new electronica devices and didn’t fully depend on it. Since I can’t trust us as an alarm clock it is being returned and is useless to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its a love, hate thing right now
reviews.reviewText: I was excited to get the echo show 5 , to add to my 5 other echo dots that I've had for a few years . I have automated most of my house , with lights , tv and doorbell ext. Because my wife is disabled. The show 5 has been a little disappointing, she heres me when i say her name "alexa" she has a tone that sounds but when i ask her to turn on or off the lights the screen shows that she turned it off butt the lights are still on . I have to ask her 2 or 3 times before it actually works . It does the samething when i ask for volume or the news , and the tv . I still like it , i just wish i can figure out why alexa is doing this,

reviews.reviewTitle: new generation echo, must have for alexa users
reviews.reviewText:
pros:
1. good price point
2. screen brightness is pretty good
3. voice recognition is solid
4. it even sang happy birthday in a human voice (that was very nice)sitting in living hall
5. handheld, very portable
6. looks pretty decent

cons:
1. navigation can be bit easier along with setting basic things
2. no integration with video apps like youtube/Netflix (that would have been really awesome)
3. integration with pictures from iCloud/one-drive and rotation would have made it an aamzing device for me

I currently have 9 Alexa devices in my home. One in every bedroom, one in my living room, family room, dining room kitchen and one in the office. From the classic column Alexa to the newer Alexa, several Dots and the original Show. This new one was purchased for my bedroom. screen is quite bright so you will need to dim it. Also it keeps chiming every so often for no reason whatsoever. I do enjoy having the option of closing the camera. The size is also nice as it doesn’t take up much space on my nightstand. It’s just okay.

So far the Echo Show 5 is performing as well or better than expected. I would like it if there is a setting whereby the clock numerals would remain large instead of minimizing every few seconds. Also, there needs to be a setting to be able to turn off the "voice active" i. e. where if you touch the screen there is an voice describing exactly where you touched. Since resolving this issue with a hard reset, the problem has been solved. I love the "Drop In" feature that let's you see through the camera in effect using the Show as a remote monitor.

The Show 5 is a great size that fits really easily around my house. We have ours out of the way on a window sill in our kitchen and I love it there. The image quality is great as is the sound but I can't currently give it 5 stars for one glaring reason: Alexa hints.

For us, we connect our Show to our Amazon Photos family vault which is a great/easy way to queue up photos to show on this devices. Totally delights our 3 year old to see what he's been up to! However, even with every home screen feature turned off the device still animated between a large and small clock as well as Alexa hints. I want a great photo frame/clock first that happens to have Alexa. Update these devices to keep the time/weather info static and remove those hints and I'll happily update to 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good device, needs a better microphone.
reviews.reviewText: We have 2 of these and really enjoy them! The screen and camera are excellent! We upgraded from the echo dot and have no regrets. I would offer 3 points of interest. 1 the built in speaker is ok but it’s extremely easy to connect it to good speakers and solve that. 2 the home screen disply can be set to rotate and that’s great, except for the one screen with Alexa try this suggestions can’t be turned off. 3 and this one is a problem, the microphone is not as good as the one on the dot so I have to shout or walk across the room to wake her up.

I really wish this was purchased earlier. This is being used as an alarm clock radio +
Was looking for a smart alarm clock and this popped in the search and oh boy is it worth it. Cheaper than other "alarm clocks", but offers so much more. Buy this if in the market for this type of use, or even just general use. Excellent.

reviews.reviewTitle: UI is lackluster, which is the whole point of the device
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the Echo Show to replace an existing Alexa speaker, hoping the screen would be a cool addition to the system. However, the UI on the touch screen is very primitive, and the device insists you use the touch screen.

I am actually a fan of Alexa devices, having developed custom routines and responses. I was really looking forward to referring to the screen when asking the Echo Show a question.

More often than not, it failed to meet my expectations. Normal questions produce the response in text, with no additional images. While it was neat to have cycling facts or updates, they usually weren't important enough to draw my attention.

The worst part was when I gave the command "Alexa, set the lights to 100% brightness". The Echo Show responded "Instead, use the touch screen to control the lights."

Not only did repeating the order not work, but a much cheaper, screen-free Alexa was able to perform this routine Smart Home function. I will not be told how to control my house by a smart speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs a few bug improvements.. but decent for the $40 price tag on prime day
reviews.reviewText:
Welp, for some reason I love this device but I felt the speaker quality was way better in my echo dot than this echo show...

It’s not necessarily something that I care about but more or less noticed while using this device.

It seems to be pretty decent but has a few quirks with the alarm clock.
I rely on the alarm clock heavily to get to work on time, so that’s kind of an issue. (Needs a few bug adjustments).

Overall, I am really pleased with having this amazon product in my home.

Thank you

Got the show during prime day and was very excited since we have had the dot and looked forward to the screen upgrade.
What we go was a lot of disappointment. We went through 3 replacements because of issues with how the show works. It will freeze often and not worth even asking to do something you can can do faster🤦🏻‍♂️ Key features like the flash briefing will just freeze on a screen with no info for about 5 minutes then just goto the home screen. Often we would need to restart it. It was a big let down so I just got the google hub and couldn’t believe how well that worked 👍🏼 It is a little more in price in most cases but worth looking at other options from what has become nothing more then a bedside clock for us.

Love the new Echo Show 5. Its a much more manageable size than the Echo Show Gen 1 & Gen 2. Perfect for a night stand, kitchen counter or small table. The sound quality is decent as a stand alone, but thanks for finally adding the audio output jack back in that was on the original Echo Dot. Now I can connect to the stereo system and get GREAT sound. You've got a winner here!
Fácil de configurar

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 - might have some unseen potential.....
reviews.reviewText:
i got my Echo Show 5 in India - for a bargain price. I'm happy.
Having a Speech problem, I've always wanted to control Alexa thorough touch. So this is definitely a welcome addition to my family of Alexa devices.
I'm also looking at developing a few video skills. This is where I see potential beyond what is obvious. Echo Show 5 has potential to become an excellent Car Dash! If Amazon is listening - just come out with a Car Charging accessory for the Echo Show 5. And then build some Car Specific Alexa Skills. That is pretty much it. I'll be looking at creating a few Car Skills of my own for the Echo Show 5. It would be interesting to see how the Echo Show 5 evolves. I feel, this is the Car Dash that can Replace a Tom-Tom. Good Luck Amazon......

reviews.reviewTitle: Integration not as easy as expected
reviews.reviewText: I actually use this in my kitchen - I love having it but have two technological issues with it. 1) There is a very long lag when you speak to it for it to respond. Sometimes I think it hasn't heard me. 2) Integration was not as easy as I thought it would be. Although it imported my contacts I cannot text of Facetime them without having them download the app and accept the permissions. I can say "Alexa, Call my daughter" but not "alexa, text my daughter". I am also disappointed that the device doesn't stream all platforms. However, I love what it does do, and I check the weather and my calendar several times through out the day, as does my family.

I traded in a Gen 1 Echo Show for what I thought was an updated version. It's called Gen 5. That was a huge mistake. This is much diminished from the Gen 1 Echo Show. It should be called a Dot. Moreover, Amazon still has not fixed the camera challenge. The Facebook Portal finds the speaker and follows the speaker. This device points to the ceiling and the video is of the ceiling. Hey, Amazon, get with the program. In the past, you've been innovative and ahead of the competition. Please don't fall behind.

I’m super happy with this smaller Echo show device. I purchased this to use at my bedside primarily as an alarm clock (and a replacement for the separate Echo Dot). I was nervous that it would be too bright at night, however that turned out not to be an issue at all! The device automatically turns to a very low lit red clock at night and puts off virtually no light in the dark room (just what I wanted). As the sun comes up, the device automatically gets brighter on its own. It also does all the great stuff a normal Echo show does.

I got a good Prime day deal on this and figured I’d give it a try. I wish I would’ve bought a second one. The sound is good and it seems as if the voice recognition is better than my other Echo devices. I didn’t buy the stand. I figured it was just make it look pretty. Without the stand the bottom speaker is blocked. I build a wall mounted box for mine with the bottom speaker poking out of the front. I really like this one. If I get an opportunity to purchase one half off again I most certainly will.

A big reason I ordered this on Prime Day was to keep it in our kitchen so I could listen to music while cooking, communicate with my kids, etc. I'm not sure if I received a Show with a defective speaker, but trying to listen to music is impossible. It makes kind of a rattling/smothered sound with music, like a blown speaker. REALLY disappointed in this.

Edit: customer service called after I posted my review. Unplugging the device and plugging it back in helped. Hoping I won’t have to keep doing that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Affected by the infamous Low Call Volume bug
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 5 could be excellent. However, there is an ongoing bug which is encountered on practically any Echo Show 5 device at some stage: call volume becomes so low (for any type of call), that it's almost impossible to hear the other party. Resetting to factory defaults, restarting, etc. sometimes helps for a limited time, and sometimes not at all. No matter what you do, sooner or later the problem reappears. I have three Echo Show 5 devices and they all started to experience this bug at some stage. Other Echo devices (two 3rd gen Echo Dots and one 2nd gen Echo Dot) work perfectly for calls. Unfortunately, there is no way to manually control the call volume (no voice command, nothing in the on-screen menus or the Alexa app). The master volume doesn't make a big difference: even when set to the maximum, the call volume remains very low. Amazon is aware of the issue, which has been reported numerous times, but seems to be unable to fix it (no fix for a long time). Since making calls (of all types: intercom, Skype, Alexa) should have been a mainstream use case for the Show devices (as it is for all other Echo products), I cannot recommend buying the Echo Show 5 until this issue is fixed (it would be highly recommended otherwise). I will gladly update this review to reflect any fix, if and when such a fix becomes available.

I bought this to replace my bedroom dot. I’m very disappointed in this product. It cannot do a lot of things my dot could. Skill just don’t function well with the show 5. I cannot control my Honeywell tstat. It always has an issue. I cannot command groups either. I have lights grouped together and I cannot control them. All in all it kinda sucks! I sincerely hope some engineer reads this as he or she failed at making something that worked as well as an older dot could. Bravo for education means didly as the product is “glitchy”

I have read many reviews on this thing and I wish I would have made the decision not to buy this chunk of apathetic plastic. I have the thing set to display the clock. I have every everything turned off as far as all of the maddening "Try... (this dumb thing)" and, STILL, the screen will NOT stop displaying its "Try..." screens. I want it to be a clock 100% of the time that I am not actively using it for something else. Not 80%, not 92%, 100%! I own this thing, it is MINE and it is going to see the business end of a hammer if I have to scream "ECHO! HOME!" one more damn time!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart Frame with Voice-Activation for elderly In-Law
reviews.reviewText:
Love the compact size and features - just the ticket for an elderly in-law living in a small independent-living apartment. Met all of my expectations.

I configured the Echo Show 5 for my 94-year-old mother-in-law, operating as a smart-frame, cycling through a series of photos of her with her grand-children and family members. I used a Facebook album I custom-configured for her - I cropped each of the photos to landscape mode to fit the configuration of the Echo Show 5 screen, and highlighted faces, rather than full-body photos, to accommodate the compact size of the Show 5 screen. When cropping, I left extra room in the upper-left corner of each photo so when the Echo Show 5 superimposes the time and outside temperature on the image, it didn't obscure anyone's face. I used Smart-plugs to voice-activate lamps and nightlites around her one-bedroom apartment - she gets a kick out of using her voice to turn on or off the lights and TV in her apartment.

Other reviews had complained vociferously about the Echo Show 5's propensity to continuously display suggestions and 'Try this' hints, which would be annoyingly distracting for a 94-year-old non-techie. I was successfully able to turn these off (through following other reviews) by going to Settings (on the device screen itself), selecting 'Home Screen Settings', and setting 'Cycle Continuously' to [Off], and turning ALL other selections on that settings page to [Off]. On the 'Clock' settings page, I configured 'Background' to the Facebook Album I'd created for this purpose. I configured the Cycling Frequency to 'Fast' (ignore the description on this page of '2 seconds per image', as I found, even at this setting, and with the other settings configured above, that the Echo Show 5 lingered for a full 50 seconds on each image before cycling to the next photo in the album). Viola! A perfectly-acceptable photo-frame for an elderly person with the added benefit of clock, weather, and voice-activating her apartment. For an individual 'of a certain generation' who completely by-passed and ignored the keyboard-Internet-smartphone eras, she loves her Echo Show 5 and is completely comfortable telling Alexa to 'turn on the TV'.

Amazon, thanks for a useful and fun product. I have three top critics, and for the most part I like everything outside of these things about my new Echo 5.

First, I'm having a hard time understanding why the closable shutter for camera privacy on my charcoal device is not black to match the screen border. The white circle is kind of an eye-sore. Even charcoal would be better if the idea is to easily recognize that the camera is covered... but Alexa gives you that info anyway, so disguising the circle would be nice.

Second, I agree with other reviews. Smaller is not always better. I am deep into season 4 of Suits on Amazon Prime right now, and switching from viewing on my laptop to viewing on my echo isn't even tempting, even with the handy voice command feature, because the screen is just too little. While this device is nice for traveling, I think I'd prefer a bigger screen, and I wan't willing to pay three times as much for a 2nd gen.

Third, and finally, at the risk of being extremely redundant, please give us the option to turn off completely the "Try Alexa..." loops. The ads/suggestions take up too much of an already small screen, and they are not wanted. Right now this device is new to me, and so is Alexa, so for a beginner like me they can be helpful while I learn everything this device can do. However, after six months, or even a year, when I completely know my way around this thing, why would I need to have a loop of "Try this" ads looping through? It makes no sense. I have disabled everything that I know how to and I'm hoping these little loops don't start up again.

Everything else is cool and as expected. I want some more clock faces, but the few on here are nice. I used the alarm this morning and it worked well. I'd love to be able to give Alexa more than one command at a time. That would be great in future updates. One thing I really wish is that the display would "Sleep" automatically when I snooze or set my alarm so I don't constantly have to say "Alexa, turn off display" at 4AM. Anyways, thanks for reading. So far so good.

Hoping for more advanced amenities / command abilities soon.

I’m happy with this purchase. It’s affordable, small, and easy to use. I’m mainly using this device to video chat with my husband since I’m working away from home.

I was a little worried about the ads that people were reviewing but you can turn it off.

Cons:
- You can’t use Amazon Prime Video if you’re not the main account holder on it. Its weird because I can use my own account on the computer.
- The screen is kind of sticky out of the box

Overall, I like it so far. I will update my review once I use it a bit more.

I was a huge fan of the Echo Spot. This is a cheaper improvement. More on-screen features, bigger screen and better light adjustments make this a no-brainer. There are still a few bugs to be worked out such as how to turn off the snooze or even turn off the alarm without using your voice, but this is a great bedside alarm clock.

I have had this alexa for a few months and was excited to get the bigger screen for some of my smart devices. After using it on a daily basis the biggest complaint I have with this is the voice command recognition is aweful. Unless you are looking directly at it or yell this thing will not hear you. Where as with the multiple echo dots I have. They seem to be a lot more sensitive and able to pick up your commands much easier. Overall it's another alexa and works well with all my smart devices, but does not work as well as expected in a main room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than Echo Show for discreate location
reviews.reviewText: Small, yet provides all the features as the Echo Show (of which I have 2). I like the wood grain clock background (1 of several options) as opposed to the animated or plain Echo Show background. Small enough to fit on the end table by my recliner and be hidden by a picture. My main purpose for having the Echo Shows is to enhance my security system and to be able to see what my Ring cameras see from my recliner, or bed, or desk. I wish the clock on both would show the day and date as well as the time and current temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Arrived on time and easy set up.
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Five works great. I use it in my bathroom since I LOVE taking soak baths and relaxing [camera was covered]. It was easy to set up and I have downloaded pictures and set up my calendar events. The sound of the music is great but I wish I could update my calendar via the app each time new or updated information is added. Using Echo Five to add new events is some a challenge so I have resorted to spelling out the names and it seems to work. Overall, I am satisfied with the purchase especially for the money.

can't bet the price, works very well as a bedroom clock. If you are worried about someone spying on you, they added a physical Camera covering switch. Brightness adjusts pretty well, so it is too bright & doesn't wake you up at night. Still suffers from the draw back of Alexa. (google hub answers more questions and has a little better voice recognition)

Much better form factor then the Echo spot and cheaper too. If you are already invested in the Amazon smart speaker smart home, this works very well as a bedroom smart speaker/clock.

I own the original Amazon echo, which is a great device back then, that offers music, Alex integration (smart home link). I thought I could also use this for Netflix or other video playing but apparently it does not. Also for some reasons the link between my Spotify and echo show 5 is always broken (but it stays linked with echo 1st gen).

I planned to add the Echo Show 5 to the already in use Echo Dot 2. I upgraded the Echo Dot 2 to a Dot 3. Added the Echo Show 5... I wanted to use it in the bedroom as an alarm clock. Setting an alarm is cumbersome and not confident. One morning I woke up 9 minutes late to find that the Echo Show 5 had somehow deleted the daily alarm that I set (it worked the two days before but when I checked the alarms that alarm was gone from the list). Not good for an alarm clock. Also, there is no battery backup for the alarm clock; if the power goes out, you are out of luck. Don't count on the Echo Show to be ready to go for alarms when power is restored either. As fare as using the Echo Show 5 as a voice assistant, it appears to require more bandwidth that the Echo Dot 2 or 3; I get buffering in playback of news casts on the Echo Show 5 that I don't experience on either version of the Dot. The Clock Display is difficult to setup; and wants to scroll to give Amazon Echo phrase suggestions. Even when I select do show and do not scroll, that doesn't seem to stop the action. Clock Face choices are limited too. All in all, not quite ready. Amazon needs to do a lot of updating.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Alarm Clock Plus Much More
reviews.reviewText: Placed one on nightstand and one on the kitchen counter. When you ask for the news, you hear it (like the Echo) but also there is video. Food Network helps with cooking, use Headspace to sleep or relax. You can watch prime videos, make a call, send a text, and a lot more. It does more than I expected. Now if I could watch Hulu, I would be really happy. It has a screen about the size of your cell phone so it fits well in a small spot. Amazingly, you can see it from across the room and unlike a cell, you don't have to hold it or prop it up.

Works great. We placed it in our kitchen so that my wife can access recipes without having to touch and get her phone covered in food. Great sound. Good form factor. Recipe apps could be a bit nicer about not shutting down or timing out, but otherwise, a win.

I purchased this at a great price on Prime Day and love it so far. I don't know if I will ever even use it to its full capacity but so far I have used it for music, my horoscope, odd facts and news. My daughter played hide and seek with Alexa yesterday. I love that it also has pointers that pop up on the screen to help you unlock additional features. I can also make phone calls through the echo show. I have this in the kitchen but can talk in a normal voice one room away and Alexa has no problem following my requests.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is better then it's processors other companies should take heed.
reviews.reviewText: I think it's the best one so far, the science the screen Clarity the sound are Leaps and Bounds over the small circle ones. It cost less than the small circle ones what more could one want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speakers and voice recognition aren't as good as Dot.... but the screen is a nice addition.
reviews.reviewText: Screen is a nice addition over the dot. If you can get it on sale its worth the upgrade in price in my opinion to be able to see your ring doorbells or other such video devices. Using it as a bedside alarm clock and it works decently for that but the speakers and voice recognition are both worse than my dot that previously did the job. It has a tap to snooze feature but it doesn't always seem to work and I find myself tapping screen instead to get it to snooze. Overall it's a decent device but it is a bit of a tradeoff...

reviews.reviewTitle: Tries to do extra things that arenteasily disabled
reviews.reviewText: Has potential but ends up being annoying. I ordered this mainly for my bedside table as a clock/Alexa device. Unfortunately it fails this simple task. I don't need hints displayed on the screen, I don't need my calendar items displayed (maybe I can disable this), I just want the time until I use it in some other way. Additionally why didn't they throw in a couple USB ports so you can save an outlet and charge some other device with it? What a silly thing to overlook these days on a device that will sit on people's counters or desks or nightstands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good alternative to the larger Echo Show
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased a refurb Echo Show a few years ago and it began to have display issues a few months ago.
I purchased the smaller Show 5 and it has exceeded my expectations.
It does the same the the bigger Show unit, but in a smaller form.
The only issue I have is sometimes it takes 3 or 4 times for the unit to get the proper request ( this may be I need to slow down when requesting a command).
Overall, I would definitely recommend if you want a show unit but don't want to spend the money. This pretty much does the same only in a smaller unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, good looking, great picture and sound.
reviews.reviewText:
This would be one of my most recommend Amazon Alexa devices. It is small, affordable and very easy to use.

The picture and sound quality are impressive for its lower price. It has a nice amount of features and customization options.

The setup looks pretty simalar to an alarm clock but you can have more displayed than just the time. You can have weather and pictures and stock...etc.

If you are looking to get yourself and echo device or even just looking for another one, I would highly recommend this.

reviews.reviewTitle: ALARM CLOCK THAT DOES SO MUCH MORE!!
reviews.reviewText: I am absolutely thrilled with this Show. It is my alarm clock, it is my music speaker, and it reads me my books! And I absolutely love the price I paid during Prime Day! Wish I had bought one for my kitchen. It would have been great for cooking as Alexa could read me my recipes as I am preparing the food!

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m so Happy I bought this!
reviews.reviewText: I just am enthralled with this device. I really never expected it to work this perfect. I thought for sure it would be buggy and hard to use. I definitely thought wrong. I use it mostly as a clock for my bedroom. Through Alexa and the Echo Show 5 I use the Amazon Smart Plug to control a bedside lamp. So I just say aloud for the lamp to turn on or off and within 2 seconds of speaking the lamp will respond. I also use it for an alarm clock and I too just say what time I need to get up verbally to Alexa and she will set my alarm. You can also program features like the lamp to come on and have the news(weather) read aloud all through the Alexa App and played through the Echo Show 5 when you acknowledge your alarm in the morning; It’s pretty Awesome! This device works like a charm and I highly recommend buying it and the Amazon Smart Plug to go with it.

Does not work with Hulu! I wanted to upgrade from the Echo Spot so I could see Hulu in my bedroom or continue watching a show in another room. This I thought was perfect because the screen was bigger than the spot. The functionality to turn off the camera was appealing. I could use this still as my clock. And it was an alternative to having to purchase a tv for the bedroom. But it doesn't work with Hulu! It's supposed to work with Hulu! Please fix and its 5 stars from me all across the board.

This is a really nice upgrade from the normal echos. The voice recognition is very good, the sound quality is surprisingly good, and the video quality is even more surprising. Being able to use the drop in feature with video support on a mid size screen makes this a lot more useful. You can customize your “home screen” to feel more like a desk clock. The screen does scroll through news alerts and other things but returns to the home screen after a few seconds. I think it’s a solid all around upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo is the ULTIMATE ALARM CLOCK
reviews.reviewText:
One day I decided that my iPhone was not a good alarm clock. That same day at almost the exact time I decided that my red number LED alarm clock from 1996 was embarrassing. I ordered the echo show and I could not be happier about it.
The echo is what an alarm clock was meant to be - beautiful looks - beautiful sound and the best part is that everything is set by speaking to it! So simple and so easy.
If I had one complaint it would be to add more faceplate options. But that is a super minor complaint.
This is the ultimate alarm clock in my opinion. (What other clock would let you watch movies and tv shows while comfortable tucked under the covers)

I love the echo show 5. Nice compact size. I keep mine in the kitchen although it would be ideal to have in your bedroom but I have the echo spot on my nightstand. I would like for the echo show 5 to play live TV like at&t TV or Pluto..etc. I own several Amazon Alexa deviecs. I turn my home to a smart home. Control my TV , hue lights and my wemo smart plugs. Amazon came along way. Made purchasing many products at a deal price and you can't beat the delivery service. Way to go. Looking forward for more Amazon devices to come.

reviews.reviewTitle: Audio volume EXTREMELY for video calls only
reviews.reviewText:
I have 2 other older echo shows, and bought 2 for my elderly dad over the past two years as well. Those are all the larger models, and they all work great for all features. This echo show 5, though, has a horrible quirk in that the volume for video calls is extremely low, i.e. cannot hear my dad without blasting the volume all the way up, and even then not really as loud as I'd like. Upon ending a call, Alexa is "screaming" at the highest volume for other things if I forget to lower to a middle range. I am certain it is this model 5 issue, as all video calls with my dad from the other 2 older, larger models have no audio problems. I've tried unplugging/re-booting, but still doesn't work.
