I would not buy, as it appears to be a product defect, perhaps only in some manufacturing runs, but certainly in mine. Amazon will probably come out with a new small model this year, and we early adopters are short changed again.

The screen has an odd effect when touching it or using it, kind of like "ripples" or some of the older school first generation touch screen products had. The sound is actually not terrible but I feel like Amazon tried to add too much bass. There are really annoying suggestions like "Try this" that constantly pop up that you can't get rid of. (reason for 3 stars)

You cannot stop the clock screen from dynamically changing to showing other stuff like "Try Alexa, blahblah" or whatever. Really a product I was disappointed in.

I have it set up in the kitchen. Useful shortcuts, smart home controls, scrolling lyrics while playing music, access to amazon video. I wish i had purchased 2 because the ability to video chat would be nice for my parents. I would also like this as an alarm clock. Great product at the lower amazon prime day price.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s easy to set up and extremely efficient
reviews.reviewText: Its amazing, I cannot live without it. I actually have two of them in addition to the original. I use it in my kitchen for recipes, a timer, organizing my shopping list, ordering on Amazon plus listening to music....the sound is fantastic. I use it in my bedroom as my alarm clock, for music and a variety of work outs. When I don’t have time there are 7 minute killer workouts to keep me on track. I also get my news, weather reports and general information I need. As I said....I can’t live without it.

I love this echo show got it at a discounted rate when they first had a sales promotion or selling well I like the fact that you can see your ring camera and also during drop in it’s nice to have the visual when you’re calling from your phone to home. I would recommend this if you are using Alexa in your house we have over a dozen we have over a dozen dots in our house and this added to the family of dots I wish I would’ve bought more because of these work better I think than just the dots

This is okay as just a small speaker alarm clock. If I didnt get such a good deal on it on prime day I would probably send it back. I dont like how you have to have a spotify premium account to listen to spotify on this thing. Also the sound mostly comes out the bottom of the device so it sounds kinda muted. Screen is okay but the advertisements are very distracting. I even tried turning them off but every once in awhile i see one still go across the screen. Oh well. I needed an alarm clock and its serving its purpose.

I purchased four of these. If lyrics are available for a song, they scroll with the music. It works with Ring. Calls to people are clearer than with my cell phone. It does video calls (haven't tried it yet). Great price. Good sound. You need the Alexa app. If you say "Good night, Alexa" she responds back and the display changes to an owl and the moon. Fun.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I had bought more than one on prime day.
reviews.reviewText: Honestly these weren't even on my radar until prime day. The price drew me in and once I started reading about it, I thought I could use it as an alarm clock instead of my Echo dot. I got it set up and love it. I've used it for alarms like I was doing with the dot, but this does so much more. I can view my rind doorbell, watch prime videos. I like the visual calendar updates, trending topics, news videos, and more. My only regret is that I didn't buy more to replace the rest of my dots and some to give as gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smaller than expected but very visible
reviews.reviewText: I do like the New Show 5 - smaller than expected but so much better than the Spot (can't see anything on that) sound is great for the size and the price point is also acceptable. I did also get the stand which helps with positioning as I have one by my desk and one near the bed. each need differing viewpoints. I have had all of the amazon alexa products and Whil I like the sound and size of the 2nd gen Show, it really only fit in the kitchen in a larger space. The Show 5 is great for almost everywhere else

We made my mom get one too, and now we video chat from Texas to Minnesota. I'm very impressed with the sound and video quality for this little guy. We got it on sale for Prime Day - which I think was a more reasonable price than their every day one considering the stand is $20 separately. We'll likely buy more next time it's on sale.

Was very simple to set up, nice clear video, pretty much the same as an Echo Spot only more rectangle like cell phone size. Tried to pair it with a security camera I had bought and it wouldn't even though the description said it would, I did find out later that the camera/app maker was having problems with integrating the camera, app and the Echo skill for it. So I sent the camera back. However, for the price I feel the stand should of come with it, I mean come on, it's a piece of stamped plastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 ordered on Amazon Prime Day
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this on Prime Day. I was supposed to have gotten two of them on this day but I only got one. I was leaving to go out of town, so I took the one I got which was for my grandson that was coming for a visit for a week. I wanted to make sure he at least got his. I really was looking forward to having them so that my grandson and I could talk and see each other face to face. I am disabled and do not get to see him more then twice a yr. because he lives out of state. Since the time I ordered the first one the price has gone up and at my house I have to stands for the Echo and two warranties I purchased on the same day. Now my issue is that I cannot afford to purchase one for myself until I see them on sale again. Not sure when that will be. Once I go home I'll be sending back one of the stands and mailing him his because that was another issue I had. The stands were suppose to come before I left to go out of town, which they arrived a day later. This is the first time that I have been unhappy with Amazon! I do almost all my shopping on Amazon because it's much easier for me then asking someone to drive me out to the stores. I hope that you might help me out in some way by pulling my past order and checking on this for me. I really was looking forward to be able to use my own Echo to talk to my grandson. Thank you for any help you can give me in this matter.

We bought it to replace our bedside clock and original Echo we had in our bedroom. We couldn't be happier. The screen is really handy as well since I've tied it in with our Ring devices. We can pull up a view of our front door. Also the screen is handy for pulling up things like our lists. Highly recommended for bedroom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't Need this for Blink XT2
reviews.reviewText: I bought the blink xt2 security camera. It says that the show is required to use with the blink. So I got both during Prime days since they were both on sale. The Blink works with my smart phone. The show just sits on the table taking up space. If you use this for talking to people that also have show you might like it. Since I don't need it for blink I hove no use for it. I already have echo and echo dot in most rooms of my house. I threw the box out in error, so I cannot return. Maybe one of my kids would like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't bother this product or the soon to be released Echo Show 8 until this problem is resolved.
reviews.reviewText: I own 3 of these devices and until recently they worked well. However, as so many others have mentioned on the forum, the large clock face has disappeared and has been replaced by a small clock in the left upper corner. I called customer service yesterday and was told this is a known problem and that tech support "is working on it". As others have mentioned, its primary use as a sophisticated alarm clock has been eliminated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as the full size Show
reviews.reviewText: Doesn't seem to hear me as well as my other devices. Have it on my nightstand about 2 feet from my head, and I have to yell to get it to hear me. The sound quality of this is far better than the dot, however. I have two alarms set - one that goes off at 6:15 to a radio station, then the second that goes off at 6:30. You can't hear the 2nd alarm at all - all it does is reduce the sound to almost nothing on the radio station and stays that way until I dismiss it. Kind of a pain.

I love this device!! It saves me so much time and headache. Keeps me organized, educated and up to date. I can't imagine life without Alexa and switching from each device is so simple I can turn off my TV downstairs when I forget no getting back up Just A "hey Alexxa turn off the LR TV and boom done... I could go on and on with the convenience and affordability of it. If I could just get my in-laws to get in on the fun; life would be perfect maybe now that the feature of covering your camera with an off shutter will finally get em to the tech side s we can video chat :)

I have the original show, and wanted to upgrade to the newer version but couldn’t bring myself to do it because there’s nothing wrong with the one I have. So I bought this during the prime deal day and I couldn’t be happier! I’ve been keeping this one in my bathroom and I have the older show in my kitchen. Love them both, the quality is fantastic. Just wish I can watch Netflix on them

I have an echo dot already and loved it. I decided to replace it with echo show since I have security cameras set up outside of my house. I have an arlo pro 2 and a kassa security camera. Both set up with echo show were easily. No problems. Now I am able to see what is happening if I ask echo show to show me my cameras video feed. The pictures are clear.
I set up the display to dim at night while I am asleep. So far it works great. Easy set up and easy use especially if you have an echo dot already. The alexa app is all you need to connect all your devices.

I recently added Alexa show to my variety of amazon/Alexa smart home products. It is very easy to use so far, doing everything that my Alexa echo does. Additionally, it was very easy to add my Kasa products and Ring doorbell to the show as well. I purchased one for my sister who lives out of state for her birthday in a few weeks - so hopefully once she gets hers I can look into how the video calling works.

1 tip - you can’t have the show and another Alexa product in the same room. Initially I set this up in a room that I had an Alexa dot in already thinking that it wouldn’t be a big deal. I was really only using the dot for music. The two seemed to get confused, neither of them fully working until I separated them.
Funciona en español!

Well this is the best alarm clocks I ever had :)
Very convenient. I like the fact that it dims itself at night , that you can setup a each day and each work day alarms, that you can cancel then for one day only and such.
What I miss is an option to configure a work week, as in Israel it from Sunday to Friday, so instead of having one work week alarm had to set up 5 for each day.
As far as Alexa itself concern.. well it's Alexa, still very limited, can do much more , but it does gave very good voice recognition.

Disappointing purchase - bought a refurbished unit and it wouldn’t even boot, was stuck cycling through the amazon screen that appears when it starts up. Disappointed in the quality control, even if returns are easy. The show itself is great though, i already have one and this was to be a second unit to live in the kitchen.

Works well. My family likes it in living room, with changing background photos, weather & news updates on screen and kids like it most with lyrics on screen for many songs being played from Amazon music. Words, games and search responses can be read on screen.

Video processing/response is little slow as compared to audio only devices. Also it doesn’t support YouTube as of now. Audio/speakers are nice but not as good as Echo device.
Without additional stand (base) it’s tilted back little more. Has to be placed on not too tall tables.

Conceptually the Show is a nice product, but it's AI isn't quite up to par yet. Integration with some apps and IoT products can be hit or miss - mostly miss. Adjusting LED lights around the house often takes more than one attempt and requests are often misunderstood. You'd think, "Alexa, turn off all lights" would be easy enough, but Alexa often responds with, "Sorry, I don't have a device 'all Hue lights'

Some apps, like Radio.com can't set an alarm to start up in the morning, even though other similar apps can do that.

After literally SEVERAL days I was able to get my Samsung TV that was advertised as Alexa ready to finally work. The final degree of integration for all that research and effort was that now I can issue a voice command to turn the TV off.

AND THAT"S ALL IT CAN DO!!!

I have a Dot in the Kitchen and a show in my bedroom and living room. These are nice products, but somehow it still feels like every time I ask Alexa to do something - it's an experiment rather than a command that I have confidence in being executed correctly. Responses can be somewhat slow and thr results confusing, unexpected, or just plain fail.

It's fun when it works. The sound quality is very good.

But good luck if you think your wife is going to be able to use it.

Great item to replace another echo device or a your first echo. Screen size is on the small side, but still very much useable. If you are going to use it mainly for music, questions, news, or for a bedroom/office room etc I would definitely recommend this size. If you are going to use to read recipes or other issues, you might want to think about going with the bigger size. The bigger size is however much more expensive, and this will be just fine to read on the screen as well.

As a wonderful beside alarm clock that has internet connectivity and can control and connect to your various devices, it's definitely a treat to have. However, Amazon missed the mark on the cost. At $90 its way overpriced given the limited functionalities it affords when compared to other products within similar price ranges. My thoughts are, wait until a sale to make a purchase; I got mine on Prime day for $50 which I think is a fair price. Next sale may be black Friday and Christmas, so wait. Overall good product, just overpriced.

First off I suggest you read the info description. It has only a 5" screen and this was very disappointing. I was all excited to integrate this into our family of Echo products. I was looking forward to using the "large screen" to see who is at the "ring" door bell or the ring spot light cams. Once the box arrives, the disappointment set in. i get no larger picture than I do with my phone. I guess you ask why i didn't return it, I would say the product serves its purpose and its my fault for not reading the size description realizing it was as small as it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect addition to our Echo home!
reviews.reviewText: We have fully embraced the Echo lifestyle in our house. We have an Echo (1st generation), an Echo Show, and Echo Spot, and then Echo Dots in basically every other room. We use the Cloud Cam as our baby monitor, so we got this device for our bedroom so we can have it on at night. I LOVE that you can manually cover the camera up - that honestly makes a big difference to me. I also love the different clock face options. It's really been perfect for our needs (granted, we don't watch videos on it).

reviews.reviewTitle: An improved version of the Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: This Echo Show 5 has replaced my Echo Spot on my night stand. (The Echo Spot has been moved to our guest bedroom). The display size is just right and very sharp. I am a big fan of the Amazon Echo devices and now have 10 distributed throughout my home to provide information and control of my home automation devices.

We’ve been very happy with the Echo Show 5 and glad we bought it. We also have an Echo dot. One interesting difference between the two is if we say thank you to the Dot it will reply with a statement like, “your welcome”. The Echo Show 5 does not respond to a thank you. It would be nice to have a video tutorial showing many of the things the Echo’s can do. There are some but they are limited. We’ve had no trouble connecting to other devices to use the Echo’s to control them.

I’m loving it since I am a visually oriented person. I traded my echo dot in for this mini echobshow version and I’m already using and enjoying it way more than my previous echo dot. 😃
The complete set up Is really easy but slow. However, It may depend on how fast your network is. It Does everything the echo dot can do but more since it is a show version. I love the touch screen.
My main wish is that it had a portable battery so I can move it around more freely without wires and power constraints.😎

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor audio recognition compared to echo dot
reviews.reviewText: I have an echo dot, and my new echo show rarely hears me when I talk to it. I find that I have to raise my volume and deepen my voice for the show to hear me correctly. I have reset my voice profile several times and there is nothing around the device that is causing noise interference. In fact, my dot is so much better that it often hears me before the show 5 does when my dot in another room behind a closed door. Not sure if mine is defective, but I'm not too satisfied. I got this to use as my new bedroom echo device due to the alarm clock like display, but I think I am going to have to revert to using my old alarm clock with my old gen 2 echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value! Our favorite echo device yet.
reviews.reviewText:
We have 4 dots, and 1 spot. Have owned echos in the past but gave those away or returned them.

Traded in two dots for two show 5s and are so glad we did. Love the form factor and sound quality for the size of the device. Perfect for light music listening, audible, and pulling up Arlo or cloud cam feeds. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice little bedroom echo with screen
reviews.reviewText: Similar to Echo show, just smaller and suitable for a bedroom nightstand/alarm clock. Not room filling sound but that's not what it's for. Otherwise can do everything every other echo can do -- skills, audiobooks, weather, meditation, news, music, whatever. Not a necessity but reasonably priced and fun!

I love my Echo Show 5. Use as mainly an alarm clock on my nightstand. Dims at night, so no annoying clock light to disturb you. I set multiple alarms every night, and it never fails. Also use for music, the speaker is not great, but ok. Used regular echo before, but having the clock is so much better. When you ask the weather (or other stuff), the screen displays what Alexa tells you. Has many more features also that others may use (like the camera and stuff), but I use it just for the clock, alarms and a little music.

Nice compact, good looking Echo Show. I bought two, fits perfect on the bedside table and the other one in the living room on a side table. Works great with out ring doorbell and garage camera spotlight. We can view the cameras through the echo show without having to fetch our phones. Can chat and see our grandchildren now too.

I was very excited to see a new device come on the market that could act as an alarm clock as well as an Alexa device for an affordable price. This was wonderful until I got into some of the basics you would expect with these devices. One of my favorite things about the Echo and Dot is that you were able to utilize the Amazon phone app to configure alarms, control lights, and manage settings... this is not the case with the Show. You are not able to create or modify alarms from your phone, this includes turning off existing alarms if you are not within a range that the device can pick up your voice. This leads me into another problem with the Show, the voice recognition is complete garbage. I have been yelling every morning to turn off my alarms, and the damn thing is not a foot from my bed. Even more so the speakers are a low quality that I have not seen with an amazon device before. On top of all of this is the interface, which is complete nonsense, Multiple different menus that have unnecessary ad space taking the bulk of the screen space. Just crappy design with crappy follow-through, Amazon you're better than this.

1/10 Would not recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Device. First Echo. Love It!
reviews.reviewText: I can't tell you how much I like this device. I also got a Smart Plug on the Prime Day sale. The sound is pretty good for such a small device. No, it is not good enough for a large room. I use it in my kitchen. Can look up recipes, play music, play games. I don't have a non-screen Echo so can't compare but love having the screen. The music has the lyrics for most songs. And the voice recognition is fantastic! It can hear me from across 2 rooms and change songs or turn the lights on. I wish I had bought 2.

reviews.reviewTitle: For being so small, it's amazing!
reviews.reviewText:
I already have the original Echo Show. I wanted one for my bedroom because we use Cloud Cam for our house cameras and my baby's nursery. I kept the larger show downstairs in the kitchen and was so excited to find this smaller one that I could put on my nightstand. We also have a Toshiba Fire TV in our living room. So no matter where we are in teh house, I can simply say "Alexa, show me the nursery" and I immediately see the (hopefully!) peaceful sleeping face of my baby!
The sound quality is really good for something so small, as are the visuals. I love asking Alexa questions and getting her to sing songs to my kids. I really love the nighttime feature where it dims the lights and just displays the time. I was already impressed with the original Show, and I am really liking this one even more!

Got this during Prime Day 2019 for a great price! Overall we love it but there are some things that could be improved. We have had some issues with Alexa not responding when we ask her something. It literally doesn’t pick up our voices even though we are in the same room. This hasn’t happened a lot, thankfully, but does get quite annoying when it does. There is also a problem when playing Jeopardy with Alexa not picking up our answers or saying a correct answer is wrong. Overall I am satisfied with this but there is definitely room for improvement!

reviews.reviewTitle: Faulty software linked to camera on/off switch
reviews.reviewText: The entire reason I got these devices was to provide privacy for the kids in my family. But now the switch that "covers" the camera has a known issue and creates an issue with the software which completely cancels the camera operation completely, and the only way to fix is to do a system reboot. But every time the camera is closed, it does it again. This faulty software needs to get updated for the system's main feature over the other versions of the show, spot, etc. are worth actually paying for. Come on Amazon, get it together!!

I have a regular Echo and that has a much better sound quality, but I love the screen on the Show. Recognizes words without much trouble. Great for looking up recipes. I have this in my kitchen and I use it to find recipes and watch Prime shows and movies. It's fun listening to songs as well when they have lyrics because they show up on the screen and I find myself singing along. I got this on Prime Day so I didn't have to pay full price. I would recommend waiting until it is on sale to buy.

I own two Echo Dots and they are great. I got the Echo Show 5, looking forward to having better sound and a screen, but was very disappointed. The sound is, quite honestly, terrible. It sounds like it's coming from the bottom of a well...muffled and poor quality. There is way too much bass, and even though I tried to balance it with the equalizer function, it's still bad. A quick search of the internet revealed that this is a very common problem with the Echo Show 5, and so far Amazon has not addressed it. Until they do, only 3 stars from me.
On the plus side, it was very easy to set up...easier than setting up an Echo Dot...because of the screen. Just sign into your wi-fi and you're up and running.

reviews.reviewTitle: The clock radio of the future without battery back-up
reviews.reviewText: So we ordered this with a bunch of Echo Dots for the rooms of the house and "teched-up" our place! The family loves the ease of communication through this high-tech intercom system. Our Echo Show 5 seems to be a good value. We got it for $50 on Prime Day. Loving it so far. Just wondering why Amazon would not have any battery at all in this product, not even an old-fashioned battery back-up. Its a bit strange that we've come so far with technology, yet this device would be out of the picture during a black out. Otherwise, we love it!

We already owned the Echo, Echo Tap, and Echo Tap. This device is the best of all. The sound quality is great. It's nice to be able to see things on the screen and not just to hear things. It has a lot of outstanding features. The only downside I see is that there is no way to adjust the sensitivity of the communications with the device. I find that you need to speak at a higher volume with this device than you do with the others. I would highly recommend this device.

I’ve own all the screen based Echos so it was a no brainer when I jumped at the preorder. Though I really like the Spot, the small round screen was a bit limited. And not having a physical camera shutter was a minus. But the Show 5 with it larger screen and much larger sound makes it a perfect nightstand clock. I’m hoping through software Amazon adds the ability to increase the size of the text for date and weather on the Home screen and button labels in Control panel. Not air have 20/20 vision:-)

reviews.reviewTitle: The perfect know it all companion.
reviews.reviewText: I have a regular show, 2 dogs a tap and a auto. I'm a little hooked on Alexa, so when this was offered I jumped on it. It was easier to set up than any of my other devices. Sound is far superior to the dog and I love having all my weird questions answered when ever something pops in my head. I have trouble sleeping so the sleep skills get used a lot as well as ambient noise while I read. I plan on giving them out to family as gifts this Christmas so I can video chat with the grandkids.

I love the concept, finding mine a tad bit slow on response time, maybe software, maybe my impatience. Still love it. Just quit suggesting try this... Good Lord it gets old!! I'm going to have to do a Video, I know Cortana is exiting the AI Assistance field in search of a higher purpose, but at least she didn't have to school us on how to use her!! Just my two cents, I love my Alexa but sometimes I really wish she would cuss me out, like I do her.... At least it would be humbling.....

reviews.reviewTitle: They need to get rid of the ads.
reviews.reviewText:
99% of the time I want a screen I can look at to see what time it is, and maybe the weather.

This thing rotates between different screens when it’s not in use. It spends at least 50% of its time displaying ads telling you to try various echo commands that are designed to start you on a path that ends with you buying something.

It’s kind of like that “tip of the day” you always disable whenever you start using a new software app, except these tips are less useful, more annoying, and impossible to disable.

It’s a shame because otherwise this thing would be pretty good for what it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: "turn off display" is my new fav phrase
reviews.reviewText:
I got this to replace a Dot and connected clock in kitchen which only lasted 3 months. It's nice being able to see timers at a glance, but the UI is cumbersome. Clock faces are limited, ugly and obtrusive. I prefer the minimalist clocks that show on Android phones when off (black screen, dim clock). No way to turn off skill suggestions. I have too many screens in my life already. A smart assistant should stay out of the way until beckoned, not market at me.

Pair with Edifier 1280T speakers!

Absolutely love my Echo Show 5! I use it on my nightstand and can’t see myself ever using a regular alarm clock again. I’ve had a lot of fun with it and it’s great having the latest news, weather and my favorite music available with a simple voice command. Just wish I could adjust the snooze time.

Without fail since I've purchased the Echo Show 5 (July of 2019), every 4 weeks or so my daily weekday alarm fails to go off. Fortunately I have been setting a backup alarm on my iPhone because of this issue, but this is getting ridiculous. Yes, I've reset the Show to factory settings (multiple times), Yes, I've set the alarm with a voice command and not through the app. Yes, I've tried setting it through the app. Yes, I talked to a rep from Amazon who's only "solution" was to set the alarm using the voice command. None of these offer real, long term solutions. Other than the Echo Show making me late for work on several occasions because of the alarm failing without notice every other function and feature is great.

I purchased the Show 5 as a replacement for a bedside alarm clock. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sound from such a little device. It always keeps the time set perfectly. Voice command alarms are super easy. And the home screen continuously displays pictures from Amazon Photos, WITHOUT GOING TO SLEEP (a HUGE problem for the SHOW 10.1"). Alexa does a nice job of giving the weather forecast, and news briefs, etc. The only thing I wish it could do is display weather maps to track storms, etc. Overall a GREAT product.

Just got it today, trying to replace the original echo since it can display lyrics for my daughters. First run, I thought it’s a matrix special edition, unplug & plug again then finally believe this is a defect unit. Very disappointing, second unit will delivery soon, not sure what to expect this time.

update after 3 days:
Not sure what happened, but after plug in for 3 days, the device started working properly. The screen is no longer discoloring and freeze, but the customer service reached out and sent a replacement to me. After few days I got the replacement unit but it's a refurbished unit......I end up return the black one and customer service offered me $40 discount so I can buy a new one for the same Prime day price. The white one I got works no issue and my daughters really enjoy Amazon music with Lyric.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes a great alarm clock alternative
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 5 is decent. It is nice to have pictures that go along with some of the answers to things. Sound is slightly muffled relative to the 3rd gen dots, not sure why. Also figuring out how to get it not to dim the screen to the point of unreadability when you turn out the lights is difficult, but I got it to work eventually. I got it to integrate with a Ring doorbell I still haven't gotten around to installing, but the other things it does are pretty cool.

I usually don’t write reviews for products that work out well for me (I know, I know). Any way, I was concerned after reading some reviews that stated the Echo Show 5 felt cheaply made?.... I took the plunge nonetheless and much to my surprise; nothing about this is cheap. I really like the device. It’s made very well, the speaker and display are both great. I actually don’t have any complaints at all. In fact, I talked my mom in to buying 2 of them. I’m thinking..... Amazon needs me as a sales team rep. 😊

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show features and performance in a small body.
reviews.reviewText: I own the range of Echo devices spread among all the rooms (not bathrooms and closets) in my house, as well as the garage. My 2nd Gen Show is in my main living area, replacing the 1st Gen Show which I moved to my bedroom. It's footprint is comparatively large, so the new Show 5 is a perfect replacement. It's the newest Show technology in a smaller footprint, and it's perfect for a bedside table. In addition, using the optional stand puts the Show 5 at a better viewing angle. I recommend both items.
My son liked it so much he ordered him one. I am wanting to order me a camera so I can see what is going on outside. Can't stand up to look out the window. It will be a great help.

reviews.reviewTitle: Honestly would love it except for the "try... " at the bottom
reviews.reviewText:
Thought about returning, but decided to keep... "try" recommendations/advertising are annoying. Luckily you can mostly get rid of them, although this then loses some of your functionality. At least with the kindles, you can pay to turn off advertising (and claims of others notwithstanding, these messages are primarily a form of advertising -- e.g., "Try -- Alexa, show me xyz product or movie"

Some functions could be better -- e.g., why no gradually brightening wake up as with the larger Show?
Bought this to reside on my desk. Very flexible and Alexa works as Alexa always does. Used mostly for the clock feature and listening to Amazon Music and SiriusXM.

I bought this mostly for a bedside alarm clock. I also use it to play music while I'm in my bedroom and the sound quality is pretty good for such a small device. the screen is about the size of my phone screen and perfect for what I use it for.
I consider it an upgrade from your standard bedside alarm clock and I like that I can use it to video chat with my grandbaby. I am not a tech savvy person at all, but even I pretty much figured out how to change settings and such to suit my needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size for the bedroom! Love the style.
reviews.reviewText: Another great Alexa product. Of course everybody loves the video Alexa's. I have them everywhere. I wanted to upgrade for an old video (1st version) Alexa, so I bought this for my bedroom. It is smaller than the new style Alexa, but perfect next to the bed. You don't even have to dim it at night, although it has a button and function for it. The style is great. The screen is nice and I think the sound quality is great. I love to listen to rain and thunderstorm from Sound Music at night.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t buy it for videos or Hulu...
reviews.reviewText:
I’m going on week with my echo show 5. I have to admit that it’s pretty handy. Like most people have commented on here, I used it to replace my echo spot as an alarm clock. The sound quality is better. On the white noise I play at night there is much more bass.

the biggest downside to this device is it doesn’t play Hulu videos. I don’t get why it’s called an echo show. It should basically be called an echo alarm. I’m really disappointed about that. Perhaps in a future upgrade. I was definitely looking forward to watching Hulu in bed on the small screen.

I will still keep it. Others are right — there is a lot of garbage that scrolls through. Some of it is interesting but given I pay for prime I don’t need to see it all the time.

I love the Echo Show 5. I love the size, the screen is clear and the sound is really good. I have not seen the messages that others have complained about. Definitely worth the price. Even better at the Prime Day price! I’d highly recommend this (get the stand too it makes a difference!)

I love that I can see my security cameras just by asking. Sound quality is not too good but what do you expect for 50 bucks. I do like using it as an alarm clock, my work schedule has me waking up at different times weekly and I can set so many different alarms. To those saying they can’t get rid of the rolling ads, you must not be the brightest bulb in the pack, 2 seconds is all it takes to go into settings and change it.
Why give a bad review on something that is your own fault?
So far, I am extremely pleased with the Echo Show 5. I was using the Echo Spot and this is much better - I like the larger screen display and it has better sound quality, too.

I have been using Amazon devices for several years with just some minor problems (2 echo dot 2nd gen, 1 3rd gen, Fire TV cube and an echo plus). As soon as I hooked up the 2 echo show 5s started getting wifi disconnect problems. Also, when telling Alexa to turn on a light or other command, she will respond ok and display that the command had been executed, but many times nothing happens---this is only with the echo shows, have not had this problem with the other devices.

I actually like this better than my original Echo Show. I use it on my nightstand as an alarm clock, to listen to music, get weather updates, and to control my Amazon smart plugs. It seems to hear me better than my Echo devices, which is a major plus since I don’t have to yell at it.

Works better then I expected delivery was pretty fast. Alexa can hear me clearly across the room and does whatever I say seems like no matter how I word a command. I use it for music mostly but using some skills it is capable of doing more then I thought. Happy with my purchase so far.

I just got home about 30 minutes ago after working a long day and having a few adult beverages. I had this set up in NO TIME!. Some magical potion connected this device to my home network without me putting in my difficult password. I was vigilant and read the negative reviews and fixed those problems like ads, tips, and such within 2 minutes. The resolution is wonderful and the sound is just right. I will continue to play around with it, but I seriously doubt I will have any issues. I'm hoping that the more adult beverages that I consume, the more interesting Alexa will get.

No issues using ALL the features of the Blink integration (make sure you install BOTH Blink skills) The sound is actually very good! Crisp screen. My only gripe is Amazon needs to let us disable the "try this..." line on the bottom. Would love to be able to rotate screens without the "try this..." line.

The Echo Show is a great concept, but hits some roadblocks in execution.
1. I thought it'd have a much more robust app market, when really it just comes with amazon music and movies. Not exactly what I'd call useful.
2. The Speaker is super nice, sounds great for such a small little package.
3. The biggest reason this gets a thumbs down in my book, is the ridiculous "Try" suggestions on the screen, I bought the device and gave you money already, please don't shove a bunch of suggested content in my face.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great smart night stand ⏰ 🥰 I love it! 💗
reviews.reviewText: I owned couple of Amazon echo and I decided to get this one because it has a display and would be great to see time and weather info. The size is just right and the sound is surprisingly good and has some bass on the sound. This is very easy to set up and you don’t need an app to configure and can do it using it’s display. I got this on prime day so definitely worth my $50. I am looking forward with the echo show 8. The only complaint I have is sometimes the sound is weird like garbled and I have to restart it and will work as normal again. The microphone on this is better and even I am far it recognize my voice commands. I would recommend this to a friend.

Awesome little addition do the Alexa family. Great with voice commands and easy set up. Speaker is super loud too! The device is able to understand Spanish so well. Such a great device that I had to get another!

I love my new Echo show. It sounds very good for its size and I like the information it gives you on the screen when you ask a question. That being said. I hate the way it is constantly displaying messages. I have it next to my recliner so it can display my ring cam. And that works great btw. But when I’m sitting right next to it, and it’s constantly changing screens, that drives me nuts! Come on Amazon! Please fix this! I didn’t buy another on Prime day for the bedroom just because of this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 is a little BEAST!
reviews.reviewText: What's not to like about this little beast of a speaker! Music sounds fantastic, integrates seamlessly with my RING cameras. No need to grab the iPad from nightstand during the late night hours, just ask Alexa to "show me" a specific camera and boom, there it is! I now have a security camera hub, a smart speaker, and a digital picture frame on my nightstand. Couldn't ask for anything more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Acceptable value for money but less than my expectations
reviews.reviewText: Like the compact size - perfectly designed for a bed table. Don’t like the poor recognition of the wake up word “Alexa”. I have 1st and 2nd generation echo shows and the “Alexa” wakeup word is well recognized than echo show 5. Besides, I’m not sitting in the US, and I’m completely unable to display the local weather even though I updated the device location information multiple times (through the app and on the device itself). Tried to read through the internet to find a solution but nothing works. Nutshell, acceptable value for money (I bought it on sale at $49) but I expected a more reliable device!

Great size for the night table. Works well as an alarm clock, camera viewer, music player, night sound machine, morning companion while getting ready for work, and talking calendar. The screen size is good for looking at my cameras around the house. I have a Show in my living room and this is just right for my bedroom.

We have been Echo customers since the initial echo and yes we were sucker punched by Amazon on the initial special offering of the Echo dot at $89.99 each (bought 2). That being said we also have the original Echo show, but we like the small form factor of the Show 5 for the bedroom. Sound quality is outstanding and video quality is also very good. Both on Prime Day for $49.99. Would recommend waiting to see another price drop to that range - probably Cyber Monday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a reliable alarm clock. Very buggy still.
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for a few weeks now. It's ok. Not great by any means. The alarm function started failing last week. Stops turning on after a snooze command. One day it didnt go off at all. Have unplugged and reset with no improvement. This is a known problem that needs fixed ASAP. We have 2 of these with the same issues. I want to enjoy the products but as with all Amazon devices the software is buggy. Resets, lock ups, updates make for a disappointing experience.

This was a great addition to the other amazon devices I have around the house. I primarily use it as an alarm clock and it works perfectly! I had an echo spot and found that I had trouble reading the time in the middle of the night since I’m blind as a bat without my glasses. I can see the time easier with the echo show 5! I also like the fact that the screen will stay dim until I turn on the light in the bedroom. The clock face light is dim enough at night that it doesn’t disrupt my sleep.

I ❤️❤️❤️❤️ LOVE these and now want them for all my rooms!!! My favorite feature is “announcement” (although I wish it was a bit louder, probably something I haven’t figured out yet!), LOVE playing “music everywhere feature (can connect all your Alexa devices). I also LOVE that my kids can “call” me on this (video chat) without having a cell phone connected to it!!! My only negative is we can’t play Amazon Music on 2 different Alexa’s with different music!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stick to the dots this is crap
reviews.reviewText: Stick to the non screen alexas. Those have better sound pickup and my dots never sounded like this now it's a regular occurance with mine and others. Also I feel the warmth radiating near this thing it gets very hot for no reason at all.

I bought this to compare with the Echo Show I had gifted my Mom. The price point was so different so I wanted to see the difference. Well it is definitely smaller! The Show 5 will be great for many things and the price is so excellent but I am still glad I gave my Mom the Show. It suits her needs better with the big screen and better sound. I ended gifting this one to someone else as the price was excellent on Prime Day that I couldn't bear to return it!

We thought it would be nice to get the Echo Show 5 to be able to do video communication. It hasn't worked yet. We can hear audio, but the video feed shows "off", despite being on. I've tried everything and nothing resolves the issue. After looking online, apparently lots of people have this same issue. We have (& love) several Echo devices and I just purchased another a few days ago but, if this doesn't get resolved, it makes the Show quite useless for my needs.

Nice. Now I can watch tv and catch up on things by using Alexa. It integrates very easily with the ring doorbell. When the dog barks I can ask Alexa to show the front door camera to see what is out front. I really enjoy the new device. I did not order the stand but will in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice features with screen, but microphone/listening is HORRIFIC
reviews.reviewText: Bought 3 of these through various deals during Prime Days this year and replaced 3 of my Dot Gen2 with them. Big mistake. While the screen and associated features are nice additions, including Wyze cam integration, the listening/microphone is HORRIBLE. It takes so much more effort to speak to the Show 5 and constantly having to correct voice commands despite having "trained" Alexa using the app and made sure nothing is blocking the line of sight/voice from typically used directions. A lot of times, I'd get responses from a couple of the Dots we still have in rooms far away and nothing from the Show 5 just 10 feet away in the same room. We ended up switching it back to the Dot Gen2 that we thankfully kept. Very poor microphone design.

The Echo Show is a nice little device. I use it as my alarm clock. It can do everything the Echo Dot can do plus it has a nice screen for displaying pictures or videos. The screen is really too small for longer video watching. It does have a little beep that sounds every now and then. I don’t know if that is the Bluetooth or what. I disconnected the Bluetooth speaker and the beep remains. I think I would prefer the larger model for use other than a bedroom clock.

I decided to try as the price was low enough to compete with Echo Dot during the last sale. The sound quality is better than expected and comes with a nice quality screen. The touch screen is frustrating to use as the CPU is too slow to follow swipes and touches. Microphones have hard time detecting commands unlike my Echo Dot. Overall I can live with its shortcomings, but don’t think it’s ready for prime time yet. I would wait for a few more generational updates before buying.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best features in a small form
reviews.reviewText: Waited for Amazon Prime Day to buy the Echo Show 5 for our nightstands. Decided to trade-in four older Amazon devices: 2 Echo Dots (1st Gen) and 2 Echo Spots. Received instant credit of $70 + 25% off. Ended up paying $13.88 for my purchase of 2 Echo Show 5s. Both came within a week and got them setup within 30 minutes. We love them! They are the perfect size for our bedside tables. The sound is terrific! We also have the Amazon Blink and can monitor our cameras from the Echo Show 5. The best features in a small form!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a Fan of The Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: I currently own 2 Echos, a first gen and a second gen, and two Echo Dots. All of them work and sound much better than they Echo Show. It is slow to respond, the voice recognition isn’t good at all, and the screen is only marginally helpful. It is also painfully difficult to hear and the sound quality is inferior to my other Echo devices. I use this device as my alarm clock, as I purchased it to take the place of my Echo, and it is completely inadequate. I would not recommend this product at all.

I started with the Echo dot and purchased this unit recently because of the many functions it has. One of the features that I really like is the fact that you can video char with another unit. This comes in handy when you want to video chat with family or friends. I also like the on-screen news and weather articles that flash throughout the day. Overall great unit, not too big or small and packed with amazing functions. You will not be disappointed.

I got the Echo Show 5 during a promotion where it came free when you bought a Ring Doorbell Pro. The integration between the Show 5 and the Ring is pretty nice in that it can answer your Ring and show you who's at the door and you can talk with them through the Show. Beyond that, the speaker poorly positioned so that unless you lift it off the table somehow, the sound is badly muffled. The speaker is actually on the bottom of the device. The screen isn't too bad if you are looking directly at it, but it has a very small viewing angle to see it clearly. Other than the integration with Ring, it really doesn't do a whole lot with the screen that I wouldn't just use my phone for.

I love the wake up and do not disturb features! This is a game changer as smart alarm clock. The sunrise simulation and gentle sound isn’t jarring, and not only can I get a snooze without fumbling, I can ask Alexa to turn on the coffee machine before bed and turn on the lights (smart plugs...also a must have). The screen adjustments are amazing too. Love it!

I like this product because it works well as an alarm clock. The display can be set to a very dim light where I can still see the time in large font but keep a dark room. It also comes with fun alarms. I also like the weather features. I got this for the clock but actually seeing the weather is better than just the echo dot telling me about it. I took my bedroom dot and put it in the kitchen so now I don’t have to yell to the living room to turn on the kitchen lights.

During this annual Prime Days I purchased the Echo Show 5 to give the Amazon ecosystem a try and give my Google Assistant-enabled devices a break. The compact design fit nicely on my night stand and I Iiked that the weather and date were prominently displayed. The unit is nice, the sound is amazing for such a small device and set up was relatively easy. Compared to the Google Assistant, I found Amazon as a voice assistant very lacking. I was often met with "I don't know how to help with that" for all but the most basic search requests, no matter how many different ways I phrased the inquiry. Perhaps, at some point with updates, this device will be able to perform at a level I need from an assistant but in the mean time I will stick to Google enabled devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought to act as Ring Doorbell display. Not good.
reviews.reviewText: Wanted quick access to my Ring Pro camera as my recliner is electric and slow. The show (and my spot) are WAY too slow at responding to "show me the front door" for it to allow me to answer as my chair is lowering the foot rest. Caller is gone, but I get a movie of the arrival and departure!

reviews.reviewTitle: My Echo Spot was much better!
reviews.reviewText: This current version of Echo Show (5) is not up to par or my standards. It does not play ANY of my content (Cheddar, History Channel, NPR, etc.) when I use my "Good morning" feature nor will any of them play if I just ask Alexa to play them. I can no longer return it and from the other customer reviews on Amazon, I definitely do not want another one. I will be selling this one on eBay or locally, I guess, along with the new Dot and light switches I bought, as well.

There are too many insufficiencies with this device. Have to basically yell Alexa to get a response. Even with volume turned all the way up. The Alexa in a neighboring room picks up my request before this device. The normal skills don’t work and just freeze on the screen (like the daily news or simple request to turn off all the lights) and then unable to get it working again. So I have to go to another Alexa (3 and 2 generation) recite the same commands and they work perfectly. Sound is less than the Spot. Overall extremely dissatisfied. Would like the timers to just show on the screen but instead it always go to promote Ask Alexa mode which is so inconvenient, especially when cooking. Just going to put it in the spare bedroom as a clock because that’s about all it is good for.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is nice, but looking forward to the next version
reviews.reviewText: I really like this, but put it in the bedroom and my wife makes me turn it off for bed. My internet is really crappy, so I had lots of issues setting it up. Alexa responds to the cats as much to me, and tells me what she can't do more often than just doing it. Once playing, it is great. The motion detection feature is actually a big distraction for me; when it is off, I want it to stay off, not wake up everytime I walk in the room or a cat meows.

Put this in my 6 yr olds bedroom as an alarm clock. It helps to wake him up for school but I wish it had more alarm options (voices etc). I plan to check and see if any can be added from the app. He likes the clock and uses a lot of Alexas features like reading bedtime stories, telling jokes, answering questions, weather, and some games. He’s learning new things to do with it all the time & comes up with stuff that I didn’t even know it could do!

Although I continue to use my pair of HomePods for listening to music, I really love my new Echo Show 5. It is my 8th Alexa device. I got it to replace my large digital alarm clock, and it does that very well. When I'm sitting on the edge of the bed in the morning, it tells and SHOWS me the weather for the day, lists my appointments, shows me how my stocks are doing, and turns on lights around the house. I love it. And I managed to get it at a great price during the Prime sales.

This new item is very close being perfect. The only problem my wife and I have is that it does a horrible job of voice recognition. We were told that it would learn our voices so we wouldn't have to turn one off while talking to the other and it has not done this yet and we've had them for a month. Otherwise. We like them. It's nice to have a visual while she's talking to you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great echo, but the "Try..." messages can't be turned off, which is annoying.
reviews.reviewText:
The echo itself is great - love the size and screen, and Alexa is awesome. My big complaint is that I don't want the "Try "Alexa..."" messages showing up at the bottom of the screen because it makes the clock go small into the corner. I've turned off every other home screen content because all I want is the clock, but this one can't be turned off. This is in my bedroom, and the messages are annoying because I can't see the clock and I have to tell Alexa to "go home" every time.

Anyhow - with that relatively small caveat, it's a great little device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this little engine that can do almost everything !
reviews.reviewText: Got a little carried away on Prime Day. But turns out I love this little product. I gave up nightstand alarm clock years ago but love setting alarm by voice, quality sound, can use for yoga & meditation practice through YouTube. Tougher to use with Podcasts would like to see improvement there.
This is an amazing alexa product. The resolution is great, you get an amazing picture quality. The sound is awesome. I love everything about it.

This thing is awesome.

Please note: if you are having problems receiving Authorization Code sent to your phone for registration/setup, as I did, simply go to Amazon App and under: Your Account settings, Turn OFF Two Factor Authentication.

Apparently, lots of people having this problem and this solves that problem. Once you have completed setup you can turn it back on again.

This works seamlessly with Ring home security and cameras. Six stars!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very impressed the Echo show five.
reviews.reviewText: When you get these on sale for prime days or black Friday week, they are hard to beat. They integrate well with my Arlo security cameras. And the speaker on the show 5 is far better than the Dot. You can ask to see a recipe for… whatever… and it will display the recipe. You can ask to see a picture of a famous person, artwork, whatever, and it will show up. You can also get videos on all sorts of things including recipes. I will buy more.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you have a Fire Tablet save your money
reviews.reviewText: This device to start has caused me frustration with the voice recognition from day 1. If you intend to play music and ask alexa a question there is a 1/10 chance it will hear you. Furthermore the capabilities of this device are very limited compared to other alexa items I own. When I play songs from both Amazon Music and Spotify I have constantly noticed that it will skip to the next song when it wasn't even 3/4 of the way done the previous song! Im honestly not sure what perk this device has over any of the fire tablets since this only has a screen that is probably smaller than your average smart phone now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best of the Echo Line - Echo Show 5
reviews.reviewText: I have them all, Echo Dot, Spot, Show. Now the Echo Show 5. I find the Echo Show 5 just the right size. The spot screen is to small, the Show is just to big and takes a lot of space, The echo Show 5 is the perfect size, the screen is easy to read fro a distance in the Kitchen, The Music sounds great in the Living room. I will be replacing everything shortly with The Echo Show 5. I have all with the stand which helps adjust the screen to the perfect angle as needed.

I was already using an Echo dot but wanted to see my security cameras at night without fumbling with for my phone. This works pretty well. It does not pick up my voice as well as the Echo Dot, but still good. The image is very clear and sharp. I like that the video screen dims when it's dark and the light will slowly get brighter before the alarm goes off. I gave it 4 stars only because of the voice detection being at bit less than the Echo Dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware as the Echo Show does not support the Fire TV Recast.
reviews.reviewText: I'm a long time Amazon customer and upset because the Echo Show doesn't support the new Fire TV Recast even though Amazon stated is would support this starting July 27, and is even mentioned on the Recast product page details.. I tried calling support and kept getting the run around, especially from their Costa Rica call center. I think Amazon is a little ahed of themselves getting into the TV DVR business before fully integrating this into their existing Echo devices. I was also later told that I would not get an email from Amazon when this will be supported, and I just have to keep checking for software updates on the Echo Show 5.

This product integrated well with my Echo ecosystem. I use it as an alarm clock and like that it has a physical shutter to block the camera. If you want to snooze your alarm all you have to do is give it a gentle tap. You can set multiple alarms to repeat daily, weekdays only or just selected days. I don’t really use it to watch any content but I like the ability to have a continuous slideshow of photos rolling behind the clock face. I use this function on my other Show devices but it is also a great addition to the bedside table. Overall great device.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is good but could be much better with software changes!
reviews.reviewText: Like the size, the looks and the dozens of things it can do that I do not need and hate things that it should do and doesn't. I wish it could display seconds on the digital clock, I wish it could dim the clock letters, I wish it could make the weekday and date big enough to see from across the room, I wish it would quit giving me hints to ask questions, I wish it could display the inside current temperature, I wish I could program it to turn off the alarm when I hit the top instead of going into snooze, etc..

This is great. I have one in my kitchen and in my room. I can use it for help with recipes, or to play music while I cook. I also use the other as an alarm and to assist with traffic information and weather as I get ready for work. Love the display and the sound quality is good.

I loved this product until the last update that removed the always on clock.

Pros:

Perfect size!
Ease of use
Compatibility with smart products
Camera Shutter

Cons:

Update killed always on display. Replaced with a screen saver that says "echo"
Fingerprints are easily visible
Does Not come with stand (Extra $19.99 USD)

If they update it where the Clock is always visible I would highly recommend. I would even buy it again.

I am still tweaking the sound mixer on the Show 5. The default sound is very flat with little treble to it. I know that this unit has a single speaker, but the sound quality setting is not as good as the Dot 2nd Gen out-of-the box. For a bedroom this unit is great. Many of the skills I use on a regular basis have setting that can be controlled on the screen, which is like using the skill's app. It is a nice unit and much better than the Spot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for the Family to Check on News, Weather, Trivia -- Anything at All!!!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little piece of technology. Ours is in the kitchen, a place everyone ends up in in the morning. I like to check the weather and catch up on the latest news. Periodically someone needs to answer a trivia question. Or it can play your favorite song. Love it!

This has got to be my best purchase from Amazon ! the sound is great and this has an equalizer you can control from
the Alexa app i have on my phone. and the picture quality is also great.and i like that it has adaptive brightness when
your lights go out the screen goes dark or Dim. i am mostly elated by the sound !! please remember your Alexa Devices
can be Managed using the Alexa App on your phone or computer. Thanks Amazon

I don't haven anything to hide, so I'm a big fan of the Amazon echo and dot. Where I spend my idle hours has had a digital clock across from my chair and a dot somewhere close out of sight. On Amazon Tuesday, I bought the new show 5 to replace the two items and am quite pleased with the upgrade. The unit is a bit basey, so I'll attempt to change that, but otherwise I've now freed up a plug and still have the dot functionality in my clock.

The improved audio, camera privacy shutter, and larger screen make this a great upgrade from a Spot (or Dot) on the bedside table. I still like the cool round screen on the Spot but all in all the Echo Show 5 is a better clock radio/room controller/news and weather monitor.

I absolutely love my Echo Show! I ordered this on Prime Day at such a great price and set it up in my kitchen. I love the size because it's perfect without taking up too much room or being too small. The screen is great and love to see the words to songs or recipes. I love it!

I bought this to start replacing the Dot's Gen 1 & 2 we have in lesser used areas of our home. Love it! Not much more then the cost of the Dot's (when on sale) and will be even a better deal on Holiday sales (I've got Alexa ready to remind me on 11/27). We have both the Show and the Show2. The Show5 is every bit as good, just smaller. We have one in a bathroom and it even has a camera lens slide to use for privacy. Happy Birthday Alexa!!

I have heard so many people talk about Alexa and I have read the good and bad reviews. Well, I was skeptical but tried it anyway since it was on sale for $59. I bought two. I love this product! I am definitely happy with my purchase. I’m going to buy 2 more and then 2 for my parents for the holidays. Loving My Alexa 5’s! I hope Amazon gives coupons or has another discount for “Black Friday” shopping. I’m definitely getting more.

The best buy of the Echo lineup. For a low price, you get a touch screen where you can always see time and temperature, and do more advanced stuff like internet browsing with its on-board Silk browser. This is paired with a really nice speaker that can boom. It's kind of like a smartphone with a huge speaker. Or, a clock-radio-tv that understands you when you speak to it. I have one in the bedroom, and one on a shelf in the bathroom; It makes my bathroom feel super advanced!

This was my 3rd Echo Show. I got this one for my brother as a Christmas gift but I own 2 more. I use these in 2 of my bedrooms as I love the clocks on them and my wife and mother love the pictures. I love the Echo ecosystem I have them in every room!. i am thinking of getting the 10inch version of this. I love you can watch Prime Video and other things on it too. If I had more rooms I would be more of these! The sound is good I think its just above the Echo Dot but not as good as the normal Echo or Echo Plus.

Works good, as expected from echo. But why the heck can't you created an echo that's angle is adjustable?!? There's an after market product. Why can't you let us have that to begin with. My kids are the main reason we have an echo show, so they can call their grandma. And we have to put a book under half the back to prop it up so the camera can see them. We have a first generation echo show and I'd really hoped the 5th generation would be adjustable by now.

I purchased a show 5 on Prime day. While I enjoyed the screen, it was a replacement for my full size Echo which has GREAT sound. This device has a very hard time hearing me, even when I am standing right next to it. 75% of the time my Echo dot in the other room replies to me instead of the SHOW which is less than 2 feet away from me. Secondly, the sound on mine is not so great for both Podcasts and Music. I actually sent my first one back b/c every so often the sound/voices would become very scratchy even on lower volume settings - almost like a blown out speaker. They replaced my item, but this one suffers with the same issue. I like having the screen to see news and weather headlines, kitchen timer countdown and clock. If you are looking for something that plays high def music, look elsewhere.

I wanted the Echo Show primarily to AUTOMATICALLY see motion activity from my Ring cameras during the middle of night, but to do this it still requires voice command, which is what I didn't want --- would disturb my husband's sleep.

Unfortunately, there is no "routine" that will prompt the Echo Show to automatically do this. Hoping since both Ring and Echo are owned by Amazon that developers will eventually add this feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Hardware but Support Needs to Catch Up
reviews.reviewText: Much better than other Alexa devices - Spot or dot. Very disappointed with the service. Although they were very courteous, they wanted to replace the whole device when my problem was simply that the app need to be reinstalled. Particularly frustrating was my insistence that it’s probably software not hardware. But they wouldn’t even submit the ticket to the software developers. So it was a waste of time and hassle for what should have been a 20 second call.

Had significant trepidation after a poor experience with the Show 1 display... on the third and that screen continues to pixelate. I’ve had a better experience with this version. It works well, except for trying to upsell me to Amazon music so I can stream the same song on multiple devices at the same time. Speaker quite good and the screen though small, is adequate... though I’ve not tried to watch full length movie, but the I don’t use my phone for streaming either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, good sound, easy to set up and use
reviews.reviewText: Nice size for a nightstand. Although the screen is small, it is very functional (but my preference is to watch a video on a different screen). Sound quality is good. It was very easy to set up. I prefer it over the Echo Spot. I do like the Spot, I just prefer the larger rectangular screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Amazon device but disappointed on missing everything else.
reviews.reviewText:
As an Alexa device it works great but that's about where the great stops.
They need a software update to allow better features like hulu and Netflix apps that we are all used to having on all of our screens these days. Even there own Amazon prime video and music is horrible to navigate they make it so you pretty much cant just browse and search easily on the screen.
I feel the sound and video quality is good for a small device but this could have been and still could be a home run with just a few more simple apps that we are all so used to having.

This is nice because you can Facetime we have noticed that it also listens in to our conversations. Our stand up Alexa never Just started speaking regarding an ongoing conversation. This one does way too often. We were speaking of a math problem nothing big but she began answering unsolicited. This is a complete invasion and I now keep her offline until I need something or want to play music. The music quality isn't as great either. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job though loading is little slow...
reviews.reviewText:
I'm not a big time Alexa person but for $49, I can't say no. It's nice to have more infos on a screen along what Alexa provide through voice.

Be Aware that you have give it a different name other than "Alexa" to wake it up if you already have another device like The Cube. I have the Cube and it was causing confusion since I used Cube to call "Alexa". I would think Amazon is smarter than this knowing people will have more than one Alexa device in the same room.

I basically use it as an echo device and a clock. Also handy that it can pull up my security cameras. The suggestions it throws at me don’t really bother me. The microphone could be a little better, but it’s not terrible. Speaker quality us decent. It does many things, is good at them but not mind-blowingly so—that would be like expecting a swiss army knife to be the best steak-knife/scissors/nail file/tooth pick. Overall, pleased.

Packed with a lot of features into a compact smart display that can easily fit on your nightstand. Access to all of Alexa's voice commands and a few handy privacy features like a physical shutter. Scroll left from the right side of the screen for a new control panel that includes shortcuts for alarms, watching videos, playing music, controlling your smart home, seeing your skills (basically apps for Alexa) and communicating with other Alexa devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 is EASY to install. Period.
reviews.reviewText: I was able to unbox, connect it in my bedroom, integrate, customize (turn off ""try this", etc.), and update my Echo Show 5 within 10 minutes of receiving it. It was absolutely no problem and it immediately took the place of my Echo that I'd moved to my office. It was Soooooo easy! I have 5 Echo smart speakers, including one that I integrated with my Klipsch sound system. I really like Alexa. And have never had issues with it.

I bought this during Amazon Sale days and it has been fantastic. My lady friend bought one as well and while she was in Tahoe for three weeks we could chat face to face with just a voice command. I LVE the special alarm clock setting. So gentle and easy to wake to compared to a screeching clock alarm. I will pop for the expensive stand as it will make it easier to adjust when talking to someone.One of my best buys. I use my echo dot but not as much as this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not really sure what this is good for
reviews.reviewText: Unless you want to spend your mornings yelling in frustration at an unresponsive device, do not buy this as an alarm clock. Alexa has a surprising amount of difficulty hearing my pleas for mercy while the alarm is playing. It doesn't turn off when I want it to, it doesn't allow me to adjust the snooze interval (9 minutes), and it does a terrible job of resetting the alarm to a new time (it simply adds another alarm). I guess I'll go back to my phone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Going back to the Lenovo Smart Clock...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the Show 5 to use as a smart clock. I quickly learned that the Lenovo Smart Clock has more useful features.

First, I have a speech impediment. Unlike Siri and Google, Alexa rarely understands me. I don't have to use my voice with Lenovo.

Second, the Lenovo has far more settings for alarms such as setting the default snooze duration, setting alarms for certain days of the week and toggling alarms on and off.

The screen is bigger and more crisp. Sound is crisp. I am sure a lot of people love the Show 5

Amazon - I would be a prime beta tester for Echo products given my speech impediment.

I bought this on Prime Day on a whim. I thought it would be just okay, but it ended up being great. The screen is crystal clear. Don't be fooled by the low resolution numbers. The screen is small enough you do not need any additional pixels. The sound is only mediocre and struggles at high volume. I use mine with a decent pair of wired headphones to stream Spotify and watch programs on Prime Video. I also have an Echo Spot and this is significantly better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely a good connection for the echo system
reviews.reviewText: First of all is a nice design simple screen nothing too big the sound is definitely loud for that little thing...have it for the kitchen so when my wife is cooking she can listen to music or have any questions when she's cooking..and one of the most important thing is it's connected to my camera so she needs to watch over our son she could just ask show me the bedroom camera..little gadgets like this can make your life very simple

reviews.reviewTitle: High privacy with this Show. Not your mother's clock radio!
reviews.reviewText: I love this beautiful, smart show 5. I got it on prime day. It looks like an alarm clock. But it has Alexa. I can see my. Blink cams and my Ring doorbell. I can make video calls and watch videos. I feel comfortable with the added privacy of manually closing the camera lens.

When using the Alexa system and Ring security this makes it easy to answer the door or monitor any cameras from whatever room or rooms you place it. In the kitchen it's easy to look up a recipe or even order items for delivery since you can see pictures of what you order.

I took advantage of the Prime Day deal and which I turned in my original Echo Show in exchange for a gift certificate and a discount off any Echo product. Enter Echo show five.

First off, I didn't realize it was going to be so small. I do enjoy the camera on and off switch future and for a little sing and makes a fairly big sound, especially when playing music. Because of its size it fits better on my desk, but the pros kind of ended there.

This thing is constantly malfunctioning, and not recognizing what I say to it. When I try to get the news report, it says that it's happening but it doesn't happen about half the time. The same thing is happening with Amazon Music. It isn't my internet. I have 1gbps fiber, and an Archer c7 router. I've been having to restart it, as in unplug it and replug it in. In my experience, it is laughable to think that this model is somehow superior to the original Echo Show.
Connects to Ring cameras, Sirius XM, nice wake up feature on alarm (gradual brightness), good sound quality. Can turn audio off and block video camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great replacement for the 'old' bed side clock radio
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this little Echo to replace an old clock radio because I could not get quality FM classical music radio in the Atlanta area. Now a simple request to Alexa via TuneIn, Amazon music, or Pandora I get awaken to pleasing classical music.
Was a bit tricky setting up even though I have several other Echo products - it required that I register the device with Amazon before I could connect. All in all a nice addition to our home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for my home office desk
reviews.reviewText: When the ES5 was announced, I immediately reserved one with Amazon points that I've accumulated. My total cost was $15. This is one neat little geegaw to have on my desk. Setup was a snap. The "try this" chyron was somewhat annoying, but it's easy enough to suspend rotation of the "try this" suggestions after the first run through any given screen. Very cool little device. I'll definitely be buying a few Echo Show 5's for Christmas gifts a bit later in the year.

Easy to set up, doesn’t take up a whole lot of room and does what it’s supposed to do. I bought this to replace my original echo show which was just a little too big for the bedroom. While the sound quality is not nearly as good, and I knew it wouldn’t be, it is still a solid little unit and does exactly what I need it to do which is play music, get scores and news headlines and to serve as a clock and an alarm. I also got it at an excellent price on prime day which makes it even better!

I was really looking forward to this and grabbed a pre-order on the day they were announced. Overall, it's impressive. Small, sharp looking, great screen for the size and the audio quality is quite surprising. If you plan to use it to listen to music and have a decent Bluetooth speaker you can certainly connect it. Just know that this isn't going to provide room-filling sound on its own.

Here's my issue.

I replaced the Echo Dot in my master bedroom with this Echo Show 5. The dot was responsive and I ran it through an external Bose speaker. I could speak to the dot in a normal voice from anywhere in the room and it would respond. The Echo Show 5 does NOT. I find myself shouting at it...and getting angry about it. It's the one room in the house now where my "Alexa..." command is usually always repeated and then followed by a few choice words.

I really love the Echo Show 5. It has been a game-changer in my kitchen with recipes and other videos. I also use it to watch outside through my Wyze camera. However, here comes the HATE part of the item. The "try" suggestions are NONSTOP. I uploaded a personal photo to be the screen saver and the "try" suggestions cover parts of the screen at all times. This makes me consider returning it and not recommend it to my friends and family members. If that option could be turned off or at least reduced in how many, it would be perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: I must confess to one problem
reviews.reviewText: There is one thing that makes me unhappy with Alexa. I am hard of hearing and wear hearing aids and even at higher volumes I have terrible problems understanding what she is saying. Sadly there is no option to change voices in the app and no sound balance adjustment in the device. Her voice sounds muffled and totally lacks the higher tones which make speech understandable. This is something that really needs to be addressed!

I've been trying to use my Echo Show 5 as a bedside alarm clock. It has proven difficult to configure wakeup alarms. Somethings you can do in the app, others you need to do via voice commands. Sometimes an alarm starts by playing my music, but after a few seconds goes into standard alarm mode. More recently, the alarms disappeared from the Echo show and I can't reconfigure them via the app. Amazon's software, at least for this alarm use case, is not ready for prime time.

Very difficult to configure, badly designed screens. Help effectively non-existent. Insists on pushing commercials for Amazon at every opportunity. Simplest setups become major problems. Definitely not worth it, unless you enjoy Alexa parading Alexa in your face when you'd like to see (not hear) the time.
