I am really happy with this! This is the first voice assistant product that I have purchased... I got this on Amazon Prime Day and got a great deal on it! I see that they have it on sale again... I would recommend grabbing one! It works with my Blink Camera and the sound quality with Amazon Music is ~ AWESOME! This sounds better than 99% of the little Bluetooth speakers that I have! Again - great product and I do recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: A total let down when I needed to stay in touch
reviews.reviewText: Bought two of these because I was moving out of state and wanted to stay in touch with my finance until she could join me. Video calls worked great for almost a month and then it got to the point where my finance could only hear me if I held the device up to my mouth to talk. Got a replacement and the replacement had the same issue. A Google search revealed that many people have had this issue and Amazon hasn't stepped up to resolve it. Returned both of them and will not buy another echo device because of this. Don't buy if you want to use it for video calls.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Hulu, no Netflix, just amazon and YouTube 😡
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to watch Netflix and Hulu and other things on this device. It even says that it is compatible with Hulu. It is NOT. The other thing that bothers me is they seem to have the same business plan as “apple”. Where it feels like my hands are tied. I can only do things related to amazon brand whatever. I wish it was more like a tablet that had an integrated A.I. (Such as Alexa). Very restrictive. Pretty disappointed, even with the half off for prime day. Don’t recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probably the worst voice recognition of all the alexas I've owned.
reviews.reviewText: This is probably the least responsive Alexa I've moved it around the room, had things behind it, had it by itself, it just doesn't hear well, which is quite annoying. In general I feel like Amazon needs to step Alexas game. I can't wait for newer generations to come out and this one to be relegated to a different room. Also I don't have the stand, that could help but it's half of the price I bought the device for, can't find that worth it.

I love this little compact Echo. Perfect for my office desk. Since i actually purchased this to listen to my favorite talk show in the afternoons I was excited! it played my station the first day i got it, then nothing. It "can't find" my station which is broadcast from Radio.com. i need to figure this out.

I love this, I bought two. one for my night stand and one where I sit to watch TV.
I can answer the phone , ask questions, set the alarm, it dims for night sleeping.
the colors are bright, and probably a few more things that I haven't found to do.
really enjoy this.

It does everything, its simply wonderful. The best part is that the cost is reasonable. A lot of bang for your buck. Simply put I could not be happier with this unit and I am seriously thinking of replacing my other household alexa units with this one!

reviews.reviewTitle: What the Spot should have been
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for bedside or desk. Screen is sharp and clear and you can actually watch video on it. You could watch video on the Spot too, but not for long. My only complaint is that I don't think the Show 5 microphones hear me as well as some of my other Echo devices.

This is a fun product! It’s like talking to an intelligent person that can give you video answers. I also use it for an alarm cloc that wakes me up with music. I don’t have an Amazon music subscription but I have a free IHeart radio account that Alexa uses. I can watch YouTube videos on it along with movie trailers. I use it to make a shopping list. I can use it to communicate with a family member that has an Alexa speaker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this! Well worth the money. Will not live without
reviews.reviewText: Love this little device. Use as alarm clock. Also added sleep sounds to it and fall asleep to rain sounds every night. It wakes me and tells me the weather every morning.

I have had this device for only one day. I already have a huge regret. I wish I had bought two.Only some of the negative reviews I had read kept me from buying two, when they were priced at $49.99. One review stated sound quality was worse than the echo dot 2. Not true!! Sound quality is surprisingly good. Another reviewer stated it was very light weight and cheaply built. Also, not even close to the truth. This is a very solid built device. I would definitely recommend this device to all my family members.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazingly power packed for the size
reviews.reviewText:
Amazon does not fail to amaze with their quality. Had bought their echo, echo dot, firesticks and very recently the Echo show (5"). Was prepared for a lower sound but the amazingly small device packs a punch.
It works as a photo frame (connect to FB or Amazon photos), integrates Alexa well, speaker is sufficiently loud and best part was a "device group" supported so that multiple Amazon Echo or Echo Show can play same music using single command. Had to change the wake word to ensure it doesn't conflict with existing Amazon Echo. One great addition for Amazon devices could be to "allow custom wake word". Overall, worth the price.

I just got this recently. I am enjoying requesting music (by performer or genre) and playing some of the games (some of the games, however, seem to have glitches, and Alexa doesn't always understand me, no matter how clearly I enunciate), and I love being to set and cancel alarms by voice command. It's the perfect size for my night table, and the clock face I chose is perfect for me -- my favorite color isn't often available in a clock face!

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be a lot better may get the Show 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: I had the first gen echo show and the echo 330. When my show blew up and the screen cracked after a power surge I bought this. The display is nice as well as the motion detection and camera hider. That is were the good things stop sadly, the speakers are crap. The Show 5 is right next to my bed and I have trouble listening to music/ audio books. The show also has trouble with voice commands. It may take me 3 or 4 times for Echo show 5 to even start listening to the request.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent but could be so much better
reviews.reviewText: The biggest thing people need to remember is this is essentially an echo dot with a screen, this is not a tablet with Alexa. With that in mind, the speaker is on par with the 2nd gen dot, worse than the 3rd gen dot. It has a few extras that the screen allows for but even then I could only say 3 stars overall. No way to turn off the ads, no way to turn off the suggestions, worse speaker than what should be inside it...

We have several Alexa products including echo auto and I have to say this happen to be the best one. The sound is great, the video quality is great. We have 3 in the house and so far have no problems. My wife love the bedside ability to watch a movie without waking me up. The kitchen one is great when needing quick information or flash Briefing. The downstairs one to take a look at my Arlo cameras or call upstairs ( video call is great). I'm a fan!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa has all kinds of recipes! For Air Fryer. For Slow Cooker. I love her!
reviews.reviewText: My neighbor has an Echo Dot. I fell in love with it while dog sitting. I’d ask Alexa to play country for 2 hours when I was leaving to help the dog feel like she wasn’t alone. I purchased one for myself & put it in the bedroom. I play music for an hour to put me to sleep & sleep through the night. Alex has found all the oldies I asked for. Then I had to get an Echo Dot for the living room. If there is a sale I’ll get one for the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: A GREAT alarm clock and morning entertainer.
reviews.reviewText: I liked everything about this version of the ECHO Show. It makes a great alarm clock, dimming a night as not to be so bright. A great picture, fantastic sound and all the great features of the Echo family. I have even taken it with me on trips in the travel trailer for entertainment and alarm clock features. (It does need WiFi, so i either connect to the campsite WiFi or use my unlimited cellular data plan as a hot spot on my iPad).

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for a very reasonable price !
reviews.reviewText:
Love this little device!! I already have a perfectly good Echo but have been wanting to
try the new Echo Show. I was having trouble justifying the cost so when I saw the Echo Show 5 at an amazing price during Amazon days I decided this was my opportunity to experience the show without committing a lot of money. I also purchased a stand to help with the sound (this little device puts out some powerful sound! I will probably eventually get a full size version but for now we are loving loving our Echo Show 5!

reviews.reviewTitle: Another good product from the Alexa family
reviews.reviewText: This new Echo has sharp image and good sound with the advantage of heightened privacy options. I like the shape of the screen too as opposed to the cute but impractical round older model. I wish the screen was larger. Very good for watching Amazon prime TV. If it was larger and had some ports to add a dongle for example and use to replicate your TV, it would be fantastic and an option to people with cable TV in only one room

The Echo Show is very simple to setup. I have it set to have the clock, temp and date showing all the time. It’s handy to ask it the high for the day as I’m getting ready in the morning. As time goes on, no doubt I’ll find several uses for it. It was a great buy on Prime Days.

I love this echo: small, portable and convenient. I love everything about its capabilities: from watching videos, music, weather and news, just to name a few of the best options. You can't go wrong, and no matter what anyone else says, the sound is incredible. I purchased this echo on PRIME DAY and it's worth every penny! Look for the positives, and the MUST-HAVES when purchasing.

I bought this to complement my 2nd gen Echo Dot, which now serves as my bedroom assistant and alarm. I chose the 5 because it doesn't take too much counter-top space on my bar and is easily moved around to serve as both a daily smart display and kitchen companion. Screen response is quick, sound fills my living room and kitchen, and Alexa integration is seamless. Minor notes: after streaming Spotify for a while, some tracks start off odd and sound distorted. I suspect this is more on Spotify's end, but not something to whine about for a return. Also, video flash brriefings (i.e. CNN) start with a stutter, but I imagine that's due to video buffering or something to do with the skill itself. It's nice to be able to make tea after a long day at work and settle down to listen to yet another episode of "Welcome to Night Vale" or to see information I request for a recipe or search query.

The camera has not worked on this device that I know of since I got it. I did not have it turned on for the first few months I owned it, now I want to use it and nothing I do will get it to work. Very cheap echo product. Poor quality. Also the voice recognition is not good. Very disappointed with Amazon.

Update - 10-8-2019
After a very prompt response from Amazon tech support because of my last review. I downloaded a software update and the Echo Show 5 has worked significantly better. Camera is working well and performance has improved. Still not my favorite Echo product but it working well enough now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Might have to switch over to another device line
reviews.reviewText: Just okay as a smart device. Don't like how I have to yell at it so it can hear while playing anything. Whisper works when it wants to. Nice looking clock though. Audio dies sound good though for such a small device. Comparing the sound to a Dot is night and day. Worst part of the echo is it cannot be used as a simple speaker for other apps to send audio to. Example, Samsung Smartthings cannot send responses to.

Very nice little Show. Takes up a lot less room than my 1st gen Show, however the screen is not that much smaller. It seams to me the adds and suggestions are ether not as often or far less intrusive. I hardly notice them on the 5. To me the screen also appears sharper and more vibrant. $90 is a little steep, but if you can get in on sale like Black Friday do snap one up, if you can wait that long. They had them at $50 on Prime Day. I figure they’ll be about the same on Black Friday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay - but not really much different
reviews.reviewText:
The Amazon Show is simply another version of the Amazon Spot except its screen is a 5-1/2” rectangular instead of a 2-1/2” circle. Both have great image and sound quality. The Spot is much more expensive and that doesn’t make much sense. I had no trouble setting up the Spot but the Show was a nightmare. Don’t know why – same setup procedure.

Check them both out. I wonder what the next ‘invention’ will be?

I love the alarm sound. I like asking questions, I like the music. I like it gives weather and temperature all the time. i like it will give you the top 5 news of the day off of CNN TV and will contiune CNN radio news. I haven't had it very long but I know there is more to use it for,

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool addition to Alexa empire though seldom used
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Show as a way for my girlfiend to keep up with her mom living across the country. For health reasons that did not pan out. I kept the Show adding to number of the rooms with Alexa and as a novelty thinking I could play movies on it. The camera and display on it have been cool to have but the sound quality on the movies suck. I've stopped using in that capacity. Otherwise, I enjoy that it shows the time, the news messages that it put on as part of the screen saver are interesting and seeing the words on the screen when using it with music is pretty cool. I've not used it much as a Face time type interface.

Buen equipo y muy útil.
Le falta tener más velocidad y mejorar la versatilidad del software. No tiene opción para tener varias cuentas o manejar distintos usuarios a la vez.

reviews.reviewTitle: Recipes and images at a glance!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a novelty and now find it to be very useful. I keep it in the kitchen, viewable from many locations. I have it working with a outside camera that shows me the front door and driveway at a quick request, great as you are awaiting guests as well as security. I use it for recipes as I am cooking, read as you cook. Oh yes, and I listen to music and use the screen default to show weather forecast at a glance. As useful as you make it!
It make a great alarm clock

I traded my Echo (2nd generation) in for this Echo Show, and I'm so disappointed. I knew the sound quality would not be as good as my only Echo, but it's just me in a one bedroom apartment, so I thought it would be an okay trade. However, the voice recognition is horrible. I find myself repeating demands, I have to make sure I am louder than the Music playing from the Echo for it to hear when I say Alexa. It doesn't understand me 20% of the time., which is frustrating when all you want is to set a sleep timer, or an alarm. These things never happened with my old Echo, or my Echo Dot, I'm beyond disappointed and have a bit of buyer's remorse.

This echo show 5, besides being my fifth echo device purchase, serves as a replacement for the echo spot I used on the nightstand. It takes the place of the echo spot and serves mainly as an alarm clock. The advantages over the spot are its ability to show more information and a better sound quality. The spot did its job adequately, but I appreciate the upgrade the show 5 delivers. Another winner from Amazon as the Echo continues to evolve and improve.

We've grown to love Alexa in our home. Video chating with the kids or just checking in on them was definitely a significant upgrade over just having a regular Echo Dot in the room. The fact that they can also watch movies we've purchased for them that connects to our Amazon account is perfect for Saturday nights when they get to watch a movie in bed to fall asleep to. The volume is pleanty loud for the bedroom and I don't have a complaint about the device itself. Alexa can be a little annoying if you don't perfectly enunciate but I'm sure that will continue to improve.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handy little device with alot of capabilities.
reviews.reviewText: I like the compact design making it easy to put down on any table. It has a good speaker if you want to keep music contained to that area. Im able to use my smart light cameras and my fire cube as well as smart plugs with short simple commands. The on screen text is no issue to me. At night the screen dims Its self or changes color so it dosent disturb your sleep.Its a good device for to start a smart home without having to buy hubs.

What an ideal piece of technology for an elderly person. My mom is no longer able to use her iPad, iPhone, nor PC. But she can ask Alexa Show to tell her today's weather, tomorrow's prediction, her horoscope for the day and I can plug in all of the reminders for her medications, elevating her legs, and her calendar of who is coming over to take care of her. The voice is pleasant too. Additionally, we loaded an audible book on to her system and she just has to ask Alexa to read her book (picks up where it was left off), or to play her favorite music.

So I have echo dot 3rd generation echo show second generation Phillip's hue lights love them all alot people fuss about the ads but its stuff u might not think to try to me not that big deal and u can turn them off some people say sound not great but i think pretty good has equalizer option so u can adjust bass and treble it's more for like night stand and office yes it is small but if u want something for living or kitchen i go with echo show 2nd generation they run deals sometimes

Overall this echo is pretty darn cool. Ask it to show my wireless cameras and it does. Easy set up. I would have given it 5 stars if the screen was a higher quality than it is. Maybe it's because my home screen is a pic that was uploaded from my phone. Overall it's a pretty cool little toy

Works as expected. Always happy with Alexa and this screen size is nice for any room. Sound is surprisingly good for such a small device. I would't make it your primary music speaker, but for casual listening it is great. It also does great viewing content, but I wouldn't use it as a primary screen either. Both generations of the big Echo Show are better for that. All in all I am very happy with this device.

I ordered 3 of these for Christmas. The idea was for us to have one and our parents to have one so my kids can call and video chat with grandparents whenever they want. We've been using ours for a month or so and after a few weeks the camera just stopped working. The whole purpose of buying these was to be able to video chat. I'm so disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera is broken in latest firmware update
reviews.reviewText: As of a week or two ago the camera has stopped working - and yes, the shutter is open. When trying to make a video call it appears to pause.think for a second, then ignores the input. A factory reset fixes it, but it "breaks" again within a few days.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor comprehension, sound, and music selection with annoying ads.
reviews.reviewText: Sound is ridiculous. It’s all bass. CONSTANT ads that eat up data. Comprehension and answers are poor. I could ask for any kind of music on my G—glen Home and it could find it. Alexa doesn’t recognize many genres like Trop rock and will play stupid versions of songs like remakes and karaoke when I can find the original and play it through the Amazon music app on my phone. All-in-all, it has been pretty useless and annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it overall, but sound quality isn’t as good as I expected
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my first gen Echo with this Echo show. I had reservations about it because the sound quality on my original Echo is terrific. I like many features of this new Echo, including the ability to view weather reports, news, movie trailers, recipe instructions, lyrics to songs it plays, etc. I’m disappointed overall with the sound quality. It is not as nearly good as the first gen Echo. That’s the only “gripe” I have about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Getting occasional popping sound from both units.
reviews.reviewText: Every once in a while a popping noise comes from it when doing nothing other than that they work great... I have one at vacation cabin and one at home... better reception than cell phones! Only problem is slight delay in voice and video so we overall each other and it blurs if you move fast.

What's not to love! I'm a huge fan of Amazon and Alexa products and this one has not disappointed. It's replaced my 3Rd gen echo dot in my bedroom and I'm very happy with it. The sound is even better than the echo. It's even nicer than the bigger show.

reviews.reviewTitle: A more compact desktop smart device with screen
reviews.reviewText: I like that it is a little smaller than the original SHOW. Still sounds great and has a nice sized touch screen. Smaller but that's great for my desk which can get cluttered easily if I let it. So, I always can see what's on when I need it.

I love this thing! I own 3 different echo devices (spot, dots, and this) and this is by far my favorite. Use it for my main hub. Microphone is fantastic, picks up even when I think it won't. Video is nice and clear, great build and aesthetics. Physical camera cover is great for privacy conscious. The price is right too, if you don't want to shell out for a full size show. This has all the capabilities of it's big brother, in a compact package. Speakers are decent. This replaced a fire tablet/dock that was in "show" mode. Vast improvement.

I love that Alexa is both in my bedroom (Echo Show 5 upstairs) and kitchen (Echo downstairs) so I can have her take notes ALL the time for me as well as keep me company and answer all my random questions as they arise. I like that Echo Show 5 does video but mainly that it acts like a clock on my nightstand AND shows date and outside temperature. I replaced an atomic clock that I had which was no longer functional for weather. The Echo Show 5 also sings me to sleep! Just the best.

Ok, after 1 week of frustrating trials I think I have a good idea of how this works. Very frustrating at first. I haven't added anything to it yet, just a confusing alarm clock. I'll let you know how my ordeals go as soon as my door bell can goes. I have to send a camera back because it doesn't work with this clock which is frustrating because that's why I bought this thing for home monitoring. Don't discard the box yet!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great bedside alarm. Wish I had one for the kitchen.
reviews.reviewText: I like that I can change the clock face. I bought on a whim on amazon day. Great price. I have it play audible titles and put on a sleep timer at night when I go to bed. It does that great. I’m checking the weather on it in the morning. I would like for it to have a usb plug in like my old alarm clock did but not really a deal breaker. I know there’s more it can do but it does what I want it to do. Oh it plays K-LOVE.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just got it and so far, so good~
reviews.reviewText: This was the typical EASY Amazon product setup. I already have assorted Alexa smart things in the house so I'm hoping my learning curve for this will be easy. So far the sound (for listening to music) is really good and the picture quality is as well. It looks kind of like a bedside alarm clock so that's where it might end up. You can click a little button to turn OFF the camera as well as the microphone, which is nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Happy we bought the Echo Show
reviews.reviewText:
The ease of use is great. I bought one for me and one for my mom. I use it to drop in on her to make sure everything is okay. She has even learned how to use some of its features. She made a shopping list and now listens to music. I’ve had an echo for several years and the show is a great addition. Hoping to add the Echo Auto soon.

The stand is a must have if you are using the show to drop in. Otherwise it points at the ceiling.

I've now owned my E-Show 5 for 4+ weeks and have enjoyed using it in my bedroom as an alarm clock, information center, and obviously...smart device control point. I wish Amazon allowed for better control over the screen and camera. I appreciate physical shutter to block the camera but concerned it'll deactivate the dimming function. I wasn't hesitant to buy it on Prime Day but not as compelled to buy a 2nd device at regular price.

I wanted it mainly as a camera display for me ring doorbell. (It does that) I also enjoy using it to play healing sounds while I meditate and or to listen to music while I am enjoying my morning coffee. It’s also good to see as a quick weather snap shot so for me it’s good.

The Echo Show was was to set up and do a software upgrade. I selected the clock face I wanted by asking Alexa to show me clock faces. It does scroll showing weather, news and Alexa tips. This hasn’t bothered me and I was impressed with the sound quality with a small device.

Except for the 5" screen size and the one speaker, it mirrors the Echo Show 10". The sound quality is nowhere near that of the Echo Show 10". If there could be an improvement of screen size to 7" and return some stereo sound to the device, it would be a better device. Overall, I would still recommend it. However, I'm replacing one of the two that I just brought with another Echo Show 10". The camera could use a little help as well.

Ever since I bought my first Echo Show, it's been sitting on my office desk. It's very helpful throughout the day. But it is way too big for a bedside clock replacement, so when this one came out, I was all in. I'm very happy with it. The buttons on top are convenient in the middle of the night to turn sound up or down when you don't want to speak to alexa. Now this doubles as my alarm clock instead of my phone. It's great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Our Experience Trying to Use as a Baby Monitor
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this to link with a highly rated security camera we got to use for a baby monitor. It worked fine. We just had to ask Alexa to show us the girls room and the image appeared on the screen. I love the idea of this. However, the picture quality was pretty blurry compared to the picture quality of the same camera when looking from my iphone. There was also about a 4-second delay on the Echo image that didn't exist from the phone app either.

The whole point was that I wanted access to a clear, live image of what was going on in my girls room. This didn't provide that very well. Ultimately I decided to return the Echo and just have a cheap audio monitor in the room. Then I can open the camera on my phone when I also want to see what's going on (since I'm obviously not going to leave the app open on my phone all the time).

I think the 2nd generation Echo Show is HD and may work better for this, at least as far as picture quality. I'm not sure why the live delay existed and if that would be better.

I traded in an Echo Dot for this unit and (for me) it fits the bill perfectly. I use the display to view simple graphics like time and weather. I do hope that more Alexa skills become available to utilize the display, for me Tides would be a perfect choice. The speaker is better than the Dot it replaced but I'm glad the ES5 retains Bluetooth connectivity so I can link to my stereo system too. Very happy with this purchase!

Immediately one of my favorite Echo devices. The screen is incredible and an amazing change for me who has had nothing but Echo dots.

With the screen, I am able to read and hear what the Alexa says, unlike the Echo dot in which you must concentrate on what she says.

The recommendation scrolls isn't exactly my favorite feature and can be turned off, but I enjoy reading some of the news it suggests.

Lastly, at night, I noticed that the recommendation is turned off, the screen is dimmed, and stays on the clock. Honestly, my favorite feature. Especially at night, I no longer have to be blinded by my phone screen at night, even when the brightness of the phone is all the way down. Now, I can just peek over at the dim but visible clock face.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good enough screen, ok speakers, great voice recognition.
reviews.reviewText: The speaker sounds like echo dot speakers echoing in a larger housing. The screen is decent, not particularly sharp or colorful, but viewing it from a distance is good enough. The voice recognition hasn’t had any issues. No internal battery unfortunately so there’s no option to take this from room to room even for a few minutes. I’d buy another one, but would continue to pair them with home entertainment speakers for sound quality as I do with my other smaller echo devices.

Really like the product and only took a star away because there is no way to disable the Alexa prompts. I will get more for the house though, especially if they are discounted on Prime Day. Picture quality from Prime Videos are pretty darn good for such a small product.
Bought this on prime day. Delivered a day early and works with my ring doorbell and flood light.

reviews.reviewTitle: I think this is best echo device overall
reviews.reviewText:
I traded in my echo 2 with this echo show 5, my daughter likes it so much. it has better sound quality, a decent screen which is also a beautiful clock. and the price is much cheaper than echo show 2.
it matches every expectation I would say, especially when you could trade in and get 25% off.

I bought the Echo Show 5 during Prime Day to put next to my home office desk and use it to run youtube or prime video in the background. Unfortunately the small size makes it next to useless for either. Navigation between videos is a hardship. My phone has a bigger screen and is easier to use for navigation. This is very much just a fancy clock with Alexa attached. Get it for that if you'd like but I would not recommend it for watching any sort of video.

I got this to work with my front door camera the blink xt2. The camera is great. The problem is using the echo show 5 I can’t talk back to the person at the door. 🤨 using the blink app I can. Big surprise to me and others that the echo would not let you talk via your cam. 😳 I even talked to echo support. They told me echo show 5 can’t talk backvia the door cam. 🥺 I’m hopping Amazon will correct this problem in the near future.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s alright. Not what I expect for it.
reviews.reviewText: I was excited for this but screen is small like iPhone small. Seem like there not much to do on it. Too bad it doesn’t work like regular tablet like do research or watch YouTube. Would I buy this again? Nope. Basically using for just to look at time and music. Not all music can play unless you subscribe to unlimited music. I rather stick with regular tablet because it does everything the echo show 5 does.

This is our first Amazon Echo product and we’re hooked! We especially love the JW Access skill feature that allows us to hear content streamed directly from JW.org such as the Watchtower study, bible reading & morning worship videos!

We also decided to purchase this specific device to compliment our Ring doorbell pro, so we can view our front yard from the screen in our kitchen when our hands are tied cooking, cleaning or wrangling pets.

I already have a full sized Echo Show (plus a couple Dots) and it is my favorite Echo product so I decided I wanted to try the smaller Echo Show 5. I put it in my kitchen so I can either watch video's or listen to music when I'm cooking. I live in a condo, so it isn't that big a space between my two Show's. First thing I did was set up music so I can play it in both places. I love both of these devices so much and I may even be spending more quality time in the kitchen!

love the show S, it replace my 2nd gen echo dot, great speaker,
i wish you could quick access certain favorite light switch on your home screen without the alexa loading so much. sometime i am on bed i don't want to speak to it, i just want to tap on screen to turn lights on.

my biggest issue with it when all the rooms lights are off, the show s will change all the text in bloody red color, as if some haunting thing is looking at you. can we at least change the color?

I bought this spur of the moment on Prime Day, didnt expect much from it. I own multiple Echos and Echo Shows and this little guy is my new fav! It actually hears me better then any Echo device to date, the screen is small but totally useable and the speaker is loud and nice. As a bonus it has a physical privacy shade for camera so you can be sure your not being spied on. Perfect size for those small spots where you need Alexa.

I owned the Echo Dot2 for several years. It worked fine, no issues whatsoever. I thought I'd take advantage of the trade-in deal during Amazon Days and upgrade to the Echo Show 5. I thought it would function the same except with a 5" display. Wrong! It's a POS. One of the things I enjoyed every morning with the Echo Dot2 every morning as I got ready for work was playing the Jeopardy App. The Jeopardy App does not work with the Echo Show 5, to say it's glitchy would be a huge understatement. The volume is also unstable as is its ability to connect to a Blue-tooth speaker. I'd gladly go back to my Echo Dot. This POS has ruined my morning routine.

Great device, most answers about units conversions are more spot-on than Google's smart speaker.

Besides I use it for smart light switches integration by Lutron, spotify expectedly works however unlike Google speaker can't mark songs liked.

Camera drop in and hardware shirm are great for checking in.

I also wished it could act as a security motion detection camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish they had this the first time.
reviews.reviewText:
Nothing that I dislike. However the voice recognition does need some help now and then.
I own 3 of these along with a first gen Echo Show. These are the right size to go almost anywhere. My primary reason for getting them was for video access to our Ring camera, it functions perfectly. Setup is easy and updates are automatic.
Unless you really need a large screen, save your money and get this.

Took awhile to use it but I purchased it to be used as a bedroom clock. I didn’t care for the clock’s feature that becomes brighter before the alarm goes off but was able to shut off the feature in settings. I like the screen dims when the lights go off, so the clock is night bright when you’re sleeping. Good sound when using to listen to music. Will be buying two more since my kids now want one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for bedside, desk, or small room
reviews.reviewText: Sound quality is somewhere between an Echo Dot and a full Echo. Screen isn't as big or easy to read as a full size Echo Show, but good for a bedside, desk, or small room. Essentially anyplace where space is at a premium. Affordable when it was on sale. Unfortunately many parts of my flash briefing don't take advantage of the screen. Can be challenging to use when there is another Echo device in the same room.

Sadly Alexa seems to be getting progressively worse at voice recognition over the past year. It typically recognizes the words (though even that seems increasingly less reliable) but it does not know what to do with them. For example “Alexa turn on bright in the living room” used to turn on all the lights in the living room on to bright. Now it says “A few things share the name living room. Which one did you want?” And is unable to turn the lights on. By the way there is only one living room here. Another example that used to work but doesn’t now is “Alexa resume/play on Roku.” Both resume or play the last thing Alexa was playing rather than pressing play on my Roku.

I had the echo dot before, the sound seemed a bit better, and the ability for it to pick up my voice was a lot better with the dot. I got this so i could use it to see my ring door bell which it does an ok job at, but to see the time or anything on the screen is bad, its always darkening to save energy i guess, but it makes it so i cant see it, and since the voice recognition sucks, i try to ask it 2-3 times before it will tell me the time quietly.
Love this echo. My favorite so far and I have them all. Great size and works perfect for a bedroom alarm clock.

I added this product to my total control smart home and it was a great add-on for smart controls and ring products. I have one in my office and one in the family room to give us voice control for our door locks, lighting and best of all it notify us of motion on our ring cameras.

It is very easy to set up and picks up all our existing alexa skills. The sound is very good if you want to use it for music. I don't use it for that purpose but i do use it to control my sonos system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handy compact voice assistant that needs getting used to.
reviews.reviewText: It was a gift for my husband’s birthday. It has taken a bit to understand and get used to. The concept is interesting and I’m sure that as time goes on we will learn to use it far more. Initially in set-up for the voice, it said we could give it a name other than Alexa, which we tried, but it prefers that only. Why offer that option if it doesn’t work? That’s my reason for 4 stars down the line.

reviews.reviewTitle: Display sharp, sounds like echo dot gen 3. No complaints.
reviews.reviewText:
It works well. It is Alexa !!! I have had echo dots for over a year.
I got 2 of these on Prime Day to monitor the doors via a cam.
The cam I bought is good, but the lag is too long ~ 20 seconds.
I don't know how much of that is the Wyze cloud lag and how much is Alexa.

I am going to try another cam to see if it improves.
Beyond the cam issue, it is an echo dot with a display.

Overall I really like this device. It is perfectly priced for what you get. The only disappointing thing about this product is the audio quality when you are calling another Alexa device. I called a friend who has an echo show and the audio is not loud at all and almost has a slight high pitch tone to it. I was going to give this 4 stars but I’m not sure if it is an issue with this device or the device that called me. If I receive a call from someone else on an amazon device and see the same issue I will most likely update the review.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can easily configure the Show 5 screen however you wish
reviews.reviewText: The hard part is finding a "settings" icon. So stop looking for one and just say "alexa show me settings." No surprise, the Settings screen pops right up. Then touch "Home and Clock" and then touch "Home Content" and you can turn off whatever you find irritating. And do much much more customizing. It's a clever little device.

I really like it but I'm using it as a alarm clock and I have to YELL ALEXA for it to hear me. Literally everytime to snooze the alarm or tell it to stop or play music I have to yell at it at the top of my lungs.

It doesnt hear me when I just talk.
Even when I tell it to learn my voice it says it knows me already.

My reg echo tower I can whisper and it can hear me across the room but the echo show 5 is deaf :(

I had heard it made a great alarm clock which what we were looking for. I can tell you that it is but it’s so much more! Great sound playing music, connected to my Ring Alarm system in minutes and the list just goes on!
It is a great piece of electronics and I bought some as gifts and the people love them! Don’t hesitate if your thinking about gettin one as it is a excellent item to have!

Set up was pretty easy... same as my Spot. Screen resolution is adequate, but not stellar. The size seems just about right for desk or bedside. I really like that now the weather can be added to some clock faces...would love to see that added to the Echo Spot, too. My only complaint is the same one I have with my Echo Spot. There NEEDS to be a card added to home settings to toggle on/off that annoying "things to try" There have been many people who have requested this feature added. For me, it's not needed and just a waste of screen space.

I was a little reluctant to buy this because of the previous reviews that mentioned the ads but I’m glad I didn’t let those reviews deter me. This echo show is pretty darn awesome. It does show suggestions from time to time on the screen but I haven’t found them to be disruptive at all. The alarm clock is great. It’s a soothing alarm that doesn’t blast out some obnoxious sound. I linked the show with my ring doorbell and love the fact that I can see the front porch from the bedroom. All in all this was a great purchase!

So far I have had this for 2 weeks and I’m very pleased with everything . The setup is quick and easy and it responds very well to my voice commands and is actually fun to just play with besides the fact that I don’t have to set my alarm clock anymore in fact it’s off my nightstand and Alexa is my new alarm and clock and resource for weather and traffic in the morning .....best thing I bought

I have the large Echo in the family room. I wanted a smaller Echo for the bedroom. I did not like the size of the echo Dot, but I did want something bigger. I was very impressed with the sound quality. The screen is the right size, it looks like a clock radio. I will be buying more for the rest of the family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Useful for Audio and Video
reviews.reviewText: Alexa mis-hears directions, plays the wrong podcasts, repeats the same news briefing, and plays the wrong episodes of podcasts, even when I am specific about my request. I have had to repeat my request 5 different ways, then I just give up and play the podcast on my phone instead. That is not why I got this device! Also, if I try to select a TV show or movie on Amazon, the choices are limited. I have better luck with my google dot when I ask about traffic, the weather, and podcasts. I should have returned it when I had the chance.

This unit surprised me, I have the original echo, and echo spot and a dot and this is a great addition, the screen is the size of an iPhone 8 I like that I can watch prime videos on this, the sound could be a little better, there is a noticeable difference between the initial volume settings 2 seems like 3 and no way to go between them. Overall tho this is a great addition to the Alexa family

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish the scrolling suggestions could be turned off
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo show! It seem less let integrated with my Ring cameras as well as several smart plugs I own. It has made my life so much easier and the screen is a good size. Fits rest on my nightstand and is very responsive. The only thing I wish was different is the scrolling suggestions which I can’t seem to turn off, hence I’ve taken away one star. Otherwise this is a great smart device.

Absolutely in love with the echo show. Perfect size. Great sound quality. Great picture quality. Wish I would have waited just a few weeks and purchased in prime day though. Thought it was a good deal. Then saw prime day price :-*
Great product. Very helpful.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you dont stream video on it, there's little point
reviews.reviewText: I love the show's sound quality and the display quality although it's small, but forget the 'skills.'Though I'm probably not the person to like the little apps or 'skills' in the first place I found them really frustrating to use, some of them even had paywalls and that was just really disappointing. As for the ads I dont think they're necessarily as bad as everyone is saying, it's mostly weather and news topics which can sometimes be interesting but most of the time are just passively annoying. It's really only a big deal because there's no way to control which ads roll by as far as I know and of course (also as far as I know) there's no way to turn them off. I like it, I just end up using it as a switch for my smart plug, a music player, or a streaming doo dad for amazon video.

reviews.reviewTitle: It can do much more than you think.
reviews.reviewText: My grand kids that are 5 and 6 love it and getting one for Christmas. Also my son's special needs son fell in love with it so she ordered it the minute he showed a happy response, but it's on back order as many must have loved this Item. I got it to pair with my ring doorbell pro and it works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome design, great display and beautiful sound
reviews.reviewText: Awesome smaller version that fits in amywhere, looks sharp, has amazing sound considering the size, only complaint is that you often have to repeat the wake word multiple times before it responds. Definitely would recommend and even considering purchasing another myself.

I was leary about getting the small screen echo show but it is a good size. I hooked it up to my ring doorbell and i can see my front porch without having to look on my phone which is very convenient. I would recommend buying this if you have the ring doorbell.

Bought a pair of these for our bed side tables. Works really well and just what we were looking for. I have them set up as a stereo pair, so they play music through both even though you command only one of the units. Alexa only responds through the unit closest to your voice - this way we can each instruct Alexa to set our morning alarms - individually. Plus has all the other great Alexa features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly what I wanted in a functional alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: I needed a better alarm clock than my phone so i used this as a discrete method and it turned out great! Love the fact I can turn the alarm off with my voice and then turn the lights on with my voice as well. I don't use any of the motion detection features which I didn't know about until now and will def use it after hours to turn my lights on and off.

I really liked it. It's less expensive than the Echo Spot, yet has a much larger screen, and better sound. quality. I also like the fact that it has an audio output, that can be plugged into an amplifier for even better sound.

I had a first and a second generation that I love but wanted something cheaper and smaller for my desk. The Show 5 foot the bill nicely. I was worried that the picture quality might not be good, but it is excellent. As good as any cell phone. The front is about the size of a good sized cell phone. All the features work as well as the larger model Shows do. I have been very happy with it.

Although it doesn't hear "Alexa" as well as my original Echo (which is in another room, and usually responds before Echo Show), it still works great. I like being able to see the time, remaining time on timers, and reading song lyrics.
Does get confused when I say "Good evening" ... sometimes it responds with a reply rather than performing the routine associated with that phrase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo 5 keeping it even without Hulu
reviews.reviewText: Picture for size. Smaller than I expected but bigger issue for me is that you can’t watch Hulu on it. Why? I have no idea. But will I keep it ? Yes because shows reminders and calendar items and easy to shop and pick item you want from screen. So I will keep the two I bought because I got them during Prime Day - at full price not to sure would be as satisfied bc of the Hulu issue. TuneIn works fine. And it is perfect size to be used as a bed side alarm clock - and it will likely find its way to a college dorm room for that purpose.

This works just fine. It shows me my cameras and alarms. Plays music and does the things Alexa should do. I'm not sure about the issue of forced ads. I have yet to see one. It will flash a "thing to try" every once and a while, but that's it. There are no advertisements flashed on the screen, and most of time it shows the clock. If you're looking for a smaller show for your house, this work great.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT PURCHASE FOR TWEEN'S USE - LACKS PARENTAL CONTROLS!!
reviews.reviewText:
I thought I would use a smart device for the tweenager's room - bad idea. There is no way to restrict what content they can access from the device nor restrict times they can use features, e.g. play videos/music, etc. Luckily you can restrict the ability to call/access camera but just not enough to place in a kids room. Wish I learned about this before purchasing..I didn't realize it until it was too late to return them.

I hope this helps another parent considering for their young kids - research any changes to parental controls before pulling the trigger.

I liked that you can set it to dim the display when it gets dark. I didn't like that you couldn't adjust the time on the brightening feature when you have the alarm set. It's either 15 minutes before the alarm goes off that the display starts getting brighter or nothing. I would like to see if you could adjust the time limit at 5 minute intervals. I would like the display start getting brighter at about 5 minutes before the alarm goes off. Not 15 minutes. when the light gets that bright that early before the alarm goes off it will usually wake me up before the alarm.

I now have 7 Alexa devices in my small home. I especially like that the clock can be read easily on the Show 5- my eyesight is poor. I have surround sound when all of the girls are going and I get more done because I ask her to turn the TV off and the music on. ♫ I will be 80 years old soon and my friends think I have gone overboard but they like to ask her questions when they visit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality and voice recognition is subpar
reviews.reviewText: While it is useful to have a screen, Amazon dropped the ball on the 360 degree microphone and speaker array of the echo dot which has better sound quality and voice recognition. For a device which cost twice as much that was a let down. Having a screen one would think they'd be able to view your camera from it, but the Ring integration will tell you about motion alerts but won't show a video feed or an image.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy set up great sound terrific price
reviews.reviewText: Love love our little echo show its perfect easy to set up sound quality is terrific we have the larger echo show in kitchen we also love but this one fits great on night stand highly recommend just the best and great price get it while you can it's great

I'm really happy I bought it. Some reviews I saw said it didn't sound great but all they had to do is go to the Alexa app go to the settings for the Echo Show 5 and their is a setting for the sound, you can adjust the bass, mid range and treble. It sounds great I don't have to connect to a Bluetooth speaker. There are so many things you can do with it I can't include in this review m

I have the original Echo Show in my livingroom. I use this one at my work computer. It is small enough so it doesn't block my monitor but big enough to read the display. I love all of the Echos. They are very easy to use for music, weather, timers, news, etc...

Nice form factor and easy to set up. The only thing I can fault it on is the insistence on showing my things to try and what to “watch next”. I’ve turned off all the options but it still does it. I only want to see the clock unless I tell it otherwise. That is a minor irritant to be honest but it would be five stars for that. I like the Nest Camera integration. That was an unexpected bonus.

I traded in my echo spot for the show 5. I couldn’t be happier. While the spot was awesome, I really like the larger viewing area. The sound is better. But, my favorite part is that you can turn off the camera. This is in my bedroom and being able to toggle the switch to cover up the camera eye is something I appreciate. I love being able to change the backgrounds. It fits perfectly on my side table.

Never thought I would buy such a device, but I can't live without it now. Both my wife and I are amazed at what the Echo Show 5 can do. It has made life so much easier. Buying one for each of my kids, and another for the bedroom. This is the future and Amazon has done an outstanding job integrating design, functionality, and becoming an integral part of our daily life. A must for every household. Can't recommend highly enough

The Echo Show 5 was easy to set up. Love the home screen that has time, date and temperature to get my day started. I keep it in the kitchen so I can listen to news with the Stream Player. I used to have a small TV in my kitchen to keep me updated when I was cooking. Since I do not have that anymore, the Echo Show 5 has filled that void. Although it does not show the local news, I am able to watch national news from a variety of stations. I've also viewed a Prime movie on the 5 inch screen that wasn't bad. Having it play in the background is all I really need so the small screen doesn't matter. Also like playing music with the lyrics appearing on the screen. Haven't played any game on it so cannot comment on that. Trending topics appear sporadically and suggested skills which allows the user to learn different activities. Very happy with this purchase, especially on Amazon Prime day.

I don't get the difference between a regular echo and a show other than the screen. IDK! I have Google Home products as well. I hate navigation and directions not built into Alexa. There are pluses and minuses with each. The skills could be much better. I think newer programmers and engineers need to take a user interface class and system building class that they give to a CS majors.

My home is now considered a smart home and controlled by me and Alexa. With the new Show 5 on my night stand, it is the perfect addition to control my home, connect to news, play music throughout and view the latest trending topics. Now I only maybe use it a few minutes a day, but it serves a purpose for sure. Setting reminders for my upcoming calendar events and watching some Youtube while falling asleep. The Show 5 is a great piece for the money, sounds good for the size and does what I need. Some people say it blasts you with Amazon ads, nope. You can simple turn off that in the settings. Pretty darn satisfied so far.
Very nice addition to Echo Dots. Primary use for me will be checking 3 security cameras without having to turn on computer or smartphone. Also like the screensavers and news updates apps.

Reading other reviews on this product show how some people don’t need to have certain technology in their possession!!! The item work just great, yes it has ads, but you can alter the items to show more or less and how frequent you want them to pop up. Sound is much better than previous echo dot. The only down side is that stand should have come with it since the item is smaller than other Echo show it would be easier to adjust for video calling option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I would have purchased 2 on Prime Day
reviews.reviewText:
I already have 2 Amazon Shows so thought I would try a Echo 5 with plug on Prime day.

This is a great little bedside unit, goes dim when dark and has surprising sound quality .

Now, if they can just make Alexa a little smarter ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome product for a Senior with Visual impairements
reviews.reviewText:
I'm writing this on behalf of my mother who is legally blind. First off she is in love with Alexa. She thinks she is cute and charming. At 90yrs old her voice isn't very loud but Alexa appears to pick up her simple commands. I was stunned by the fact that Alexa could listen to two languages and disambiguate instantly. This was hands down a killer feature.

Things that need to be worked on.
- The onscreen interface is clunky and a little slow to recognize swipes
- I wish there was a way to manage songs or playlists on the screen
- I wish that there was better Audible integration
- Podcast support isn't great and relies on 3rd party app integrations
- Playing a Youtube video is non-existent/difficult (I get that Google and Amazon are competitors so this may never be perfect)
- The alexa mobile app also feels very poorly designed as well as the web app.

I'm hopefull things will only get better

I purchased 4 of these. Great sound quality, display is nice, works great with Fire TV recast, can use as a video phone! I gave one to my daughter out of state and the quality is very nice! I recommend this device!

We have one of the original Echo Show's in our kitchen and we use it multiple times a day for everything from the weather to a recipe to video calling our kids. We wanted another one for our bedroom so we could use it to connect to our Ring doorbell so we can see who's at the front door without trying to unlock our phone to check! We also use it for multiple alarms each morning. Great investment for any room in your house!!!
it is used for music, games, and checking doorbell and viewing camera when alarm signals some thing in yard.

I love all of our Alexa devices. We haven’t had an alarm clock in our bedroom for a long time. We bought this to use as our alarm clock and love it. Perfect size, works great, and the screen is an added bonus. Love that you can personalize it and display pictures of our kids.

Absolutely love my Amazon 5 The one thing that I would like to see when the updated is if they make choosing a picture folder easier for the background! I made a folder specifically for those pictures and I can’t ever seem to get that pull up and I just does random photos out of my photo thing which is kind like I don’t like. Or maybe they should have photos like they do on the TV for background. Just a thought .

This is pretty much a perfect alarm clock. I've had an original Echo bedside for a couple years now, and I've always wished that I could just look at it and see the time instead of needing to ask it, but don't really have the space for a larger Echo Show.

I think Amazon expected this to be the intended use because this is the first Echo device with a built in slider to physically cover the camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will make phone calls and play music ..love it!
reviews.reviewText: 4.8. I purchased two..one a gift and one for my home! (I have two other items) Screen size good and Alexa works good also. Just a minor glitch with a voice command for music and it corrected itself. This is in living rooms so at night I unplug it. It can make phone calls hands free! I love the Alexa in bedroom due to can call 911 in a emergency 🚨. A good purchase I consider.

Great product for the price. I use the Echo in my kitchen area which is open plan to dining and family room areas. I can crank the sound up for enjoyment throughout. The kids have fun watching music videos and we’ve used it to find recipes and watch food prep videos. It's really an all around handy addition to our household.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't understand what you said like Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
Compare to Echo dot it seems to have hard time understand me
Like I said alexa turn off the light echo dot will work 100%
But with this it will tell you "I am sorry I can't find ___ light.."

Other then that is good device and looks good on kitchen top.
Also work with my ring camera so my wife can say show me the front door to see what is going on right the way even she is busy.

Her speaker blew out randomly. Didn't have it cranked up or anything. Just at teh default volume and it ended up giving out. I got a replacement one and the NIC and the software started to give out. Refused to let me type anything or even log in. The one time I was able to get my information into the Echo it wouldn't get back on the internet. May just of been bad luck but I got two bad ones in a row.

So its a nice compact version of the show but it was way too bright for a bedroom and not being able to rid the screen of notifications and hints detract from the whole alarm clock thing I had in mind. Please enable the ability to turn that stuff off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product and a perfect upgrade
reviews.reviewText: I graded in an Echo for this during the prime day sale, and I'm very happy I did. This is a factastic unit and I love having the screen. Its nice to be able to see the weather outside at a glance without having to ask. We use the screen a lot when we hear about some actor/actress/singer on the news and want to put a face to the name. For the cost we got it for during prime day this was a no brainer!

Works as good as my larger Show, being smaller it looks much nicer bedside, the night feature is perfect with it dimming the screen to just the clock. I was able to shut the previews & recommendations screen off for nighttime, there is also a slide button to close the camera lens for those who feel a lack of privacy. I love it and need to get another for myself this Christmas.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can see the clock face without my glasses, even at night!
reviews.reviewText: This little diddy is great! My concerns are not with the unit itself, but the limitation on access to smart devices that can be controlled audibly without dependency on 3rd party iOS or Andriod apps, an account with and reliance on the availability of a 3rd party server, and the availability of a corresponding Alexa skill. The Amazon smart plug supports a comparatively a streamlined interface, but is comparatively limited in features and as a rule, has a higher price point.

Love that gen 5 is smaller n compact. I like the camera u can close the shutter n mute the microphone. Loudness is great. Accurate on voice commands and the screen is no smaller than the gen 1 it just looks smaller as its rectangular. They did a great job with this echo

reviews.reviewTitle: Screen is great addition to echo
reviews.reviewText: How can Amazon make a better echo? Add a screen! I was surprise how Alexa integrates with the scree, Both work together when asking questions. I was surprise that I could play video from Amazon and youtube. The only thing I have not figure out is that I lost the ability to play video to my Firestick. Every time I request a TV show it does not play on my TV....

A wonderful addition to our Echo family, this unit is in our craft room at the back of the house. It makes checking our Ring Doorbell easy and has been great for Djing our craft sessions. Will be purchasing more units to add to the kitchen and mancave area.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty solid, but seems to have a harder time hearing me than my echo dots
reviews.reviewText:
Does everything I would expect it to so far. Shows me video from my Arlo cameras, shows me weather, recipes, etc., and otherwise responds to everything you might ask an echo/dot to do.

The only problem I have with it is that both my Echo Shows seem to have a harder time hearing me than my Echo Dots. They still work, but I find myself raising my voice more often.

I mainly purchased so that I have an accurate clock, which I need since I am a daily train commuter who needs to know the exact time. Actually, I wish it showed the seconds on the clock face that I like, but that is OK. "Drop In" works nice with my older Alexa device, so I use as an intercom between the two rooms that the devices are in. I just wish my default clock face would stay on instead of the screen switching to accommodate the "Try this" messages, but I have even gotten used to that somewhat. Night mode of the clock is perfect -- not bright and easily to read.

I've been using Alexa devices for a while now (older Show, Kindle, Fire Stick) and wanted something to replace my alarm clock while expanding Alexa in the home. This unit fit the bill. I've been able to do anything I wanted it and then some. It's my photo frame, my alarm clock, my radio and a quick way to get to calendar events. The sound is not phenomenal but adequate for my needs. As an expansion to my other devices, it was easy to setup and navigate.

I got this because it was a great deal on Amazon day and I have enjoyed it so far. The sound quality is been good for listening to music. Because the unit has a screen it was easy to get on the network and set up. I have moved it to a second location with ease. However, be advised that the plugs I had set up with the first installation so far have not been able to change networks. My Echo Show was easy to move and works very well.

Alexa Show can tell me the weather, or even show me the front door camera, but I can't seem to get it to do much more. I'm still learning, but was expecting more. It is not compatible with MyQ Garage Door software as simply trying to see local weather radar (vs. just temperatures) seems too tall a task. This leaves me wondering if I should have tried Google Home instead.

Got this to replace an Echo Spot in the bedroom because of the much larger display. Overall good quality, but the microphones in this one don't seem to be as good as the predecessors. Often, this unit will not register the wake word even when I'm less than 3 feet away from it and I have to speak more loudly and directly than I did with the previous Spot in the same location.

I really wanted to like this device but the sound quality is horrible. I have several dots and they have better sound quality. This Show is going back.

UPDATE: After speaking with an Amazon Tech, it was determined that the unit had issues with sound that is not typical for the Show 5. They sent a replacement and all is good. The sound is so much better and I will be keeping the Show 5.

Echo show 5 is a less expensive alternative to the regular Echo Show. Does all the same things, with a smaller screen and speaker. I'm not a huge fan of the smaller screen, but i 'm not using it for videos and it hasn't been an issue. Speaker is strong enough that I have it on 33% volume and it's too loud for a white noise machine.

I love this thing. Still figuring out how to watch other stuff than Prime. Wish I could cast to it. Put on nightstand and now don’t watch my 42” tv. It’s awesome. Maybe I’m trippin but I think she doesn’t hear as good as my echo.idk yet.

Bought as gifts for my nieces and they are happy with the items. The buying transaction was less than desirable and I am unhappy with the price I paid under the Pre-Prime Day access price and the price 5 hours later on the Prime Day pricing. It was a pull the wool over my eyes move and I am still unhappy about the old switcheroo pricing but nieces was happy with item.

I originally bought the Echo show and an Echo dot to automate my home. After intergrading it into my house and then buying the needed smart switches and plugs (those can get expensive pretty quick at $50 each, depending on the size and scope of what you want.) After changing everything out, I can now turn on and off and dim all the lights inside and outside my home with voice commands. There are many other benefits too. If you’re willing to learn, read and research how to personalize the Echo (Alexa).
It can do many, many things. The only very minor complaint I have, is that it will only respond (wake) to 4 names. (Alexa, Echo, Computer or Amazon) I would think that something this advanced should be able to be renamed to wake up to whatever I name I want to assign to it.

Wasn't looking to purchase another Alexa device but this was part of a special when I purchased the Ring Pro so for its size, thought it would make a nicer size bed side view/clock as well. It has great sound quality (which I've noticed many of the Alexa devices are improving upon with each new release). Works about the same as the original Eco Show, just in a smaller package.

I purchased the Echo Show 5 for my desk at work to listen to music through. The Show 5 is nice and compact and has a very nice screen. Since it is in the office I like being able to turn the mic and camera off. I also love that I can setup a slideshow and use it as a digital picture frame.

What I hate about the Show 5 is that my phone won’t automatically connect to it via Bluetooth, and when I do connect it makes a loud sound letting the entire office know that I’m connected. I turned all notifications sound off, and it no longer says I’m connected, but it still makes the loud chiming sound. Please fix these couple things so I don’t have anything to complain about.

Love everything about the device except for the muffled sound quality. It sounds like the unit is buried in the sock drawer. Even sent the first unit back because I thought it was defective. The echo spot that it replaced, had a more natural tone, and I expected more out of this unit. Tech support had me adjust the bass, mid and treble and it is somewhat better. I lowered the bass and mid all the way, and raised the treble to the max.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Right-Sized" for my night stand - Easy to check in with grandkids
reviews.reviewText: The sound is excellent, much better that expected for the price. The screen display quality rivals that of my top-of-the-line cell phone. The Echo Show 5 is an incredible versatile and useful addition to our WiFi enabled smart home. I love it!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa - miniature version, so cute and highly functional
reviews.reviewText: Love all things Amazon!! This is an awesome size, works great, just like the full size Show - can’t wait to use it when I travel, which is why I *thought* I bought it.....using it on a daily basis. You can’t have too many Echoes!

I have at least one of each of the Amazon Echo devices, and I love them all. They are positioned essentially in every area of my home. Since I purchased the Show 5 device, I ended up setting up my Dot device in the garage (the only place that I did not have an Echo device). Turns out, I love it there, too. Now, instead of using my phone, I ask Alexa to play my playlist, while I work in the garage.
Great for my end table as well as bedroom. Love the bigger screen compared to the spot.

reviews.reviewTitle: We’re using it as bedside clock. Love it, but
reviews.reviewText:
Solid product. We love it. Sound quality is amazing. We purchased it in AmazonDays and the price could not be beat. Would buy more for the other bed rooms to replace dots. Only thing is to be cautious as these do not have any alarm battery backup. So while power is out there is no alarm.

I wish Amazon would have thought to integrate a battery backup just for the alarm to at least buzzer if the power was out.

If it had an alarm battery backup I would give it 6 stars.

I’m not sure why some are writing bad reviews for the echo show 5 but it’s a fairly decent product for my purposes. I use this as a calendar / surveillance video player in my home office. As far as the ads are concerned I believe the ‘ads’ are more like screen savers and typically appear while the device is not in use or when the screen isn’t being used e.g. music is playing. I have purchased two more for potential Christmas presents. I snagged them during prime day and it was great to try at the discounted price.
Easy set up and easy installation. What more can I ask for?! Love the screen.
Love the size of the show 5. It is the perfect size for your nightstand. The sound quality when playing music is average. Otherwise it is my favorite new device

I’m very happy with my purchase! I bought this to replace my old side table alarm clock radio and I’m so glad I finally pulled the trigger and bought it. Alexa is very responsive, and I like that you can close the shutter for the camera! I also like being able to shut my alarm off via voice control, however that can be dangerous for those people that like to snooze their alarms!

This is perfect for my office! It could also be a great addition to your bathroom.....Easy to setup as all the others are. I have 4 other Amazon devices throughout my home. This one made perfect sense for my office. I haven't tried to watch anything on it. I do know unlike like the new generation (bigger) Show device it doesn't have Hulu ability. The only thing you can watch on this device that I've tried so far are Amazon Prime shows.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible mic and speaker, worst of all support never helped
reviews.reviewText: I have submitted contacts for the mic being muted when on a Alexa call on this device twice already and never heard back. It it frustratingly impossible to use. Also, once in a while the speaker starts having some static noise. I hate this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great replacement for an alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to replace my alarm clock and couldn’t be happier. The display dims automatically at night which is a nice feature, avoids having a major light source in a dark room. Connected my Apple Music account and the sound quality is much better than I thought it would be coming from a small device. Alexa voice recognition is great as well haven’t had to repeat myself. With it being in my bedroom closed the shutter on the camera. Overall great features and would recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kind of pricey when you start expanding its capabilities
reviews.reviewText: This has been a fun introduction to home automation. It is amazing what it can do but it's a lot like a Barbie doll. You can't just get the doll. You have to get all the stuff that they sell to go with it if you want the full experience. lol Everything electrical you want to control with it is gonna cost you another $25 each. You can flip a lot of switches for that!
Drop in ability needs better privacy. It should REQUEST a drop in without automatically connecting to audio and camera. I'm shocked Amazon set it up this way!

I like how it integrates with Wink, Nest, Kasa, Hue, Wyze pieces of equipment, I can see the cameras, control outlets, and lights. I also like how it works with Amazon music, when it plays music it shows up with lyrics of the song. This is excellent upgrade from Echo Dot that I was using for about a couple of years now. I strongly recommend. Video does provide much more usability on Alexa.

The Echo Show far exceeded my expectations for quantity of services and quality of audio and video. It is especially useful as a personal assistant, allowing you to create and update your shopping list, order online, set alarms and timers, create and manage reminder, and a whole lot more! Check out all the features...you won't be disappointed. I very highly recommend it for anyone.

The Echo show 5 is a great little device with all the ability of the Echo show but in a smaller cutie package. the only issue I had with it was the setup. Most Echo devices you use the app to setup this setup is all performed on the device itself kind of cumbersome. Being this is my fifth echo device I had gotten used to the ease of the app doing all the work, but still love it...

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Things Come in Small Packages!!
reviews.reviewText: What an amazing piece of technology! It is sturdy, and it fits anywhere. The sound quality is terrific, too. This sweetheart almost connects itself to your network. I keep mine in the bathroom, but I have other SHOW receivers in other rooms. The price is amazing, too. Since buying mine I’ve purchased three more to give as gifts. Don’t pass this one up, because it’s a real treasure.

I'm 70 and live alone. I have not thought much about personal assistants before. I'm finding that it is kind of fun to hear a human voice once in a while. I must say that neither of my cats have come to love Alexa yet.

Overall, it's a great device. Im using it as a smart home input device and an alarm clock by my bed. The mechanical camera cover is a nice addition to prevent family and friends from dropping in and spying on my patented smooth moves in the bedroom. The only downside I've noticed is lagging on videos. This is to be somewhat expected at this price point, which is less than the Spot. Besides that, it's a great addition to my echo lineup which is rapidly expanding.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well with just a few rough edges
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these. The first one worked flawlessly. However the second one will not connect to any camera that I’ve tried (Ring or Wyze). Beyond that everything works pretty well. I feel like the echo dot is more sensitive to picking up my voice though. But the show is good for its multifunctional abilities. I’d like to see the regular price a little lower though.

A typically well designed and functioning Echo product. Happy with everything, but the clock screen alternatives AND the inability to stop rotating announcements. Much better than the more expensive Dot which it makes obsolete.

I purchased this on Prime Day for $49. I decided to put it on my kitchen counter in replace of my Echo. I love it because I can visually see recipes, que in to my side door camera (Ring Doorbell) and listen to music. It's great and was well worth the prime Day deal!
I have all pros on this and no Cons. If you compare it to a regular Echo Show, the only difference is the screen size.

I love this! It fits so perfect on my nightstand. The quality is really good I can watch Amazon prime video on it and I'm happy I purchased this. I don't need it to do everything the regular show does so it's perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: Bang for the buck on the Echo products but.......
reviews.reviewText: I was very please with this product until I tried using the Alexa video to make a call. I worked flawlessly when I first purchased this product then one day, it just stopped. I would say the camera was off. I tried several different things to fix it, until I finally had to reset the device (which takes 5-10 minutes to set up) and now it is working properly again. I have a second device in the house and I refuse to do that again. Hopefully they will update the firmware and it will be corrected.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker is terrible with video calls!
reviews.reviewText: We mainly purchased for the video calling and the speaker is terrible! Can barely hear anyone that called us. Music and other audio is just okay. Worse audio is experienced with video calls. Returned it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok I guess. Not for kids videos
reviews.reviewText: Videos played on device are full of pharmaceutical adds.. doesn’t always wake with motion, voice is about 80%. Cute and functional but needs work in my opinion. We have this one and the second gen show. Ok for a parent but not suitable for kids as they tend to watch videos on most devices. For tasks like lists, schedules and hub options for smart devices is good.

Liked this much more than I expected to. Thought the sound would be mediocre but it was deep and room-filling in the kitchen. Not as good as the Echo but way better than the Dot. Though the messages about the Alexa tips was mildly irritating as the other reviewers mention you can turn off the cycling and so this minimizes the issue. Overall very happy with this addition to our Alexa family.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Potent Little Device With One Major Issue
reviews.reviewText:
While I feel like this is quite an amazing little device given it's diminutive size, it's lacking in display quality. Specifically, after about 24 hours of use I was beginning to see "burn in" on the display from the clock face, and from the Spotify and Tune In Radio logos at the top right of the screen.

With that being said, I brought the issue to the attention of Amazon and they replaced the device as quickly as they possibly could, but I just didn't want to bother with taking the replacement out of the box.
