If the issue regarding the display is resolved, which doesn't seem to be an isolated issue, I'd consider acquiring another. In the meantime, I'll stick with the Spot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful product to organize my nightstand
reviews.reviewText: Device size and form factor is a great balance on appearance and functionality. Screen is large enough to see short videos [I refuse to watch nexflix on it] and other content clearly and of course the time if used as alarm clock. I was surprised by its great sound accounting for the size of the device and its bass gives a great deep tone to enjoy music of any type. Voice is clearly recognized from the distance on a large bedroom (14x17). Easy to setup and straighforward to use. I am still enjoying and learning new skills (abilities) of this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to monitor your pets
reviews.reviewText: Makes life easier. I have a Amazon dot and love it so I bought this during prime day FOR $50! WHAT A DEAL I use it when ever I'm not home to drop in on my dogs and I can see them and they can hear me . The screen is very clear the speaker is just soso easy to run to my stereo so it's not a big deal . For $50 I got a 5" screen and away to make sure my dogs are doing well while IAM gone Wich is priceless.

This was our second Alexa device. I love that you get a visual screen showing news updates, weather, song lyrics, videos, etc. I am disappointed by the voice recognition it doesn’t seem as responsive as the 3rd generation dot. The sound quality is also lacking as the case rattles at some frequencies. I purchased on Prime Day. I am overall pleased with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not my favorite Amazon Alexa device
reviews.reviewText: Half the time it want even respond to me, or acts like she is but just goes back to what ever it was doing (music Mostly) god forbid you try to get her to stop playing music I'm screaming at it half the time, typically have to go to another device and cancel or do whatever I'm trying to do. I like the fact I can see my security cameras on it but not really a fan of this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, just with some annoying home screen issues
reviews.reviewText: The sound quality is quite good and integration with services like spotify and amazon video are quite nice. The screen is a bit small for video watching, but the quality is pretty good. The main annoyance is the constantly cycling home screen, which kind of ruins the point of choosing a clock face. Although you can stop the home screen from rotating in the settings, this will also stop displaying other rotating notifications such as weather, news, etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's like having the smartest alarm clock ever
reviews.reviewText: I keep this on my nightstand. The screen changes every few seconds so there is no burn in. The screen gives ever changing information. It automatically dims at night and is not bright enough to annoy me. The sound quality could use some improvement, but I bought this on sale and it is well worth the price I paid. I am considering one for the kitchen since I can use it for recipes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to have in the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I love the new Echo Show 5! The screen size is about the same as my Galaxy Note 8 so it is large enough to see whatever you want. I wanted the Echo Show but the price was just to high, so this is a great alternative! I got it on sale for around $60 and felt it was a great deal. I would recommend the Echo Show 5 to anyone who would like to have a screen but doesn't want to shell out over $229.

I've been using the show 5 for almost a week now. Its size is just so perfect for a side table. It serves as an alarm clock and weather update for me. I like the thought that it can serve as a security cam too. The shutter on the lens is well thought for privacy. I stream a lot of music. I find the sound quality just enough for easy listening.

Set up was flawless and easy as usual.

reviews.reviewTitle: With the exception of suggestions, a decent product.
reviews.reviewText:
The product is mostly good. I like that it does what it’s supposed to, but I don’t like that it shows you how to do other things.
Try “Alexa, what’s on my...”. It’s annoying that these “suggestions” can’t be turned off. Otherwise a good product.

Love this! The Echo is awesome. I’m still learning all of the things it can do but so far I am very impressed! I ordered two for different rooms of my house and after using them decided to order another for my office.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Ready for Prime Time (with Ring devices)
reviews.reviewText: Great idea to use with Ring. It is the only hub-type device that will. However, it doesn't work right. Will not discover all of my Ring devices, so what is the point? Amazon is sending a replacement, but I think they just didn't want to spend the time troubleshooting. Ring has gone down hill since it was bought by Amazon. Nothing more than a glorified toy at this point. I saw all of the negative reviews but thought maybe somebody just had it out for Amazon. Nope. Trash.

Perfect size for next to my bed on the nightstand. Video quality is good as is the sound. Alexa commands work well. I was hoping this could be my alarm clock that I could glance at to see the time in the middle of the night but I like a dark room when I sleep and the glow from the screen is more than I want. Having said that, it's still on my nightstand (with the screen off at night). I have Ring security cameras around the house and this works well displaying video from them. Nice device.

I'm really loving my Echo Show 5. It's the perfect size, and its mimicking an alarm clock has made it fit into my bedroom perfectly. In fact, I use it as my main alarm clock as well as for the new Alexa "Good Morning" function that reads me my flash briefing as I get out of bed. I will definitely be buying more in the near future for other rooms in the house.
I'm no stranger to the Amazon echo. I bought this to use with my ring products. Works seamlessly as intended. Easy to set up. Doubles as my alarm clock and is about the size of one. So far so good.

I love this echo.
It’s great for the living room or kitchen to use for every day things. I use it for news, weather, the calendar, asking random questions and motivation!
It’s very helpful. The only con I can think of is, if I’m across the room, it thinks I’m whispering if I’m not talking loud. That makes sense but sometimes I have to be almost yelling for it to hear me.
Its still a great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Addition to the Echo family!
reviews.reviewText: Amazon has achieved a happy medium between the Echo Show and the Echo. The screen size is just right for me. The sound is good considering its size. The privacy features are a testament to Amazon’s focus on customer input. I love the form factor and the navigation scheme.

Can't go wrong with this. It connects so fast I was wondering if I was done. Pretty much sets it's self up. Connects to so many other brands. It even understood our two year old. Can't wait to buy more smart products to connect to it. Screen is not bright at night which is good. Prefect size for a bedroom. Alarm clock is great. Just a really good product.

The microphone should be omnidirectional, like on our Echoes. We have it mounted on our kitchen counter, facing the kitchen, but when we try to speak to it from the back side (our Family Room), it doesn't hear very well (and we cannot tell it isn't listening because there are no indicators on the back). Simple improvements would make this a much better product...

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor Voice Recognition Sinks This Product
reviews.reviewText: I was an early adopter of the Amazon echo series because the voice recognition and skills were actually useful. Now as I find out with this version of the Echo Show, the ability to recognize my voice is gone. I find that I have to repeat commands again and again with this device. But not with my original Echo. Obviously some design changes have been made to lower the cost. Bad move. I will try the Google Nest Hub now or upgrade my Apple TV for Siri.

I'm really loving having a smart clock with weather and date.
The one thing I'm writing this for is to suggest more selections of clock faces. Maybe some color control too.
But this thing is great. I get to do face time with my Mom who lives an hour away, (I bought her one too. She's 91 and savvy. Awesome times).
Thanks Amazon. Keep it up.

I have a house full of Echos…dot, Show 2, regular Echo, etc. This one is my favorite. It is a perfect alarm clock replacement, and does almost everything I want it to do.

The only knock I would give it is the lack of the ability to wake to Radio.com stations. So, my local traffic and news cannot automatically be played in the morning; I must summon them myself after I’m fully awake.

I like this new show version of Echo. I have one in my home office and in the kitchen. I very much enjoy the screen as it constantly changes: local weather, trending stories, news, etc. I like the ability to learn more about a topic and to see the video version with the story. It is easy to set up and customize each screen as you would like. This is a great upgrade to echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's very good but yet very annoying!!
reviews.reviewText: The most annoying part about this device is the constant various FYI's that last 7 seconds each repeating over and over . If you're thinking about getting an echo 5 hold off until they remove this distraction.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great 3rd Gen device - Ideal for bedroom use
reviews.reviewText: While my house is sprinkled all over with various Echo devices, I had only put a Dot in the bedroom. My office had the round echo show, but the camera in that device was not welcome in the bedroom. But the Show 5 has a sliding privacy cover for the camera - check! And the smart dimming feature is ideal for bedroom use - it is NOT bright at night. The speaker is much better than a Dot, so this was a worthy upgrade.

Great device! I hooked it up to a powered speaker, connected my mobile phone via blutooth... it's very loud alarm clock! and I like it because its hard for me to wake up in the morning. I can also view all my ring camera which is cool, i can play music and movies, i can do a lot of things inside my bedroom without the need to touch my phone or computer.

When first got it wasn’t sure with the small screen but once set it up which was extremely easy I discovered I loved it. Great sound quality for the size and loaded with features. On Prime Day I actually purchased three of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best screen and sound quality from a small box!
reviews.reviewText: Great little screen. I bought one for my grandkids so they can talk to me. They love it. They call every morning between 6:00 AM and 6:30 AM before school getting their papa fix! Best thing next to sliced bread and canned beer!

The connection could be faster but l like how simple it is to use. I use it to check on my son. My son is autism . His social skills is a little different from his peers. So l use my echo show to talk to him and to make sure he’s safe and remind him to eat his lunch. I like how other family members can
check in on their love ones.
I like, except voice response is very deep baritone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound but has issues with Bluetooth speaker
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is really good for the size... I'd say it's a little better than the Echo Dot 3rd gen and with more bass.

My only real annoyance is that when I try to play music on one of my music groups while it's connected to my Yamaha sound bar via Bluetooth, it reverts to internal audio. It sometimes says paired or couldn't find... But I never had this issue with my Echo Dot 3.

I love this! Bought 2 more for family members. The display and interaction is a easy, dependable, and so convenient. It’s one of those items I thought I could live without but now I’m so glad I don’t have to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Same volume for drop-in and listening to music
reviews.reviewText: I’m not sure if anyone else has this problem but when I drop in upstairs, my son can’t hear me in his room (no issue with the echo spot). He said he has to turn it down or else his music blasts really loud when he listens to it. So he keeps the volume level that is comfortable for listening to his music, resulting in drop-in being too soft to hear. Is there a setting or fix for this issue?

medium sound quality. I'm disappointed in the drop in feature... I want more control. We wanted to use these like monitors for our kids in their rooms and playroom, but the drop in feature takes 10-20 seconds or so to tune in, we wanted it quicker than that and it alerts them too... I appreciate the idea here, but I'd like control of those features.

I replaced my alarm clock with the Echo Show 5!I love that it provides video chat capability as well as video feeds but also compliments the rest of my Alexa and home automation setup and I bought one for my elderly mother with a couple plug/outlet adapters. Now she can video call us (the grand kids) plus she has voice control over several lights. Just wish Comcast would come out with Alexa Integration so we can complete the setup. (Comcast does not integrate with anything at this time whereas DirectTV and Dishnetwork do)

It’s a second show in my house and bought as a present to my niece with a new baby !
Now my daughter( got her 1) , my niece and I can talk , look at the babies while doing something at the kitchen without any problems!

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the visual feature but the sound is terrible
reviews.reviewText: I like being able to watch say, YouTube videos for crafting projects I'm working on in my craft room. The Show is easy to use and easy to set up. I got the stand, not sure I would have needed that. But the sound on this thing is awful. I mean my second gen Dots sound better than this. I would not buy another one until they improve the sound quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth if is its on sale
reviews.reviewText: I dont think this is worth $80-$90. I got it on sale for $50 and that is a good price for this. I use it for the clock on my night stand. Besides that it doesnt add much compared to the Echo Dot I had there. One downside is you have to turn off the scrolling cards or it will constantly show you "this to try" which sucks. I want to have my clock large, not small in the corner with ads.

Picture is decent, sound is a bit better than a dot I think. Watching videos is a bit of a cluster. Kids like to sit at the breakfast bar and watch some prime shows on it, but it is hard to get Alexa to play or show the right things. She needs some work in this regard. Integrates decent with wyze cams. Should really update to allow more video services.
Does not discover new devices when asked, when my old dot would be able to without problem

The dimming methods are very much improved over what Echo Spot did. The screen clock digits are low contrast at night, would be better if the clock had better dimmer on backlight so contrast could be higher on the LCD screen.

This thing is really neat!!! My husband talked me into getting one. It's really easy to set up. She can hear me pretty far away and has been able to answer and respond to everything I've said. It's a lot smaller than I thought. Its smaller then my phone screen but it has a nice bright screen and the speaker has good sound. It's a cool little device! I'm very happy with it.

This works just like one would expect from an Echo product. Sound quality is very good and I have had no issues with voice recognition. The screen is, in my opinion, a very nice size for the nightstand in a bedroom. The picture is very clear and I appreciate how it responds with picture and text to commands. The manual switch to cover the camera lens is a great feature for privacy concerns.

reviews.reviewTitle: Constant Bombardment by “ads” via “Things to Try”
reviews.reviewText:
Constantly being bombarded with Amazon “Ads” via the “Things to Try” - Literally, these things will not go away and THERES NO WAY TO SHUT THEM OFF!!!

My house is fully automated with smart devices and it’s all run with Alexa. I’ve already got 7+ Echo devices and was thrilled with the idea of the new Echo Show.

I bought two of the Echo Show 5’s but I’m returning them today... very disappointing!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as I wanted
reviews.reviewText: I have an amazon echo 2nd gen and the sound quality on that is AMAZING. So going from that to this....is underwhelming. The speaker is such a poor quality it almost makes the screen not worth it. People saying the speakers are comparable...must just not be as picky as I am? Having the screen is super cool and I’m sure I’ll find ways to use it, but it is super small so it would be great for a desk...not like a kitchen counter or something big like that. I recommend the echo 2nd gen MUCH MORE than this shotty speaker with an iPhone sized screen

reviews.reviewTitle: Ring2 and Echo Show5 made for each other
reviews.reviewText: Works just like a regular Alexa plus. Replaces the alarm/clock radio on the night stand. Next to computer at back of house just ask Alexa to show the front door and you see what's going on in the street. Ask her to answer the door and you can talk to who ever is there. Very easy to set up. Still learning what things she can show me. Have one in computer room now. May put another in bedroom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Form factor is great, sound not so much
reviews.reviewText:
Pros: I love that you can close the camera. It’s the perfect size to go on my night stand and replace my alarm clock. I love that I can control my entire apartment from the screen or using my voice. I like that it essentially doubles as a radio since you can stream pandora, Spotify, iHeartRadio, TuneIn, and Apple Music, etc on it.

Cons: The speaker is terrible. I would describe the sound as hollow and reverby. If you’ve ever put your phone in something (like a cup) to amplify the sound, that’s how the speaker sounds.

Not sure what all of the reviews I previously read are talking about as far as the annoyance of the 'Try "Alexa..."' pop-ups. It can easily be turned off. I simply went to settings > home & clock > and made sure discovery is switched to off. I haven't seen a single suggestion on what to try with Alexa. I switched from the echo dot to the show 5 and I love it! Would recommend!

overall i like the size.
I have an Echo show (1st gen) and Echo spot and never had any issues with either device.
unfortunately with the Echo show 5, it has a few gremlins. when i try to drop in to my other devices or make phone calls my family or clients have a hard time hearing me. Clients normally tell me i sound choppy or far away. nothing has changed with my internet only my echo device. now its just a pricey mini sports radio.

overall i wouldn't recommend it to business owners .

On a Scale from 1-10 (compared to echo show(1st gen)
Quality - 4
responsiveness - 6
voice recognition - 3
microphone - 2
sound - 7
clarity of music - 8

The device is not super fancy, but it does what I needed. My kids can video call me when I'm out of town, and it functions as well as the original full size Echo we had in the kitchen. It seems to hear us and respond well. I have yet to try to use most of the video functions but plan, when I bake next, ask it to display a recipe for me rather than worry about a recipe card.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are an Echo fan, buy one!
reviews.reviewText: Love it! Simple answer. Best modern replacement to a bedside alarm clock you could ask for. Wish they gave it some kind of battery though. Don't need portibilty, but a backup for power outage would have been nice to maintain time and alarms.
Bought it for our newly finished basement bar. Works great recognizes my voice much better than the Pringle can alexa. I have all sorts of these alexa devices and this one is my new fave.

I love it, way better than my dot. Sound is a lot higher than the dot. The display is bright and colorful, voice recognition is good, I say ECHO for my echo and ALEXA for my dot so they don’t both go off. The echo does have quite a bit of adds on the screen but it doesn’t bother me really that much. You can add you pics on there for wallpaper and screen saver, music, etc

For a smaller version of the Echo Show, the show 5 is small and powerful. A great addition to any household. I would suggest this product for use in any bedroom. The use of a small screen for Prime video and a Alexa Alarm clock, morning info, etc. If anyone wants a device for kitchen purposes buy the Echo Show 2 w/ stand. I also got the stand for the Show 5.
Needed Alexa for the bedroom, This ones perfect

I had not planned on purchasing this, but after reading other reviews and seeing what it could do I decided to purchase.

I'm glad I did b/c although it just sits there on my kitchen counter, it's always ready to answer my questions, play music and movies, tell me my schedule, and so on. My wife and I ask it stuff all the time. It's fun!

I initially bought it to pair with the Ring doorbell, but it's handy for lots of other things too. Price point is good too.

Look into it - you might pick one up too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Occasionally works, never works as expected
reviews.reviewText: Alexa doesn't know basic, intuitive commands. The sorts of commands you'd expect to be it's basic purpose. The Show disconnects frequently, sometimes daily. The other echos do this as well, unlike other devices on my network. However, the other devices work after being power cycled. The Show requires the network password each time. It's unusable more often than not. The experience has been bad enough that I don't bother trying to reconnect it most days any more.

I bought a couple of these on Prime Day - one for my bedroom and one for our guest room. Shortly after purchasing them, we had two Japanese exchange student come stay with us. I was able to set the language of the guest room Show to Japanese, and I was tickled to hear the girls asking it questions and using it to translate words and phrases into English. Fun product overall and a great programmable alarm clock, too!

Can't make or receive video calls. When someone tries to call me, they are asked if they want to call my alexa devices, and when they say yes, all of my devices sound off at the same time and my echo show 5 won't answer the call. After 15 seconds of trying to tap the green "answer phone" icon without results, it says that my call was disconnected. Great JOKE!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Highly recommend - fantastic smart alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: Fabulous smart alarm clock. The sound is amazing--I play Pandora through this clock and the sound is rich. Love the style. So easy to use--user friendly. Alexa, set my alarm for ___. Alexa, turn off the alarm. Alexa, what's the weather like? I could go on and on. That, plus news bits stream on the face; lots of design options; incredibly compact and stylish. I am soooo happy I bought this clock.
Quit working after a few months, sound quality is terrible now. Support isn’t helpful either so a waste of money. Half the suggestions on the screen to ask Alexa she doesn’t understand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size but very poor speakers (your mileage may very)
reviews.reviewText: I ordered one of these bad boys for the bed room to replace my alarm clock and it did great! The screen does not bother you due to the super dim auto adjusting display, and you can just tell Alexa to shut up and the alarm just goes off. But with my first device after a few hours of playing music the speaker started to crackle, I ask amazon for a replacement and they sent one out next day. Great customer support. Although i got a new one the same thing happened to the second one around the same amount of usage. I love the size of this echo but i think a few things need to be ironed out before i buy another one, mainly speaker performance. Everything else about this product was flawless!

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a very fine piece of technology. I can see the time and date on a screen, which you can
reviews.reviewText: I like the lighted screen showing the time and date and temperature, weather. And the screen moves from time to a different kind of subjects like cooking ideas, and other news and current events. You talk to Alexa and ask about anything you want. Not always will give you the answer correct, but it has potential to be a fine piece of information besides just the time and the weather. The only thing I don't like is that it's corded. I would have like to be cordless. I also like that it plays your music, just by command it to play it for you, almost like a dog, Unconditional love and obedience. I recommend it to anyone. it's like an extra companion . cool...

I have 3 Echos in the house and love them all but this one is awesome! The setup took about 3 minutes. I love the look and form factor of it. Not too big. Smaller than most alarm clocks. I use it to listen to music before bedtime, setup alarm for the morning and even see some of the news updates as they scroll through the screen. Absolutely love it!!!

This device will not support Google Photo Galleries and requires you to have a Prime account to view photos on the Amazon system as if many folks were using it in the first place. I am pretty sick of deliberately hobbled devices. There are many things this device could if not for corporate greedy fingers trying to squeeze every last penny of revenue out of their products.

The wife wouldn't let me get one until I told her the camera could be closed.. It's basically my alarm clock and morning music machine, but it's cool to get my day schedule, news, weather, etc. while getting ready. I haven't gotten close to the things I will eventually use it for, but so far, it's been a pretty cool addition to my growing Alexa universe.
I like this little device but I have several of them. This is the only one I have with a screen. Sometimes it gets mixed up with my other ones. I am getting used to it and I like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Haven't had time to trouble shoot. Just bought alexa TV and the echo show might not be needed
reviews.reviewText: Added another dimension to alexa!!! The only problem is I have base's and subwoofer, sometimes they answer back instead then can't do visual. I would think reconfiguring things could change that, everything in my house is smart devices and all tied together. 1 thing can effect others,gotta be careful and haven't had time to square away. Even have IFTTT involved

reviews.reviewTitle: Show 5 doesnt pick up your voice as well as the Echo tower 1st edition.
reviews.reviewText:
I love Alexa! I traded my Echo 1st edition in to get the Show 5. The only thing i dont like about the Show 5 is she doesnt her your voice as well, you have to stand in front of her or speak louder.

I have her everywhere, kitchen, bedroom, kids room my phone and my car!! I love that you can make video calls to others with the Show or Alexa on your phone! There is still so much to learn!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally got the screen size and price aligned—it’s a winner.
reviews.reviewText: Let’s be it! This was the perfect addition to the Echo video device line. The spots were nice but the round screen was touch for video calls with family. This larger screen makes all the difference.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not purchase another for sure..my friends also stay away from this model.
reviews.reviewText:
Great device with sick forced info displaying all the time on the screen
Do you know... etc
You cant switch this off. So i dont want amazon force me what is on my screen. I paid for it not rent
Amazon! Let people decide what they want have display on the screen. Before all of them will turn away from your devices like you did with me
This has the best sound quality and I’m so impressed by it. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends and am thinking about replacing a few of the echo dots I own with this.

I bought the Amazon Echo Show 5 as a prime day deal. Fits perfectly on your nightstand or on the kitchen counter. On the plus side it is compatible with Zmodo security cameras , which I already own. The volume is quite loud and videos stream clear . You can watch videos on it although the screen in quite small but my kids think its cool and want one by their bed, plus its a nice little night light. The only think is I wish it would of came with a stand rather than having to buy one separately. After getting the first one. We bought 2 more for an awesome price. Another cool option is if your wanting to upgrade you can trade in your echo for a new version of Alexa and get 25% off plus a gift card from $5-30 .

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent sound and video. Mic as good as original Echo.
reviews.reviewText: Replaced an original full size echo with this. Impressed with the sound quality. At lower reasonable listening levels, as good as original big echo. But doesn't go loud as well. The mic works as well as original. The screen is excellent. As a replacement for clock-radio, it's superior. Autodimming is very effective. And it works with the Blink and Nest security system cameras.

It does everything the Dot does and so more! It's a clock, a radio, an intercom, a phone, a mini tv ... it even scrolls the lyrics to the song it's playing. We have several of them in our house so it's like having a personal secretary following me around. It turns my lights on and off, controls my TV, keeps all my lists, my appointments, reminders, and either reads them back to me or displays them on the very easy to read screen. Being a die hard Star Trek fan I call my Echo Show "Computer" (instead of Alexa .. lol ) and it may as well BE one .. I ask it questions constantly.

reviews.reviewTitle: No sound on drop in/call feature
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product to drop in with audio and video and the audio quality is terrible!!! You can’t hear what the other person is saying at all, though they can hear you. All my other echo devices are wonderful and the volume is great. Apparently the development team is looking into this, but if it’s not fixed SOON, I’m sending back for a refund!

reviews.reviewTitle: I prefer it my old Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText: The sound is much better, and with the video screen, I get song lyrics, weather forecasts, and can watch Amazon Prime programs. Compared to my old Echo Dot, having a screen and better sound makes all the difference. I am really happy with this purchase.

It took about 5 min for this device to drive me crazy. The home screen keep changing and flashing different items. The bottom of the screen show “try this xxx” and that keeps changing. I expected a screen like is shown on the amazon. Now I read the review (after the receiving ) and see this is a common complaint.
It would take so little to make this device out standing. Amazon are you listing?

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy this for bedside clock.
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO USE IT AS A BEDSIDE CLOCK. Until Amazon decides to stop the" try yada yada yada, from constantly taking it out of clock mode and sticking the tiny time in the upper left corner. If you like rolling over and saying" Alexa home" in the middle of the night or walking into the room and saying it, then this is the product for you. I have turned off all features and still no luck. Amazon please don't call me and ask to troubleshoot this with me, I have already received an email for that. Just push a fix to remove the damn " try this" from the screen. I have had Alexa's for a few years now. I've tried quite a bit. FIX THIS!!

About the size of my iPhone 6s. Doesn’t take up much room. Has been extremely handy since when Alexa answers question it’s also in print on the screen. Love calling my friends on it. Always has a clock and temp on screen when not answering my stupid questions. Music quality wonderful. Like that the words are also on the screen when song plays.

I don’t know what other people are complaining about. This is a great replacement for an Echo Dot.

I use mine as an Alarm Clock/show. Sound quality is quite well, on par with an Echo Dot.

Lacks apps like other Amazon devices.

It’s a stripped down Show. I enjoy it. Will buy another for a Christmas Gift

I am a huge fan of all versions - but I really love the display. It is always rolling headlines, my appointments and the lyrics display when playing music is great. It's like a little karaoke. It integrates with all my products - ring, kasa & sensibo. I also like that you can cover the camera and shut off the mic and camera, great features. What a great buy.

Love it so much I bought one for my daughter. Have it on my bedside table. Set alarm, play music and find weather and temperature every morning. Sound quality is surprisingly good. Several brightness controls. Can adjust for the actual time for dimness at night and brightness in the morning. Everything I could want plus the usual Alexa options games etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice small device that reboots quickly for room changes..
reviews.reviewText: I’m quite impressed with this device the video picture is clear and nice and the sound quality is loud and impressive. The responsiveness of Alexa did not disappoint... Very good device for a fair price..

reviews.reviewTitle: This "Vision Speaker" works Well but I feel that the Display isn't Bright enough
reviews.reviewText:
This "Vision Speaker" works Well but I feel that the Display isn't Bright enough even when it's at it's Brightest.
I left Motion Detection unrated 'cause I wasn't even Aware of it's existence (IF it does exist) but there is a Constantly Visible Clock & the Display shows Your next scheduled Alarm.
I DO Recommend this Unit !
LesB
I don't like the size of it. I though it was going to be just a little shorter and the same length. But it isn't I think its to small for are room.

This product does everything you would expect from an Echo device. The sound quality is average. The quality of the device matches the price (good). The main problem for me with this product is the lack of customization available. The background is the only thing I can change on the homescreen. If you're thinking about buying the Echo Show 5, I would recommend you wait for a good discount or for the next generation version.

reviews.reviewTitle: Es bueno pero tiene un par de detalles negativos
reviews.reviewText: Tiene algo de problemas para escuchar la voz, aveces hay que casi gritarle, en cuanto a la calidad de sonido es buena, pero después de un tiempo de estar escuchando musica algo sucede que hace ruidos de distorsión. Para arreglarlo hay que desconectarlo de la corriente, ya me ha fallado 2 veces. Lo demás muy bien. Es muy útil tener una pantalla de 5"

reviews.reviewTitle: Bigger than a Spot but no robot
reviews.reviewText: I have wanted a Spot from the day it went on sale. Just wasn't a fan of the price. The Show 5 is a terrific alternative. Does everything it's bigger brother does and with a built in cover for the camera. Even the sound is good on this small device. Only downside is no robot accessory like the Spot has but for a bigger screen and better sound, I'll take it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the extra money to have the screen.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first alexa with a screen. I love the smart alarm. The touch screen isnt as sensitive as a phone screen. The sound quality was about the same as the other echo devices. If you use alexa for routines, skills, listening to music you can't go wrong with this device. Having the screen definitely enhances the alexa experience, now i want one for every room with the lower price point its possible. My favorite part was having the screen to change my thermostat instead of yelling at it till I remember the exact phrase i need to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: waste unless just using alarm clock and calendar
reviews.reviewText: I need a refund immediately. Hulu does NOT work on this device as it should. After countless times of restarting and reconnecting my Hulu account, it still does not work. And when I connected my Apple Music it only played ONE of my many playlists. I ended deleted that playlist to see if it’d play something else but no. What bothers me the most is that this Alexa is SUPPOSED to be great because of the screen but I can barely use it!!! There are so many better devices out there than this... DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Was very excited and couldn’t wait to receive this. I was waiting for the release date and was pleasantly surprised when it arrived. It fits perfectly in my decor, & works great so far. I have other Alexa products in our home along with Google products and it seems to be doing its job. Thanks Amazon for another great product. 👍🏻👍🏻

I've found that the Echos and other "Alexa boxen" are about the best "Internet Radios" out there. They are reliable hardware devices that don't require a bunch of setup to use. The audio section is very good. When combined with a decent set of amplified speakers or a stereo system, you end up with a "better than FM" solution for radio listening. THe display on the new units is bright and clear, and more useful than you'd think. I see a lo

reviews.reviewTitle: This Alexa, doednt hear too well..........
reviews.reviewText: Not as good as my echo dots.......... This unit, wont wake up, when you say Alexa. You must say Alexa, Alexa (twice). Rarely responds to voice commands. WHen replying, first part of the response is not there. Example; should say OK, but all you hear is K. Etc, etc. Screen is dim, hard time to recognize bluetooth devices (speaker). Not worth the money. Going back to my E Dot.
The Show 5 is a very easy setup and now I can use it to see all my Ring cameras through it!!!
The camera stopped working withing a month. Now I cant do video calls or take photos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Voice remote not currently compatible with Show 5
reviews.reviewText: The Show 5 is okay except for one flaw. The Echo remote control voice function is not working with the 1st generation Show 5. The remote volume control and left/right button functions and play/pause button works, but not voice. I called Amazon support and they confirmed no remote voice compatibility with Show 5. They were unsure if a fix is coming or not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good little monitor with all the features of Alexa.
reviews.reviewText: I use this product as a clock in my room. Its an amazing little device. You can stream movies, keep an eye on security cameras and interact with it just as Alexa. The speakers aren't bad as well, when listening to music.

This does not measure up to what I was hoping for...yet. Basically it is an Echo Dot with a display -- You get a picture while your skills are executing, but you do not get access to the App store. For example when I asked for a Calendar to display I was expecting a grid of numbers. What I got was a recitation of the next 4 events on my calendar. Yes it can show movies but other than a few skills developed for it, the display does not offer all of the functions it could. Hopefully the development will be done without making the Gen 1 obsolete.
I own many different alexa devices and this one is by far the WORST, it is SO SLOW and hardly ever gets voice commands right. The customization SUCKS. Don't waste your money on this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Warning!!! Does not stream from Fire TV Recast like other Echo shows
reviews.reviewText:
This product does not allow streaming from Fire TV recast like the other Echo shows, the response from customer suport.
"I checked and I am sorry to let you that the feature is not supported as of now. I take this as a strong feedback for future reference to the concerned team"

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Alexa unit for the bedroom and kitchen.
reviews.reviewText:
A great addition to our bedrooms. I’ve been searching for the perfect alarm clock for my bedroom for 30 years. Amazon just put me at ease. I’m done searching.

By the way, this unit fixed all of the shortcomings of the echo spot.

If they improve sound quality and integrate the power brick into the unit, it would be perfection.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent smart bedside clock, but that’s about it
reviews.reviewText:
The sound quality surprised me, it’s got a good little bassy punch to it for such a small device.
The screen is too small to watch videos or anything like that. My Ring security cameras look reaaaally small in the screen, and as of today I can’t even zoom in on the videos.

However, it is an EXCELLENT smart clock to keep by the side of our bed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but doesn’t work with other video apps
reviews.reviewText: Great product for viewing weather and keeping the traditions Alexa qualities. The only issue I have is that the video unit only appears to work with another similar unit and not with other apps, like Skype or WeChat. I found that disappointing because it would have made my life easier to chat with family who don’t wish to buy one of these nor is it available in China WeChat

I bought this one without a stand to sit by my bed so it would resemble an alarm clock & it is perfect. I can see my Alexa Ring Doorbell with it which is the main reason I purchased it. Works great & looks great & perfect size.

Echo Show 5 is Amazon best virtual assistant yet. Alexa is smarter then ever. Echo Show 5 is very compact and it fit in any small places without taking too much room. Music sound great and the speaker is very loud. The screen is perfect size video look great and making video call look and sound clear. This little unit is compact but it pack lots of great features and is worth every penny. I have one in my bedroom and one in my kitchen!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice sound.. Works best via wifi
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic device. Though Alexa doesnt know everything you want to know. Its a pretty smart device. I like the camera cover flip switch.. The sound is unreal for a small device like this. Very good bass you can clearly hear the sound. Suggestion to buy the base that goes with this model.. Reason one its magnetic and grips pretty well.. A good purchase item.

It takes a little bit of practice before its starts recognising your voice and sometimes you just need it to stop and start all over again but other then that once you get it set up it works pretty good.. I am happy with my purchase and will enjoy using it. Makes calls and I here my news report every day plus my local weather....

I have a lot of Alexa products 2-spots 3-kids 2-speakers 2- dots. And I love all of them. This one though is a huge letdown. The sound quality is so horrible. I bought this for in my kitchen. I like the size. It’s great to see my door bell but you can hear very well. Also forget listening to music because it sounds horrible which is one of our main uses.
Very happy with my Show 5. Have a bit of trouble with voice recognition but I am told I mumble at times so its not Alexas fault. Very good sound. More than happy with sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Alarm Clock For The Modern Age
reviews.reviewText: I use this in the bedroom as an alarm clock. The form factor and aesthetic of the device definitely evokes that image and the crisp display does exactly what I need it to: display the current time. In addition to that, having Alexa handy in another location is definitely a plus. Now I can add the odd item I recall as I lay down to my shopping list, or watch a Prime Video before falling asleep. And, setting an alarm with my voice is really nice.
Super easy to install and setup. Love the integration with Ring Alarm and Ring doorbell. Highly recommended!

This little guy fits the bill for an alarm clock. I was using my dot for over a year and this blows it out of the water. Great sound and quality. I really like the sunrise feature along with the auto dim so it doesn't light up the whole room while sleeping.

If you're looking to a great alternative to an alarm clock I highly recommend the Echo Show 5

I bought the Echo Show 5 for my bedroom to replace an iPhone station and radio that died. It is an effective alarm clock, visual clock, and I can play sound effects on my side of the bed to help me sleep and not disturb my spouse. It does not recognize whispered voice as well as the Echo Show or my other Alexa Devices. That is the most disappointment I have as I must raise my voice and disturb my spouse.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to setup and configure right from the start! Good value for the price!
reviews.reviewText: A year or so ago I bought the previous generation Echo Show and returned it within a couple of weeks. It just wasn’t versatile enough nor configureable enough. Not so with the Echo 5! Love it! It setup easily right out of the box and was very easily configurable. I especially like that you can set the brightness right on the device! Great value! Home Run Amazon!

reviews.reviewTitle: A fantastic addition to my Echo family!
reviews.reviewText: My full-size Show is in my living room, so I decided to purchase this one for my office. I'm so very glad I did. It's just the right size to set on my desk and is perfect to set reminders for my job! I've found myself asking it several work-related questions throughout the day, and when stress comes creeping up, I can enjoy some relaxing music! The graphics and sound are surprisingly good, and I'm thoroughly enjoying my newest addition!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Prce, Not Quite as Good as the Show
reviews.reviewText: Was looking for some upgrade to my Show for my home office, but the sound wasn't near as good. Still, worked as the classic Alexa which was cool, but I wish I could have something that sounded as good as my original Echo (the tower kind) when the first came out (the tall one - that thing rocks and is great - still the best! - Do it again Amazon!!!).

we had two 3rd Gen dots on either side of the bed as a stereo pair. I replaced them and our alarm clocks with these, fully expecting to be able to stereo pair them.
NOPE. NO WAY. NO HOW.
no good reason technically for them not to. just laziness on the engineers part. pfft.
at least I got at the BBig BBox for half the price on sale.

Excellent addition to the alexa ecosystem. Some other reviews complain about the alexa adds on things to ask. What do you expect the device to sow to be engaging when you don't have you own content to show. If you have your calendar, email, photos , etc. Set up then the device displays your cont to keep you engaged.

Touchscreen does not work. Have tried restarting multiple times, have also performed a factory reset, nothing. I should have known better, this is the second amazon branded device in a row that has had screen problems.

update: within minutes, a support tech contacted me to offer help. he was unable to solve my issue but, it was outstanding that amazon reached out to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hyperactive Slideshows and Designed by a Moving Bilboard Enthuisiest
reviews.reviewText: I can't take the Alexa Try forced feature anymore. Why Amazon won't listen and allow this to be disabled can only be because it is a pet project for someone and not an interest for customer satisfaction. It seems EVERY photo in a slide show has to have one of these prompts completely ruining the experience for me. I'm about to put electrical tape over the display.

Sound quality is terrible. I have an echo plus and a 3rd gen dot. The dot sounds like a high end speaker compared to the show 5. The UI is extremely clunky and not worth the effort to use it’s anything more than an echo with a fancy integrated clock. The sound quality really is the biggest disappointment. Maybe I just have a defective unit but I doubt it. It’s washed out hollow sounding. Nothing is crisp and clear especially compared to my other two devices. Recognition is okay but I do find myself repeating requests often.

reviews.reviewTitle: They are very easy to operate and does everything the larger size does.
reviews.reviewText: Love the first one I got. Bought two more for gifts.

I had an Echo dot for years and loved it. When I saw the new Alexa Echo Show I wasn't sure I wanted to spend the money since my Echo dot did everything I needed. Amazon offered a great deal on the Echo show so I bought one and glad that I did. The sound on the Echo show is amazing and having the screen to watch videos or weather reports is great I can even ask Alexa to look up a recipe and she will pull it up on the screen for me. I would highly recommend this product. There is so much more you can do with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Full alexa power in little package
reviews.reviewText: This it a nice product, one of our first alexa devices. This unit is in the home office, allowing us to see and control our devices from our desk. Screen very clear, cameras show well. Nice sound too for music. The smallish size doesn't have to compete with 2 pcs and a printer, perfect for our space. Very happy with this prime day purchase

Love it But
Mike sensitivity pretty poor compared to dots
Needs more skills that take adv of video/screen

I like the size of it. I like the options for the clock. I love that I can see lyrics of songs. But the sound quality is really bad. I can't listen to it. I don't even like to hear her talk and music is unbearable for me. I was just about to return it when I remembered my little bluetooth speaker. When I pair it with the Echo Show 5, the sound from the speaker is great. So I will keep it.

Bought this as a gift for my 9 yr old. Boy was it a hit! We haven't even begun to use all the features, but she can listen to music, read the lyrics, call my cell, use it ad am alarm clock, ask the weather and video chat with her sister. I cannot get it to pair with her tv, but other than that, it's a great little gadget!

reviews.reviewTitle: Got his/hers to use as alarm clocks, but be aware...
reviews.reviewText: I tried to turn off my alarm this morning and both alarm clocks answered. This is going to be a problem... Otherwise, these are great devices and if you happened to score one on Prime Day, even better.

Ordered this to use at work to be able to monitor and control my house. Being able to see my cameras, answer the door and drop in to speak to family is very handy! I use it to listen to the radio at my desk as well. Very convenient size! Fits under my monitor like a glove.
Enjoy the words to music on the screen for singing along. Nice to see time and current temp.

Overall it isn’t bad for the price. It is a cheaper alternative than the larger Echo Show. Sound is decent for its size. Video is low quality but then again you wouldn’t probably use this device to watch movies. I love that this one has a cover for the camera which adds to the security of having control of the camera itself.

Working out better than I hoped. Mainly use for alarm functions, but also very handy for adding items to my schedule when they occur to me without having to get to my phone. Also nice to have music/videos so handy.

Voice recognition is ok, not terrific. Sometimes have issues being understood, but that should improve with time (I hope).

reviews.reviewTitle: No Amazon Recast TV support, the only reason I bought it.
reviews.reviewText:
Just to reiterate what others have said here: There's currently (Sept 2019) no way to stream Amazon's own Recast TV OTA DVR content to your Echo Show 5. Huge disappointment. I wish they state that the Show 5 doesn't support their own products.

It is cool that it integrates with our Google nest thermostat and Yi home camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its better than a Echo Dot speaker, but
reviews.reviewText: The screen is useful mostly. The speaker is disappointing. I had an Echo Dot with a Oontz Bluetooth speaker that was as good maybe better than the Show sound wise. I wouldn't pay full price. I use it in my home office for music, controlling smart home devices, and keeping appts etc. For the price on Prime Day withe the trade in it was a decent deal.

I am disappointed in the product. I purchased the Show 5 for my RV. It is the perfect size but it does not use current location for updating time and temperature. When I travel across time zones, I need to add or subtract time to know what the current time is. I requested, though Alexa, for my location to be current location and was told it did not have that function. Even my Kindle has that function.

Got this during the Amazon day sale for extremely cheap....finally replacing my 14 year old alarm clock. Works well and adapts brightness to the brightness in the room. easy to see the weather as soon as I wake up. sound quality is good, but the voice recognition seems to be a tad bit less capable in comparison to the original echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: A very nice Alexa device at an unbeatable price
reviews.reviewText:
In general this works as advertised and is a pretty solid piece of hardware given the price.

If you’re already using Alexa with other sound-based devices then the addition of the screen is pretty welcome for certain scenarios: for example the kids love the music videos and it’s nice to have a clock always on display.

My two gripes:
* There should be a wall-mounted echo show. I was planning on using this as a glorified home control panel and it really wants to be on your night table or desk.
* Dropping in from phone takes tens of seconds to show clear video. It’s baffling. And I can’t find a way to make it one-way only.

reviews.reviewTitle: Turning off Try Alexa or Ask Alexa!
reviews.reviewText: The first Alexa show that I purchased worked great after I went into setting and turned everything off. I did not see the constant barrage of asking Alexa to do something. With my newest Alexa I went into the setting and turned everything off and now Alexa will flip to another screen and Ask Alexa or Try this with Alexa happens. Since this is in my guest bedroom, I do not want my guests to continually see this when in the bedroom. I really only want a clock, the temperature and music if desired.

I really like it and it’s easy and fun to use. I use it for my nightstand clock. I just wish the black Screen(clock setting) at night was darker. It gives off a bit of like but it’s nothing that’s gonna make me move it to another room/use. Audio is good. Kids like it because it’s at their height and they can somehow easily fun kid friendly videos

Amazon has outdone themselves on this one! I always thought bigger was better, but not the case with this one. I own every Echo device that Amazon has ever made, and this one is by far the best. Nice compact size, great sound quality, and lots of great new features, including a mechanical camera privacy switch that physically blocks the camera lens. Out of the 5 Echo Shows that I own, I’m thinking of replacing them all with this one.
Amazon, nice job. Now turn off “Try” !

She's in every room in one form or another. I have to Show 5 - one on my nightstand which is perfect as a clock and quick view to any of my Blink or Nest cameras. Excellent quality for music too.
Compared to my Show, this one is excellent and at the Prime Day price, I had to grab 2.
Looking forward to the 8 :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent little Alexa Show with deficient sound
reviews.reviewText:
My echo show 5 is being used by my bed as an alarm, news source and other sound capabilities.
Unfortunately the base is a bit too pronounced which muffles the higher ranges and gives the sound a two source feeling as if the words were on top of an amplified base.
Hope they fix this.
Very happy in every other detail.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great replacement for my bedroom alarm clock.
reviews.reviewText: The Echo 5 is my 4th echo unit. Nicely constructed and well working.

I am older, but my Daughter has an Alexa that I have come to appreciate, so I thought it might be time to bring her home. I keep my Alexa in the kitchen. She is my song partner and recipe coach; as well as my instant information resource. Can't wait to Integrate her into the rest of the household-compatable plugs are expensive so I will have to be patient.

This product was delivered on time w/ prime now. I love the Echo Show! It was easy to set up and connect to wifi. I have an android phone. Fingers crossed it's working as if I have an iPhone without any problems so far! I use it for everything...the current weather in my area, finding recipes, calling my daughter in the next room and even putting me to sleep with sleep sounds at night! 5 star isn't enough stars!!!

I upgraded from an Echo Dot to the new Echo Show 5 because I got a Wyze security camera and wanted to be able to see it from the bedroom. I was surprised how quickly it connects to the camera. And I was pleased with the lower price, compared to the full size Show. I’ll probably be getting one of these and a Ring for my sister.

I am not impressed with Alexa. I have asked her questions she didn't have answers to. Not hard one. Than I asked my Google it had the answers. One question was what the latest dinosaur found ? Second how many Active volcanoes are there in N America ? She could not answer these questions. When buying her I thought she would be fun for learning for my 8 yr old daughter and myself as well. I was wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's awesome, but it could be so much better
reviews.reviewText:
It has done everything it has supposed to be able to do and so much more in just the first few hours I've had it and been playing with the skills and routines.

It could be so much more if Amazon let people create custom widgets, clocks, voices, trigger or wake up phrases, and the most noteworthy addition being some sort of battery backup base to allow you to move it around a room.

I genuinely enjoyed the echo products, transitioning from an echo dot to an echo show has its benefits such as video capabilities, security purposes, camera and touch screen additions to certain applications that gives a better access to Alexa. However, I feel like over time, Alexa becomes less smart. Certain commands that I used to tell her to do has shown to be difficult for her to understand now. And I know that I can set commands for her to recognize, but I feel like I shouldn’t be doing that for a smart device and especially for a lot of commands. It does look cool in my room and makes a good impression for anyone who sees it, but aside from a glorified alarm clock I mostly got it for aesthetic reasons and I hope the programming for Alexa will get better in the future updates.

So, I love my Echo Show. This screen is perfect for my night stand, and the sound quality is above average (i.e., clear, bass-evident, and sharp). I also have an Echo Connect, which allows me to answer my landline phone through all of my echo devices. If you, like me, are a landline lover, I certainly recommend the Echo Connect. Therefore, this Show acts as a speaker phone next to my bed. I look forward to all of the future products Amazon has in store. Alexa is like an artificial of my family now.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Show 5 does almost everything!!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love this little machine! It does so many things; I can get weather, play music & get the words, photo slide show, calendar updates, and so much more... it even dims at night! Love it! Thank you Amazon!!

Absolutely love my Echo Show 5. It runs so smoothly, is easy to navigate, and the screen just the right size. I traded in my Echo Spot for this and it ended up being a great trade-in. The regular Echo Show which I also love is bigger and I keep that device in my home office. I have the Echo Show 5 on both my nightstand and I bought another for my husband's!

I love this screen. From using it as a Prime Video display or helping my shopping journey, the Echo Show 5 is quite amazing. It also fits on my desktop with a minimal footprint!

Only thing is, when I touch the screen, it distorts slightly (like.. ripples on the screen). Not a concern I think, since I'll mainly be using my voice.

Poor audio quality compare to the original Alexa. I traded in my original Alexa for this and should have kept the original one based on using the new one for last 2 months. The microphone does not pick up command well. I literally have to yell to recognize the command. The speaker quality is ok. It does. It produce sound like the original Alexa.
Order this on prime day with trade in from echo dot. Love the video capabilities. Kids can watch videos on it. No issues with voice recognition. The speakers are loud enough for the whole room.

We added the echo show 5 to our kitchen and like it more than the spot. Sometimes our other alexa products pick up our voice before this one even when we are right in front of the show 5. I think this product would be great if you could flip it upside down and mount it underneath a cabinet, so you could keep it off the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really happy with this - traded in my regular Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I am loving this more than I thought. Having the screen is super convenient because it allows you to use the device with your voice or fingers. I am loving having my house become more and more tech savvy and hooking this up to my cameras and my Ring device. If you have a smart house or cameras this is an awesome addition!

I really like the smart light, plug and video connect features with Alexa. I use a wyze cam and smart light in my home and its so nice to say show me camera features and to be able to turn on/off lights with a verbal command. I've found so many skills I something forget what Alexa can do. I like it so much I put an echo spot in my kitchen too.

Too hard to connect apps like Hulu. YouTube is the only app I successfully connected. Some of the interactive games like Groot are dumb. No point and doesn’t do much. Needs to be updated. When asking Alexa to show a recipe there should be a function to save it into “my favorites “ or something like that. But all in all I guess it’s ok.

What's not to like... the sound quality is awesome, the picture is great... set up went without a hitch. Up and running in a snap. The voice recognition response time is so good that when I am talking to Echo in another room , far enough away you wouldn't expect the EchoShow5 to hear me, Echo Show responded quicker then my Echo
Overall nice package, user interface is fantastic! Screen quality and sound is slightly lower than earlier versions, but, can’t beat for the price especially on sale during the prime day!

I really like many of the functions of this device. But I do NOT like that every few seconds it goes into "advertisement" mode - the clock displays shrinks and goes to the upper rt corner and a message displays across the screen. I wanted a full clock display so that I could use this display as a clock in the bedroom.

I have a regular echo maybe 40ft away across a kitchen and living room. It picks my voice up looking at this thing at least half of the time. Very frustrating. The on-screen features are a nice bonus that make up for the fact that I have to be very careful to lower my voice to get this echo to respond. Hopefully that can be fixed in software!

I am very disappointed with this product. I can be sitting right next to it and it continuously gets my commands incorrect. Most of the time it’s response or output is not even close to the command I have it. My Echo and dot’s around the place do a much better job. I also have to use the wake word multiple times before it responds. Sometimes I yell a command across an open space to a different product and it works better than this which is sitting right next to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Alexa option for a bedroom
reviews.reviewText:
It's a really good option for a bedroom. The screen is really useful and you can control all alexa devices from the screen (like a tablet) without talking. Also a lot off the alexa app features are available here and the sound is pretty decent for an speaker of that size. Definitely is a really cool gadget.

My only complaint is about the mic sensitivity, because if you are used to the echo, you will notice the difference. There are just 2 microphones on top instead 7, so you have to be more close to the mic and the whispering function will not work that good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent addition to the Alexa lineup
reviews.reviewText: I ordered on the deal of the day even though I have several Alexa devices already. After reading some of the reviews I was concerned the the sound would be horrible. For a device of this size it is actually amazing. Amazon does an amazing job of making the set up seamless as my wifi password and account information didn't need to be input again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Keeps Track of all My Cameras
reviews.reviewText: Alexa integration helped me be able to see Cloud Cam, Nest Cam, Ring, and Blink all on one device. I am also able to play Amazon music, iHeart Radio, and Sirius XM. This is AWESOME.

I use it primarily as a bed side alarm clock. Likes; adaptive auto display brightness, customizable clock, good sound (vs Echo Dot-2). Quirks; some set up functions still require using the app, many touch screen operations have annoying laggy response. Over all a great little device (especially when purchased on sale!).

This is the first Alexa device I rated after having more than a dozen.. it's the best so far. The screen size is perfect and easy to read. I wish the stand came with. Read the description for a full look - but I like it best - it sits next to a Google device and the size and resolution is a skinny better in my view.

Show 5 turned out to be a big improvement over the Echo I had been using. I like the clock face with date feature and it is the perfect alarm clock, who won the game,whats the weather,remind me, play my music, how far is..., news brief, whats at the theater, shopping list, timer, etc., etc.,assistant. Great job Amazon!

Good enough to keep on an end table next to where you sit. Further away, seriously, too small for anything beyond a desk clock 95% of the time. Slightly larger speaker helps music as I added it to my living room Dot-3 speaker pair. Amazon really just needs to update the firmware to keep the clock large and visible 99% of the time so it could be more useful from across the room, or at least a clock app for it. 11/6/19 addendum

reviews.reviewTitle: Love, Love, Love my Echo Show 5!
reviews.reviewText: Love my Echo Show 5! It works just as good as the larger Echo Show, but is much more convenient because it's not as big. Don't know what I would do without my Echo Show!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great upgrade from the Dot!
reviews.reviewText: I have a smart home with multiple devices that were controlled with an Echo Dot. I wanted to upgrade to the Show 5 because the regular Echo Show was too big for my nightstand. What a huge improvement! Audio quality is great and customizing the screen is easy. The camera shutter is awesome too because I won’t have prying eyes trying to look at me.

reviews.reviewTitle: A very useful echo in an alarm clock form factor
reviews.reviewText: Excellent - a much notable improvement over the previous echo show, and the camera shutter is nice. Unlike other reviewers, I did not feel the audio quality was insufficient - it was plenty loud with a reasonable bass in a small form factor. The only room for improvement in my mind is the limited choice in clock faces and such - it would be nice to give us more options for clock faces and the information we wish to display on the clock/home screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price for all that it offers
reviews.reviewText: This thing seems to do everything I want it to do. I can't imagine what its big brother does for $100 more. It connects to ring cameras, makes calls, etc. I love that I can just say "call my wife" and I can talk to my wife on her phone. I can use it as an intercom with other echo devices in the house. It's great!

So far so good... not in love and decently not 5 starts. I like the show the camera function, but the sounds fidelity sucks.
Update: the functions that Amazon teak IR can do are not there, tech support has no clue and just says the engineering is aware of it ..
Waste of money and I wish I had my old echo 2 back from the trade in I made ..

I have several different Echo devices and so far this is my favorite. The sound it produces is awesome. The screen is large enough to clearly see the images but not so large as to require too much space. I'm considering trading up all my Echo devices to these, but am wondering what Amazon will come out with next that may even surpass this one.

I was actually looking for a alarm clock with blue tooth. Most models were around 30 dollars. I saw the Echo Show on sale for just 15 dollars more, so I got it. Best decision for what I was wanting and a lot more. Alarm clock that you can turn off by voice, very nice. Get the weather for the day while getting dressed. Even get a video to watch with your cup of coffee before leaving the house. It does have blue tooth but with but with Amazon music and other music stations you don't really need it but nice to have anyway. Another quick note it has a slide show feature for your photographs from Amazon Photos and Facebook. You can even set your own photo as the background for the clock face, very cool.

It’s okay, but not worth the money. I’ve actually been pretty disappointed at how it doesn’t respond. We have 3 dots, and they work much better. It also buffers a lot. There have been many things that it doesn’t respond to (when I’m in the same room) but my echo dot (two rooms away) will respond to. I’m disappointed. I was really hoping this was going to be the best, but instead it’s just meh.

reviews.reviewTitle: Update turned mediocre device into garbage
reviews.reviewText: A recent update makes the device next to useless as a clock since it will no longer stay on the large time display more than five seconds no matter how one has it configured. This is an idiotic and infuriating change that, if not corrected soon, will lead to a return.

reviews.reviewTitle: Viewing photos is one my best times.
reviews.reviewText: It's very useful, to many to list. My wife love trying different recipes just ask echo and bingo new recipes. I ask all kinds of questions and get a great response. You'll need to try one to experience.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love it and it works for us!
reviews.reviewText: I know there are a lot of bad reviews for the show 5 but we actually like them. They fit perfectly in the rooms they are in they don't take up a ton of space and we don't mind the small screen or the ask Alexa ads. We have learned a lot about what Alexa can do through the ads. It works perfect with our home security system. The only downside we have is we wish Hulu worked on it but other than that we love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't recognize my words. Very Frustrating
reviews.reviewText: I was hoping the Echo Show 5 would replace a bedroom radio-alarm clock. I can't get it to play the radio station that I want, I don't particularly like the way the clock is displayed, and I don't like the constant messages. One good thing so far, it will show me the weather. I think the idea has a lot of potential, but the product is not there yet. I hope Amazon can make it better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon Music only one at a time
reviews.reviewText: I have an amazon alexa device in most of my rooms and when one is streaming music, the others cannot stream music. Why is this a limitation? Do i need each device to be on it's own amazon account to be able to do this? Sound quality is also pretty poor. I feel my iphone has better sound quality than this device.

truth be told I got this to be an alarm clock that would scroll pictures form my unlimited Amazon Photo Storage. It does that and s o m u c h MORE! My kids love to have it read bedtime stories. It gives me scores for my favorite teams, and like and echo dot answered anything and everything. Now I want one with a larger screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! Love Alexa and works better than Siri!
reviews.reviewText: Still a little odd talking to a machine but I hate to say, she responds much better than my Siri... I love the screen and the speaker quality is very good for what it is. I really like it and will start using Alexa more and more. I have it in my kitchen and bought a couple of dots as well. Really great product.

I like this product very much I bought this because I like how it shows the time on the display it makes it look like a smart alarm clock and its cool that I can watch my prime shows and movies on it and I like the ideal Alexa is built in.
there is two things I don't like it doesn't do it doesn't support Netflix App and Silk Browser hopefully in time amazon will come up with a update for that. I like you can also make video calls which I don't use at moment but i plan on using it in the future. I'm pretty much using this Device like I use my Alexa speakers. I like this device so much I'm wanting to trade some of my devices in and upgrade to the echo show 10.1

I love my little show. I purchased Gen 1 last year and fell in love with it. It’s perfect for so many things: finding recipes, checking my calendar, showing song lyrics along with all the other Alexa features. I bought myself the Show 5 my lake cottage because I just wasn’t satisfied with “plain” Alexa! I bought 2 more for grandchildren Christmas gifts!

This is a great addition to our Echo family. It makes an excellent clock on the nightstand and the sound quality is great. The video screen is about the same size as the average smart phone. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: fails to live up to hype
reviews.reviewText: This device has failed to live up to its hype or the $90 price tag. On the Echo Dot, I could ask for a particular song or audio book and receive it immediately. For this unit, asking for a movie on Prime Video may result in an "I don't know" or a definition of Prime Video. It often requests payment for movies that are free on Prime and my Watchlists do not match. Asking for a TV episode in a series never works. I'm not sure if there are just too many options for the Alexa system to handle or if this has flaws. Maybe I need to wait for Echo Show 6.

For some time I've been thinking about trying out the Echo/Alexa system. Just received the Echo Show and set it up. I'm a senior citizen, not especially technically challenged, but far from technically astute. This was easy, logical, and quick. Now, I want one on every floor. Dare I say, Alexa, order an Echo Show?

I have had this for several weeks not and I love it. I am a big Echo fan and owned several of them. I love this because it is small and goes well with my kitchen décor. I use it to dictate recipes, put on a timer, and of course have a dance party. I love it and cannot wait to see what Amazon comes up with in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: learn the lingo and key words.
reviews.reviewText:
If the questions are not phrased or asked jut so, it does not work.
Certain phrases work and others don't.
Do not know how the problem can be solved.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speaker issue. Really nice bedside clock though.
reviews.reviewText: The speaker started randomly making a scratchy sound while playing music, within the first week. I had to return it. It was smaller than expected even after reading reviews. Haha.. Basically my cell phone screen. But the clock face was nice and it automatically dims at night. Maybe I'll look into getting one again down the road.

I like the way I can easily set the alarm. I was disappointed that I couldn't find the pic of the dog in the beach to put on my home screen. I like that I got it at a discounted price. Still haven't figured out if I can get my e-mail on it or if I can change Alexa's voice to sound like a man's voice and call it Alex.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Replacement for an Alarm Clock.
reviews.reviewText: As usual the setup was very easy. And the screen is the perfect size for a bedroom’s nightstand. I would highly recommend purchasing the optional stand,which should come the device.My only complaint is that it’s not quite as responsive as the “Echo Spot” that it replaced.But again the screen offers a much better viewing experience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Goes beyond the price you pay for
reviews.reviewText:
For a 5.5in screen it has excellent picture quality & even though it has 1 speaker it still sounds good.
I have the Echo Show 5 a the original Echo 1gen. Both are great & offer a lot in small packages.

I bought this for my nightstand to replace an old Google Home. It works great. The screen is nice and bright and I love setting alarms by voice. I like the ability to display my photos from previous years. Like all Echos, I wish the Apple Music integration would recognize all my playlists - not just some of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to the Alexa line!
reviews.reviewText: It was very easy to set up and had a pretty good sound quality. I hooked mine up to a Bluetooth speaker as I wanted a better sound quality for listening to music but otherwise I think most people would be happy with how it sounds without one. The screen is a decent size and allows me to see the feed from my security cameras. I would recommend the Show 5 over the spot because of the larger screen.
Can't turn off the try suggestions on the home screen
I love the smaller size. I have it in my bedroom. I enjoy setting music to play for a designated time while falling asleep. I’m also using it for my morning alarm.

Honestly, I haven't had time to sit down and actually figure echo out yet. I really like the voice recognition. Much Better than any other device in that category. I can have tv on loud and it still recognizes my voice. My Note 9 phone definitely can't compete when echos voice recognition. I'm not even sure how it utilizes motion detection

I love the Echo Show! We already have Tap, which we love and are disappointed it’s been discontinued. I also have 2 Dots, that I need some help coordinating them. My favorite features of the Show are playing my Amazon Music playlists and watching a slide show of my Grandkids! I definitely recommend Echo Show!

I purchased 2 Echo Shows - one for my bedroom and one for my office. I think that they are perfect as alarm clocks. I like that I can use them to view my Blink a security cameras and see the weather forecast when I wake up.

Great addition to the house. The voice recognition and sense of direction has vastly improved. Ours is in the kitchen proves very useful. Good sound for music in our space. Overall, good purchase for the price.
My only criticism would be in the size. If it were bigger and had more easily accessible capability to stream video, I’d be completely on-board. I find myself watching something on the iPad and using Alexa as a kitchen timer.

I have been using Amazon Echos devices for over a year. When the Echo Show 5 came out I decided to give it a try. I placed it in the kitchen and so far have mostly not used the video features. Slowly I have starting using the video features. With my Ring doorbell I can see who is st the door without pulling out my phone. I like being able to see a wether report. The longer I have it, the more useful it becomes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its small but its great.. SUPER as a bedside alarm clock / assistant etc..
