reviews.reviewText: The sound is better then the original and 2nd gen dots.. maybe not as good as the 3rd gen dot but hey .. you get this for the overall thing and the screen makes it great.. love the pricepoint and its not as big as the regular show which may be tough to put just anywhere.. Great for keeping up with remote family members .. voice+Video calling for free over the alexa is super

I have an Echo Dot in my living room but wanted something for my bedroom. This is perfect! Like the screen....I like seeing the info instead of just hearing it. Sound is excellent for playing music. I have it set to slideshow with a bunch of my photos. Just wish you could plug it into a charging unit like my Dot, but this is ok for now.
Love love love this!! I use it every night as a noise machine and it shows my sons room camera anytime I ask. The kids love to dance to the music it plays as well.

This device is awesome! The echo show 5 is my first Alexa device and it works and understands me perfectly.

I have it linked with my LG AIThinq and it responds on commands- tv on/off, volume. Don't have channels though because of set top box. Other than that it works great.

Also contrary to other reviews I enabled my echo to only show the time without the scrolling info. However it doesn't bother when it suggests things here and there.

Very happy with it! Thanks Amazon

I bought this on prime day for half price, otherwise for what it is i wouldent pay full price. It does work as it should and seems to be of quality. its in my wifes office and she can run the whole house with it including viewing our RING doorbell cam. If you got the extra cash then do it, otherwise wait for a sale or look on offerup

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to the Echo lineup
reviews.reviewText: I like the echo show 5. I’m using it to replace my echo spot. The larger screen is nice and the sound is so much better. I’ll be buying another one so that my daughter can have one in her room.

I wanted the big echo show and then this one went on sale so I thought it was perfect to try and see if I liked it. It's the perfect size for a desk clock.
I already own an echo, 2 echo dots and a echo tap. I also have 2 fire sticks and a ring indoor camera. I love all my Alexa products and can't wait for more!!
Highly recommend this product!

This has to be the most "meh" product in the echo line. I'm not exactly sure what I was expecting but I thought that it would be a smaller version of the Show II. It feels cheaply made and barely has enough weight to stay put on my nightstand. I feel like I move it back into position a lot. Sound quality leaves a lot to be desired. Screen resolution is as advertised but leaves a lot to be desired. I've also noticed that the camera takes extraordinarily long to focus when using the drop in feature. This may be by design in order to allow naked people in the bedroom to clear its view before the drop in takes place. Either way, not good, not bad. Its okay.

reviews.reviewTitle: AMAZON include the base for these devices!!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought two spot and they have been good so far. My BIGGEST problem with both the spot and the show 5 to this point is the viewing angle. This is an easy fix with an AMAZON $20 base. AMAZON you are making a killing. Why not just include the base?!

I’m a prime member and have been. I bought two show 5s on prime day. I’m very happy so far..... but have to spend another $40 so that the angle of camera is not looking at the ceiling.

So amazon please stop being so tight and include the dang base or drop the price, it’s not a $20 item “half what I paid for the show”. With all that I will say I also own and am very happy with.....
Echo 1st gen
Fire stick
Spot x 2
Blink cameras
And more. I support Amazon love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great upgrade from the Echo Spot
reviews.reviewText: I thought that nothing could take away my love for my Echo Spot which I used primarily as a bedside alarm clock. The one thing that I didn't like about the Spot was that the screen was so small. I never upgraded to the Show series because they were just too big. The Echo Show 5 is just the perfect size to use bedside.

reviews.reviewTitle: I kind of miss the bigger screen
reviews.reviewText: This was a great trade-in deal, but I do think it seems really small now. The screen seems like an iPhone 5 screen turned horizontally, or a very small alarm clock. I like the features to block the camera, and I like how the screen auto-darkens, but I do thin kit seems a bit too tiny compared to the original Show. Maybe I will learn to love it.

I really love the size of it. It works well like my show but, it did start recording a conversation that it should not have. I was on the phone and then it started repeating what I had said. I would love to keep it on but, maybe it you can change it to any name you prefer it would not confuse it with alexia.

I like the larger display in a relatively small footprint. The larger clock numbers make it easy to see from across the room. I like that it has a built-in camera cover. Of course, Alexa works great, finds and displays the recipes I ask for. The sound is good, although that's not the main use of this Echo device for me. Being used to the Echo Spot, I am just thrilled with the larger display.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is way better with video
reviews.reviewText:
Just love it. Another Quality assistant from amazon. Clear video and sound. Music is balanced even at volume 10. Multi room music fills the house. The white color cloth back looks very sleek. Well build device.
I wish they had a battery built.
Alexa with a video screen gives you a whole different perspective. it is an excellent device.

This thing does everything that I want, at an affordable price. I play with this device more than my computer. I know that everyone is afraid of AI and it listening. I could honestly care ! It's benefits way outweigh it's liabilities for me. Besides AI is everywhere anyways. This product has brought mostly positives to my life being an aging man.
I received the Amazon show as a gift! Everything about it is amazing, screen sound response set up everything!! I had and still have the Amazon Tap the show is so much more!
Does a whole lot more than I ever thought possible! A huge time saver and source of entertainment and knowledge for our whole family! Wish I had gotten sooner!

The sound quality is poor. It is as if the speaker inside is torn/distorted. I sent it back for repair, all they did was re-download the software and send it back. No change.
Moreover, the unit setup is annoying. Why can’t it be set up like other Echo units through the Alexa app? The touchscreen input is annoying and lacks responsiveness. At least give the option to set up the unit through the app just like the Echo Dot or Echo.

I would contend that it is not ADA compliant for low vision or blind

Unhandy as heck. To see it you need it right by you and since it requires a power cord that makes it useless to me as I don’t have power handy where I can see it (coffee table). So it sits where the the echo dot did in the room and display is useless. Make these with rechargeable batteries. As an expensive echo dot they work fine.

I love the echo show. Only dislike is when I ask Alexa to dim a light or brighten a light the display screen changes to the light brightness screen. It shows the (example: kitchen light) light at 50% with a on/off bottom and a slide dimmer. If I say “kitchen off” the light goes off but the display screen stays on that dimmer/on/off screen for 60 seconds at full brightness before the Alexa screen dims itself with the ambient lighting function. I want the light off because I turned the lights off. I don’t like that I can’t control this feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device especially with visual display
reviews.reviewText:
Great device. Had the Dot and Tap but having a visual display knocks the ball out of the ballpark.
Hope that Amazon comes out with a bigger size visual display.

I’ve not had the opportunity to “play” with the Echo 5 that much, but it is a nice addition to my bedside table. Until I really get to know it, it’s a nice alarm clock. Not noticing that the switching screens bother me, as once I turn out the lights, the screen dims to something that blends into available light.

This Echo 5 is smaller than I thought but that's even better. I don't sit there and look at it, I walk around cleaning a couple of rooms and listen to music. I tell it what type music or an artist, and it does it's thing. Worth every penny. I might buy another for myself and one as a gift for a friend.

We have 6 echo devices in our home (echo, dot, echo show). Why buy more? Well we did buy this smaller and cheaper version of the echo show. I could not be more delighted. The video and sound is crystal clear. Easy set up. Quick integration with the rest of our devices. Whole-heartedly endorse this product

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed no instructions on how to add Ring 2 to Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: I'm disappointed in the lack of good instructions on how to link my Ring 2 doorbell to the Echo Show. Since you were pushing the ability to add Ring to the Echo Show, I would've expected instructions to have been included. I've been reviewing posts in the forums but it's still unclear to me on how to complete this task. It shouldn't be this difficult.

This device is fantastic! I know that I am only scratching the surface regarding what Alexa can do. We have really come to enjoy this unit much more than expected as my original thought was to place it in a bedroom to be used as an alarm clock has now transformed into a kitchen area setting where everyone present utilizes Alexa's skills. I did not buy this unit for sound quality, but what it does deliver is certainly adequate for the setting. I am planning to purchase additional units in order to work with the "drop-in" features.

We have an Echo in several rooms in the house and this Echo Show 5 is the perfect desktop addition for my home office. Sound quality is great, screen size is perfect, and the visible clock face is a very nice feature. I use it for all the usual Echo functions including controlling lights in the room. A good buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome Addition to the Product Line
reviews.reviewText: I wish I had purchased another one during Prime Day and I will be purchasing the larger Echo Show... First, let me say, I am working towards an Alexa enabled home - I have automated lights, security, and other features already and the new Echo Show 5 with the display is a great addition. It's great seeing my morning flash briefing and other items on the screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible screen... which is the whole point of the product.
reviews.reviewText: The screen is horrible. It has bad contrast, black level and viewing angle. I realize it is cheap but perhaps it is too cheap. I bought it to replace an old school digital alarm clock. It has a night mode of red click digits and black background (like the clock it is replacing). This sounds great but it is too difficult to read the clock without turning the screen brightness way up. Then it is too bright when trying to sleep.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love our new member of our family!
reviews.reviewText:
We traded our Alexa for the alexa show. We are really enjoying the new member of our family. Voice recognition is a bit slower than the original Alexa. But the video capability, taking pictures and amazon photo slide show more than make up for it.

We are happy with our Alexa show, she is awesome!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Need some improvement on the touch screen and the group options when you have multiple devices.
reviews.reviewText: The only problem is with using the group function and the touch screen option. The Echo 5 sometimes stops playing as a group. I have had to open and close the phone app to get it to work. It would not follow my voice command. Additionally, I could not use the screen touch option for any commands. The sound and video is really good.

Bought 3 Echo 5's for the wife, and one of the bigger ones. She loves to listen to books and read them too. So they work very well for her and what she does. She wants to use the one in the kitchen for recepes and things like that.
I use it for music and the weather.
Works great as an alarm clock and for reminders.
Only thing I don't really like a lot is how dim it is at night time.

Totally awesome communication tool with screen. Just love it. Connects to my ring and other smart home devices.
Controls Alexa events from one room. I even put my 5 and 7 minute workouts on it.
Get soothing rain forest and ocean sounds and up to date news clips, and weather reports. Very outstanding product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a transformer, but it will Transform your life for the better
reviews.reviewText: I love it. This new gen has the built-in camera hide, it fits. It isn't bulky like my 1st gen show but seems to put out the same if not a better quality of sound. It makes my life easier. From video calls to cooking timers, weather check to news, even reading the bible to me while I'm doing housework. The Echo Show 5 is a blessing.
Had for an hour and am already tired of the constant try this suggestions

The echo show works with my security system, lights and speakers. Alexa works good with all my commands and glad I purchased. My sister has one and told me about how her family enjoys having in their home. Did not have any issues setting up and it came in great condition. I also ordered the stand and sits great on my nightstand.

I like my other Echos better. For some reason, this one often does not seem to hear me, and I have to speak loud and clearly. The other Echos just "get me". I don't use the screen much. Overall I love having an "Alexa" in almost every room. Use them every day to get time, weather and turn on lights.

It's a decent unit. Screen quality is good, voice is good. I just wish it integrated with other apps besides the Echo/Amazon apps. Examples: I can't see my Outlook emails on the screen. And I can't see my phone texts. Those would require me signing up for add'l email accounts, and that's ridiculous.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty easy to set up and get going
reviews.reviewText: My very first Alexa. And she is fabulous. I mainly use her for music. And weather. As she is in my living room. I love her size. Looks like a clock /. Haven’t figured out all of what she can do yet. But it’s easy as of now to set up and learning features as I go. Just got my smart plugs so she can start controlling lights and fans and such. Liked her so much ordered the big one ( show) and have in bedroom. My favorite feature is asking the time when it’s the middle of the night. As if I open my eyes. I won’t be able to go back to sleep. So find it very helpful and the sleep sounds ( listen to rain nightly ) helps me sleep better as well

I loved my Echo for its sound, so decided to try this Echo Show 5. The sound was terrible- like and old transistor radio. The size and screen are fine, but if you want music, forget it. I retuned it for the much bigger Show with much better sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: I read slot of reviews. I don’t know what people expect ! It’s awsome !
reviews.reviewText: I am sorta shocked at the sound that comes out of this. Crystal clear when I have it set on loudest. Adorable for night stand when you wanna play and not get out of bed yet Worth every dime

reviews.reviewTitle: Could do more but nice alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: This could do more. I would like to watch Netflix or other streaming services. I love the concept of the “routine” but that is also limited. It works great as an alarm clock and I like that you can choose the background and manually shut the camera. The auto dim of the screen at night is also great.

This device does everything the Echo Show does (I have both)...just smaller and less expensive...and I like the fact that I can turn off the camera. Turning off the camera doesn't affect the functionality of the device so I keep it off all the time. The sound quality is similar to the other devices.
Excelente..!! Supero mis expectativas..!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome device, for the price! (Whoop Whoop! That rhymes!)
reviews.reviewText: I have Alexa devices all through my house and this one is, by FAR, my favorite! The small size is great for a night stand, and they did not compromise on the sound. The screen was nice and crisp. The camera wasn't "great" but it is sufficient for its purpose. I did not purchase it to take studio photos. For me, the "Alexa Suggestions" are easily ignored. I highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: If you spend time studying what it can do, it'd be great
reviews.reviewText: The best I've found is hypnosis "tapes" to play when I want to go to sleep. A different subject every night. Not the highest quality but for free.... Speaker is too bassy but can be adjusted with equalizer. The auto brightness clock with bright bold letters is worth the price alone ( and you can always yell "What time is it?")

reviews.reviewTitle: The perfect tool for your office
reviews.reviewText: I have the show at home and was using a dot in my office. When this was introduced I had to buy it right away for my office. It works very well and helps me stay on Pace with my schedule at all times. If you want to stay organized and need a visual assistant, this is the perfect tool for your office.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Things to try" horrible, 5 stars if it wasnt for this
reviews.reviewText: It's a cool bedside clock and decent speaker. Biggest issue is the constant "things to try". There is only a way to limit them but have not seen a complete shut off option. It is very annoying and would have been 5 starts if it wasnt for this. Instead of wanting to try those features it just makes me want to do it less.

I got this one to replace my dot. Love how when you ask Alexa how old is someone, the information pops up on the screen. The only thing it doesn't do (or I haven't figured it out yet) is notify you when your package arrives. My dot (which I moved from my bedroom to the kitchen) flashes yellow. My show doesn't....errrr....show anything. Oh and the Show has great audio. Much louder than the Echo dot. Recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact screen is the biggest issue . . .
reviews.reviewText: Over all I like the new unit because it functions pretty much as it's supposed to except Alexa occasionally doesn't recognize a word or phrase, but that's typical. Oddly enough it's the compact size of the screen I have issue with because it seems like there's something "missing" or that the designers were "stingy" for some reason. It almost looks like a bedside clock (was that what they were going for?) as opposed to an Echo Show unit. Actually, the ergonomics of the Echo Show 5 make it more suited for a hotel room rather than a personal AI device. Not a bad thing in and of itself.
Great for a nightstand

As an echo it's fine. As an alarm clock? It's junk. Can't set alarms for specific days unless you set one alarm for each day. You have to poke at the screen a dozen times to get it to snooze. That said, it sounds decent for its size and the voice recognition is fantastic as always for an echo product.

This is so great we had google and switched to Alexa then got this one with the screen. I love it because we call my grandparents states away and are able to see them it easy for them to use. I also love I can ask her anything and she will put it up and show me on the screen like recipes or websites.

I’m an avid user of Amazon products, I have two echo spots, one echo, and a recent user of the Echo show 5... I’m very disappointed. The Echo show 5 has issues with poor sound quality and static. The screen also has issues with ghosting, no burn in as of yet, but it does not do well with refreshing and ensuring the screen stays clear. I’ve already had to replace the Show 5 once, and now I’m being told I might have to send this one back due to the screen issues... several other people are reporting the same issues, and Amazon refuses to provide a fix or answer. I was hoping this would be a great product, but it’s turned into a lemon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not what I thought...price should go down
reviews.reviewText: Screen is smaller than what is advertised. Having a Alexa in the kitchen and in the living room is annoying, I know I can change ones wake up name but I really like saying Alexa can you ......Also I have it on my fireplace and bought the stand and still have to sit it on a book just to see part of the living room

reviews.reviewTitle: This dumb device has a lot to be desired!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: this is the most unresponsive unfriend user-friendly frustrating device that Amazon has come up with an I own probably 14 Alexa devices this one is trifling unfortunately I didn't pay attention to the return date and I'm stuck with it I would give this back I'm thinking about unplugging it and putting it in a drawer I'll go back to my echo dot for my bedroom hate it
It serves as an alarm clock and much more. Alexa integration allows me to check my ring doorbell, automate tasks, check weather and traffic etc.. it’s not overly large and works well.

Great screen size and perfect angle for a night stand. It does everything all Echo’s can do. I’ve even found the aquarium skill that I really enjoy. I plan on using these for my video doorbell also. I’ve already ordered another one from prime day sales.

reviews.reviewTitle: where are the instructions and why doesn't Alexa hold the Xfinity streaming?
reviews.reviewText: I thought it would be fun to have an additional Alexa Show since I have the original and larger screen. I wanted to maybe watch a program but the cord is too short. There are no instructions that I can find anywhere. I set up the streaming to my Xfinity and ask Alexa to put on a particular show or station and she doesn't understand. I have tried multiple times and it doesn't work. The app is on my phone but I have yet to figure out what I am not doing or doing wrong. I don't have alot of time and so quick and easy are essential. I'm very disappointed.

Love the echo show. It is compact enough to fit on my night stand, so I use it as an alarm clock. You can adjust the brightness of the screen, so it doesn’t interfere with sleep. The sound quality is very good considering the size of the product. I liked it so much that I ordered a couple more to give as Christmas presents!

reviews.reviewTitle: A wonderful home tool for everyone!
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the ease of installation and the ease of operation! The clock alone is wonderful and the assistance it gives to a disabled person is outstanding ! Thank you Amazon!

The main reason I brought my Echo Show 5 was for a alarm clock to my favorite music and to be able to play my prime music in another room. I like the idea that I can ask Alexa to play any song on my Amazon playlist or any other song. I can also watch prime movies and dozens of other new things I have not tried yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything you can ask for plus more for its price!
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 5 really impressed me for its size, and the fact that I was able to snatch for only $50 was a win for me. Pretty much, if you've been on the fence about getting the regular Echo Show but its price has been stopping you, the Echo Show 5 is the way to go. If you can deal with the smaller screen, a subpar sound that is really only good for bedroom use (doesn't get very loud), and the fact that it isn't wireless, then you'll end up loving it. My favorite feature thus far is how I can set a music station to be my alarm sound and sometimes, I also have it play rain sounds for me at night. And even though I don't use these features, you could also watch something from Amazon Prime through it or videos through Vimeo.

Everything works just fine. The size in our bedroom is very good as the screen is sharp. Being able to close the camera shutter is excellent. The voice recognition is about 90%. The sound has too much bass in it. I used the Alexa app to correct but still a little be too much. Other than that, it is a great price and great product

I got it because we needed to be able to answer our ring doorbell in more places. It's turned out to be something that the whole family loves. My kids constantly ask Alexa questions and interact with it much more than they did with the Echo dot. I love the privacy feature that has a built in camera cover.
No problems yet. I bought this to look at lyrics from Amazon music. Very easy to use and set up. Volume sounds great and screen works fine

We bought two of these on Prime Day (one black, one white) to upgrade from the Echo Dots we were using in the bedroom and kitchen, and LOVE the addition of the screen. It makes a perfect clock on the counter and night table, and I enjoy the changing news stories and weather info. Most fun, though, is singing along karaoke-style as song lyrics scroll by while listening to music. Do ya need one? No. Should ya get one? Yes!

reviews.reviewTitle: This show fits wellnext to my night stand.
reviews.reviewText: It allows me to access my Ring alarm and Ring cameras at night if I get a alert or if someone rings my video doorbell. Also, it works good width my Alexa skills. The audio quality is ok for what I use it for. I purchased a 2nd gen show for great audio quality and the integrated hub. and it works good on my kitchen table.

My son loves his Alexa! I was looking for an alarm clock and timer for him so that he can get up on his own in the morning and use the timer to make sure that he brushes his teeth for 2 minutes. He likes being able to see the weather before he leaves his room and feels like a "big boy" because he has his own Alexa now.
When I initially purchased this new device I had my doubts about it's size. Turns out it's a perfect fit for our needs. The most surprising thing however is the sound quality! Superb!

I try a few Amazon devices here and there , this one is the worse one yet. Horrible sound quality. It sounds muffled all the time. I've moved the device several times and it still sounds terrible. Not sure if I have a bad device ... Stay away from this one if you are looking for sound quality.

I love my Echo show 5 and so does all of my children and grandchildren. I had a repair man to my house and he ask me what my grand baby was watching and what was that she was watching it on. I said her shows she only two and she knows how to find her shows on my echo. He was like are you kidding me. Of course I said no its true. Wow he said I have a mother who is very ill . Do you think she would like it and know how to use it. I said yes and if he had one he could talk to her and see her. Well where did you find it. I told him QVC where I find lots of things and also on Amazon and if you are a prime member you get free prime video and music. I have so many songs for my grandchildren. He said he was going to buy tow

It is exactly what I needed. My first language is not English and even with my accent Alexa can understand me very well.
Perfect to have some music while I cook or watch recipes.
Some people was complaining about the quality of the image and sound. I have a Bose speaker so I am not expecting that the ECHO show has the same quality or the image to have the same quality of my TV. Sound is perfect for smaller rooms.

reviews.reviewTitle: You Can Turn Off the Camera Feature.
reviews.reviewText: Love that I can see the weather for the day. Viewing things gives you so much more information than just hearing it. I also like that you can turn off the camera.

I really like that it displays time and weather without having to ask for the information. I also like that it senses the lighting conditions and adjusts the display automatically. I haven’t used it for video calling yet and appreciate that I can block the camera since I am using it in my bedroom.

We have a smart home and we love our echo devices! We use the echos to communicate throughout the house so there is no need to yell- yes we talk to each other thru the screens from downstairs to up Hey! We have teens! It's great for music, it shows the lyrics! So many skills! I need an app to remember the skills I need to recall!

I love this device but there are issues with device integration with smart bulbs and especially with the SkyBell video doorbell. This device is supposed to have a built in hub but why must I have to buy another hub for smart bulbs. That makes no sense.
Also, there are only a few things for hearing impaired people. This needs to increase so it can be completely interactive with hearing impaired individuals. Hopefully, someone can incorporate a program which can help Alexa recognize ASL.
The sound, size and picture quality are perfect for me.
I hope Amazon works on improving some of these known issues in order to keep their followers.

I bought my second Echo Show 5 during Prime Days and got quite a bargain. It is the only device of it's kind that I have so I cannot provide much in the way of exacting comparisons to other brands. I do wish some of the apps were more "new user" focused. Still, for all the things it does---it does most of them well.

Within one day the camera stopped working. Had to do a factory rest to get camera to work. Called tech support and they said that this is their only solution at this moment. Having to factory rest is not a solution, but a work around. Support said they do not know why camera stops working nor do they know if a real fix is coming for this problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Eh, glad it was only $50, screen no value, slow
reviews.reviewText: Not impressed. My prime account is secondary under a family member, so cannot play prime videos, hulu not supported on show-5, ring camera access way so slow to interact.

It's a very nice piece of device. Easy to set up, size is perfect - not too small or too large. I have 4 echo dots at home. This echo show 5 has all the features echo dot has, plus very useful screen. The screen can be used to display time, weather, etc. The best part is, it can connect to my Wyze Camera and show me what my dog is doing! The interface is also pretty good. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: No Amazon FreeTime - Can't Lock The Kids Out
reviews.reviewText: This device has been quite frustrating for me as I can't lock my kid out of it using FreeTime. The only thing I've been able to lock him out of is the web search which doesn't keep him out of Prime videos, etc. I unplugged it the other day because we couldn't keep him away from it and I was going to lose my sanity.

Constant problems. I have 2 Echo Show 1s that are perfect. Thought I was upgrading and to a more compact model. When I call another Echo Show now sometimes they can barely hear me with their volume all the way up, and then 10-15 mins it increases to normal. Now the other Echo Show can’t see me. I’ve switched the camera shutter back and forth multiple times, rebooted, no luck. Just a camera image with a line through it showing me camera is off when it isn’t. Amazon needs to can this and move to 6. Going to try calling Amazon and exchanging this, but right now it’s shut down and I’m back on the 1.

I love the size and that you can turn off the camera. Great for the bedroom or other private places. It is a nice size and good promotional price! Of course, now they have the 8. (What happened to 6 & 7?) I like the smaller size but the 8 is suppose to have better resolution, but costs more.

My only problem with this device is the god awful sound. Sounds like someone's holding a rag over the speaker. Irritating! I will return if I can't fix it and so far I haven't had any luck. I've tried boosting treble all the way and cutting bass, but that seems to have no affect. Irritating!
I bought this for my mom and she absolutely loves it! The sound quality is fantastic and she loves that it can show her weather, be her alarm clock and use it for video calls!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5" screen is very small in person
reviews.reviewText: Everything is good on this product except they should have made the screen a little bigger. My cell phone screen(Note 9) is bigger than this and this screen stays very hot in temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easiest setup ever for an electronic device
reviews.reviewText: This was the easiest setup I've ever experienced, just plug it in and follow the easy-to-understand directions. The picture quality is good and clear, just remember that it's only 5 inches. My intent is that it function as a smart desk clock and it looks like it will perform that task quite well.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Echo Show is perfect for the kitchen!
reviews.reviewText: I love this device. When cooking, I have thousands of recipes at my finger tips. Alexa will even read it step by step! When cooking is all done and we are ready to sit down and eat, Alexa plays some nice dinner music for us. I love the display and how it has scrolling info on it. This device is defiantly worth the money.
Traded in our older original Alexa for this. Nice screen and very versatile in the kitchen for my wife. We set up many “routines” that are helpful using some of our smart home appplications.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall a great replacement for an alarm clock
reviews.reviewText: I love the small form and functions and customization, has good sound but at about 75% volume it kinda distorts but still is clear.I like that It can be used it in stereo with my 1st gen echo overall good product and nice size for a night stand I use it as my alarm clock and the camera cover is an awesome privacy feature.

Nothing seems to work on Echo show. Host of problems:

1. When I connect remotely via Drip In the camera doesn’t turn on and I get a message “video off”. Tried resetting, but doesn’t help. Even if resetting would help I don’t see why one would have to use such drastic measures everyone there is a problem with the decide. Super annoying.

2. Voice recognition is just a joke. I have to sometimes shout at the Echo Show (already weird enough) so it hears. I have to always stand in front of it to be heard. If I stand behind the device it doesn’t hear me.

Being stuck in Amazon only land is frustrating, very frustrating. I want to like this, but I also want to throw it out a window. Also, the skills section is crazy. It may well have 50,000 skills but searching them is exhausting and mind-numbing. I have multiple Echo and Fire devices and this is my first disappointment.

I love this thing, except for the amount of bass from alexa's voice. It's so annoying that it basically vibrates the table when she talks, even after turning bass all the way down. Great for music, bad for Alexa's voice. Causes the low frequencies to carry far more than the mids and highs.

I have to admit, I really only got the 5 because of the larger screen than the Spot, but now I'm extremely glad I did. It's SO much better, from sound to image quality and everything in between. This is more than an upgrade to the spot, and for an auxiliary device in a small place, beats the Show as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice option for the bigger Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: The voice recognition is very good. The sound quality is surprisingly very good. The screen is great at displaying what information you asked for. The images are clear and sharp. Video playback is also good. I will eventually link this to a door cam. I'm sure the images will look very good from what I see now.

I got this thinking I could watch youtube while in the kitchen. It does okay but has to search the internet and usually cant find the video I want. The sound is fine, similar to my gen2 dot but not better. Maybe I'll learn more in time. Thought it would be better by this generation of the show.

reviews.reviewTitle: More fun than the Echo Dot.
reviews.reviewText: My favorite skill is that your uploaded photos are randomly scrolled on the screen. I like that the time and temperature are displayed as well as the time remaining when you have set a timer. You can also display recipes which is helpful while cooking. The only complaint I have is the screen cannot be made brighter.
To me this sucks it’s an over priced alarm clock , I was told this would support Hulu and other networks but it only has nbc and amazon prime I most likely will return it
I am an original Alexa owner so adding this to our collection was a no brainer. It integrated flawlessly with the other devices including a separate camera I purchased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive Volume, decent Speaker, horrible microphone
reviews.reviewText:
Volume is quite impressive but some audio does become noticeably distorted when the volume is turned up. Overall not bad, definitely nice for bedrooms or home offices. However, the voice recognition is extremely poor. The device almost never understands what I say; I am instead met with responses such as “hmm, I’m not sure” or “I couldn’t find a device named..” just a few common examples. However it has trouble with more than half of the voice commands. Even despite setting up my voice profile and ensuring there is nothing blocking or interfering with its microphone.

Overall if you want a Bluetooth speaker with alexa capabilities through the app, a good buy. Not good as a home assistant though.

I used this to replace the full sized echo 2 in my bedroom. I switched over my morning routines to this one as more of an alarm clock and it's awesome. Not only does it tell me my schedule and weather report but I can see a little more information as well. I love that when I tell it to play a specific song most of the time it has lyrics available displayed in a karaoke style. The sound quality was better than expected and rivals the full sized echo. I've only done a few video calls but they have been very clear with good audio quality as well.

Bought this on a lark and didn't expect to use it much. I find more applications just about every day, from reminding to give the dog her meds to turning on/off lights. Also enjoy getting quick answers to questions about sport scores, weather in different locations and traffic and just about anything.

I have been wanting an echo show for a while. I bought an echo spot, which I like a lot, but always wanted a bigger screen. The Show 5 exceeds all my expectations by far. Nice screen size doesn't take over my desk. You can ask this thing. anything. Alexa's abilities grow by the week. Five Stars. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it. It's an Echo device, it does what it's supposed to.
reviews.reviewText:
Good little device. Especially at the $70 price point. I wouldn't pay $100 or more for it, but at $70 it makes a great little nightstand gadget/alarm clock/music player/whatever have you.

I do like the mechanical camera cover too; you KNOW nobody's peeping into your bedroom through it. :)

PROS
- alexa integration works as expected
- auto dimming for dark room is fantastic
- can disable all the suggestions and other garbage on home screen

CONS
- poor viewing angle (not a big issue)
- short cable
- when turning on/off lights, it auto changes to a light switch screen. can't seem to disable this

we upgraded to this from the dot and this show 5 is so much better even connects to our ring doorbell.
we love it !!! definitely would recommend .

The device is cute and does everything that the regular alexa does and a little bit more. Its much smaller then I thought it would be, not crazy about that, but its cool. I love the fact that I can close the camera, that for me is major, at least I know for sure no one is able to look at w/out my allowing it.

Love the Echo Show 5, & so does my family! It is affordable and works perfectly! It's easy to turn on a video for my son when I don't have the hands to help him out and he needs something to hold his attention for a little while. We are constantly listening to music with amazon music, some even have on screen lyrics. So fun to have around!

The microphone is not that great. I have to repeat and adjust the decibel of my voice before it can hear my commands. Installation is not difficult. Choices of screen a bit limited. I replaced my echo dots with the echoshow as there is more options to do with it. We now have a mini video reminder gadget that wokes us up on time every morning and a voice reminder at scheduled times at night for the kiddos when to go to sleep. I like the camera cover button that is added that is not on the amazon echo show. It gives me a sense of security that no one is having unauthorized access of my room through this camera.

I purchased the Echo Show 5 for the living room. Already had an Echo Dot, but this is so much nicer and displays time, temp and your photos as screen saver background. I find that Alexa is a bit slower in responding to questions than the Echo devices. Size is good on this one too - about the size of a smartphone.

First of all I read all of these negative reviews about advertisements being annoying. There are none it just gives visual suggestions on the screen not annoying at all. Second my wife likes it because she can ask for a recipe and it is right there on the screen while she is cooking. We haven't even tapped into all of its capabilities yet. It is GREAT!!

I bought the Alexa Show for my husband a few years ago and love it for being able to see recipes and words to songs, so was happy to see this smaller version. I have it my craft room and can call my hubby in his room if needed. Bought 2 black ones for my kids for Christmas so I can drop in on them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good things come in smaller packages.
reviews.reviewText:
I love my Echo’s. I have 7 of them. I love being able to use them in synch as multi room speakers.
This newest one I got, I use the most. Picks up everything I ask. Sound is fantastic. Picture quality is great on it.
I love this more than the regular show. I feel the size is much better.

The Echo Show 5 is a great smart speaker in a compact size. The compact size is what I like most about it. It’s the perfect fit for a desk or night stand. The sound quality is good for a speaker as small as this one. It gets plenty loud and doesn’t distort. Even bass response is decent. The Echo Show 5 is sensitive to voice just like other Echo devices. The display is vivid with excellent colors. For only $90 it’s an awesome little smart speaker.

Despite the naysayers this is a great little device. I have three Spots and went to purchase another but found this was, essentially, it's replacement. It's a good improvement. I have it on my nightstand and it does everything I expected except mine doesn't show ANY ads. Must be something wrong with it. :)

Enjoying my new Echo Show 5. The screen is larger than my previous Echo Spot and a big upgrade from my original Dot (the hockey puck). Voice recognition has been improved along with slight chatter response from Alexa. Also like the ability to close the camera whenever I don't want to be "on the air".

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks great and replaced my alarm clock. I plan on getting two more for the lining room and kitchen
reviews.reviewText: Voice recognition doesn't seem to be as strong as my gen 2 hub. It could be me or ambient noise. I'll adjust my review as I get used to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing voice recognition on this device
reviews.reviewText: We have three echos and five echo dots. Compared to those devices, this has noticeably worse voice recognition in noisy environments (room with a fan in it). Otherwise I would happily give this device 5 stars. I really like having the screen and like that I can block the camera easily.

I love my Alexa Echo Show. It works better than the Echo Dot, and I love seeing photos, that I upload to the Echo Show. This is the Future, and Amazon is way ahead of the curve. Its also nice when I play music that I can see the Lyrics to the song. Alexa works great, and it will dim the screen at night automatically.

I am glad Amazon finally gave us privacy with this show 5. Camera can be covered and microphone can be muted. The clock function is perfect not to be to bright at night so not to wake you. Can still answer most questions but still lacks google intelligence but still smarter than Siri (idiot).

reviews.reviewTitle: If your looking for small compact bedside or desk. The show 5 is best.
reviews.reviewText: I currently have the echo show 2. I really like the show 5 for bedside use. I enjoy the fact that as soon as the lights go out the screen goes to sleep but still shows time.

Purchased back in June. Worked great at first, loved it. Now I literally have to scream from the top of my lungs for it to work if I’m lucky. My other echo devices in other rooms pick up my voice and respond to commands I’m screaming at this one and I’m much further away from them than I am to this one.
I love my Echo Show Mini. It's the perfect size for my bedside table and my home office, very configurable, and easy to set up.

I loves this until a few days ago. My primary purpose for this device is a bedside alarm clock. It no longer functions that way since the large display is reduced to a small top left corner display. I’M SO DISAPPOINTED. I hope you IMMEDIATELY fix this feature.

I love the little gadget! I have it in my kitchen. It takes up less space and I love that while I am cooking or cleaning and I need a recipe or info and my hands are busy- I can just ask Alexa. One thing I noticed with it - Is the screen suppose to glitch/ jump every so often? Mine does.

I was amazed how quickly I was able to setup the Echo Show and have it operational. It is the perfect size for my night stand. Sound quality for music is acceptable but on the level of a Sonos unit for those looking for high quality sound. The integration with my Ring doorbell and other smart home products was also a plus. Now when there is motion I can ask to see what is actually moving in front of the door and turn on the lights if needed. GREAT!

I replaced my old clock with this unit, was able to link it to my Amazon account and being that I have a Prime membership. My music is in there at no additional fee. I use apple products such as I-phone and I-pad, to set up your system, I was able to download a free version of Amazon Alexa. Other products were asking for a monthly fee, the image of the app I downloaded is attached. I am able to link devices and prime TV as well. Using the app I also loaded my personal info as where I live and my job as well, I am able to get morning commute information. I love this unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not good, use a different echo for on screen functions
reviews.reviewText: This thing is trash. I have many Echo devices and this one rarely hears when I say the wake word. The device almost never shuts off when it’s playing music and I try to talk to it. The screen is so small that you practically have to be standing over it to see/use it. Worst of all it displays advertisements all day and night. Overall I have been very impressed with Echos, however this echo show 5 is a big step backwards. I would highly recommend an echo 2 and use a Fire TV or cube for on screen functions. The Echo Show 5 is small and you can’t see its ready for a response unless you can see the front screen on top of the fact that it’s terrible at listening

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound quality could be better but good value for price.
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
Great as alarm clock
Using as sound machine to fall asleep...like Sleep Sounds skill.
I also have an Alexa in another room so use to play music throughout home.
Connected to smart bulb and works great.
Shutter for camera is handy.

Sounds is not as good as Alexa speaker but not bad for bedroom or 2nd unit.

I use it at my office in school. I tried this last year with a first-generation Dot, which had problems with the university's wifi system. I had no problems getting it onto wifi, and syncing my account. I hooked it up to my office stereo system, and it sounds great. All the benefits of a Show, but in a small package.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its cute. It works as advertized
reviews.reviewText: I have 2 dots and I wanted something that would work with the new NetVue cameras I just bought. This does the trick. It is cute that it shows lyrics when it plays music (sometimes) It has trouble with my naming latino music (maybe it is my accent LOL). It is very clear and reliable (so far). I like the mute switch and camera blocker built in. Nice touch

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa where have you been all my life
reviews.reviewText: Super happy and I wonder why I waited so long to get one of these. I want one for every room to have security over my home turn lights and ac on. I’m absolutely loving this thing. I’m new to this and this is my first virtual assistant and I’m obsessed with discovering new things to try!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stupid "Try Alexa ..." messages ruin a good product
reviews.reviewText: I have tried everything to stop these stupid messages that reduce the time to the corner. I have EVERY option turned off on the home screen and they still show up after 3 weeks. I can't understand why they can't be disabled as a line item. Someone really needs to fix this because these messages don't make me want to try anything, they make me want to trash the thing and go with something from Google.
Useful. I've stopped using my calculator and asking Alexa to do it for me. Most of the other questions I asked Alexa she couldn't answer.

Wanted one so badly and my son surprised me with this gift. I couldn’t be happier! It’s wonderful. It shows time, weather, and news. It’s a perfect alarm just by saying Alexa wake me up at 9 am. It tells me how warm it will be by 3 pm. Couldn’t ask for more. So pleased. Love it.

This is perfect for my bedroom! I love the sunrise feature for the alarm and then slowly increasing volume on the alarm. It gently wakes you up, compared to my phone or old alarm clock that just instantly starts blaring. I also love that the screen dims when the lights are off automatically.

got this for my mother while she was recovering from surgery.
connected several smart plugs to it so she could control the lights and tv without having to get out of bed.
it's kind of like an alexa enabled smart radio clock for a bedroom.
at least, that's how she's using it.
plan to get a ring, so she can see and talk to people at the front door on the echo show 5.

Like everything but the alarm feature. Can’t easily set an alarm to music without doing it verbally. Then you have to edit it in the app. Snoozing it easy, but if you dismiss it, it deletes the alarm. There needs to be an easier way to set an alarm to music non verbally and stop the music when the alarm goes off without deleting it. It’s just not intuitive.

If you want a device that wakes you up in the morning, shows the weather as well as tells you the weather, plays music and has pretty good sound. This is the device. I previously had a second gen echo in my bedroom and I replaced it with the Show5 and I am very happy I did. It does everything it was advertised to do and I love the lens cover on the camera!! No drop ins from my grandson in the bedroom :) You won't regret purchasing this version of the Show!!!

Just love this "alexa show" device! I have 2. one for my bedroom and one in my kitchen. I love all the alexa products and got these shows on prime day at a really good price. I use it daily for music, recipes, watching videos, tv shows, etc.
Cannot wait for more Alexa devices to come out!!

reviews.reviewTitle: try this prompts suck + defective hardware
reviews.reviewText:
This would be a great device if it didn't constantly nag you to with try this prompts. Please add way to toggle this on or off.

Update: Theres some hardware defect amazon isn't fessing up to. I've been getting speaker distortions on occasion with both music and alexa commands. Tech support wants me to RMA it and be out of an echo for 7-10 days. I thought amazon had great customer support. Terrible, just terrible. I would return this if I were still in the return window.

Im glad this version came out as I didn't want to spend 200+ on the bigger model. I own a Echo Dot also. My only complaint is that I find myself repeating myself a lot with Alexa....we have a love hate relationship. And some simple questions I ask she always says I dont know but yet I can google or ask siri with no issue. But good for what it does

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great for the bedroom and kitchen.
reviews.reviewText: The sound quality is good for a small device. It goes into a red mode when it's night, which is the color that is helpful when sleeping. I've really enjoyed mine.

I bought two of these devices and mainly high quality alarm clocks. They replaced an echo show gen 1 and I was surprised at the superior audio quality and the breadth of features available. The alarm is second to none that I have experienced and listening to audible is fantastic as I get ready for bed.

I got this to view my Ring doorbell and it works, but bit slow. I don't have any other Alexa device so I'm not sure how it works other devices. I just wish it would load my Ring doorbell footage faster. The glass break sensor is bit too sensitive and I get lots of false alarms.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo show 5 with ring spotlight camera
reviews.reviewText:
I like using it with my ring camera. I was hoping that it would show the video when motion detected. It doesn’t, but does allow my wife the ability to say Alexa, show front camera and it connects rather quickly.
I also bought some electric outlet devices to operate my lights in living room on command, works great 👍

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a magnificent multifunctional device.
reviews.reviewText: I love the Echo Show 5 because it helps me keep track of my medications, the weather, the traffic, it plays both Movies and Music on my Prime Account, I can make phone calls hands free to my contacts, I can use the Camera for multiple reasons, I can obtain recipes with hands free instructions and videos, it controls your smart home, I can get the latest update on sports and news, watch current events around the world, plus many more added features. I plan to get a couple more as gifts for my family members so we can stay connected through long distance and see each other using the camera. This is a must have device for every home with excellent service for the price and Home features.

This was an anniversary gift for my partner. It is great for setting alarms and reminders as well as controlling the lights in multiple areas of the house. We have an ECHO in addition to our ECHO Show 5, plus two ECHO oultets and Philip Hue light bulbs. They are all synced - very convenient!
The latest update removes the full size clock. I am not happy with the small clock in the left corner. Why even let us choose a clock to display. I want a refund.

I love our 2nd gen Echo dot, so I thought I'd add this device to our lineup. After using it for about a week, I can't get past how awful the sound is. Every time Alexa says something it sounds like it's in a hole - very muffled and not at all clear. Turning up the volume only made it worse. Going to return.

reviews.reviewTitle: Exho Show 5 is a 3 on the scale!
reviews.reviewText: I like the concept of the show 5. Good for a rightable and some of the features are good. It dims itself when not in use, allows for a custom background, good quality internal speaker. Cons; still has a few bugs like showing wrong temperature setting (celsius) when the thermostat is set for Fahrenheit!

I’m not really impressed with this little thing. None of my Works with Alexa cameras have been able to connect to it, and it doesn’t hear my voice half the time. I am comparing it to our echo tower that we replaced this with, which heard me say the wake word at any volume, without fail.
This thing is great. It’s on my nightstand. I can have it show me my front door, the news, weather, football scores, plays my music, etc. love it!
Love this!I have the Alexa basic ,this is great because of the screen.I have it in the kitchen and use it constantly for recipes and conversions

Loved Alexa my wife and I both have one. No kids they are out on their own. Got an Alexa 5 for my wife and we are so disappointed by the experience. Setup went fine. Added it to her alexa account she is an amazon prime member also. Every time she comes up stairs and asks alexa to play music tries to sell her on a music monthly membership. This is terrible they said don't play music downstairs. But she is not. This is very very disappointing. Not happy thinking about returning all Alexa's

reviews.reviewTitle: Alarm doesn't play well with sleep sounds.
reviews.reviewText: Having issues with the alarm function. When we have some sleep sounds on the alarm does not go off. So we have to have the sleep sounds turn off before the alarm goes off. It took a bit of trouble shooting to figure out why alarm didn't work since it only happens with some sounds and not others.

I like the size and look of the Echo Show 5. It resembles a minature TV set. You can ask Alexa just about anything she'll find it. I really enjoy asking her to play music for me in the mornings when I wake and in the evenings when I get home from work. However, if you want access to thousands of songs through Amazon Music, you'll have to subscribe to the service which is only $3.99 a month. Trust me, it's worth it! I'm still testing the "waters" with my echo and look forward to experiencing all that it can do. I highly recommend the Echo Show 5.

I LOVE this device! Use it as a night clock so I no longer have to have my phone on all night. I also purchased the stand, which arrived later, and didn’t think I needed it until I added it. Great addition. Love how the clock goes dim automatically at night, sensing sleep mode. Love that it shows weather.
Links to my driveway camera, internet, music. Works great. If I would have known how much I would like it, I would have bought more on Prime Day.....

I found out that every hue light has to be reconnected manually with the ID number at the base of the bulb, because they are connected to the old hub, which for me is the Echo Dot. I have 15 different types of hues lights. I'm not going to reconfigure every one of them. I reconnected my echo dot back again and everything works, including my Samsung vacuum, and Denon Pro logic receiver. If you have a lot of smart things in your home be prepared for a lot of programming.

The Echo 5 is a great product. It works fantastic with Prime membership on Amazon. My only problem with this product is the Android app. I purchased several Echo 5 with stands to help with the Ring system. The Alexa app and the Ring app does not work well together. I am praying in the future they are more compatible. God bless, Vickie

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to our Echo family
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Show 5 is being used in our bedroom as a personal assistant and an easy to use ‘alarm clock’
It is nice to set an alarm and shut off an alarm without handling the equipment. No jumping up and running to shut off the obnoxious alarm. Ever stub your toe running to shut of the alarm?

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product for the kitchen; Echo Show 5.
reviews.reviewText: I have the Echo Show 5 place in my kitchen and if your wondering what it is? It is an Alex with a viewing screen. I like using it in the kitchen for background music and for cooking! I believe I would use one in the bedroom too, but kitchen is where it is staying for now.

Love the Echo Show 5. I got mine on Prime Day. I replaced my alarm clock with it. Love the convenience of just getting in bed and letting Alexa shut off lights and set sleep sounds and timer. I wake up to music most mornings and watch videos or play games when I can't sleep, plus tons of other things I can program Alexia to do on my Echo Show. Love this device. Great purchase.
I use this with my Ring doorbell. works great can see outside really well. ask it to play a old song, I Love it shows the words you can sing along with it. Great product!!!!.
Great product, item as described. This is the second unit in my household. Enjoy listening to my Sirius account away from the car.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart device? Only if everybody gets a trophy...
reviews.reviewText: The echo show 5 is not worth purchasing. Alexa's capability with this device is not great. The sound and video quality is poor. If you only need alexa to do a few very specific things and you know that those skills exist for the echo show 5 and you can memorize exactly what phrasing is required to get alexa to execute those commands then this is the smart device for you. Otherwise, pass on it.

I bought the original Echo and it's in my kitchen. I use it mainly for music and questions now and then. When I bought the Echo 5 it has been perfect for the bedroom! A great alarm clock, that wakes me with music. Still so many things I want to do with it. Glad I purchased the Echo 5!

Nice small video Alexa unit. It's video is sharp, but it sometimes doesn't hear me even when I'm right next to it. The sound is OK, but then it is a small unit, not meant for high fidelity sound. I like it, but I see room for some improvement, in particular the ability to pick up your commands. At the price, it's worth having.

reviews.reviewTitle: You'll never not have answers to your questions😁😁
reviews.reviewText: It's very useful whether I use it for recipes, sports, current news, weather or upcoming event venues and travel info. You can information about anything you need and the screen is a perfect size fior displaying upcoming movie previews or anything else you'd have to watch.

reviews.reviewTitle: Video calling does not work. Known issue by Amazon but yet they keep selling it. DO NOT BUY!
reviews.reviewText: I’m very surprised that Amazon is knowingly continuing to sell a product with this major of a fundamental defect. We bought this so we could FaceTime with our daughter while she’s away at college. We tried everything to get the video working on her end and could not get it to work. She eventually went online and found an entire forum dedicated to people reporting on this known issue. Extremely disappointed!!!

We have the large sized Alexa show and absolutely loved it, using it every day. I saw this and decided to put one in my kitchen. It's smaller and just as cute as it can be. With the stand attached to it it's awesome! I use it for my music, recipes and talking to grandchildren while I cook. I love it!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: You can switch off the camera
reviews.reviewText: I have the larger one in my kitchen> I got this Echo show to replace my alarm clock in the bedroom. Very helpful as an alarm and works with my Amazon smart plug to turn on and off the lights when I enter or leave the room. I have linked it to my Google calendar, so every morning I review my schedule and also ask for a weather update. When I turn the camera on, I can do video calls with the family. I really find it useful.

reviews.reviewTitle: A clock that talks to you..
reviews.reviewText: Seeing the clock face reminds me to use Echo more often. Makes it so much more functional than the original round cylinder.

Sound is not bad, but don’t buy if you want to pair it for stereo sound with the sub and a dot. The apps says it is not compatible. The interface is not great and the constant suggestions should have a way to be turned off. Overall disappointing and i wish I was still in my return window.

It integrates seamlessly with the rest of my Alexa family. And I really like having it show me who is at my front door when my Ring camera sounds. The rest of time, it sits quietly on my desk, displaying time, temperature and, occasionally, a suggestion of something it can do.
Sound quality is not at the level of the Echo tower. I do not see enough value in this product to warrant the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it better than I expected too.
reviews.reviewText: I seldom write reviews. I did not think I would like this device as much as I do. I wanted an up dated alarm clock with some music features. This is a lot more. I like the audio quality. It recognizes my voice low or speaking normal. I downloaded an audio book to see how I like that feature. It was excellent . Now I’m considering a second one for my downstairs area.

reviews.reviewTitle: The most Boujee alarm clock that you could ever need.
reviews.reviewText: If you can pick this up for $50 like I did on Prime Day(wait for black friday *hint hint*) it is the boujeest clock you will ever own. I love it. Works with all our cameras and you can set alarms just by telling it to wake you up(yes I know a regular alexa lets you do this but you can actually hit 'snooze' with this)

I purchased this item specifically for being able to stream shows while in the room this device is in, but had no idea that the only streaming service that’s compatible is Prime Video. The sound is also terrible and the screen constantly comes on even when I’ve asked Alexa for it to be turned off. It’s now useless to me and remains unplugged while I use my Echo Dot instead.

I love my echo show. I can play any song I want, set reminders, timers and do a shopping list. My husband has the dot in his workshop and I can talk to him when I need him. Always has time and weather on screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: The face of the screen is always warm to touch.
reviews.reviewText:
But when trying for music, which I will have to not keep the subscription of, the face gets very hot. Hot enough to make me turn it off when not in the room.

So as to using it with the Ring 2, which just arrived and not set up yet, it will be useless cause it is off more then it is on.

reviews.reviewTitle: easy to use and turn the camera on and off!
reviews.reviewText: I like this as much as the full size echo show, even more because of the easy turn on and off button on the camera so I feel safe. I have one in my office, my husbands office, and home so we can drop in any time or call our friends and family. I also watch the news on it in my kitchen while cooking dinner. For its size the sound is great

I bought this echo view with out reading any of the reviews, big mistake. Wish I had read the reviews, once set up and trying get to stop asking if I wanted to see this video or this song, finally got all of that pretty much stopped. Then it kept saying try this or try that, it was frustrating. Then tried to set up the calendar part, with my iPhone. I got the apps it suggested, but never could get it to work, so I took it back.

This is nothing more than an expensive speaker/alarm for me. Your life has to be integrated into Amazon services in order to really benefit from this and I don't use them. You can go on the internet, you can listen to YouTube, set an alarm and ask it questions, but you need to pay for the various Amazon services to really use it. The one thing I wanted to use it for it will not do and that is to communicate with another Amazon device-- the Portal. My main reason for buying this is to put on the other side of the house so that my disabled husband can use it to call me if he needs me so he doesn't have to scream, but the two devices are incompatible. Wish I had not purchased it.

What can I say but I LOVE my Echo Show 5. The voice recognition is amazing not to mention that it picks my voice even when other electronics are playing loud near My Show5. The functionality of shutting off the camera was a +++ for me. Love it so much am going to purchase 2 more.

reviews.reviewTitle: How easy it is to set up except for the calendar
reviews.reviewText: I love the echo show as well as the spot, but I am having a horrible time trying to put my calendar on them. Everything else was so easy- not so the calendar!😡

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 is worth a try! Good price!
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded from echo Dot and love the screen! Love the clock! I wanted a way to chat with my 89 year old mom from room to room and it's great. She loves it! We can see each other and talk. Mom is not into the new tech stuff but she can call me or drop in. We love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: An awesome new addition to our home!
reviews.reviewText: We added Echo Show 5 to our existing Alexa Dot in our house. The Dot has found a new home on the 2nd floor and the Echo Show has found it's home on the first floor. My wife and I love the Echo Show and all of it's features. We are definitely pleased with our decision to purchase our new Show 5.
Loving the Echo Show 5...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great alarm clock for the bedroom.
reviews.reviewText: Using it as an alarm clock in the bedroom. Love the size , quality and sound for this purpose. Had the echo spot and replaced it with this , glad I did.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not connect to blink xt2 properly
reviews.reviewText: Product has issues connect to my blink cameras. Has only ever once shown then when asked. Otherwise Alexa just says I’m not quite sure what went wrong and goes back to the home screen. Kinda dumb, the only reason I got this was for that reason. I guess it still makes an nice alarm and tells some perfect bad jokes....

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice upgrade from the original.
reviews.reviewText: The echo show is a very nice upgrade from the original echo. I love how it integrates with my Ring doorbell so I can see who is at my door quickly.

The form factor is really nice, and when it does work it's great - the recipe feature is nice, as are voice chats and watching videos. The problem is, they seem to have frequent problems understanding or even acknowledging commands. My other echo devices work great, but the echo shows have constant problems. Often they'll show it's processing my request, but then fail to do anything or even play the sound it's supposed to when it processes. Other times, it'll just crash during video calls or showing video, or won't ring with my other devices when someone calls me. Sometimes it tells me it needs wifi to play a video...despite using the wifi to process my instructions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better night stand clock then Echo spot
reviews.reviewText: This compares most to the spot. It is better as a night stand clock then the spot as it has larger clock face. You have to leave the auto adjust feature on light off as it becomes to low of a light level to read in a dark room. Otherwise it compares well with echo spot.

I just received my Echo Show 5 devices today. They are extremely easy to set up. The sound quality is also better than I expected for the price. I love the touch screen. I mainly purchased these to be able to video chat with my elderly parent while I am at work. So far, I am very pleased with my purchase.
So far so good

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, mine came to me cracked.
reviews.reviewText: I love Alexa. I purchased the new Echo Show early and received my two units on the 26th of June. The only bummer is that one of my Echo Shows came to me cracked at the bottom. I took a picture of it to show. It isn’t a huge crack, but it’s a bummer to receive something new to find that it’s not in pristine condition. That is the only reason that I gave my review 4 stars instead of 5. It works very well and sound quality is decent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just as good as the Alexa Show
reviews.reviewText: Great Alexa device, as good as the original Alexa show. The screen is clear and big enough to watch a video or movie. Bought mine on Prime Day for $50.00 this version is a better value than the Alexa Dot. Very easy to set up, I will never buy the Alexa Dot again this one is a better alternative.

Alexa is the new way to host a party at home. Our circle of friends are between Boomers, Generation X and Millennials and thanks to Alexa and Amazon Music is very easy to please everyone. Alexa has become our personal DJ, and Amazon Music is capable of pleasing all generations.
I bought this for myself during Prime Day and I'm loving it. I use it on my nightstand and It's diffently worth the money.

Alexa is like a member of the family, there is one in every room. She connects with my Ring doorbell system so even if I am on the deck I know when someone is at my door. She wakes me in the morning and lulls me to sleep and even helps with recipes for dinner. Can't wait until I can put her in the car!

reviews.reviewTitle: Show 5 is my favorite, great little device.
reviews.reviewText: This is my 4th Alexa device that I have added to my home. I do have the first generation Show also. I actually think this little one is my favorite of them all. I do keep it in my kitchen. Being small, it doesn't take up much space on my bar. The Show 5 really does have nice sound even though it is small. It is a very useful accessory and worth the price for sure.

I wanted the echo show original but too much for me! So I decided to go for this model and it’s worked great. Great display and I love that I can check the inside of my home when I’m away. I also have a ring door bell and I can see who’s outside. Sometimes it won’t hear me. But it’s no biggie. Love it :)

I love this clock. Besides being a small but clearly visible clock you can find out almost anything from the weather to the capital of Chile with this gem. You can play games or get jokes. Attach your phone to use the calendar or Pandora. This thing is wonderful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to your night table..!
reviews.reviewText: I have really enjoyed this product. Still exploring Alexa's many features. Convenience and information at the sound of your voice..

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice addition to my ever growing set of Alexa devices
reviews.reviewText: It's small sitting on a coffee table. It is bright and easy to see. It has good sound, I would say about as good as the Echo Dot. The main reason I got it was the screen and the ability to interface with my Ring doorbell. It connects about as fast as my phone, so no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 5 - Better, not close to best..
reviews.reviewText: I like this idea as an Alexa device in an alarm clock. Great idea, but Amazon has decided that it is more important to push information at me, some configurable, some not. Then I need to wait till the time is full screen again, as the small time display cannot be seen across a small bedroom.

I just replaced my echo dot with this. The sound quality is awful. Very echoey. I bave hooked up the ring, which works, but who wants to go to the trouble of looking up whos at the door when you can just walk up to the peek hole by the time it comes up. Other than that i've only used the regular alexa features.

I have owned the Echo Show (1st gen) for a while now. I LOVE IT! But I wanted a device I could take to work that was smaller. This Echo Show 5 is PERFECT! It set up in a few minutes. The Echo Show 5 sounds and looks as good as my full size Echo Show! I could not be happier! You have to try this device!

I love the Echo Show 5. It has a great screen and the sound quality is surprisingly good for such a small device. It's perfect on my nightstand and office desk. Makes it very convenient to have the functionality of Alexa, with a touch screen display, and not occupy a lot of space.

I bought 3 of these Show 5 during Prime Day sales. I love that i can close the camera shutter so it can be in bedrooms. It sits next to my Google Home Hub. I use this device for my Ring cameras. These Show 5 devices join my Amazon ecosystem of Echos, echo dots, echo spots and Echo Show.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the Echo Dot but I gave this one a try and now I want one for every room
reviews.reviewText: I personally love the Echo Dot we even have one in the shower but I ran across this one and I decided to give it a try, I was expecting it to be too big and not as loud and maybe too much of a screen device and not just blend in with the décor like the Echo Dot. But to my surprise, it is small enough to blend and big enough to be useful at a glance with the time and weather and with Amazon Pictures we can see our pictures slideshow. Sound is great just like the Echo Dot so overall we kept it for the office but are planning to get one for the bedroom as well, maybe one for the foyer. Great price for what we wanted and got a better device than what we paid for...

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it love it love it
reviews.reviewText: It’s like you get to see what Alexa is thinking soooo much better than just a speaker! I was on the fence about the screen but after I got it I unplugged my echo plus second gen and went straight show!!! Yea it’s small but big on personality! One of the funnest things is “Alexa show me the vortex” Try it it’s fun.

I purchased this to replace a 3rd generation dot because I wanted an alarm clock with a display. I enjoy the display aspect, but the microphone on this device is terrible compared to the 3rd generation dot. I have tell it to snooze in the morning multiple times because it can't hear me. Sometimes it doesn't hear snooze correctly and it starts talking about something... It's pretty bad!
Already had the original Show and we got the 5" for the wife's office. Seems to do everything the original does, so no issues - no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t expect everything to be perfect yet
reviews.reviewText: Only dislikes are how the audio sounds, the image quality, and how Alexa reads. I didn’t want to customize my background because when you look up close the image that you used looks like YouTube in 2005. The audio has a weird echo so I prefer not to use the drop in for conversations. When I discovered I could access my kindle books on the echo show, I got excited. But when it came to Alexa narrating the book I just couldn’t handle it. I don’t know how to describe the voice during the reading but if you heard it you would understand the unpleasantness that I’m talking about lmao

I like this device and fits well on my desk. I got it on Prime day so it was cheaper than most clock radios. However, I have not been able to figure out how to stop the Trending Topics. Not interested in most and replaces the screen I want to see. A bit annoying.
Way better than the more expensive Spot. Although I love them both, this is a great product! The screen is big and high quality. Sound quality is solid!
I have each version of the Echo, but this is my favorite!!! Everyone needs one- sound/video quality is great- compact size is super cool! Love it!

While this is a good product, I would have given it 5 stars had the voice recognition performed better. This is an area where I feel it is not very good. I have 1 echo show in my living room and 1 echo dot in my kitchen. Even when I am in the living room, the echo dot from the kitchen is the first to respond.

I replaced an echo something (not a dot but not a plus either) in our daughters room and the sound just isn’t as good. But having the lyrics for songs is a big plus! We keep the camera lens closed of course.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you can get it on sale ($50 or less) it’s a great upgrade over the Echo Dot
reviews.reviewText:
Bought it during the recent Amazon Prime sale... well worth the $50. Nice clear screen, great voice recognition, great sound quality. Replaced my echo dot and wish this had been out earlier.

If you’re considering an echo device, spend the few extra bucks (when this is on sale) to upgrade from the dot.
